review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.
author: Bolaji A.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for managing projects and tracking task
review_detail: jira solving the problem of scattered project management by centralizing task , bugs , and sprints in one system , it helps me stay on top of my development work , collaborate with teammates , and keeps project moving forward without losing track of priorities , its helps to calculate performance also .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: jira helps me orgnize devlopement work , track progress and collaborate with my team effectively , for project management its best tool , the ability to create and manage tasks , stories , and sprints in one place is very useful , UI also best not complex , we use it for daily task management . it keeps whole team on one track with clear priorities .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: sometimes jira interface can feel heavy , for new users it take time to understand the functionlaity , some time integration with other apps feels complicated , too many customization option make setup confusing .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:
title: Strucutred task management that keeps data projects on track.
review_detail: Jira has been an effective way to manage data request, analytics workflows and cross team collaboration. It keeps projects structured transparent and moving forward which is critical . I can manage analytics request, long term data pipeline improvements and reporting task all withing the same platform. this has helped me prioritize request and ensure i am spending time on the task with the highest business impact.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira has been a reliable tool for keeping my work organized and aligned with the rest of the team, i like its flexibility in creating boards and workflows that fir different project needs. The integration with GitHub and Google Workspace makes collaboration much easier. this implementation makes it easy to use. The ability to tag team members, add members , add comments and update tasks in real time also helps cut down on back and forth communication.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: It can feel overly complex for smaller teams as i were doing internship, and lightweight projects. The number of customization options can be overrwhelming at first and performance sometime slow down when boards get very large.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Tracking Tasks and Managing Sprints
review_detail: Jira helps us streamline project management by keeping all tasks, bugs, and feature requests in one place. It improves team collaboration by making responsibilities and deadlines clear, while Agile boards and sprint planning keep projects moving smoothly. The transparency and reporting features give managers real-time insights, which helps in making better decisions and delivering projects on time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to manage projects with clear visibility into tasks, deadlines, and team progress. The customizable workflows and boards are great for Agile teams, and integration with tools like GitHub, Slack, and Confluence make collaboration Seamless. I especially like the detailed reporting and sprint planning features which help keep everything on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complex interface and wide range of features. review_detail:
title: A reliable tool for managin complex data engineering projects
review_detail: Jira has been a trustworthy and reliable project management tool for me and my organization and our data engineering workflows. it helps us stay organized, track deliverables and maintain accountability across the team. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering processes from ETL development to production incident tracking. we got a strong visibility into project status with boards and dashboards. and effective for sprint planning and backlog management.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: ad a data engineer. i have been using Jira continuously for managing data pipeline tasks, bug fixes and sprint planning. i like how customizable Jira is. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering process. from ETL development to production incident tracking. The Kanban and Scrum boards make it much easier to break down large data initiatives into smaller, manageable stories and ensure the team stays aligned. the integrations are big advantage. Connecting Jira with GitHub for code commits , Slack for notification and documentation.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel heavy when handling multiple projects with many customizations. the interface is not the most intuitive for new users and performance can slow down if boards become overloaded. It takes discipline and proper setup to Jira clean.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.

It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.

author: JAYDEEP L.

review_detail:
title: A reliable tool for managin complex data engineering projects
review_detail: Jira has been a trustworthy and reliable project management tool for me and my organization and our data engineering workflows. it helps us stay organized, track deliverables and maintain accountability across the team. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering processes from ETL development to production incident tracking. we got a strong visibility into project status with boards and dashboards. and effective for sprint planning and backlog management.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: ad a data engineer. i have been using Jira continuously for managing data pipeline tasks, bug fixes and sprint planning. i like how customizable Jira is. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering process. from ETL development to production incident tracking. The Kanban and Scrum boards make it much easier to break down large data initiatives into smaller, manageable stories and ensure the team stays aligned. the integrations are big advantage. Connecting Jira with GitHub for code commits , Slack for notification and documentation.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel heavy when handling multiple projects with many customizations. the interface is not the most intuitive for new users and performance can slow down if boards become overloaded. It takes discipline and proper setup to Jira clean.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: Pruthvi M.

review_detail:
title: Greate tool for keeping project on track.
review_detail: Jira helps us manage the tasks across the team and keep track of deadlines without things slipping through the cracks. Its especially useful for sprint planning and making sure everyone knows what they're working on. Having all updates, comments and progress in one place saves a lot of back and forth over email or chat. It also gives better visibility for managers to see overall progress, which makes planning and reporting much easier.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like how Jira keeps everything organized in one place. The boards and spring planning make it easy to see what's in progress and what's coming next. The integration with other tools are super handy, and the reporting gives a good snapshot of where the team stands.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: it can feel a bit overwhelming at first because there are so many features and options. Once you get used to it though, it becomes much easier to work with.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Herry D.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for task management and for following the sprint
review_detail: Jira helps us to plan the day according and matches the dealdline and most good part about it that in sprint it shows the progress of our task what are their status within that sprint how we task need to resolve like that. It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:

It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

cons: sometimes jira interface can feel heavy , for new users it take time to understand the functionlaity , some time integration with other apps feels complicated , too many customization option make setup confusing .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:

review_detail: Jira has been an effective way to manage data request, analytics workflows and cross team collaboration. It keeps projects structured transparent and moving forward which is critical . I can manage analytics request, long term data pipeline improvements and reporting task all withing the same platform. this has helped me prioritize request and ensure i am spending time on the task with the highest business impact.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira has been a reliable tool for keeping my work organized and aligned with the rest of the team, i like its flexibility in creating boards and workflows that fir different project needs. The integration with GitHub and Google Workspace makes collaboration much easier. this implementation makes it easy to use. The ability to tag team members, add members , add comments and update tasks in real time also helps cut down on back and forth communication.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: It can feel overly complex for smaller teams as i were doing internship, and lightweight projects. The number of customization options can be overrwhelming at first and performance sometime slow down when boards get very large.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

cons: Jira can be complex and overwhelming for new users, especially when setting up workflows and boards.Sometimes it feels slow when handling large projects or many issues.With so many features, it can be confusing to navigate and find exactly what you needReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:

pros: The number of features and the ease of integration are what truly make Jira stand out.
cons: The main downsides are the ease of use and ease of implementation.
author: Divya W.

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Tracking Tasks and Managing Sprints
review_detail: Jira helps us streamline project management by keeping all tasks, bugs, and feature requests in one place. It improves team collaboration by making responsibilities and deadlines clear, while Agile boards and sprint planning keep projects moving smoothly. The transparency and reporting features give managers real-time insights, which helps in making better decisions and delivering projects on time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to manage projects with clear visibility into tasks, deadlines, and team progress. The customizable workflows and boards are great for Agile teams, and integration with tools like GitHub, Slack, and Confluence make collaboration Seamless. I especially like the detailed reporting and sprint planning features which help keep everything on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complex interface and wide range of features. The initial setup and customization require time and effort, and it may feel slow when managing very large projects. Non-technical users sometimes find it difficult to navigate without training.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: JAYDEEP L.

review_detail:
title: A reliable tool for managin complex data engineering projects
review_detail: Jira has been a trustworthy and reliable project management tool for me and my organization and our data engineering workflows. it helps us stay organized, track deliverables and maintain accountability across the team. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering processes from ETL development to production incident tracking. we got a strong visibility into project status with boards and dashboards. and effective for sprint planning and backlog management.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: ad a data engineer. i have been using Jira continuously for managing data pipeline tasks, bug fixes and sprint planning. i like how customizable Jira is. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering process. from ETL development to production incident tracking. The Kanban and Scrum boards make it much easier to break down large data initiatives into smaller, manageable stories and ensure the team stays aligned. the integrations are big advantage. Connecting Jira with GitHub for code commits , Slack for notification and documentation.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel heavy when handling multiple projects with many customizations. the interface is not the most intuitive for new users and performance can slow down if boards become overloaded. It takes discipline and proper setup to Jira clean.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Herry D.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for task management and for following the sprint
review_detail: Jira helps us to plan the day according and matches the dealdline and most good part about it that in sprint it shows the progress of our task what are their status within that sprint how we task need to resolve like that. It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.

pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
