author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.

As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Herry D.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for task management and for following the sprint
review_detail: Jira helps us to plan the day according and matches the dealdline and most good part about it that in sprint it shows the progress of our task what are their status within that sprint how we task need to resolve like that. It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

review_detail: Jira has been an effective way to manage data request, analytics workflows and cross team collaboration. It keeps projects structured transparent and moving forward which is critical . I can manage analytics request, long term data pipeline improvements and reporting task all withing the same platform. this has helped me prioritize request and ensure i am spending time on the task with the highest business impact.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira has been a reliable tool for keeping my work organized and aligned with the rest of the team, i like its flexibility in creating boards and workflows that fir different project needs. The integration with GitHub and Google Workspace makes collaboration much easier. this implementation makes it easy to use. The ability to tag team members, add members , add comments and update tasks in real time also helps cut down on back and forth communication.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: It can feel overly complex for smaller teams as i were doing internship, and lightweight projects. The number of customization options can be overrwhelming at first and performance sometime slow down when boards get very large.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Tracking Tasks and Managing Sprints
review_detail: Jira helps us streamline project management by keeping all tasks, bugs, and feature requests in one place. It improves team collaboration by making responsibilities and deadlines clear, while Agile boards and sprint planning keep projects moving smoothly. The transparency and reporting features give managers real-time insights, which helps in making better decisions and delivering projects on time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to manage projects with clear visibility into tasks, deadlines, and team progress. The customizable workflows and boards are great for Agile teams, and integration with tools like GitHub, Slack, and Confluence make collaboration Seamless. I especially like the detailed reporting and sprint planning features which help keep everything on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complex interface and wide range of features. Non-technical users sometimes find it difficult to navigate without training.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:
title: A reliable tool for managin complex data engineering projects
review_detail: Jira has been a trustworthy and reliable project management tool for me and my organization and our data engineering workflows. it helps us stay organized, track deliverables and maintain accountability across the team. we have tailored workflow to match our data engineering processes from ETL development to production incident tracking. we got a strong visibility into project status with boards and dashboards. and effective for sprint planning and backlog management.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.

pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

cons: I used jira daily and As of now no dislike for jira.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Pruthvi M.

review_detail:
title: Greate tool for keeping project on track.
review_detail: Jira helps us manage the tasks across the team and keep track of deadlines without things slipping through the cracks. Its especially useful for sprint planning and making sure everyone knows what they're working on. Having all updates, comments and progress in one place saves a lot of back and forth over email or chat. It also gives better visibility for managers to see overall progress, which makes planning and reporting much easier.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like how Jira keeps everything organized in one place. The boards and spring planning make it easy to see what's in progress and what's coming next. The integration with other tools are super handy, and the reporting gives a good snapshot of where the team stands.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: it can feel a bit overwhelming at first because there are so many features and options. Once you get used to it though, it becomes much easier to work with.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Herry D.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for task management and for following the sprint
review_detail: Jira helps us to plan the day according and matches the dealdline and most good part about it that in sprint it shows the progress of our task what are their status within that sprint how we task need to resolve like that. It improves the collbration within the team and real time reportingReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: i like jira alot because it is very easy to use for any person and easy to maintain the task management and follwing the sprint and it is an go to tool for everyday use without it i cant plan the process and ease is too good to be true .Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: I dislike about jira is that it takes soo much load in the website as it is heavy software so get difficult in that and there and sometimes with some too many clicks the jira stop responding also.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.

This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Mrudul P.

review_detail:
title: Jira product review
review_detail: Jira tickets once created stays as a record so anytime later a similar issue is encountered, we get a track of actions taken for it.
pros: Its an amazing tool to track work progress between peers.
cons: The workflow and dashboard understanding is a little complex for beginners and requires training for fresh joiners to understand the working of application.
author: Dhanush P.

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool with great tracking but a bit complex
review_detail: Jira helps us manage projects and track tasks effectively. It is very useful for bug tracking, sprint planning, and managing workflows across teams. With Jira, we have better visibility into project progress, deadlines, and responsibilities. It improves collaboration between developers, testers, and managers, which saves time and reduces confusion.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira is excellent for project and task management. I like how it allows me to organize work into boards, sprints, and backlogs. The issue tracking system is very detailed and makes collaboration easy between developers, testers, and managers. I also find the integrations with Confluence, Slack, and GitHub very helpful for streamlining workflows. Overall, it keeps projects transparent and helps my team stay on track.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at first because of its complexity. The interface has many features that are not always intuitive, especially for beginners. Setting up custom workflows also takes time and requires learning. Sometimes the system slows down with very large projects. It would be great if the UI was more simplified for new users.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Monisa A.

review_detail:
title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Prachi  S.

review_detail:
title: Robust solution for task management with minor learning curve.
review_detail: Jira helps me and my team keep all our tasks in one place, so nothing gets missed. It makes it easier to see who is working on what and how far things have progressed. This saves time, avoids confusion, and keeps everyone on the same page.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira makes it easy to keep track of all tasks in one place. I like how I can see the progress of each task, assign it to the right person, and follow up without confusion. The boards and dashboards are really helpful to get a clear view of the project. It also works well with other tools, which saves time.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up Jira for the first time can feel a bit confusing, especially if you are new to it. There are so many features and options that it takes time to learn. The screen can also look crowded sometimesReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: SANJAY C.

review_detail:
title: Solid tool to keep track of complex projects
review_detail: Jira helps to have centralized visibility into everything. We can see bottlenecks forming before they become serious problems, track how our estimates compare to actual work, and give stakeholders realistic timelines instead of just guessing.
pros: I've been using Jira daily for the last couple years, and what started as a tool that felt overwhelming has become pretty essential for keeping our projects coordinated.
cons: Interface complexity is real - new team members consistently struggle for their first few weeks, and I find myself constantly training people on "where to find things." Recent UI changes didn't help either. I get that they're trying to improve things, but it definitely disrupted our workflow for a while.
author: Elena V.

review_detail:
title: Flexible for all team setups and workflows, but requires some effort to implement well
review_detail: It allows us to track our dev work so we know where the team's efforts are going. It provides easy to use planning tools and helps us keep track of our performance/velocity so that we can optimize our resources and allows us to provide the rest of the company with visibility on what is being built.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: It's flexibility allows it to adapt to our ever-evolving workflows. It seamlessly connects to all the other Atlassian tools that we use. Once properly configured, it is easy to use and provides structure without too much overhead. The community forum is a great source of support when trying to accomplish some more complicated tasks, very helpful!Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Setting up and configuring Jira could be a bit easier, there are a lot of options and they can be quite convoluted. There are quite a few concepts that aren't explained well and can interact together to make it difficult to get the wanted results.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Sascha Z.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

title: At the Heart of the Software Team: A QA’s Perspective
review_detail: Jira makes it easier to keep everyone on the same page from testers to developers to project managers. For me as a QA Test Engineer, it means I can log bugs, connect them to related user stories, and follow their progress without things getting lost along with collaboration with developers to resolve bugs as per priory. It streamlines sprint planning, improves communication, and helps us catch and fix issues faster, which leads to smoother releases and better-quality software.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: I like that Jira keeps everything in one place. It helps from tracking bugs to linking them with user stories and test cases. I use it every day, and it makes it easy to prioritize issues, see progress at a glance, and collaborate with developers and product owners. The dashboards and filters help me stay organized, and its integration with automation tools allow me to get faster feedback and can fix issues sooner. As a result, software team is able to provide quality product to customers.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira is a great tool, but it can feel a bit overwhelming at times, especially when different teams set up their own workflows and fields. As per my experience, I found that some tasks, like bulk updates or detailed reporting, take longer than I’d like. And when there are too many integrations running, it can slow down, which makes day-to-day work a little less smooth.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

author: Ritika S.

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Flexible Project Management, But With a Learning Curve
review_detail: Jira helps our team stay organized by centralizing all our tasks, bugs, and project timelines in one platform. We’re able to catch issues early thanks to tracking and reporting features, and the integration with AI agents streamlines repeatable operations like triage and prioritization. This has minimized miscommunication and boosted productivity across projects, letting us focus more on core business goals instead of endless status meetingsReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
pros: Jira stands out for its powerful issue and project tracking capabilities. Over years of use, the customizable workflows have saved so much time, and the Agile boards (Scrum, Kanban) make team collaboration super transparent and organized. The integrations with tools like Slack, Confluence, and GitHub also mean fewer silos and more productivity. It’s scalable for both small projects and enterprise-level work, and the reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into our progressReview collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users—there’s a definite learning curve before everything ‘clicks’. Sometimes the interface feels cluttered, and core features are hidden behind a lot of clicks or configuration settings. For smaller or less technical teams, setup and customization might feel like overkill. Also, costs rise quickly as you add users or need more advanced functionality, and certain plugin integrations can be pricey or require extra admin work.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.

review_detail:
title: Tracking Work the Jira Way
review_detail: Jira has solved a few of our biggest headaches around keeping work visible and organized:
pros: I really like how Jira has added more user-friendly updates recently. Features like Jira Product Discovery, the new automation engine, and simplified boards make it easier for both technical and non-technical teams to collaborate, while improved Slack/Teams integrations help cut down on context-switching.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: Jira can feel overwhelming at times, especially for new users, and the interface gets cluttered. Performance slows on large boards, and it would be great if more lightweight features (like checklists) were built-in instead of relying on costly add-ons.Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
author: Vivek G.

review_detail:
title: Project management tool with a bit too much customization potential
review_detail: I use Jira every day during the daily standups to discuss the progress of all tickets assigned to members of my team. I mainly use the Kanban Board and Backlog to see if we are still on track and see what we need to schedule for upcoming sprints. The clear UI ensures that we don't forget about important projects and can quickly see if we need to replan our sprint to ensure we handle any problems or delays.
pros: Jira can do pretty much anything you want when it comes to project management (tickets, backlogs, sprint plannings, burndown charts, productivity metrics, you name it). The UI is clean, intuitive and responsive and once you have everything set up, it is genuinely nice to work with. We use it daily, mainly as a Kanban board within the team to discuss our progress in the current sprint. It is easy to update an existing ticket, drag it to the "review" or "done columns".Review collected by and hosted on G2.com.
cons: As mentioned before, Jira can do everything, but I was a bit dissappointed that Jira can't do alot of things out of the box, which means you have to customize things yourself, and there the story is slightly less positive.
author: Dylan E.

review_detail:
title: Jira keeps support transparent, accountable, and always on track.
review_detail: The biggest problem Jira solves for me is project chaos and misalignment. In my role, projects move fast, involve multiple stakeholders, and leave zero room for error. Before Jira, tasks would get lost in email chains, deadlines slipped, and it was hard to hold people accountable.
pros: What I like best about Jira is how it gives complete visibility and structure to projects that would otherwise feel chaotic. I’ve been using it for over two years, and the way it organizes tasks, bugs, and backlogs has genuinely improved both my personal productivity and my team’s collaboration.
cons: As much as I rely on Jira, it does have challenges. The biggest one is the learning curve. New hires often struggle with the complexity of features and workflows at first, and it takes time to get everyone comfortable. Sometimes I even need admin help just to tweak permissions or workflow rules.

review_detail:
title: JIRA will enable your Agile Workflow
pros: JIRA is the solution to integrate agile software development practices with team in small, medium and large corporations. Whether startup or 40,000 employee company, JIRA can handle project management, work distribution and release planning in one go
cons: Pricing is very tricky, especially when considering the market place extensions. Whether running your private standalone instance or using the cloud instance, JIRA can become forbiddingly expensive to a startup or small business that grows beyond their entry level tier.
author: Matt

review_detail:
title: Agile product management with ease
pros: For the features which you use everyday, JIRA is incredibly easy to use. Creating Stories, Bugs and Epics is easy and fast. Also ordering them in the backlog as well as on your Kanban / SCRUM boards. The project planning is made a lot simpler with the powerful Portfolio feature of JIRA.
cons: Getting started with more complex project plans can take a bit of time.
author: Philip

review_detail:
title: Review of jira
pros: Jira is very user friendly. Roles and tasks allocations can easily be assigned and viewed. One can instantly get a feel for and navigate around this software. Their many tabs can easily seperate and divide into certain categories.
cons: While jira is easy to navigate, it can sometimes be difficult in changing or updating task allocation. One has to go through layers to access data or any info. It does take a learning curve to filter and sort through.
author: Nikhil

review_detail:
title: Jira Ticket Tracking
pros: Jira was a wonderful addition to help us keep in contact with our software developers. It allowed us to keep a timeline of bugs and other issues and monitor their overall correction. It was easy to use and allowed for files to be attached which was critical in relaying some of the larger issues we have had to track. This did fulfill our needs for monitoring this and worked well with using files from many other sources
cons: For our end, there was not confirmation of live tracking the issue. There was an initial email that said the ticket has been received by the recipient but would rather see some way to say what user saw the issue and at what time.
author: Derek

review_detail:
title: Really amazing!
pros: I used and use the platform a lot in my day to day with product management. I like the possibility of being collaborative, customizable according to the agile methodology and allowing an excellent visualization of the processes that are happening.
cons: One thing that is missing is the possibility to modify the board view, I would like more options like: timeline and roadmap. In addition, filters and groupings by epics would be interesting and would optimize the view of boards in Jira
author: Camila

review_detail:
title: Very Simple Jira Review
pros: Jira is a great software program. It is very easy to use especially for first time users. It does not require so much training as it is user friendly. It is very robust and versatile as it offers a great way of monitoring agile projects in every stage of the project life-cycle. Being an agile scrum master and experienced project manager, I found that it also helps in consolidating my reporting to stakeholders easily.
cons: Like several technologies out there , there are a few drawbacks. I believe some of the functions have the potential to be more user friendly and intuitive. Also, the mobile version is not as friendly as the web version. The navigation path of the mobile app is too complicated. Downloading graphical reports as images from Jira is also not feasible.
author: Osahon

review_detail:
title: Easy to Use and Drives Actions
pros: We used this as a collaborative tool between two internal departments to track progress, assign and prioritize tasks requiring different departments' team members. When we introduced it, it streamlined a lot of things. Instead of excessive email chains spent looping in different people and not a real good way of tracking all of our projects, who was doing them, how far along they were, JIRA helped to make all of that easier. I could create a ticket and assign it to the developer's manager, and he would assign a develop how he saw fit in terms of efficiency, expertise, among other things. JIRA is really rather simple to use, no fluff, and that's a great thing. It's a no-nonsense software that helps things get done.
cons: The UI could be prettier, but again it was designed as a no-nonsense program. There are a couple navigation things that bothered me, but once I learned the system (very quickly) those issues went away.
author: Jake

review_detail:
title: The best tool to manage agile work environment
pros: Easy to use, task prioritization and tracking, bug tracking with full ticket system, sprints iteration for projects
cons: Need to improve performance of search through the backlog as it sometimes is buggy
author: Hamzeh

review_detail:
title: JIRA is a Great Tool - for the Right Teams
pros: The best part about JIRA is how visual the UI is. It is incredibly easy to track down and track through different tasks and sprints without having the hassle of digging through a 90s-style ticket system. My other absolute favorite thing about JIRA is the simple ability to tag individual users basically anywhere. This saves an incredible amount of time due to the way in which notifications are handled in and outside of the system. Collaboration is beyond easy with JIRA.
cons: Many of the most important features are being deprecated over time, and the customer service component of the software seems ineffective at best. Some of the best features have been removed and the highest priorities on their roadmap aren't those that would severely increase users' quality of life. I think this is part of a growing process that the company is going through, but it does cause some heartache on the regular to think that our business desires aren't being met - even through months of users requesting the simplest of features.
author: Patrick

review_detail:
title: Best project tracking tool for all teams
pros: As someone who has been using Jira for over a year now, I can attest that consolidating all of our marketing team's work in one place has significantly increased visibility and made collaboration a whole lot easier. We have found it beneficial to submit support tickets in a centralized location. This allows individuals outside of our team who handle the tickets to view them, assign them, and update their status accordingly.
cons: In our team, we often face confusion regarding the editing of workflow settings and struggle to determine the correct way to transition tickets.
author: Muthu

review_detail:

pros: The categories available in the tool is great and we have options to customize as per the organizational needs. The email notification is also one of the great features where any update on the ticket gets reflected in the email. Follow ups and SLA maintenance are quite easy. The search options are also great with many filters
cons: The templates used can be made much more simpler when compared to other features. Nothing apart from that to specify at this moment.

cons: Nothing it is a great app I recommend it to anyone who wants to begin his project it will help you and you wouldn't find any problem with using it it's so simple and effective
author: akarm

review_detail:
title: Good experience with software development teams
pros: This tool is really good when you need to gather different teams together that are working in the development of a tool. In my experience, working for a multinational company based in the US West coast and having a developer team in India plus multiple teams inside the company scattered also in Europe and Asia, having a common place so that we can all collaborate through different time zones to make things possible in order for the development to keep advancing is vital. I really like the way you can categorise tasks so that you can clearly see what's its status at a glance which allows you to have the full picture real quick and then assessing what's coming next in the overall plan. Another great feature is that it also serves as a ticketing tool that integrates with the whole development scheme. From there you can create tickets with requests or bugs that can then be resolved or developed accordingly.
cons: Although very powerful, the platform might be a bit tricky at first when you don't know exactly how to work with it. For smaller companies, the cost of the tool can be a bit high and might not be worth spending that much as they might not profit all of the features at the end.
author: Laura

review_detail:
title: Paradigm shift
pros: Ability to integrate with legacy Microsoft products and represent ongoing projects in the company with a timeline view and also overcome shortcomings of other Project management software out there in the market. The dashboard view has everything w.r.t timesheet capture and effort spent in the same view. Hierarchical approach to IT management with English like terminologies are easy to understand and implement. This makes life easier of the users as well as administrators.
cons: In a single project it will be good to have multiple epics to manage the branch projects. Trend tracking with snapshot is a must. Please consider to make it available in future versions.
author: Ravi

review_detail:
title: Productivity monster
pros: Jira offers variety of use cases for project management, task, management, employee task, scheduling. It is very helpful that it is not a standalone software but runs in browser. I find it very helpful to manage my daily tasks and be on top of the deadlines.
cons: If a task assigned to an employee is missed by him or her, then there should be an option to nudge them to check the jira board.
author: Prashant

review_detail:
title: Enterprise and clunky but fully featured
pros: JIRA has all the features you could reasonably want from an agile task-management system. It integrates nicely into existing Active Directory user controls, allows for lots of teams independent teams with cross-dependencies, and allows for full customization depending on how your company implements agile methodologies.
cons: As an enterprise product, JIRA can be somewhat clunky and overbearing. Changes can be difficult to implement, and the UI is sometimes overwhelming or unhelpful if you only want to use a subset of the shown features.
author: Austin

review_detail:
title: Great Tool with multiple benefits but grown too big and clunky
pros: The core capabilites are at its best. Creating issues, bugs, epics, stories, tasks etc is brilliant. Managing status changes, showing sprint summaries and completing sprints is very good
cons: Settings have become very very complicated. Project ownership, allowing edit and delete access, modifying status workflow are fragmented and confusing to understand

review_detail:

cons: La curva di apprendimento all'inizio può essere davvero ripida, soprattutto per chi deve gestire i progetti ed effettuare il setup del sistema, al punto da far desistere e puntare su sistemi più semplici.

cons: The search function needs improvement. It frequently seems to miss similar results, only finding exact matches. Not a deal-breaker, but definitely could be better.

The possibilities are endless with this program, though I will admit that the current implementation is by far the best.

title: Jira

review_detail:

La capacité de personnaliser Jira pour répondre aux besoins spécifiques de l'entreprise permet une adaptation optimale aux processus internes. Le support actif de la communauté et une grande base de connaissances offrent une assistance pour les utilisateurs.
cons: La configuration et la personnalisation de Jira peuvent nécessiter une expertise technique, ce qui peut être un défi pour certaines entreprises. La gestion de projets complexes avec de nombreux flux de travail peut nécessiter une planification et une maintenance régulières.

cons: Mi ha lasciato un pò a desiderare la diffcoltà che si riscontra all'inizio affacciandosi al programma

review_detail:
title: Organization is key

cons: Nothing really, i really enjoyed the experience
author: Joana

review_detail:
title: Most advanced project workflow management solution
pros: Jira is robust, well-know solution used by lots of companies. It provides lots of features which allows you to control your project from the ground. You can set up project roadmap, create tasks and epics. Reporting for bugs is also included. You can make great customisations which provides a bug flexibility. Employees can track time on task and set esteemed time. You can use JIRA API to make some process integrated with another tools. Jira provides another solutions integrated into one place like documentation management Confluence or Support desk board.
cons: Application performance sometimes make me angry :) Lots of functions so the UI is not so intuitive.
author: Martin

review_detail:
title: Enhancing Productivity and Collaboration with Jira Software
pros: It has some really useful features like customizing how you work, support for different ways of managing tasks, and keeping track of your work. It can also connect with other tools you use. While it's powerful, it might seem a bit tricky at first. Making it work smoothly with the tools you already use depends on how complex your setup is and how familiar you are with the software. But the good news is, Jira gives you lots of options to connect things together. You might need some help setting it up perfectly, but it can be a valuable tool for getting work done efficiently.
cons: Some people might find It a bit tricky when they first start using it, especially setting up projects and making custom workflows. It's become easier to use over time, but it can still be a bit challenging for newcomers or those who aren't tech-savvy. Making it work smoothly with the tools you already use depends on how complicated your setup is. Sometimes, you might need help from experts to make everything fit together perfectly.
author: Sanobar

review_detail:
title: Great tool to manage your workflow
pros: The ease of use, effective steps, and useful for setting goals and monitoring them, the free plan is helpful for small businesses and entrepreneurs
cons: Complexity in one place 'you will need to learn about every aspect to master it

review_detail:
title: More visibility to see what the tech team is working on
pros: I work in a customer-facing role; the product/tech team use Jira to plan their sprints. Beyond the benefits for the planning, It helps me see what the tech team is working on and previous tickets. I didn't ask as many questions on Slack; I could check it during my meetings with customers or while answering an email. It made my life easier, I bet the developers appreciate the peace too.
cons: I don't feel that comfortable using it, I like it as reader,

This makes collaboration extremely amazing. It is very affordable and effective. I also prefer Jira because of its analytics and reporting features (jira query language), which help to track project progress, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions.

Es gibt keine vergleichbare Lösung auf dem Markt. 2. **Schnelles Setup:** Die Einrichtung geht zügig vonstatten, und du kannst direkt loslegen. 3. **Übersichtliche Ticketliste:** Die Tickets werden klar und strukturiert aufgelistet.
cons: **Nachteile:** 1. **Komplexere Zusammenhänge:** Bei komplexeren Aufgaben können einige Schwierigkeiten auftreten.

review_detail:

cons: For smaller teams, I find it rather expensive and kind of an overkill.
