review_detail:
title: Jira,the best choice when it comes to team work.
pros: What I loved most is the ability to get notifications on my mobile phone,even when am not on the software
cons: Absolutely nothing,the software is very efficient to me.
author: Adedayo

review_detail:
title: Jira is a very fantastic tool for managing projects
pros: monitoring, flexibility and tracking are really good in Jira. Jira has a good reporting system.
cons: Its a little complex UI but I will say Jira have a lot of features in it so being heavy or complicated is natural.
author: Amar

review_detail:
title: JIRA- Easy to Plan, Track & Release Project.
pros: I have been working on an Agile Project and I would say this is the best tool for the below reasons, * Better visualization of the project roadmap for the team. *Customizable options, Kanban and Scrum boards that can be modified as per the project and fields to be displayed, columns on board for the flow of tickets, etc.. * Easy task allocation and tracking, from both Manger's and team members view. * Allows the user to create/edit respective items, for example making file and screenshot attachments just a click away. * Integration with other apps used by the project is simple. Namely apps like TestRail & Confluence. * Best part is the backlog, which helps to create/track ticket then and there when required and work on it in future. * Viewing logs is easy as every action is tracked. * Easy filtering options and report generation for project statuses. * Filter out tickets release-wise, helpful for regression.
cons: For the simplicity of the application, I could hardly think of any major negative points. I faced this situation so just sharing it. If the team member is released from a project he/she has no option to request via.JIRA to dissociate from the Project Board/unsubscribe from getting emails related to the ex-project. Inbox gets loaded with all the comments and action performed by the ex-team members.
author: Rubini

review_detail:
title: Addons for almost everything
pros: It's eide accepted as a standard within the industry thus most people already know jira Makes it easier to collaborate with other companies.
cons: For most things I want to do within Jira, it turns out I need an addon. There is a very wide variety of addons on the market but the top quality ones are mostly paid. I would expect this tool to have better feature coverage within the core product.
author: Bruno

review_detail:
title: Best tool to manage tasks and practice Agile
pros: As a QA engineer, I have been working with Jira for more than one year now and it is the best tool to manage my tasks and practice agile. Since it helps to manage multiple tasks under one project it is easy to track the tasks. The ability to use labels when creating issues makes me easy to filter the necessary tickets based on m,y project modules. Jira also enables email notifications once a change is done to Jira tickets which also makes me easier to track the assigned tasks. We use a separate dashboard to track the progress of our sprint in Jira. As Jira has the ability to generate pie charts and graphs it made me easy to present the number of issues encountered, the number of test cases and etc to the management without any struggle. The function to generate sprint reports, burndown charts and velocity graphs in Jira assists our team to get an idea on which parts we need to improve and focus on in the next sprint.
cons: The learning curve is a bit high in Jira since it has a lot of hidden functionalities that can be used to optimize our day to day work. The scrum master should be more concerend about managing tickets because there is a high chance of creating unecessary tickets and the tickets being misplaced.
author: Dileesha

review_detail:
title: Very Powerful but only if your team is techy enough to use it
pros: So far, the gold standard in project and process management, especially in the number of options, features, automations, integrations and workflows that the software is capable of handling. We shifted to this software when the pandemic hit and were forced to stay at home since we needed a more powerful software to handle our workflow. If you have a techy team, nothing else compares.
cons: Biggest con really is that it is not the most user friendly software. Unlike Trello or Asana where you can just go fire it up and it's good to go. This one takes a lot of set-up to do and a deep familiarity with how it works under the hood. Given that the software is one of the older ones, you can sort of see it's age in both the older workflows (issues, screens, etc) vs the newer templates. The newer project templates sort of partially solved this problem but if you need to tweak the settings, it still has a steeper learning curve. The con really here is that i tried Jira with my other less techy company (a school) and adoption was really low as users just weren't able to keep up with it.
author: Niel

review_detail:
title: Awesome Project Management Tool
pros: It's a very flexible and powerful tool ideal for managing any project, from small to large-scale enterprise projects. We loved that we could easily link it to our Github and Slack channels to automate many things while providing us with a clean interface to track our project timeline.
cons: Although Jira is very powerful, there's a bit of a learning curve for new users. However, once they get past the initial learning curve, It becomes easy to utilize Jira's extremely powerful and useful features.
author: Paul

review_detail:
title: Great software for managing projects.
pros: I like the graphical user interface that is included in jira. I also like how it is easy to assign individuals different tasks and to monitor project development throughout the life cycle.
cons: The responsiveness of the software can sometimes make using it frustrating. This could be because there are a lot of users, but improving the responsiveness would be very helpful.
author: Chris

review_detail:
title: The essential planning and run tool for agile software teams
pros: Shallow learning curve to get started yet feature rich enough to customise to your needs
cons: New features are slow to rollout and the communications/ notifications from the product could be better
author: Alex

review_detail:
title: Flexible and efficient organization in the execution of tasks
pros: It is important that the different teams can execute the tasks they are asked to perform with precision within the agreed timeframe. For this reason, Jira is equipped with an efficient and optimal planning tool that allows to apply with its multiple functionalities methods of management and personalized follow-up of the projects.
cons: By integrating other software, Jira exponentially increases its capacities and functionalities. The main difficulty encountered was to be able to successfully get used to it, which takes time.
author: Rodrigue

review_detail:
title: the first time I used jira, it was great, I could use it easily
pros: I was able to customize the planning in the way that is most comfortable for the team to work with. It offers a global vision about the work of the team, whether the users are in the same location as if they work in a decentralized way in other delegations or perform teleworking. Order incidents, user histories or tasks from your list by simply dragging and dropping them according to priority. Choose the way to follow the status of the projects of your entire team, with a quick view, with customized panels or even with a predefined report. You will be able to know to which member of your team your work is accumulated, how many projects are still ongoing, which are completed, add an appointment to the calendar, etc. Thanks to the workflow that define the processes, you will allow your team to keep track of the tasks, they can change the status of pending tasks by simply dragging and dropping the task in the corresponding column in the kanban panels. Supervises all the details in an easy and fast way, thanks to all the information is in the same place and thus avoid sending emails or schedule unnecessary meetings. With notifications, the attention of a certain person may be required when necessary.
cons: I did not receive notifications to the mail. does not have Spanish language. the interface could be a little more user friendly
author: Alejandro

review_detail:
title: Best software of its kind
pros: Good UI that let's you keep track of all your open projects
cons: Grid view with the preview layout on the right
author: João

review_detail:
title: Takes time to learn how to use but useful for Agile work flows
pros: Well organised flows in the tool for full sprints and for a single task/bug/epic. Useful for team collaboration, especially if team is distributed in different geographic areas. Allows attaching images that have been coppied (for example in a screenshot) by using "paste" function - very useful!
cons: The UI is cluttered and difficult to master. At times it can be very confusing. Search is difficult - as it is never clear where exactly the search is conducted (in the project? in ALL projects?). Filters are hard to apply, and different filters are missing. Minor issues can be a real nuisance and slow down the work - for example links will open in the same window, overriding the task you have just been looking at. There is no autosave - so you may find yourself writing for a while and for some reason a refresh will delete all your work.
author: Sagit

review_detail:
title: Best ticketing tool
pros: JIRA software is very easy to use , it doesn't require any special skills to understand . Anybody can use this product on their own.We can track the individual team's work or individual employee's work and track the tickets easily. We are using the scrum dashboard to monitor & track our sprints.
cons: In the new jira software , i cannot copy / paste the mail contents , if i want to copy multiple mail chain threads to the JIRA , it's failing. This issue is not there in old JIRA software.
author: infant

review_detail:
title: Jira - a Writer and content Manager's Mutual Ally
pros: I have used JIRA to track and submit writing assignments. I am assigned the articles by a content manager through Jira dashboard. Each article happens to be an item. Within that item, the general idea of the article, outline and even keywords are shared by the content manager. If I am an assignee, I receive a notification via email to check my dashboard. Once the article is done, I can upload the draft and the content manager would get the notification. Word count is also specified. Usually, my articles are accepted in one go. However, if there is a need for revision, there would be a comment or an edit and I would get a notification about it. Once the article has gone through all the checks by the content manager, the status of the article is changed to resolved.
cons: It took me two days to find myself around the system. I wish there was a tutorial that would have been easy enough to understand an follow. But once I got the hang of it, things got very smooth for me and my content manager.
author: Ambreen

review_detail:
title: It's Cost Effective and Useful
pros: It is affordable and effective, which is my number one reason for liking it. This simple user interface allows you to configure it to suit your preferences and recognizes everyone approaches their work differently. It's easy to manage resources and workload with Jira's reporting and resource management features. You can create custom workflows and rules for Jira without any hassle and in no time. Dividing complex tasks into simple ones can be accomplished by keeping everyone informed about the project's status and progress.
cons: Understanding the software and setting it up takes some patience and time. After an update, the software sometimes behaves strangely.
author: Godfrey

review_detail:
title: Best issue tracking platform
pros: Once set up it's very easy to use and has so many integrations with other systems that it's hard to live without.
cons: Setting the system up is not an easy task at all. There are so many options that knowing the right choice is often difficult and error prone causing you to go back and try to find the right setting amongst hundreds and hundreds of settings.
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: Jira is an excellent tool for managing software development projects
pros: Jira is a very customisable software that can be adapted to fit the needs of any organisation. It is very flexible and can be used for a wide range of projects.
cons: Jira is a pain to use. It's complicated and technical, and it's hard to keep track of everything. I've had to ask for help from our IT department multiple times just to figure out how to do simple things. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone.

review_detail:
title: Jira is great
pros: That you can escalate the issue easier to your management
cons: It's a really good tools so no complaints overalla

review_detail:
title: Best Ever toolbox which has reshaped the software delivery
pros: A very good tool for workflow management and supports all sorts of software delivery models. It allows to delegate tasks, monitor progress, and allow follow-up. Useful reporting features that can be used to track progress against a milestone.
cons: JQL is a key feature to add the capability of having custom dashboards but learning JQL could be a steep curve for someone not from a programming background.
author: Mohit

review_detail:
title: Development Tracking Tool for Software Development
pros: JIRA Software is powerful project management tool which is used in planning, tracking and managing the agile software development life-cycle. The scaleable workflow for collaboration helps in customization of the life-cycle as per the need of the product. Tracking on issues can be prioritized as per the release importance. Release dashboard helps in tracking the status of the sprint or version. We have customized the workflow of the some of new projects to deliver the sanitized code. The integration of Bamboo helps to let you know the the build status.
cons: Managing and assigning the configuration permission need some feature to simplify the process. Self-managed hosting need care and cost, So cloud based hosting is always recommended for the users those who have lease line for Internet connection.

review_detail:
title: Smooth and Fast
pros: We are using cloud version of JIRA. Its react UI is very fast and simple to use. Project dashboard is clean and very well tracked. Burn down, Burn Up all charts are so easy to understand that management can see the progress It also supports Kanban for the projects. easy to create blockers/dependency from other team
cons: Bit learning curve Need some training before even getting started. Subtask and categories are little confusing.
author: Vikash Kumar

review_detail:
title: Jira the Task management Tool
pros: As a user of Jira, I appreciate its ability to allow you to plan your entire day, including the tasks you must do and the projects you want to work on. It is a great tool for planning the entire day at the office and also provides work reminders.
cons: My experience with Jira was positive. It is helping our organization to keep a track of each employee's work and keeps us updated about their progress.
author: Shelly

review_detail:
title: Avaliação do Jira
pros: Os recursos de abrir e concluir tarefas e administrar o tempo de cada uma é muito importante. O software é fácil de configurar e utilizar.
cons: Em alguns computadores, o software apresenta uma certa lentidão ao executar algumas funções.
author: Rafael

review_detail:
title: Advanced Project Management tool
pros: Jira is a nice and powerful tool to track our projects. This includes all Epics, Stories, Tasks, Sub-tasks and bugs. It allows for many options as well, including labels, easy prioritization (drag and drop). Recently they have added features to help track milestones, so you don't need MS project anymore. There are a lot of different reports (good for clients) and numerous integrations available.
cons: After you get to so many users, the costs increase quite a bit. Confluence and some add-ons are also additional costs. We have also found the odd bug. For example, the wrong ticket is updated, or in the backlog view the mouse curser can no longer select rows (fixed by a refresh). Classic Projects vs. New Project is also a bit confusing. It's hard to get new features for some of our old projects, unless we recreate the Project from the start.
author: Benjamin

review_detail:
title: JIRA is a functional agile project management application
pros: Jira is a fantastic tool for managing projects. It is the finest choice for managing agile projects and bug tracking. Jira makes it possible to utilize several teams at once, creating a lot of connections. Teams from the product development, product design, and product strategy divisions may collaborate to better projects. Using the filtering and searching tools, each team may keep track of its own deliverables, milestones, and tasks. If you are leveraging the Agile Scrum framework, implementing custom views will help to assist your daily stand-up sessions. You might create your own distinctive points of view to talk just on the important components of the assignments. This function is efficient and saves time for a daily ten-minute stand-up. Other new features that make Jira a must-buy include alerts for due dates, assignment distribution, labelling, assigning task priority levels, and generating epic connections that display the user narrative and project progress. Jira has Kanban boards where you may choose between showing and hiding features from other team members. Due to its capacity to integrate with many frameworks and maintain task and deliverable backlogs, Jira offers a great level of flexibility. Jira has excellent organization in its sprint planning, sprint release, and history structure. Any type of project management may use it. Customer assistance is offered by Jira, which is quite helpful.
cons: My own opinion is that it's a fantastic tool; one of the dew drawback is the cost per user, which initially looks good but increases overtime. Another drawback I've seen when using Jira is that there isn't an option to have audible notifications. When a new ticket is created, Jira, for instance, doesn't make a sound. So, if a user leaves the system, they risk missing a vital ticket.
author: Samuel

review_detail:
title: The best tool for a product manager
pros: JIRA gives me so much functionality out of the box. Within five minutes, I can create a board and invite my whole team to start working with me. It doesn't take long to customize your presentation of work to make it specific to your business. It has become the standard for the industry and with good reason; JIRA gives me everything that I need to track performance and ensure a timely release.
cons: There are occasionally some annoying bugs that will present themselves, but it's never something that really prevents me from using the product effectively; usually it's an annoying UI bug that looks messy or ugly. For the most part, many of the people that complain about the product just don't know how to use it 'as is out of the box'. The more configurations you try to make, the more problems you can create for yourself. Aside from this, their customer service is quite lackluster and it often takes days if not weeks to hear back from support - usually the bugs are fixed before you even get a response.
author: Mikael

review_detail:
title: Excellent tool for workflow management and issue tracking
pros: From the standpoint of a user, Jira is easy to navigate and a robust tool for submitting requests to other users for action. All actions are then tracked and cause alerts to anyone who is watching the request. Workflows can be easily managed and requests sent down unique paths to specific users or groups for further action and approvals. Communicating on requests and then collaborating back and forth with other users is simple and effective. It's a great tool!
cons: Reporting and searching within Jira is strong, but very confusing for new users. It can be difficult to establish the right query and users are often left with large lists of requests/Issues to sort through while attempting to find what they are looking for. Reporting is also difficult and other tools are much more intuitive. We are often left wanting to use other tools to consume the Jira data and then display and analyze it.
author: Matt

review_detail:
title: My 5 year Use Review of Jira
pros: I love the ticket filtering and export feature the most on Jira. I am able to view tickets by status, I can move the columns around and create multiple different views on my profile. I can create alerts for tickets with preset properties
cons: The data visualization feature on Jira is a bit confusing to use and I honestly think the feature be removed
author: Ogarekpe

review_detail:
title: Jira is a one stop shop for project management
pros: I live how easy Jira is to use. The familiar functions mean that I can quickly pick up how to use it and get started straight away. The visual aspect of jira tickets means I can effortlessly see where things are up to.Swim lanes mean that I can track progress with a glance.
cons: I like colour. i like to tag and colour code things. It helps with visual understanding. I wish jira had more colour.
author: Cheyenne

review_detail:
title: One and only Jira
pros: Jira's agile boards allow teams to plan and manage their work using agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban. These boards can be customized to match the team's specific requirements and provide valuable insights into project progress.
cons: when working with large datasets or complex workflows, it can result in slow load times, crashes, or other issues that impact productivity.
author: Manohar

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: I have been using Jira for many years to manage Sprints and Long term strategic planning.
cons: I can't say that there is anything that I dislike about Jira. This system hit the nail on the head.
author: Mindy

review_detail:
title: Jira offers a comprehensive range of project management services.
pros: The best thing about this tool is that it offers you so much functionalities that makes your day to day work easier to manage and you can easily keep track all the project info at one place. Integration with other applications is one of the great functionality what this tool offers.
cons: There are limited automations functionalities this software has to offer. While the project is software type, it does not offer you the automations functionalities. Other than that, this tool is a one stop solution for all your project needs.
author: Deepanshu

review_detail:
title: Highly Customizable - Blessing and Curse
pros: JIRA is extremely customizable. If you can figure out how to use JIRA, anything you want to make happen can happen. We've used templates in different ticket types to ensure users are providing all information needed at the outset. We have different boards for triage, scoping, and dev work to chunk out the process and keep it organized
cons: Because its so customizable, it is extremely hard to figure out how to setup an experience you want...especially without disrupting existing setups. The names JIRA has for customizations are not clear and you get into a web of different settings and its very easy to get lost and not understand what youre doing. And its very difficult to tell how one setting affects another and which settings you need to update to realize your change.
author: Abigail

review_detail:
title: JIRA is a tool that is simply required for every project, helps in tracking and managing the tasks.
pros: It is the only solutions comes up in mind when working on a software development project, but its not only limited to this, we can track work items/tasks easily. I also used it as to track the overall incident. Easier to make the comments and to assign the different work items to different stakeholders. Version tracking is also another great feature comes up with JIRA. If you are using confluence for docs management, with JIRA it all comes under the same umbrella which really makes it cool.
cons: Access management might not be that good, as integrating different tenant (Users with different alias from outside organization) within JIRA was not possible . JIRA should work on improving this feature.
author: Anwer

review_detail:
title: Jira a comprehensive tool for successful Projects
pros: Prioritization time tracking task management are my favorite features of the software. By utilizing these features I am able to successfully delivered projects on time within budget and above expectations to our clients.
cons: The only downside I have noticed is that in order to administer the software you need more than just basic skills. It requires a background in IT As well as some networking and coding skills.
author: Eugene

review_detail:
title: Great for project, time, and task management
pros: Jira works perfectly for me to keep all my tasks organised. I know what I have to work on at a given moment, in the context of agile/kanban/sprint setups, and it connects really well with the other software I use. Definitely recommend for its wide featureset and helping me keep on track.
cons: Complex to learn at first, though the tutorial helps. I would recommend doing a short course on LinkedIn or something, as the featureset is very broad. I tend to just use it within the immediate realm of use.
author: Eshwar

review_detail:
title: If you are doing Agile/SCRUM software development, JIRA is a must
pros: My organisation uses Agile software development to do product development, it would be appropriate for me to say every one of us uses this software right from the developers, to QAs to designers to Product Managers to even the senior management. Everyone has their own work areas inside JIRA. It is difficult to say in few words what JIRA is, it is a complete suite for a software development company and I'd suggest you try out JIRA no matter the size of your team. My main work areas and familiarity are the backlog, story management and issue reporting. JIRA acts as the single source of truth with its easy to use Epic and Story feature which makes the life of a product owner very comfortable. The development teams are then able to do their story estimations and sprint planning all in the same place. I would highly recommend you to try JIRA even if you are a startup or a big software house.
cons: JIRA has a learning curve (at least for me, coming from a non-technical or project management background) but with a bit of training (can be done by yourself) it is not that hard to get up and running. Initially, I struggled to find my way around the software and also didn't know how to use some features and tools. But when you get accustomed to the UI, you will realise the power of JIRA.
author: Chandula

review_detail:
title: Jira integrator is helpful to leverage task data across critical apps
pros: Jira is being adopted by more Development Teams within our organization and now we are able to use the SmartSheet integrator to report project metrics. This tool allows us to sync our task status to one or more sheets to manage separate deliverables as well as projects. It limits the need for Teams to report data in multiple applications.
cons: While the integrator is useful, we cannot edit or view the details for workflows created by others. The integrator(s) have not worked well with Confluence, but that may be a training issue. I would also like to use the API if possible.
author: Melissa

review_detail:
title: Using Jira to manage your Agile team
pros: One of the handy features is the integration with our code repository. The way that everything just simply worked and was easy to figure out was a huge plus.
cons: There was not an easy way to integrate our QA tools into Jira. We had to link stories manually. My understanding is was not a limitation of Jira, but the tool we were using. We have since changed tools.
author: Shawn

review_detail:
title: Highly flexible Agile project management tool but a little complicated to use.
pros: I have been using Jira from last 5+ years now for Backlog management, Requirements management, Bug tracking and creating Dashboards for project review meetings with leadership. It's extremely flexible tool where you can configure your own workflows and customize it as per your project's needs. It's my go-to Agile project management tool (especially for Scrum). It's so easy to create and manage user stories, bugs, technical tasks etc. You can tag your user stories as per Epics and Features, you can also add labels to each ticket. You can track the status of any ticket and also see the bandwidth allocation of various teams. In JIRA, you can add advanced search filters to view only those user stories that has particular combination of fields (like specific assignee, status, epic name etc.). Moreover, JIRA Dashboard provides a bird's eye view of the overall project status which gives the real time visibility to you and the leadership team. The UI is very clean and simple and it makes Agile Development very productive, once you get the hang of it. Plus, it's very well integrated with many popular apps like Google workplace, workday, slack etc. But there is definitely a steep learning curve with Jira. The success of this product largely depends on how your management/leadership standardize various processes and workflows within Jira.
cons: Jira doesn't allow you to add multiple assignee on one user story, and this becomes a concern when multiple developers are working on one story. Also, it's hard to get support from Atlassian when you are facing some technical issues. Additionally, in my experience, I have found that as Jira provides great level of customization, it can become really messy, if multiple management styles are involved during project planning phase. The workflows can get overly complicated and as a Product Owner, you find yourself stuck in updating the ticket statuses all day long.
author: Shivani

review_detail:
title: The go-to tool for tech teams
pros: I like the ticketing system and how its integrated with boards. As a more technical guy, i like to use tools like Jira. But it's always a mess to onboard non-tech people as its not easy to understand for many.
cons: It costs a lot. You have to pay extra for a lot of things like new connections or new members. Also its hard to teach to non tech people.
author: Siim

review_detail:
title: Powerful Project Management tool
pros: Jira is an excellent project management tool. It enables us to create and track tasks, track progress, and collaborate effectively as a team. Jira's customizability is also a major advantage, allowing us to create workflows that are tailored to our specific processes. The reporting and analytics tools are also excellent, allowing us to monitor performance and identify areas for improvement. It has aided us in streamlining our development process and improving our collaboration.
cons: The interface is cluttered, and there are so many options that it's difficult to know where to begin. It takes some time to get used to Jira, and even then, it can be difficult to find what you're looking for. Excessive customization can make Jira even more complicated and difficult to use.
author: Anoop

review_detail:
title: Professional Project Management Suite Comes with Expensive Price Tag
pros: Jira is the industry-leading project management suite, and it provides A+ grade customer support. Whenever there is a problem with the Jira server, I can log a support ticket, and Jira has provided great support to fix it.
cons: So expensive. There are state-of-the-art new project management tools available now, such as ClickUp. When comparing Jira with other latest project management products, I think Jira pricing is way too higher.
author: Yasas Sri

review_detail:
title: Versatile tool for help desk and task management
pros: I love Jira's ease of use. Jira allows our staff and business partners to request from us using Jira Service Desk. Engineers track their effort using Jira Software. We use the default settings for the most part and that works great for us. There is no need to train anyone on how to use it because everything is self-explanatory. That cuts down on confusion and allows us to get/enter accurate information.
cons: It is slow. It is very slow at times. Jira's makers - Atlassian - have not paid much attention over the years about its slowness. If you are into full-fledged project management, portfolio planning and more, you will have to buy add-ons to get additional functionality within Jira. Did I say that Jira is slow? While the ease of use saves time in accurately recording information in Jira, all that saved time is wasted away waiting for pages to load.
author: Chirag

review_detail:
title: Jira jira, hear alll about it!
pros: Jira is a powerful agile tool, with plenty of out of the box functionality for teams using pure agile methodologies. With some minor tweaks it can accomodate hybrid delivery methodology and is visually pleasing to use. The confluence connection makes for a well formed eco system for daily usage.
cons: The one drawback is the unified nature of Jira. When admin managed, it may be over restrictive and limit a projects potential customization. I do believe this is however implementation specific and can be easily overcome.
author: Matthew

review_detail:
title: Great Project Management Tool
pros: Jira provides a ton of features in terms of project planning, the ability to create a hierarchy of epics, and feature > delivery > story, which is a great feature to track deliverables in a release. It provides sufficient options to write detailed stories, add functional workflows, excel data sets, etc. Helps in Issue and bug tracking during production support, UAT phase, and QA testing. A great collaboration platform, due to the ability to write comments, notifications, tag required personnel, and seamless integration with other tools such as Outlook and Confluence.Log efforts and Tempo (dashboard to track daily efforts) is an amazing tool for productivity enhancements.
cons: There are a few limitations of JIRA as well - - The search engine of JIRA doesn't always fetch the correct results despite using the correct keywords, it's not as smart as an AI-powered engine or Google. Also, the Smart Query feature is not that useful, many times basic search work well.- Doesn't have the templates to write detailed documents such as FSD or a design document, not a very good knowledge management tool.
author: Rishabh

review_detail:
title: Jira is the de fact industry standard - for a reason!
pros: It's highly customizable so it can fit the needs of practically any organization.
cons: Support does not reply to your issues unless you're a Jira admin.
author: Mirza

review_detail:
title: RECOMMEND Jira for Agile Delivery Projects
pros: Workflow management Backlog creation Estimations Task Management Prioritization Dashboards and sprint metrics
cons: Would be good of Jira had more formatting options when writing user stories.
author: Rekha

review_detail:
title: JIRA is probably the best tool in its field
pros: JIRA is a great software, very useful in the day to day working life. It is able to provide a good track of our records and customer complains, and it is a very good monitoring tool for all our cases. I have used several / different software for this job, and I can certify that JIRA is the best tool (even if it is more expensive compared with the competition). The customers are also very happy with our reaction time and the way we are treating the cases with JIRA (writing text, sending attachements and pictures, highlighting text etc.)... it is kind of the best customer support tool that we used so far.
cons: Even if JIRA is a great product, it is not perfect. There are some things that I do not like. One of them is the response time, which quite often is slow, and after I click one menu it take 5 seconds to load the page. Other issue is the refresh rate: sometimes I update cases but on the main page they are not updated. Also, if I refresh the page, I receive the old status first and only after 5-10 seconds it gets updated to the latest status. The search function is not the best, as sometimes is missing some results that I am actually looking for.
author: Mihai

review_detail:
title: Jira - fantastic if you know how to use it.
pros: Jira is incredibly powerful when it comes to tracking work across teams. The customisation options are a real highlight. For example, we liked that you can tailor boards, workflows, and automations to fit almost any process. For planning, we found it especially useful to visualise projects, assign responsibilities, and monitor progress in a way that kept everyone aligned. The integrations with other tools (like Slack and Confluence) also added a lot of value.
cons: Personally, I found that it can be overwhelming if you don’t have someone internally who really understands how to configure it properly. The setup isn’t always intuitive for non-technical teams, and without regular maintenance, it can get messy quickly. Also, we found that the cost can really add up, particularly for smaller teams or companies looking to simplify their tool stack.
author: Alice Taylor

review_detail:
title: After more than 5 years using it, I still recommend it!
pros: The way it's integrated with BitBucket for tasks and version control is fantastic, they work together beautifully and will continue to use them as long as I'm in the business.
cons: Can't say I don't like any part of the product, but I will say that if you have more than one Atlassian account and switch between them constantly, some funky stuff happens when switching. But this is probably a browser mismanagement of cookies or cache, who knows.
author: David

review_detail:
title: Advanced user but still has to fumble around
pros: It simplifies burn down reporting, allows users to manually enter and submit tickets and stories for sprints. I like that the different task types (story vs epic, etc.) can be customized to have their own fields. And I like the history feed on each work item.
cons: It frustrates me that I’m unable to easily bounce from BLI sprint view to swim lane / Kanban view, and being able to revert or remove imposed fields when the wrong template was selected. These make the tool so cumbersome and time prohibitive that employees stop using the tool altogether.
author: Bri

review_detail:
title: Greatest tool ever
pros: The ease to use and multipurpose for project management is the best solution ever. The features are outstanding and stands out.
cons: The user interface can be more and more intuitive and interactive. The drag and drop features are u known which needs to be put up.
author: Ketaki

review_detail:
title: STREAMLINED AND EASY TO USE TOOL TO KEEP TRACK OF COMPLEX PROJECTS!
pros: Being that I had never used JIRA before, I found it very easy to adapt to. The simplistic nature of moving story cards from left to right as the project progressed made the platform very simple to understand. The support received internally also made troubleshooting a breeze.
cons: When certain situations arose, not being able to move the story card from right to left sometimes created more work when issues took place.
author: Lisa

review_detail:
title: Great for Project Management, but a Bit Complex
pros: well, Jira is a powerful tool for managing projects and tasks, and it's great for collaboration. I especially like how one can customize workflows and create dashboards to track different types of tickets. It helps our team stay organized and efficient
cons: one problem faced was is user interface, which can be cluttered and difficult to navigate at first. It also seems to use a lot of computer memory, especially when multiple tabs are open, which can slow things down.
author: Fohsoh

review_detail:
title: Great project and task management tool
pros: Highly customizable workflows and easy integration with other tools. It has effective collaboration features. Also, enabled creating a dashboard on different categories of tickets that are created, both internally and externally, which helps with tracking trends and increasing overall efficiency of the process.
cons: It has rather complex UI and the interface can be overly complex and cluttered, making it difficult to navigate. It can also be slow, especially with large projects or data sets.
author: Parsa

review_detail:
title: State of the art project management software
pros: Jira is a really well rounded tool that integrates highly with other Atlassian software such as bitbucket. When using multiple issues it makes it easy for a team to track work load and releases accross everything.
cons: There can be a steep learning curve to get everything setup, and its not often clear where the right settings are.
author: Zachary

review_detail:
title: Every business needs this
pros: Submitting tickets and getting issues resolved has literally never been easier. Not fun having work problems, but I can easily get resolved with jira.
cons: Sometime I get too many notifications about unrelated tasks. But overall, I can't imagine my workday without jira.
author: Jacob

review_detail:
title: A Powerful Tool for Agile Teams with a Steep Learning Curve
pros: Jira stands out for its robust features tailored for Agile project management. I especially appreciate the flexibility in configuring workflows, custom fields, and issue types to suit different teams and project needs. Its integration with other Atlassian tools like Confluence and Bitbucket is seamless, and the reporting capabilities (burn-down charts, velocity reports, cumulative flow diagrams) provide valuable insights for tracking progress and performance.
cons: The user interface can be overwhelming for new users, and the initial setup requires a solid understanding of Jira’s configuration options. Performance can lag slightly with large datasets, and managing permissions or automations sometimes feels unnecessarily complex. Additionally, the pricing can be a bit high for smaller teams or startups.
author: Jose

review_detail:
title: Jira - Great for teams big and small
pros: As a Jira user for many years, something which always stands out is the highly customisable workflows and fields. Having an understanding of JQL queries really helps bring power to their search snd filtering functionality. Jira has a wide reach when it comes to integrations with dev tools. Issue tracking and workflows allows for easy tracking, bug fixing and feature development, allowong for cross team collaboration, with clear reporting features to understand dev team efficiency.
cons: Jira, although a tool of choice does come with a steep learning curve and to some extent, a complex UI. With large instances, going with the cloud solution can be beneficial, but also has the potential for some performance issues with large instances. Due to the flexibility of Jira, although great for dev teams cuatomising their own methodology, there is a risk of over-customisation which could lead to causing complexity. There is a mobile app, but there are many limitations, and it used more for updates rather than working within the app. There are many addons, but there is a potential to add cost to your base subscription, this can cause the total solution cost to be high.
author: Brian

review_detail:
title: Great software with plenty of extensibility
pros: Jira is incredibly flexible and it is tailored to fit the needs of our teams and workflows.l like how user can track the issues using epicor releases. I also use Jira tool to manage our sprint board as we work on Agile.we do use Jira intergred with test Rail to have the test cases linked to the particular Jira.
cons: Jira is great and it provides the necessary options.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Jira a Powerful Tool For Team Collaboration and Task Management.
pros: Jira provides customizable workflows that allow us to adapt to our specific needs.Drag and drop features is great as it saves alot of time.Has an excellent mobile application for both Android and iOS devices. Support both Scrum and Kanban methodologies that help us to manage projects effectively. Offer time tracking feature with color indication that us we are able to use color code to indicate the time spent on tasks thus facilitating tracking.
cons: My only challenge is in Jira sometimes there is a struggle to handle complex data ,load slowly .
author: Martin

review_detail:
title: Robust Tool for Agile Teams with a Learning Curve
pros: Jira offers excellent visibility into task progress and team workloads. The customizable dashboards and robust integration with development tools like Bitbucket and Confluence make it ideal for tracking and managing Agile workflows.
cons: The user interface can feel cluttered and unintuitive for new users. It also tends to slow down with large datasets or when managing multiple boards, which affects efficiency.
author: Necko

review_detail:
title: The one-stop-shop Project Management ,issue tracking and Agile Development Platform.
pros: Jira interface is easy to use making it friendly for all our teams to use .Provide alot of customizations that helps us to define our agile processes. Automates repetitive tasks eg ticket assignments and notifications.Provide real time reports that allow us to measure out team performance. Also it allows custom workflows for teams following scrum and kanban.
cons: Sometimes it slow down when one has a large data and compex workflows.
author: Virginia

review_detail:
title: One of the powerful tool for project management
pros: JIRA usability. Issue Tracking Time logging feature Integration with other Atlassian tools
cons: Combining different project. Branching out current project is not effective.
author: Sunil

review_detail:
title: There's no better solution than jira at the moment
pros: Comprehensive sets of tools every Product Owner / Product Manager needs. Professional, frequently updated, solid tool to manage stories/tasks/bugs and so on. In brief summary: - Task fields customization - Integration with BitBucket (I can easily see what task has been deployed to stage/prod, and what needs to be deployed) - Integration to slack/google chat that alerts me when deployment has crashed - Timesheet integration to manage hours spent on a given task - Confluence integration, where we set our working agreement document, and knowledge base
cons: Sometimes crash or gets slow, but it happens veeery occasionally. So don't take it as a real disadvantage
author: Bartosz

review_detail:
title: Jira-Add Your Spice
pros: The thing I like most about Jira is that it gives great capability of task management and collaboration by which we can assign tasks to team members and also can check on their progress.
cons: The thing I like least about Jira is its user interface which is very cluttered and it has a lot of features which takes time to learn for new users.
author: Kalpit

review_detail:
title: Jira Service Desk Management for HR
pros: Jira (Service Desk Management) is incredibly durable and customisable. The system can be designed around internal processes and workflows in order to produce a platform bespoke to requirements. It also integrates very well with a large range of other platforms and services.
cons: Some of the build and design can be tricky and on occasion due to confusing navigation of the administrative menus and options, especially if your HR function lacks a technical resource or support from IT function.
author: Vicky

review_detail:
title: A Powerful Tool for Project Management
pros: JIRA is the most flexible tool for project management. I can use it to track the status of my projects or I can use it to plan for the future
cons: There is some learning curve to it and hence it needs training plans in place. Additionally, some advanced functionalities require expensive add-ons.
author: Shameek

review_detail:
title: JIRA in startup environment
pros: It is a really easy tool, you can understand it quickly and most of the features can be handled very quickly without any major training, I would say that even by yourself with a bit of time of discovery, you can almost find everything needed. And this is a really interesting tool in the agile environment and as a team working tool.
cons: We need to have a clear direction and a bit of rigor if we want this tool to be powerful, things can become quickly useless if everyone does whatever they want in it. Maybe the KPI side of this tool is a bit more complicated and sometimes too difficult to handle properly.
author: Antoine

review_detail:
title: Generates detailed reports
pros: Creating epics to represent key goals and tasks helps to have a specific order of what has been done. It allows us to assign tasks or "user stories" to each team member by setting deadlines and priorities. Tracking the progress of each project allows us to identify problems and make adjustments on the fly.
cons: The interface looks very cluttered and messy when projects are very large or complex.
author: Kim

review_detail:
title: Easy To Use Jira For Managing Projects, Products & Bug Tracking
pros: Jira helps us create great softwares and in an easy way because Jira is easy to use. It is always easy to manage projects with Jira. Jira's Bug tracking software allows us to solve issues fast.
cons: Nothing, am happy to be using Jira for managing products, projects and for bug tracking.
author: Saleem

review_detail:
title: Life of software developer with Jira
pros: The ease to add or remove the tasks and handle various operations in the team
cons: There are glicthes sometimes which we are unaware of how to handle them on immediate basis.
author: Gowtham

review_detail:
title: Impeccable
pros: Le rôle des collaborateurs est très important.
cons: Pas d'outils de gestion des temps nativement intégré .
author: Sylvain

review_detail:
title: Mahetab lodhiya
pros: Jira is powerful software that manage all requirements
cons: Jira is software that help management system so I like that.
author: Mahetab

review_detail:
title: It is an excellent project management tool!!
pros: Jira proves to be an invaluable tool for efficient project management. Its comprehensive features allow us to seamlessly handle various aspects such as project progress tracking, ticket and story management, phase monitoring, assessing project complexity, and keeping tabs on workforce enrollment. The platform's versatility plays a crucial role in streamlining our project-related activities and ensuring effective collaboration across the team.
cons: The experience was consistently positive, and I appreciate the absence of any notable shortcomings. Jira is effectively met my expectations, providing a smooth and satisfactory experience.

review_detail:
title: I can't think of another platform for a company to work with.
pros: With a vast number of tools integrated with each other, Jira I believe is the Go-To platform for any company, whether big or small, to track the development of its products, as well as gathering information from their employees performance. Not only gives you a good insight on how long it will take to develop something, but also how much you will invest on it. I will highly recommend it to any start up or person with new professional objectives/goals within a company.
cons: It really does take time to understand how everything works and connects. I believe the user interface is well designed, but in the end, the experience sometimes can get a little tricky or hard to navigate such a big platform. I can see there's an effort to put things in their respected categories, but I think this is something you can always keep improving. I really needed my managers to help me go through Jira when I first put my hands into it, but its like everything. You have to invest time to learn it properly, although I remember it to be a bit frustrating at first.

The way it allows for collaboration across the team while working on shared projects is truly impressive.
cons: It has made improvements over the years, but I still find the interface to be fairly dated. It looks like it was both designed and developed by developers.

review_detail:
title: Jira is simple and a good product for it's value
pros: Simple to use, Collaborative, Real time and flexible
cons: More options and the reporting structure and tools could be improved
author: David

review_detail:
title: JIRA allows us to align the entire team in a single direction!
pros: Jira is a very complete tool for tracking tasks, sharing work and, in general, for project control. Getting started with it was very simple and requires practically no learning curve. A very useful feature is that it can be adapted to almost any type of project and the use of templates makes it easier to adapt to the way we want to manage our resources. Notifications can be configured automatically or specifically for a person and we can share documents and photographs as evidence of our work.
cons: Its licensing may not be as flexible or accessible for small businesses. Therefore, it is important to consider the total number of licenses for which we must pay to use all the functionalities of the tool. It is important to understand that we are storing the historical memory of our projects and even many times contractually, we are obliged to keep this information available several years after finishing a project if the contract requires it.
author: Jose

review_detail:
title: A Jira experience, its strengths and challenges in project management
pros: The customizability, the agile support, the integration capabilities, the reporting and analysis, and the user community and resources.
cons: The steep learning curve and the performance issues for some of the reports, particularly when dealing with big projects or multiples issues, about the loading/response tome which can be slow. Also, the cost could be more affordable to ensure scalability and integration with the whole pmo office.

review_detail:
title: Robust project management capabilities.
pros: What I like most about Jira is its robust project management capabilities. It offers a highly customizable workflow, making it easy to tailor processes to fit our team's needs. The integration with other tools and the ability to track issues in detail has significantly improved our productivity and collaboration. The reporting and dashboard features provide great visibility into project progress, helping us stay on track and meet deadlines.
cons: What I like least about Jira is its complexity, especially for new users. The learning curve can be steep, and setting up workflows or custom configurations can be time-consuming. The interface can feel cluttered at times, and navigating through the various features can be overwhelming. Additionally, the performance can slow down with larger projects, making it less efficient when managing a high volume of tasks.
