review_detail:
title: Jira, the eldest son of the Atlassian family
pros: a complete and very user-friendly workflow management tool that allows you to optimize work times with a perfect management of all tasks, collaborators, project delivery times and more generally "who does what" on each single activity. Thanks to the easy connection with Trello it is possible to have a complete and easily accessible platform also from mobile for the management of team work. once discovered you will not be able to do without it because it has a free version available complete with all the features you need to manage even complex projects.
cons: I have been using this software for several years and I have never encountered a problem either at a technical level or at the interface with the different businesses that I have managed. Implementations are always welcome so I look forward to testing some new features that they will release in the future for now everything works great.
author: Mattia

review_detail:
title: Jira - The way to go in Project Management
pros: Jira is a complete and user-friendly workflow management tool that has greatly helped me to fully utilize my work time through proper planning of tasks and tracking progress in line with their needful deliverables at the right time. It also has a free version available that has complete features you can easily use to manage complex projects.
cons: So far, I haven't encountered any serious challenges with Jira, but perhaps I would suggest that external users should also be allocated to tasks and stories so that they could be on the same page with the internal users. I believe this could have a way to harmonize it.
author: Augustine

review_detail:
title: On-Point Project Management Solution
pros: A comprehensive and user-friendly workflow management solution that enables me and my team to handle all tasks, team members, project delivery dates, and more generally "who does what" on any individual activity flawlessly. It is possible to have a full and convenient platform, even from a mobile device, for the administration of teamwork thanks to the simple integration with Trello. Because it has a free version accessible with all the tools you need to handle even complicated projects, once you find it, you won't be able to live without it.
cons: Apart from network glitch from our end. There had not been any problem with the solution. The only need is for the JIRA team to keep making it the choice of every technology project manager. No problems from us over here.
author: Ibrahim

review_detail:
title: Effective Agile business project board
pros: Couple of features below that I really admired the most-Mobile version of Jira board, colorful status tracking with accurate percentage, effective customized workflow modal, quick peek view of tasks in dashboard, search option for any filter, quick catch for getting user by using '@', easy query handling and filters, easier mode of cloning tasks, linking items and referencing, multiple built in report types like bar chart, pie charts, etc., Kanban & Agile flexi boards, vast of plugin support like git-hub, git bucket, zendesk, etc., From the admin point - easy configuration of development tools dotnet, configuring mailing options, deep level view of audit logs, watch list for issues.Couple of features below that I really admired the most-Mobile version of Jira board, colorful status tracking with accurate percentage, effective customized workflow modal, quick peek view of tasks in dashboard, search option for any filter, quick catch for getting user by using '@', easy query handling and filters, easier mode of cloning tasks, linking items and referencing, multiple built in report types like bar chart, pie charts, etc., Kanban & Agile flexi boards, vast of plugin support like git-hub, git bucket, zendesk, etc., From the admin point - easy configuration of development tools dotnet, configuring mailing options, deep level view of audit logs, watch list for issues.
cons: Sometimes I feel, the JIRA GUI is clumsy to have many things in dashboard, other than that I do not see any specific negative factors to hate JIRA, and it depends on how we use the features for projects.
author: Senthilkumar

review_detail:
title: Top Tier Organizer
pros: JIRA permits groups to envision and comprehend assumptions for when to convey an undertaking, have knowledge into project/group/individual limit, and track stay at work past 40 hours. In a remote-first world, JIRA permits you to keep up with tight correspondence and adjusted degrees even as groups work across time regions. JIRA is extraordinary for having the option to sort out the extent of significant elements or item dispatches in a manner that can be imagined across groups.
cons: There is an expectation to absorb information to working in JIRA, it isn't quickly instinctive to another client. It normally requires a great deal of learning to most actually and ideally use JIRA. A great deal of it accompanies time and experience. There are a ton of extravagant accessories in JIRA. It's truly incredible that you can mark or coordinate tickets in a wide range of ways. It is truly dependent upon the association to make a technique for getting sorted out inside those extravagant accessories. This implies each time you go to another association, there is a great deal of cross-over, however, you are gaining some significant knowledge of new techniques and best practices too.
author: Marvin

review_detail:
title: Helpful tool for Development and Product
pros: The ease of back and forth communication between product and development teams. It is very easy to add wireframes and mock-ups along with notes and updates to ensure that everyone is up to date during the development process.
cons: Updates are manual, so the system relies on individuals to calculate hours and status updates.
author: Patrick

review_detail:
title: Why to use JIRA?
pros: Dashboards are really helpful, easy to follow assigned task and check status for the tasks. its simple to maintain the access for the projects, permissions can be granted to specific members only related to projects. Time to time notifications help in keeping the track.
cons: writing query to fetch the tasks/ bugs is bit difficult but still ok.
author: Megha

review_detail:
title: Jira - A best Project management tool for agile projects
pros: The best part which i like here is that the user friendly UI and it's ease of use. Also various activities that can be tracked related to project.
cons: Finding a specific user story related to a particular release becomes little unease sometimes. But still it is good compared to other tools in market.
author: Mujeebu

review_detail:
title: Jira as a Project Tracking Tool
pros: Easy way to create tasks then drag and drop to keep updated. Also the great to have a feature to attach files, images, assign a team member.
cons: The interface takes too much spaces, when we create a multiple steps inside a project, also there is no color coding feature.
author: Shovon Kumar

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Any Project Management
pros: I love the UI, it is extremely natural, I like it a great deal since it is cordial and justifiable, the client can adjust rapidly to its capacities, I love it since it is excellent for getting sorted out and doing my undertakings and ventures, I love its Scrum and Kanban loads up, it is very imagining the work process, it is exceptionally valuable since I can see the improvement of the assignments progressively, I like it since it is extremely simple to produce a report with this instrument, it coordinates very well with Trello and Slack, the task the board is ideal.
cons: As of now I found it very useful tool . One problem I think only Software Industry people can use it but other industry like finance and marketing industry won't be able to use it.
author: Surajit

review_detail:
title: Jira makes work life better
pros: It's easy to use out of the box and to begin setting up tasks and dashboards in no time. You need the commitment of the team to use it and a quick walk-through on expectations, but once you've done that, you have a great archive of all of your tasks and a workflow management system that helps you to prioritize the right work at the right time while not losing track of issues or functionality.
cons: Custom configuration is time consuming and frustrating. Best to use what it has out of the box and don't try to make many changes - adapt your workflow to the screens and you'll be happier.
author: Charles

review_detail:
title: Sophisticated and efficient project management tool
pros: Jira is an excellent project management tool. It is the best option for bug tracking and agile project management. Multiple teams can use Jira at the same time leading to a lot of integrations. Teams including product strategy, product design, and product development can collaborate together leading to improvement in project. Each team can track their individual milestones, deliverables, and tasks using the filter and search functionality. If you are using an Agile Scrum framework, your daily standup meetings are well supported by using custom views. You can create your own custom views to discuss only the relevant issues of the tasks. This feature is time saving and efficient for a daily ten minutes standup. The other new features that make Jira a must buy are due dates notification, assignment allocation, labels, assigning priority levels to tasks, and developing epic links which displays the user story and the project progress. For Kanban framework users, Jira provides Kanban boards where you can turn on and off features that you want to display or hide from other members. Jira provides high flexibility with features that maintain the tasks and deliverable backlogs and these features are applicable to different frameworks. Sprint planning, releasing sprint, and organizing history is very organized in Jira. It can be used for any type of project management. Customer support is available for Jira, which is very helpful.
cons: Jira has deficiencies on micro level. For a particular task, if you are maintaining the workflow, it is hard to customize the columns. Jira always displays all columns on a single view, more like a static view without scrolling. This leads to columns being smaller in width with smaller font size text, which sometimes become hard to read. Unavailability of scrolling leads to column being fit in a single screen browser. Pricing is also an issue. Jira is expensive and fits very well in the budget of big enterprises, but many for small sized firms it is a hard pass. Also, limited user excess to Jira makes it challenging to most small size companies. There is a trade off between ease of use and efficiencies. User has to have good knowledge of Jira navigation and customization before he can make the project management efficient. Customer support is helpful, but comes at an added price. Overall, customization, ease of use, and price are the biggest drawback for Jira right now.
author: Prathamesh

review_detail:
title: Good all around task management software
pros: With Jira I can know what, me and my team, are working on each moment and keep track on highest priorities. Also, It let's me me see if is any unblance in work load, and help me fixing it.
cons: The olny bud thing I could say about this software is that It has an infinite number of functionalties and sometimes I feel that It must be something for each specific problem, but I do not have the time to explore it.
author: Mario

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: The Jira software is very useful to us. It allows tracking, measuring, and working collaboratively. We need this platform to be more efficient with our projects.
cons: It is be if we can make this platform or software visible or something we can access in mobile devices.
author: Jerome

review_detail:
title: The best engineering tast management tool
pros: 1. Is a part of Atlassian suite, so integrates with Stash and Bamboo 2. Integrates with most chat tools like G chat, Flock, Slack etc 3. Covers entire scrum use case. 4. Lot of flexibility options available 5. Can use JQL to easily draw out a host of data
cons: 1. Some very basic reporting like Work in progress time, blocked time is not shown in Jira. Needs to integrate with paid tools for those. 2. Very complex for new user. 3. No way to find out long term reporting e.g. Quarterly metrics in one place.
author: Amitkumar

review_detail:
title: Best tool for Managing Projects
pros: There are the following reasons due to which I like using Jira software for my projects: 1. Due to it's simplicity and easy to use. 2. It's distinguishing features like people can have an access to it in real time and thus visibility to all at once. 3. It gives a Dashboard summary at a glance and give a full scale progress of a project along with the Gant chart.
cons: The following are the downside of Jira. 1. The complete project management tools are not covered in Jira. For example, out of 10 knowledge areas it only covers few and does not include let's say cost. 2. The images cannot be downloaded from Jira.
author: Asma

review_detail:
title: Un fantastico software per la gestione e la collaborazione sui progetti di un team
pros: Jira è un fantastico strumento per semplificare la gestione e la collaborazione sui progetti di un gruppo di lavoro. Offre ai project manager l'opportunità di pianificare lo sviluppo di progetti in maniera avanzata e flessibile, utilizzando interfacce come Scrum, Scrumban e Kanban, assegnare il lavoro, monitorare i progressi e i vari rilasci. Jira consente inoltre la possibilità di attivare una molteplicità di plugin esterni al fine di ampliare le caratteristiche di base del software.
cons: Trattandosi di un software avanzato e con molte funzionalità, la sua comprensione può risultare un po' difficoltosa e la documentazione non risulta essere sempre aggiornata. Molte funzioni utili richiedono espressamente servizi e pagamenti aggiuntivi.
author: Gianni

review_detail:
title: Great Tool for Agile Product development
pros: Jira closely represents most of the agile frameworks for product development. I like the fact that it can inherit the concepts of Agility Out of the Box and most of the effort need to be invested in following the governance rather than force-fitting in the tool Their integration with some of the road mapping tools is also very smooth. I use product board to Jira integration which works like a charm
cons: Sometimes their workflow can get very complex and that can be very difficult to manage the issues in the platform. Sometimes I feel that there should be harder governance in the sprint execution which will force no change after the sprint has started
author: Nishant

review_detail:
title: Great issue tracker and project management tool
pros: We have multiple projects running in the company and there are different teams working on these projects. So,Jira helps us to keep a track of all the running projects and track issues and manage those projects. We can easily keep a track of the features and the issues which are being currently worked on and what is the progress of the issues being worked on. We use Jira for all the project management and for planning out the sprints. There are many charts like Gantt chart and Kanban which helps to track the progress of the project.
cons: The mobile application for Jira is not that great and it is a little bit of laggy sometimes and the UI also could be much better. Apart from this the pages on Jira should auto refresh when a change has been made. Whenever some change has been made it just gives a warning or instruction to refresh the page to reflect those changes.
author: Tanuj

review_detail:
title: JIRA is the best project planning and organising tool
pros: 1. It is very flexible and fitted really well with agile development work. whether you are using kanban or standard sprint planning work flow, it supports all of those. 2. It is extremely useful to do project planning and creating stories, they will be saved in backlogs and you can access them with weight, estimate and priority. 3. It is quick to create a bug ticket to track bugs. 4. It is very easy to plan for a new sprint, by adding task, stories from the backlogs, it helps with the total points you want to target for a particular sprint, it automatically sum up the story points and make sure you don't over plan. 5. great report tool to help you analyse the project completion and nice burn down chart as well. To help the team retrospectively go back and review.
cons: 1. It is a big over complex by providing such flexible functionalities. But it is worth the time and learning curve. 2. As a developer, I don't have to pay the bill. But it is not very cheap if you have a large development team, the bills add up quickly.
author: Kevin

review_detail:
title: You've got to try this.
pros: Seriously, where do i begin on this one? Project management? Help desk? This system makes it look easy. If they haven't thought of it, dont worry - they have a marketplace with add-ons by independent developers .. you're going to solve your project management / help-desk / ticketing / stuffyouhaventeventhoughtof problems with this one.
cons: There are so many features, so much to try out that at first, it can be a bit of an overload. Just stay focused, start simple, and grow into the more advanced features and add-ons.
author: Matthew

review_detail:
title: JIRA - Best Friend For The Companies
pros: JIRA in overall is very helpful tool for the organisations . Many things can be tracked and put in the same place . Very comfortable and easy navigation , anyone can easily set up a project , register bugs/incidents , use it for project planning for long periods , create dashboards and many more . Also , its very helpful for integrations as it supports many tools .
cons: At this moment , I Can not find any cons for the tool
author: Irakli

review_detail:
title: Better way collaborate and build products
pros: Jira is simple to use with minimum options for tracking the bugs and tasks, it's easier to collaborate and build better products with status updates and integrate it with other third party software, It's a major top tool in the agile process.
cons: It's UI is old and needs to be updated, Jira is not an advanced tool compared to its alternatives like ClickUp, and Trello. Only few many features it's not an recommended tool for an advanced software building teams.
author: Manokar

review_detail:
title: A Popular Bug-tracking & Project Management Tool
pros: -Versatile application that keeps evolving. -Jira has plenty of add-ons. We have integrated Jira with Confluence Wikis & TestRail.-Dashboards can be customized by the users as per their need to effectively track tasks, bugs or project milestones.-Assigning tasks to the team members and tracking the hours spent on tickets helps us in creating detailed reports & also to make better business decisions.
cons: Bulk updates are a nightmare- Jira takes a lot of time in performing bulk updates & also in populating bulk results.Jira has a learning curve. Product requires formal trainings for both the users & the administrator.
author: Shubham

review_detail:
title: A mature product for workflow management of a ticket.
pros: Jira is one of the simplest to use, issue tracking software with a smooth and user-friendly UI. It tracks every step of a ticket with its well-defined workflow. One of the most useful features is that, for every status change or for every comment, it triggers a mail to the people tagged with the ticket. It helps the project teams to maintain a software life-cycle and is handy in agile methodologies. The reporting feature of Jira is reliable for retrospective review.
cons: Jira does not have an auto-refresh feature. The user has to refresh the page and check for the latest update on a Jira ticket. The search function could be made better in case the user does a typo in the search bar.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de tâches
pros: Jira est un logiciel conçu pour permettre aux équipes de suivre et de planifier les projets et s'adapte à tout type de projets
cons: Elle a souvent des répercussions sur certaines entreprises qui gère mal les projets
author: Djessinon

review_detail:
title: Flexible tool to track everything you need
pros: The customisation was a big selling point of this, I've been part of organisations of more than 2000 employees all using Jira in very different ways and it managed to adapt to each teams needs. Wether it's with regards to each teams workflow, like having different stages on the software development life cycle, or with stuff like the fields needed for each requirement or ticket, it managed to cover most of our needs. Also the integration with other tools is excellent, we triggered Jenkins jobs right from within Jira and also updated the tickets back and all worked perfectly.
cons: Some of the stuff can only be achieved by external (and most of the time, paid) plugins. In particular we had to get a Zephyr plugin to track testing and some other things. It can also be a bit difficult to setup, but that's a tradeoff with being customisable so it's understandable.
author: Carlos

review_detail:
title: Power tool with only a few flaws
pros: There are almost endless ways to customize the tool to suit your needs. There is a bit of a learning curve to understand how all the components fit together, but once you get the hang of it its pretty smooth. The automation feature are easy and fun to implement.
cons: My main gripes about Jira are the fact that Atlassian often makes update to the software assuming that the change benefits all their customers, when often it does not. Then despite numerous complaints they stand behind their change. I understand the need to evolve and make updates, however they can achieve this by making the new features optional with a toggle switch so users have the choice whether to use them or not. We use Jira Service Management to manage inbound support requests for clients. For privacy reasons the software no longer displays the user's email address but we need this information to identify the client. This can be problematic at times. Lastly, reporting options are sometimes limited and we need to rely on 3rd party plugins to provide information for an added cost.
author: Jerry

review_detail:
title: JIRA review
pros: Its flexibility to track and measure the progress bar as well as to introduce changes in plan in between.
cons: It consists of a lot of features in a single tool. It sometimes get a bit difficult to look for the exact feature one is looking for.
author: Shubham

review_detail:
title: Use of JIRA for complete tracking of your project and time management
pros: JIRA offers to manage project related requests , tasks ,defect to be mapped under single project which in turn help greatly in project management activities. The syncing of time tracking with associated project tasks and requests helps in gathering reports wrt project budget management. One can track number of hours spent on particular project which can in turn help in future project budget management and in order to manage any upcoming work in advance. JIRA is very good tool for project related activities and maintaining project dashboards , sprints ,taaks etc
cons: Ease of use can be improved as for some process if one is not aware then it would take considerable time to figure out in JIRA like how to start Sprint or how to manage different project dashboards and tasks. Jira can provide additional features for mapping or storing test cases so that all project artifacts can be at one place related to particular task. JIRA can also provide some additional features like defect ,test case management related activities to make it complete package for test management cycle of project.
author: Pushkar

review_detail:
title: Jira is a great tool when working togheter in a team on a mutual project.
pros: Their interface is rather easy to use, especially if the team manager sets everything up properly and everyone knows what they have to do.
cons: You have to go back and forth quite a bit, slowing your workspeed down a bit. And it happens quite often that Jira isn't fit for every sytuation.
author: Jarne

review_detail:
title: Best Scrum tool
pros: I really like using Jira from Atlassian. I usually use it in the scrum and with the support team to open tickets and solve them. It integrates with a lot of tools and has a lot of plugin-ins that I use.
cons: Using it with Kanban as it didn't support all the required features in sophisticated board design in Kanban.
author: Mahmoud

review_detail:
title: Review of Jira (2022): Features, Costs, and More
pros: Scrum boards for agile sprint teams Kanban boards for real-time workflow visualization Bugs are simple to find, track, and record high standard of security and safety
cons: Not an intuitive and user-friendly interface for those who are not developers Limited assistance for working with outside parties
author: Azeem

review_detail:
title: The best at what it does
pros: JIRA is ticketing and workflow management software. The things I like most about JIRA are how customizable workflows are, the availability of additional third party plugins, and how well it integrates with other atlassian products. The integration with other atlassian products improves our workflow significantly in IT and development, it allows us to link git commits through FishEye and documentation pages through Confluence to every JIRA issue. JIRA's customized workflows also help us stay accountable to eachother. Because the workflows have specific permissions and assignees built into steps in what we do they help insure that the right person does the right thing at the right time. I don't think we could work without JIRA or something similar.
cons: The software has gotten progressively slower over the last few revisions. That's my only complaint. The first load of JIRA in the mornings especially seems slow (About 20 seconds in the browser).
author: Zach

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management, SDLC and bug management software for agile teams
pros: I've used JIRA a few times, along with Confluence when I was on contract with a few large enterprise digital teams. I found JIRA to be excellent as a tool to share files, track project conversation streams, and manage multiple versions of files through the project lifecycle. Though I only ever used JIRA from an end user perspective, I always heard great things about the customizability (it seems to be a word) of the app to different business processes. Digital teams, such as UX design, development and copywriting are an ideal use case for this app provided stories and projects are set up properly. It's a great way to give stakeholders and PMs and other managers visibility into how projects are trending against milestones.
cons: There were a few outages when I used JIRA, but it was generally reliable. JIRA seems to be one of those business applications where you're only using a fraction of its capability. Administration access should really be restricted to a qualified few, as you don't want to have conflicting stories tracking the same project, telling different information. The success of a JIRA implementation/adoption really relies on the quality of the data users, PMs, and development managers put into it. I found that I was writing a lot of updates and @ing people all over the place on one contract, yet certain PMs were still asking me for updates. That was less a JIRA problem, and more a condition of the people I was working with though, so I won't name names. :) - Moral of the story, you get out of JIRA what your teams put in, like many enterprise apps.
author: Mark

review_detail:
title: A developers perspective of Jira
pros: 1) Jira is performing well in the industry which results in lots of people integrating with them. The most impactful for us was the integration done with Zenddesk our ticketing system. Our support engineers are able tie Zenddesk tickets to our Jira issues and when issues are updated, so is the Zenddesk ticket. Very Cool! 2) Notifications were very well done in Jira. There is an in-app notification system (A bell in the bottom corner) but they can also be sent via email. They also are very smart about sending you only updates that involve you so that you are not notified too much. 3) Smart task ordering and prioritizing that work well in a development environment.
cons: Most of the cons that I noticed are rather nit-picky however I believe there is room for lots of improvement. 1) Give for example the sprint page. There is a little star in the upper right corner. If I hover over the star I get a description that says 'Star'. That is not a great description of what that button will do for me. Users are dumb and won't figure things like that out on their own. 2) I think the UI is a tiny bit clunky. I see lots of wasted space here and there. Often times there are things that do not seem that important that seem to take up a lot of space. Also I'm not a big fan of huge collapsable side menus. 3) The many features that are offered in Jira make for a steep learning curve.
author: Kent

review_detail:
title: JIRA Enterprise IT Product Honesty
pros: Being a user friendly online software designed to help in project management, planning, budgeting, scheduling and rescheduling of tasks. It's capability to bring teams together and provide a single source of information on all projects.
cons: Nothing to dislike this far since it does it all under single umbrella, besides it enables me to track the progress of all projects.
author: George

review_detail:
title: JIRA THE SOFTWARE THAT IMPLEMENT AGILE METHODOLOGY
pros: Jira helps us to manage the tasks that correspond to each member of the team day by day to implement the agile methodology since as soon as a task begins with it, we do not wait for the completion of this task to start, on the contrary, doing tasks according to your assignment. Through this tool we will be able to observe the progress of the tasks assigned to each one and we will even be able to learn more information to have the evidence of what is being worked on.
cons: It is difficult to mention any defect that we can find to jira since, as I have mentioned before, it is useful for the implementation of the agile methodology. In addition to the moment that you give a status of your development, jira sends notification to the people assigned to this task or to the supervisors in this way the progress can be observed. In particular, I do not find anything displeasing to Jira or something that he lacks. I think he has everything essential to fulfill his objective.
author: Ximena

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Clear and easy to use, very useful in project management and scrum.
cons: Interface improvements can be made, language support is not very good, there needs to be a better translation.
author: Ilgın

review_detail:
title: Avaliação do Jira
pros: O Jira é super fácil de usar e entender. Ajuda demais a organizar e dividir tarefas nos projetos. Além disso, é ótimo poder criar relatórios e gráficos de forma simples, facilitando o acompanhamento do progresso e a identificação de áreas que precisam melhorar.
cons: Gostaria de ter mais opções na versão gratuita.
author: Evna

review_detail:
title: Best App for Agile Project Management
pros: I like the most that it has a list of never-ending features which basically helps us to organize our projects very easily. Some of the examples are - I can create my customized dashboard, I can create boards for backlogs/sprint management, I can query my results and save them as my saved searches, I can even integrate with third-party apps for my dashboard management. Moreover, they also allow automation that makes our manual tasks quite easy.
cons: It has a learning curve, I have been using it for a while, and sometimes I still learn new features every day.
author: Mansi

review_detail:
title: Perfect for managing tasks in an agile setup
pros: - Ability to set up different types of tickets (e.g. tasks, stories, bug, epic, etc.) with their corresponding workflows - Ability to add comments & tag people as watchers for notifications/updates; receiving Outlook notifications/summary - Ability to easily update tasks - Advanced search feature for drawing up reports/data
cons: - Text editor is limited; sometimes, the formatting suddenly gets wiped out - but could be an installation issue - Dashboard creation could be more extensive and easy to use
author: Prachi

review_detail:
title: Project management with jira very easy.
pros: Most I like is integrating app with jira is very easy. We are using jira in many ways for managing development planning to managing testing and customer service. Its very awesome tool which provides almost all features which is needed for planning or designing workflow for your project.
cons: Some times its respond too much slow and consume lots of resources. And other thing is cost.
author: Prakash

review_detail:
title: Best and Must have tool for Agile methodology
pros: It has every Scheme to work with, may it be different Issue types, Workflows, Field configuration, Permission, Notification, Screens, Custom fields etc. It can be easily configured. JIRA and Agile methodology goes hand in hand. I believe Agile methodology brings out the best from JIRA and completely utilizes it to it's best potential, From flexible and rapid Issue creation and updation to have easily traceable developing environment, It does all with ease. Managers and Scrum Masters can not have a single meeting without JIRA Kanban Board. Every issue, every story is traced with in-depth details. from it's creation, execution till it's completion, Even after completion the history of every issue is maintained and can be over viewed with ease.
cons: From feature perspective there are no such feature to dislike about JIRA. They're simple and easy to accomplish, Operations like Creating or Editing Issue(s) are easy and can be done by anyone. There lies the problem of such operations performed by any one. Rather they should have some access level of control with which they can initialize on individual issue to individual member involved with that issue. Even if someone does edit an issue on accident, they should atleast be prompt about the changes they're about to make, or save. and only after successful confirmation from the user, JIRA should allow those changes to be saved.
author: Manikant

review_detail:
title: Great for Devops but not just for ITSM

cons: For ITSM, it just not meant to be , there are better tools out there

review_detail:
title: I love kanban :-)
pros: Loved the kanban boards and all the information you can store there, makes it easy to track and save project information about just everything.
cons: Not everyone used it like it could be used, as a powerful tool.
author: Sebastian

review_detail:
title: Jira: An Essential Task Management Application
pros: I use Jira for Project Management in my occupation. As a worker in a large enterprise, Jira does a phenomenal job of creating a fantastic user experience for both desktop and mobile. I think mobile project management is especially intuitive with this service. Where Jira stands apart from other standard project management tools is in its ability to track issues throughout an entire development lifecycle. Tickets are an essential component to keeping work organized and teams moving forward. The ability to collaborate via comments is unparalleled. Jira also offers extensive add-ons and pre-created templates for those just learning the service. When tracking projects, I never felt overly-encumbered by high learning curves or a clunky interface. Jira allowed me to work with many of the tools I am comfortable with and expand my potential.
cons: From my experience, the largest pain-point / decision point between my team is on the issue of creating 'tickets'. While Jira is a very detail oriented application, this detail can sometimes become quite cumbersome. For example, the process of creating and resolving tickets can sometimes feel even longer than completing the task itself. Furthermore, it is difficult, if not impossible to close a ticket if you are not the creator. Therefore, project managers need to carry significant oversight as task statuses change. Therefore, tickets are very controversial but also an essential component to completing work successfully on this platform.
author: Joshua

review_detail:
title: Jira - Task handling tool for smooth workflow
pros: 1. TRD and TDD can be tracked easily 2. customized report via JQL query3. email notification for tracking each updates4.Bulk update when there is huge data.
cons: Need guidance for the query building to the users
author: Vijay

review_detail:
title: JIRA is essential for good software development but you NEED to invest in configuration
pros: The powerhouse controls that allow you to configure exactly the solution you need. JIRA is unmatched in customization. For controlling workflows, getting status updates and clearly understanding what's on your plate, JIRA is amazing.
cons: The use of JIRA without properly configuring it. Without that commitment, JIRA can be offputting and seem like a heavy mess of a system. You need to remove what you don't use, need to set everything up for individuals and you need to educate your team about how they can use the system. It's so open that it can overwhelm people without management.
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: JIRA Should Be Called the *Anti* Project Management Solution!
pros: If you are willing to do the work, the advanced search is useful and the user experience isn't bad except that to eliminate done tickets you have to deselect all then re-select every option except those of a done type.
cons: Advanced search is the only useful way to reliably get information out, making getting even the smallest view of your data onerous. The core advantage of the tool - it's lack of structure - make it difficult to complete even the simplest of tasks without a ridiculous amount of effort. It's biggest failing is that everything is too flat by default. For example, I am working on a project now and the team has made duplicate tickets because the original tickets are too hard to find and are just dumped on the screen... we have sometimes used epics/stories/sub-tasks with sprints but these are truly inadequate... in today's time why should someone have to spend 20-30 hours a week grooming the backlog and writing searches when if the tool was any good it should (!!) be able generate these views automatically. We are now investigating other solutions like Wrike (absolutely no affiliation, not even sure we will switch to it) and in 10 minutes of testing we were getting views that we have been struggling to get out of JIRA for over a year. Also, you can't do something obvious like make a reminder in the future for a ticket, so you either get flooded with reminders for just about everything or you have to go outside the product to remind you to do something in JIRA. Seriously!?!
author: Julie

review_detail:
title: JIRA a revelation for project management
pros: Issues created with Jira is seamlessly tracked and completed in time provides quality in development process.
cons: Sometimes it made complex for users to navigate around the workflows because of too much menu tabs in UI.

Easily customizable tool, am glad am able to customize to my projects this makes me finish all projects on time and also work for many projects at once. Jira interstates well with third parties like Git which I use making my work easier. Updates and notifications of new tasks and task updates keeps my team on the toes always.

Il est collaboratif et intuitif, et de nombreux modules complémentaires permettent d'ajouter encore plus de valeur ajoutée au produit.
cons: Les widgets de base du dashboard sont assez limités lorsque l'on veut des indicateurs très précis. La recherche de tickets pourrait être un peu plus complète pour des recherches précises sur des changement de statut à une certaine date....

review_detail:
title: Jira Pros and Cons 2023
pros: Jira's customizable workflows empowers teams to tailor processes according to their uniqie requirements, supporting various project management methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. Agile boards, backlogs and active sprints facilitate efficient planning, tracking and execution of projects.Robust issue tracking capabilities allow teams to create, prioritize, and monitor tasks and bugs. Suited for small teams as well as large enterprises, Jira scaleseffectively, accommodating the evolving needs of growing projects and organizations.
cons: Jira's resource consumption, especially in larger deployments, can be demanding. This may necessitate careful consideration of server resources to ensure optimal performance.

review_detail:
title: Essential software

cons: Jira lacks some automatizations in issue creation, however this is normally fixed by integrations and plugins.

Secondly , I think that Jira is one of the best ways to organize my issues into tasks and sub-tasks with clear visibility of workflows . This is the most important thing for me as a simple user .
cons: As a developer, I would like to highlight one thing regarding the watcher option that the user could enable and disable on a Jira ticket. It happens that someone forgets this activation and miss maybe crucial informations of updates added by someone else on the ticket . I Think that Atlassian should promote the use of the Jira notification system and put it on the front line . Additionally, Jira's support team does not respond quickly

review_detail:
title: Jira is great PM tool for medium to large game development projects
pros: Overall, I really like the flexibility that Jira provides. The one feature that I most appreciate when I use another PM tool is built-in support for Fix Versions. Being able to assign a fix version for a sprint and for each build, makes it easy to see all the tasks and bugs that are in a given full release or an individual build.
cons: A lot of folks, especially artists, have a general disdain for the Jira UX. It is not as ergonomic, clean, and tactile as Trello or Basecamp. I would love it if there were a way for Boards in Jira to be as simple and powerful as boards in Trello.

review_detail:
title: Perfect project/issue tracking tool but needs few improvements.
pros: We use JIRA everyday to track issues, feature updates, IT requests etc. It is easy to use and has lot of useful features such as making tickets visible to selective teams. We can also hide comments to restrict from our clients. We can prioritize tickets and set target date for the tickets to be address as per requirement. It is integrated with Outlook, such that we can receive timely updates on activities done on any ticket. We have the option to create dashboard for better analysis of team work or project activity. We can easily import test scripts from excel sheets with help of third party tools like zephyr.
cons: Setting filters cannot be easy sometimes and might not retrieve desired output every now and then. Exporting tickets to excel messes up the format and is hard to read or understand. Adding steps and creating test scripts in jira is tedious since it doesn't have important feature like cut or copy rows.

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management with a top notch features
pros: Jira is the most widely used software development tool among agile teams. Jira is used by teams ranging in size from two to 20,000 to manage every stage of their process, from planning to shipping and releasing. Teams may use native roadmaps to organise their work and keep track of the big picture. With a few clicks, Jira's no-code automation engine helps teams to save time and gain power by automating any operation or process. And, with a free edition, teams of up to 10 members may use all of Jira's features for free, forever.
cons: The results of the activities can be a little shaky at times, but nothing to be concerned about. Also, while availability may certainly be enhanced by using a private cloud, there are still some hitches here and there. I believe bug tracking is the area that can be improved the most. Don't get me wrong, it's nice, but it could be so much better with just a little adjustments here and there.
author: Vikram

review_detail:
title: The best way to synchronise requirements, roadmap, agile roadmap, scrum, reporting and much more in a single solution
pros: I have been working in information technology field for more than twelve years. For a long period, I was a big fan of Bugzilla. However in my previous company, when we have migrated to Atlassian Jira, it was a very difference experience. When the entire organization moved more in to agile, the product also changed priorities around understanding customers' problems. The migration was tough as we were not in a position to ignore the requirements from our users. The import functionality helped us a lot and thanks to our engineering team to put huge effort in doing research on Jira. I love the way information is organized across, projects, boards with decent agile reporting capabilities. Being in product management, I have enjoyed the flow of user stories, backlog review, estimation, roadmap and Atlassian Jira's functionality to customize workflow. The transparency which Jira brings to the product management team is a big plus. What we are working on, what is going to come next and when, what is in the pipeline are a big relief to any customer facing product development organization. Another beauty is the categorization of user stories and epics, which helps the product owners to start filtration of issues at the entry level itself. The knowledge handover from product team to other teams collaborating for product success ( Eg:- CS, Marketing) became seamless with Jira. The dashboards are great for monitoring purpose. Finding Jira, an effective and comprehensive solution to ensure that every action in a user story is accounted and traceable across the product life cycle without loosing the goal of delivering iterative and incremental value to customers, as fast as possible.
cons: I like learning new things. Jira require good learning and is not a very light tool. The user interface act a bit confusing sometime. Setup, project/workflow creation, user management etc. are tough tasks and require brains from Dev ops with good knowledge of agile practices.
author: Sreekumar

review_detail:
title: Jira: A Double-Edged Sword
pros: I think what stands out most about Jira is its flexibility. It’s like a chameleon for project management—it can be adapted to fit a wide range of workflows, whether you’re working on software development, marketing campaigns, or anything else. The customizable workflows, detailed reporting, and integration capabilities make it a powerful tool for managing complex projects and keeping teams aligned
cons: One of the main challenges with Jira is its complexity and steep learning curve. It’s incredibly feature-rich, which can be overwhelming for new users or teams that don’t need all of its functionalities. Setting up and customizing workflows can be quite intricate, and it might take some time to get everything configured just right
author: aditya

review_detail:
title: Good Experience
pros: Task management become so easy with jira.
cons: UI design is too bad as its difficult to understand.
author: Ankita

review_detail:
title: Jira helps get tasks done!
pros: I like the ticketing-system in Jira and that you can search by tags.
cons: I do not necessarily like the System Dashboard design.
author: SAMANTHA

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management and issue tracking tool in the market
pros: It is used by me to track daily bugs and tasks also for project progress live updates. Easy to understand and providing training to new user.
cons: There is nothing that I don't like in Jira, everything is useful.
author: Harsh

review_detail:
title: Powerful Project Management Tool with a Steep Learning Curve
pros: Jira's robust project management capabilities, particularly its customizable workflows and detailed issue tracking, are standout features. The integration with other tools and automation options streamline processes, making it an invaluable resource for agile teams managing complex projects.
cons: Jira's steep learning curve can be challenging for new users, and its interface can feel cluttered. The software's complexity sometimes leads to slower performance, and setting up and managing projects can be time-consuming, especially for smaller teams.
author: Zarana

review_detail:
title: gran herramienta de gestion de proyectos
pros: Lo que más me ha gustado de Jira es su flexibilidad para adaptarse a distintos tipos de proyectos y equipos. La posibilidad de integrar herramientas y automatizar procesos agiliza enormemente la productividad.
cons: lo que menos me ha gustado es que la curva de aprendizaje puede ser pronunciada, especialmente para quienes no están familiarizados con herramientas de gestión complejas. A veces, la interfaz puede sentirse un poco abrumadora.
author: ayelen

review_detail:
title: Jira is a great product
pros: The robustness of the platform is the most important factor for us.
cons: We do not like that some features are hard to find or limited so we had to improvise.
author: Alex

review_detail:
title: Great for users, hard on administrators
pros: I use Jira products both as a user and as an administrator. As a user, I find it very straightforward. I like how easy it is to do things like update my tasks, see the team's work, add files to items and connect between the various tools like Stride and Confluence. As an admin, there is a lot of customization I can do regarding workflow. My team has changed as we've grown and fleshed out both our development and QA process, so having that flexibility to modify the Jira workflow has been incredibly helpful. I also like the fact that Jira integrates with virtually every other major piece of software, such as Slack.
cons: Most of my complaints with Jira software comes from the admin side. Because it has so much customization, it's often hard to know where something is or how you need to modify it in order to customize it. The documentation leaves a lot to be desired, and searching the web usually takes you to outdated documentation or a community forum post. Between the two, I usually can find what I need. Generally, the biggest gap between documentation and what I'm doing is that the UI has been updated and things moved around. The actual information is solid, but entire menu items have disappeared or been renamed. Oftentimes, I think I have found what I need and roll the dice and check this box or press that button, and it works. I've never run into anything that couldn't be immediately undone.
author: Christopher

review_detail:
title: Carefully designed to enable the team to fully monitor all operations
pros: Jira has high capabilities to communicate and integrate easily with many applications that we use to develop our capabilities to manage our products to achieve the best results required. I like the ease of creating tickets as well as lists, which simplifies us to follow up on all products and customer feedback with high efficiency. I like the ease of allocating tickets to team members so that it increases the flexibility of follow-up, and the project manager can constantly obtain reports that cover all stages of workflow and accurately describe the team’s achievement.
cons: In general, not much negative, but the use of Jira requires extensive training by the team members so that they can use all the functions efficiently. Sometimes when dealing with a large number of tasks Jira can take time, but this is not an issue that comes up often.
author: Mohammed

review_detail:
title: In big development teams the custom workflow of JIRA allows you to build a solid agile process
pros: JIRA gives you the essential tools to manage your development projects and comes into its own when you scale up managing larger teams and 100+ developers. User stories, epics, issue management, backlog management, task assignment, tracking charts for scrum, kanban boards etc give you the visibility you need when operating in an multi-team Agile development structure. The visibility of the state of your project(s) and workflow is the key benefit for using this software in an enterprise environment. Another key benefit is you can extend to use Atlassian's suite of products where there is great integration such as Service Desk, Confluence & Stride - although most of our teams eventually developed a preference for Slack.
cons: JIRA can be a little complex at the outset to the uninitiated, some tasks require searching for in the menu system. Customization does have an overhead attached, for example adding attributes with logic etc. Email notifications can be overwhelming if you are attached to multiple teams, a digest option would probably be better than one email per update.
author: Allen

review_detail:
title: Jira to build analytics software
pros: One of the most critical features of Jira is traceability. Even after a task is pushed to done, you can track it based on the released version. The use of swimlanes to facilitate Kanban and Scrum frameworks is straightforward and easy to follow. The integrations with Teams work smoothly and help us to keep track of the comments we make on developments in Teams as well as link to an issue in Jira.
cons: The workflow management could be improved on the project settings as you have to remove an existing workflow to edit it, and it is sometimes tedious. Bulk edits may be slow sometimes.
author: Praveen

review_detail:
title: ideal for project management and task development
pros: It allows you to work flexibly, allowing you to give an overview of your project, assigning tasks, monitoring their development during the stipulated periods of time.
cons: It should have a more explicit interface for administrative and sales department personnel, it is often very technical.
author: andrea

review_detail:
title: Review about Jira.
pros: This software has many useful features which are easy to use and smart looking interface. I can easily overview the progress, the report and timestamp of every task. What I like most about it is, several team members can participate in a single task and can be identified by their separate assigned responsibilities.
cons: I found it pretty confusing at the very beginning using this software and could not understand the difference between epic and story and many thing. Once you download a new software for the first time and ready to use, you can easily run it. What I least like about this software it might not be much easy to use at the beginning.
author: Zarin

review_detail:
title: Great Tool for Daily Use
pros: Easy in ordering stories, tasks in the backlog. Easy in moving issues across a visual board. Typically onboarding new users who haven't used JIRA before can be done easily and quickly. The ability to set colors to epic is also very nice and supportive of a quick review of how many epics team is committing to for sprint planning
cons: Lack of ability to have a visual roadmap/timeline and move epics around it. Instead of having a ppt, it would be good to have a board built for epic and product roadmaps within JIRA itself as another tab on the navigation pane or at least an integration with Miro, beautiful.ai, or Mural The settings controlled by an admin in large companies causes too many impediments for scrum teams The ability to query certain data is not intuitive for all users
author: Spencer

review_detail:
title: One of the greatest defect tracking and project management tools in the industry
pros: I find this software to be very versatile and useful. It has functions that make work easier when it comes to organization, planning, and meeting goals. It facilitates effective teamwork; it is simple to keep track of the activities that must be completed and the notifications of changes to any action work well. It has multiple views and is used to manage projects, so people who want to see an overview of the work can use the To-do List or simply the Roadmap, and team members who are trying to balance their daily activities can use the Dashboard to plan their workload. I like it because it easily adapts to what you want to do.
cons: In some circumstances, receiving notifications has become difficult, preventing real-time monitoring. Although simple and adaptable, defining and organizing the sorts of work items might be difficult at first.
author: Sudhir

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Tracking Project Status
pros: Jira is the most common tool used in the IT organization and the best part of this tool is we can easily create the different sprints or total sprints which are going to be used in the project and can we can track work very easily. It provides transparency to business as well which gains more confidence for the user on the project status whether it's on track or not. Also, the features like Task completed, Ready for deployment, Ready for UAT, capturing comments on the status, Assigning tasks to others and email trigger automatically are the best features of this tool
cons: I would say nothing to say where we can tell this is the least used or waste things in the tool. All the features provided in the tool are very useful and have some reason. Might when people start using they feel like it's difficult to use but actually it's very easy.
author: Udit

review_detail:
title: Best Issue/Project management system out there!
pros: The user interface is extremely simple, and yet complex. Also, it integrates with tons of 3rd party tools to richness the experience
cons: Sometimes is very complicated to perform tasks that shouldn't be that complicated, like adding custom fields to issues, or change permissions
author: Gaspar

review_detail:
title: Jira as a tool in projects
pros: Jira is one of the most powerful tool for implementing agile methodologies like SCRUM. It's an enviroment where you could find calendars, organize activities, meetings, create task and goals and be in touch with all the team and their progress.
cons: It has a lot of templates, but you should be acquinted with at least one methodologie. If you don't you will lose a little time while you're learning about the software.
author: Luis Francisco

review_detail:
title: Review JIra
pros: Organisation task with flowltly, flexibelity to use it
cons: structure of menu, and visibility of diagrames
author: younes

review_detail:
title: JIRA Review
pros: Best tool to Manage entire project and as a tester it enables easy tracking of defects or issues and ensure quick fix. Along with team efforts required in a project Jira makes sure individual efforts are noticed.
cons: At times while using Jira, if suppose my task for the day was not updated or something mismatches then its the days status goes wasted.
author: Alphonsa

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion
pros: Un logiciel qui gère l'outil de développement et qui est utilisé par les équipes jusqu'à 20000 personne.Il s'occupe aussi du flux de travail de chaque de la planification à l'expédition et à la publication.
cons: Je ne trouve aucun inconvénient à ce logiciel je peux le recommander aux utilisateurs
author: Barthélémy

review_detail:
title: Jira, the de facto in Agile Project Management
pros: Jira is as powerful as you allow it to be, you are not limited to the current sprint or even a single project on a board. With the use JQL, endless customization is possible. Since it is the de facto in project management, every development tool you can think of is able to integrate into Jira, including your IDE making it the one-stop for every step of your development process. You can also trigger the transitions on the boards for 'lazier' teams when they commit or merge a branch, meaning you dont have to chase after devs to update the board. You can also build the board to be as simple or complex as a team needs it to be. Jira adjusts to your needs, not the other way around. The sister applications to Jira are also amazing (Confluence, etc)
cons: For repetitive tasks that have a set format, Jira, out of the box at least without pricy add-ins is not able to automatically do this. For bespoke functionality and workflows you need to be a jira expert Can become a little slow over time
author: Max-Andre'

review_detail:
title: Review of JIRA as Software Engineer
pros: The task tracking and defect creation . Easily integrated with qtest for attaching story requirment in jira with the test suite . The software is designed so that it can be easily implemented in any team or project with of any size. What only matters is how efficiently one is able to use it.
cons: In case somebody needs to edit an existing defect or story the existing editor doesn't allow complete visibility.Sometimes it's hard to view the attachment. The editor should be in the complete maximize mode . This feature currently we don't have.
author: Devasheesh

review_detail:
title: Jira for IT Project Management and Integrated Project Teams
pros: Flexibility in workflows and tracking separate projects and sub-projects in the same system. Ease of creating multiple tickets as well as placing them into different projects without having to be in the projects portal. Creating reports to review metrics is relatively easy, it was useful in an integrated project to review estimated times reported in previous sprints to project development times for other projects. The flexibility of how tickets look and editable fields as well as workflows to tailor to the team and/or project being worked on.
cons: The bad part of Jira's flexibility is that settings are all over the place and you typically need to refer to Jira's knowledge base on how to configure custom settings whether it is for fields inside of tickets, workflow settings and automations, and many other settings. The standard Jira end user interface is not exactly user friendly and some things may not make sense depending on the team using it such as a ticket being in a closed state however the resolution state has separate "states" such as do, don't do which is more used by software development teams. Jira typically requires a lot of customization when setting up new projects either for project managers, agile software development teams, or integrated project teams. As an administrator this can be difficult to convey to my end users who want to track their projects in Jira. This is where you need to have great communication with your end users to be able to setup and tailor the Jira project to their needs and improve the overall Jira experience.
author: Jonathan

review_detail:
title: Ease of use and breadth of options make Jira stand out.
pros: It's depth and robustness. It can pretty much accomplish whatever it needs to for your business.
cons: Price. It can be a bit expensive for smaller companies.

pros: It is one of the leading tools which has good feature and easy to use.

review_detail:

pros: It is user friendly and enables collaboration among team members. It is easy to add links and attachments. The features are super effective in getting work done. Effect of kanban board on our project was evident
cons: Not so easy to get accustomed to, except with training and time. The upload size may be limited for some users, depending on the projects being worked upon and documents to share
author: Yemi

review_detail:
title: Needful and Helpful
pros: Task Scheduling, tracking the project with its progress, and its easy way of drag and dropping the tasks are my favorite things about Jira. Its such a go to software for tracking purpose. I strongly recommend everyone Jira as a tracking software
cons: I don't really find something, that I don't like about this software
author: Spoorthy

review_detail:
title: HelpDesk Dream System
pros: Coming on board with Delta I hadn't user the JIRA platform outside of submitting tickets in my past. There was a shell created by our IT team and it was a great start but with the help of an intern he and I were able to completely change and enhance the user experience on both sides for those who enter tickets and those who work or engage with tickets. The system seems a little overwhelming at first because it offers so many variations however once you really consider what you want to do and who you want to achieve it really straightforward. You're able to change and modify just about every aspect of the interface so that its complete company-specific or even department-specific is you choose. You can make it look like its an extension of your companies actual website. You can access and run reports for so many different KPI's or metrics to see preformance or SLA's and they are all realtime.
cons: Like I stated it was a bet overwhelming bacause there are so many options and changes that can be made using JIRA however there are tons of resources as well.
author: Jarvis

review_detail:
title: Jira: A Must-Have Tool for Streamlining Software Development Team's Workflow
pros: I appreciate Jira for its ability to streamline my team's workflow and improve our efficiency. The ability to track and manage tasks and bugs in a centralized location makes it easy for us to stay organized and on top of our workload. Additionally, the collaboration features such as comments and mentions, allow my team to communicate and stay on the same page in real-time. Furthermore, I found Jira to be very scalable, it adapts well to our team's growing needs. Overall, Jira has become a vital tool in our development process.
cons: I would say that one thing I like least about Jira is that it can have a bit of a learning curve for new users. It has a lot of features and options, and it may take some time to become familiar with all of them. Additionally, some users may find the interface to be a bit cluttered and overwhelming. Furthermore, the customizing and configuring the workflows to fit the specific needs of my team can be a bit difficult and time-consuming. But once you get used to it, you'll find that Jira is a powerful and flexible tool that can help your team to be more productive and efficient.
author: Paulin

review_detail:
title: EXCELLENT
pros: More velocity at the answer When we need help
cons: Answer the request ASAP. many times we call and take more than 1 hour waiting at the phone

Jira dashboards are the best at keeping track and monitoring the project progress. Plus we get very insightful reports which helps us understand how much work we have done and the much remaining.
cons: Nothing for sure. Perfection can be rare but honestly, Jira has been perfect for me and my teammates.

This adaptability fosters efficient project management, enabling seamless integration with diverse methodologies and ensuring a tailored experience that aligns precisely with organizational needs.

author: Isac

review_detail:
title: The most versatile project management tool
pros: As I use Jira for many projects and many different tasks, I love that its customization capabilities, it is more than easy and extremely accessible for everyone using it, no matter their role to create/edit/report and export projects. Everything is well organised, transparent, and at hand. Also, it is flexible, in the sense, that depending on what task or activity is given, my team can customize every individual workflow.
cons: The only con I could find is that Jira has very limited functionality in the offline mode. In some instances, you need to work on some projects and it is impossible to update the workflow with no internet connection.
author: Delia

review_detail:
title: Great for task prioritisation
pros: Jira is relatively simple to use, and has a lot of good options to prioritise tasks. It is also a great tool if you are working with the agile way of working as you can use it for sprints and scrums.
cons: I think some of the user interface could be simplified, and it could be made more obvious whether you have access to certain dashboards or not, and how to get access if you do not have the right access.
author: Zoe

review_detail:
title: The incumbent continues to be the incumbent for a reason
pros: It is what everyone knows and learns how to use.Jira can handle multiple workflows, highly customizable for each team wich is highly appreciated by the different teams. It is not a one size fits all.
cons: It keeps on adding new tools to the offer, if not always well-integrated, especially from an admin and billing pov.
author: Alex

review_detail:
title: Jira is great tool for agile teams
pros: Jira helps team discover agile foundations with the guide of a scrum master or project leader. The sprints provide guardrails to teams take smaller chunks of work. Jira provides a centralized location to work in and can reduce the amount of communication gaps.
cons: The greatest opportunity Jira has is that the user experience is rough in the fact that the product needs in-depth training to properly use it. For example, there aren't any youtube tutorials or best practices documents on why the end user would use label or a component. Most project leaders I know do not have a standardization why they use that and it causes confusion on project teams. The product isn't a plug and play, it is more that any user will need several lessons on simple actions such as creating a story, creating a Jira board, and creating Jira JQL. At the end of the day, there is a steep learning curve for this product and that increases the resistance for enterprise teams to go agile.
author: Vince

review_detail:

Platform planning, creating and managing structures is one click job. Issues can be imported into different formats.

review_detail:

pros: I like how flexible the tool is and an excellent tool for issue management and highlight different cases.
