author: Krishnamurthy

review_detail:
title: Review on Jira
pros: Jira is an amazing software when it comes to issue handling. With numerous possibilities it makes your many tasks simple and easy to execute. It has a well built platform and a great user interface. I love the ability for customization and no other software can compete with Jira on this feature. Also the bug tracking tool is awesome. This software is a perfect solution for an organization with a huge number of employees.
cons: The greatest drawback I see on Jira is that customer support is really poor. They take an awful lot of time to respond and sometimes they actually never do. I faced this issue several times and I hope developers work on this matter. Other than that, I really don't see any negative aspect related to Jira.
author: Shenali

review_detail:
title: This tool is implementation dependent
pros: customization is a plus. The ability to modify/change things as you learn more is unique and helpful, however it can be a curse as well. The ability to create metrics and follow projects is there and it is helpful when done properly.
cons: the customization is both a blessing and a curse. You can over engineer things and make them very complicated. If the tool becomes to cumbersome due to the implementation, then you wil turn your stakeholders/users off to it. Be careful with you set it up.
author: Brad

review_detail:
title: Excellent solution as “One stop shop” in IT industry
pros: This software is very easy to manage day to day work,progress,assignments and forcast for different phases of projects..It turned out to be very effective tool in order to achieve efficient and cost efffective operational model in enterprise organizations
cons: This software should have most reporting widgets and open integration ports so that various data connectors can be integrated for limitless reporting
author: Ashish

review_detail:
title: The best organizer and issue tracker
pros: I like how easy it is to look up past events—having the ability to transmit directives telepathically is a plus. And we're all set to check out the exciting details, like the suitable date, in each reference. Moreover, dragging a record is a snap. Bringing up the work in a new tab is also quite helpful. Card-to-card attachments are also helpful.
cons: They have already been making progress on this issue. However, I suppose they could include more guiding principles in the template for less frequent users to spare unnecessary hassles. This is not a significant concern, but I agree that they could provide more designs. For example, performing the same item in two separate places in Jira might feel like two completely different experiences due to the item's inefficiencies.
author: Nur Syikin

review_detail:
title: Jira software
pros: The fact that you can drag and drop stories in terms of priority order with ease.
cons: If you’re not familiar with the tool, you will require quite a bit of training.
author: Andrew

review_detail:
title: Very good management tool for Agile project
pros: Easy define backlog for the whole project and allocate task into PI, Sprint and assign for team and member of project, clear dashboard to track working effort, member task, and sprint progress.
cons: It is hard to customize and require some effort for creating a ticket, it will be better if we are able to create a default template ticket for each team/project
author: Hung

review_detail:
title: Need to track Agile development methodology - Just go with Jira
pros: Jira is one of the best development tool for the agile environment of development. It is very easy to plan, track and release software. User can create project roadmaps with just drog and drop features with every minute project details. It's functionality like create user stories and issues, plan sprints and distribute tasks across the team etc very flexible to design. It is one of the best tracking tool I have ever worked with. I believe it is extremely handy and effective for project management. In nutshell I like below features very much: - Drag and drag feature is one of the best feature to design the project roadmap - Bird view and quick access to the project status/ tracking - Security features are also awesome and highly configurable - Beautiful dashboard - To extract data for reporting suppose is also easy
cons: - As an user I didn't find anything I can considers as 'Cons' but I heard from the management that it is quite expensive software. - It is highly configurable, so some times it is quite complex also to find out the configuration for a simple change
author: Sumit

review_detail:
title: JIRA IT Product Software Incredibility
pros: Ease of deployment and possession of simple settings. Flexibility to all internet enabled devices. Online projects, tasks and teams management. Employees scheduling. Online time tracking, among more.
cons: Nothing to like least since it over delivers all.
author: Kibaiya

review_detail:
title: Defect and project managment at ease with Jira
pros: 1) Ticket or story management becomes very easy. 2) It allows multiple links to a child ticket and hence tracking down or updating the ticket becomes very easy. 3) Ability to create new custom subtasks in a parent ticket. 4) Embed test case management tools like test rail, hence user can see and update the status of the test case in the same window. 5) Updates/comments form QA and Development teams are very clear. 6) Works efficiently for agile methodology projects. 7) All project related information like scrum team, sprints, scrum masters, QA team, Dev team MRD/BRD are organised very well. 8) Allows users to split their daily working hours in different tickets. 9) It has a vary vast storage, and allows all types to files to upload without any overall size issue.
cons: Webpage loads with some lag. Although mostly it has data only rather than UI but still it lags and specially if you are working inside VDI or VPN as in India most of the QA testers work inside client VPN only.
author: Manish

review_detail:
title: Best way to track your time and tasks
pros: Jira is the most professional ticketing solution I found so far. It is by far the easiest to use and is the golden industry standard.
cons: Some options related to sprints can be hard to find in the context menus, but once you know where they are it becomes much easier to use.
author: Goran

review_detail:
title: An industry leader that hasn't kept up
pros: Jira for a long time has been the industry standard for software development process management, and it has some exceptionally powerful workflow features to help you keep a development team on track. It's pretty intuitive if you're just looking to plan and run sprints.
cons: In the last couple of years, releases to the product have felt a little careless. This has lead to several inconsistencies and problems in the user experience. It can be overly complex and require you to reach out to Atlassian's (incredible) customer support team. I will be exploring other alternatives in the future such as airtable, Monday or Trello (owned by the same company).
author: Ash

review_detail:
title: Best software for allocating and tracking work items for project collaboration
pros: 1. Can personalize the fields as desired for work items or tickets or whatever you would like to use for like status, assignee, environment, importance, etc. 2. Can assign labels and resources. 3. Easy to see comment and activity history.
cons: 1. Analytics and usage per team or per user can be improved. 2. Sometimes email notification stop coming. Happened more than once. Hamper's the day's work as we become dependent on the product.
author: Yash

review_detail:
title: JIRA software helps me in my work
pros: JIRA software provides better workflow visibility by automating the process and tracking progress in real time
cons: It's a little confusing at first because of its sheer size and scale
author: Mohammed

review_detail:
title: Simple & Easy ALM Tool
pros: Good UX Flexible Options Customizable Provisions Add-In Support Dashboards & Boards
cons: Nothing as such. The JQL Syntaxes can be made available via hints for complex / advanced queries.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: Jira...the best out there
pros: Jira is highly customisable, and also has plugins. It allows you to monitor your projects and provided granulated access to individuals. You (or your admin) can set roles for the project and associates those roles to certain activities and then associate the roles even further to individuals. You can organize your tickets in sprints and releases as well as monitor workload and task assignment to your team during sprints (or whatever other form of software delivery you wish to choose).
cons: Pricing model. Currently, you have a choice of server vs cloud setup. If you have a team that can maintain the server instance, I'd recommend going to server because you have a lot more plugins you can use on server and you can set it up the way you want. The best thing is the licenses are a one-time cost, as opposed to lower, but monthly and forever costs on the cloud portion. The other thing that is to be considered is that the plugins you choose need to have the same level of range for hte user count. i.e if your jira is for 101-250 users, all your plugins will need a license level of the same range, i.e 101-250 users. Something to consider if you are thinking about moving to Jira.
author: Shaffick

review_detail:
title: Excellent for task management, setting workflows and an easy-to-set system for approvals
pros: Task management, setting workflows for approvals were damn easy - even for a huge organisation like noon
cons: Project management was not great especially compared to the likes of Asana - could be done, but not intuitve
author: Vedant

review_detail:
title: Best for large teams
pros: Jira is awesome; If you want to use it in large teams and big projects, definitely this is the one
cons: It is complicated and hard to use compared to other available solutions, Lacking flexibility. You will need a lot of paid extensions.
author: Mostafa

review_detail:
title: The Standard for Tracking and Reporting
pros: Jira provides everything we needed in a resource/project tracking tool. If you know how to use it, it provides great reporting and metrics to track progress, velocity, etc.
cons: Jira is a workhorse and while new users get quite a bit from it, it does take someone with solid experience to get things working right. Even with this person, there are still so many features and use cases that you feel like there is always more you could be doing and that gets overwhelming.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: The best tool for SCRUM
pros: The ease of use (for administrators and users). The Agile board provides a much-needed dashboard to track the progress.
cons: Reporting is limited and can be spruced up. Export of issues out of JIRA is not always easy, if not configured correctly.
author: Amit

review_detail:
title: Best In the Market Project Management and Test Management Tool
pros: I use it for Project Management and Test Management. It's User friendly and have useful integration with tool like Jenkins and BitBuket.
cons: I can't find anything to dislike which I can term as Cons.
author: Rajat

review_detail:
title: High quality software
pros: All project management features has high quality functionalities.
cons: Integration with 3th party applications
author: Sergio R

review_detail:
title: JIRA is an amazing tool in a very useful suite of project management software.
pros: JIRA is a great way to track items that need to be done or defects that need to be fixed across a business. If you take the time to customize the interface, add fields, workflows, etc. that match your business model, JIRA can make your organization so much more transparent and efficient. Combined with it's siblings Confluence, BitBucket, et. al. you have an amazing suite of productivity tools. Each individual may feel that they are doing a little more than they used to when adding information into these tools, but the time saved in meetings, querying peers for information & not having the full picture will soon become apparent. To get the most of JIRA, be prepared to customize and train. Without those two pieces, you may end up with users who don't see or feel the benefit.
cons: The least appealing thing about JIRA and the other tools in the Atlassian suite is the fact that you must buy plug-ins to get a lot of functionality that should have been built in. Atlassian is proud of their App ecosystem, but, from an end user perspective, it can just feel like it is a place grabbing your money.
author: Tim

review_detail:
title: Extremely confusing software, not user friendly, just complicated
pros: The amount of possibility that gives you are endless. Usefull in really big teams especially when you have to log and keep track of software issues and failure. It helps to easily manage the status of your issues and easily communicate with your or other teams.
cons: Not user friendly. It completely makes you forget why you are using it in the first place. Too many "solutions" and often not a single one is worth it. The price is extremely high, considering that you are not receiving the same assistance and software quality of their competitors.
author: Dario

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: I liked its customizable workflows which were helpful in handling tasks in a way that aligned my development methodology. We used multiple methodologies for different projects and Jira was perfect as it is adjustable to any method. I liked its integration feature with GitHub and Slack which made our task flow smooth.
cons: In the beginning, it was complex because of its extensive customization options. For me, it was a bit harder to set up the projects and flow initially.
author: Bishal

review_detail:

pros: The Scrum boards are very light weight and handy to manage backlog and Sprint planning and execution
cons: Customization is a bit a of an issue. Eazy BI report plugging is bit lethargic and difficult to operate upon

review_detail:

pros: Jira's ability to be customized to meet the unique needs of any organization and its comprehensive set of features and integrations make it an effective solution for tracking and managing tasks, monitoring project progress, and collaborating with stakeholders.
cons: The least liked thing about Jira is that it can be difficult to learn, especially for those who are unfamiliar with the project management software.

review_detail:
title: It is very easy to keep track of assignments at work
pros: I loved Jira such a ton that subsequent to moving positions I took it with me and utilized their free form just to help track my own personal errands but none of my other colleagues were utilizing it. Jira has made my work life simpler particularly during a period where we as a whole need to work distantly. It assists me with dealing with the undertakings and follows side by side of the jobs being finished. The product is very simple to know and hence the wealth of clear how-to recordings is incredible.
cons: Estimating has gotten truly wild as of late. it had been once extraordinary worth however since they should be cornered a major market fragment they're truly draining it for all its value, Jira like most programming highlights a tad of an expectation to learn and adapt.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Useful tool for agile development
pros: The tool works great to keep track of an ongoing software development job. Multiple users can get involved within the platform and have different subtasks assigned to them. Having the possibility to create workflows keep things simple and easy to see what's the current status of the whole task at a glance. The platform allows for customisation as well, this comes really handy as no project is identical and you may need to add some automations to the process to meet your specific needs. Thanks to their recent Boards implementation, you can see the next tasks that need to be worked on and as well as what's already been done and what's in progress.
cons: The platform might be a bit overwhelming when you start working with it for the first time. It's hard to know all the possible functionalities until you have worked with it for a while. Although it's possible to customise, some parts can get a bit tricky to perform if you don't have the knowledge. On the other side, you can also reach out to them if you need help. In terms of pricing, it can get a bit expensive if you need a lot of users.
author: Pedro

review_detail:
title: Using JIRA with Corporate Learning and Development
pros: Ability to collaborate easily with SCRUM teams; everyone has access in real time to the most up to date information for each JIRA story; ability to mock ups and to add comments @ team members who are notified immediately and vice versa when they respond. It allows us to accurately track to our L&D deliverables related to the SCRUM’s JIRA stories, as they may change over the course of a sprint.
cons: Sometimes you have to download a mock up instead of it opening directly in Windows viewer, not a big deal but just an extra step; JIRA is a much more technical application, it definitely requires a learning curve to use it, it’s not a super simple interface.
author: Marcy

review_detail:
title: Among the top 5 best project management tools for Software Development
pros: This is a pretty interesting and simple to use software platform by developers, testers & managers in the software industry. It is mainly adopted by teams following the agile methodology. The overall usability and user experience are unbelievable and the smoothness through which we can switch between different sections of the platform makes it a very usable product. It helps to create Scrum and Kanban projects as well as create and manage tasks, user stories, etc. by these teams. Developers can easily use GIT or TFS to check-in or commit data on the respective servers whereas testers can file relevant bugs or issues encountered for the relevant tasks under a User story. Overall, this is a great project management tool to use.
cons: As compared to other platforms like Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly Visual Studio Team Services), this tool doesn't provide much more features and support for functionalities. Anyone would prefer to use Azure DevOps as it is a complete DevOps solution as well as a Project management tool with decent pricing for corporates and also free pricing for a team of 5.
author: Siddhant

review_detail:
title: The best solution for Team Project Management
pros: A lot of plugins and tools are available on the Marketplace. The tools are used a lot amoung the Video Game Industry, making it a standard for task management and bugtracking. Offers a lot of options to present to the data to the users as well as gathering information from the backlogs and rendering charts for project managers.
cons: Lot of options and tools, makes it hard to master. Not always easy to find its way in the options, especially because the tool is revamping and evolving often, making tutorials or classes quickly out of date.
author: Cédric

review_detail:
title: Great for Backlogs and Organizing Software Releases - Bad For Agility
pros: The backlog and features for managing the backlog with different methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum, or Kanban + Scrum hybrid are very flexible. Planning sprints, releasing sprints, and looking at history of what was done is very organized.
cons: Cumbersome to setup. Workflows for issues and UI/UX for creating them is not easy to understand. Sure you can figure it out, but it will require a lot of facepalms. It's good for larger organizations with several cross-functional teams, but if you are a smaller organization stick with Trello and checklists for the cards if sub-tasks are needed. The sub-tasks in Jira are just plain awful to work with, and will end up wasting a lot of time for your team.

review_detail:

If you have several users working on a project, no matter how complex - JIRA is your tool. You can create tasks, subtasks, assign them to different users (who will receive email notifications when they are mentioned or any changes are made), request updates, etc.
cons: Some of the users I worked with overcomplicated the process - but this is not fault of JIRA at all.

I love that they allow Kanban boards and sprints on the same project - if that's how you want to work. Super flexible, fast and easy to use, even when I'm doing Admin work that I don't do everyday and can't remember exactly how to do it. Additionally the tool has lots of add-ons - we use Tempo for time keeping and have used Gliffy in the past for diagramming. I'm not sure if
cons: My least favorite thing is that they have changed the interface several times while I have been using it. However each time after I spend time getting used to it I find their redesign to be significantly better. I really find this when I use locally hosted older versions and see what I used to do - I really realize how they improved it.

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management Tool
pros: The best part about JIRA are - 1. Different workflow can be integrated for different category of projects. You can have different transitions, conditions, post functions, validators and behaviors associated with a workflow. 2. You can have different issue type schemes based on the project categories and projects. 3. You can easily assign issues based on the lead and team you want to assign to. 4. You can easily integrate JIRA with other Atlassian products like confluence, GitLab and many more. 5. The permission schemes are the best part. 6. The UI is user friendly.
cons: Mostly if you are a user then you can easily create issues and can check its status with comments, history and much more. But if you are from administration setting up projects, templates and other requirements it becomes a bit difficult to understand as their are not much documentation and support.

review_detail:
title: You now have no excuse not to know what you need to do
pros: In one way, we could escape from some task if we said we forgot. Not any more, JIRA tickets that you are assigned will hound you until you resolve them or do your part and pass the hot potato by assigning it to someone else. You boss who is always a watcher can also comment if he/she thinks you are wasting your time or should be working on something of higher priority (helps the boss who loves micromanaging). I particularly like the way you can use epics to pools similar tasks and then make sub-task to link them to other tasks etc.
cons: It has made most of the places so efficient that before when I worked as an intern, my boss would brief me on what I had to do daily. Nowadays I get a steady list of tasks which I need to sometimes write back and forth before knowing exactly what to do - sometimes a good old fashioned face-to-face would be helpful - so maybe this is a flaw in management rather than the fault of the tool.
author: Jenny

review_detail:
title: Tailor Jira for your Workflow needs
pros: Like the fact that Jira is highly configurable , you can add modify remove fields, add process steps , change workflows , excellenet tool
cons: Sometimes making changes could be challenging and needs an expert to make those changes
author: Ramesh

review_detail:
title: Quite good but I have some suggestions
pros: JIRA is good for project and issue tracking. I think the best part about it is that it's an easy yet full way for QA personnel to submit bugs to the teams responsible for them. We can communicate through it back and forth regarding the issue and status. It's easy to see what issues remain open vs already addressed.
cons: JIRA can get overwhelming, in one sense because you get tons of e-mails from it. Aside from cutting that back a bit, for example, the company could develop other ways for notifications that need to be seen by team members, in a desktop application tool. So, in such a case, the desktop would continually be running through the day, and JIRA could stream a notification to the tool. It could make its appearance by simply highlighting the tool in the toolbar. That's one way. People should be able to choose how they get notifications from JIRA. Some will prefer e-mail, others this tool, and others who really need to stay on top of everything, could get text alerts. JIRA should expand even more, and be more of a project lifecycle tool.
author: Stephanie

review_detail:
title: Best Project reporting and performance management tool
pros: The best part is, easy to understand the features of Jira for everyone in the project Very useful for me like a Testers Easy to track and assign bugs, Tasks, User stories and everything Best part is reporting and dash board
cons: Nothing to say dislike here, only performance and logging issues some times when opening in multiple tabs in browser
author: Charan Raj

review_detail:
title: An essential tool
pros: I have worked with Jira across two companies and it's remarkable how it can be customized to very different contexts. Most tools are easy to use and there are lot of resources for documenting the tasks.
cons: I believe there's a steeper learning curve, specially considering each company may set up their workflows differently. But since it's an ubiquitous software by now, it's worth it in the long run.
author: Vinicius

review_detail:
title: Great for PM, not so good at user experience
pros: Used this tool on a daily basis while I was a PM at an agile software company. Favourite features were the boards and the knowledge base. It's easy to add and configure tasks, as well as moving them across lanes. Overall, the software has everything you need to move a project forward, especially with large teams. Customer support was also friendly when we contacted them over a technical glitch that was interrupting a project. They're not the fastest but they're fast enough. Got the issue resolved.
cons: As a PM of a very dynamic company, jumping from project to project was the daily standard. The biggest issue we had with this software was not being able to open multiple timers at the same time. We had to run one, stop it, log it, then open a new one, do the same and return to the first timer again. Rinse and repeat. We ended up replacing the time tracking with a whole different software and syncing it. Also, customizing the boards and features is pretty finnicky. You'll find yourself going down a rabbit hole to find anything. The interface is always changing too so once you figure something out you'll just have to re-figure it out later. Introducing a new team member to the software was always a long process. It can seem overwhelming to the inexperienced and has quite the learning curve.
author: Jenny

review_detail:
title: Excellent Solution for Issue Tracking and Resolution
pros: Jira's UI is very intuitive, even for those who have not used similar software in the past. There are no obstacles or barriers to entry for organizations who have limited experience with this type of application. It also integrates very well with other related apps such as Atlassian and Confluence, both of which are extremely useful when creating a full-featured help desk solution.
cons: At least in the implementation we are currently using, there seem to be times when the application is updated and the changes are not communicated. In the past, this involved a change to some fundamental UI characteristics and layout. As this has only occurred once, I cannot complain too much, but it was something worth pointing out.
author: Anthony

review_detail:
title: Easy & straightforward for mini projects follow-up
pros: I like the simple and fast UI. The search engine is very dynamic and intuitive. I find it very convenient to track meeting's outcomes about the mini-project, do @someone so she/he gets an email notification with the latest news, questions, etc is very efficient. Overall, I think this tool brings value while keeping the UI easy enough.
cons: Maybe it would be great to have an easier way to customize the kanban columns like "in assessment", "done", "on hold",...
author: Ariel

review_detail:
title: Excellent Project management tool
pros: Easy to use and easy to add customised fields as per convenience. The access level from admin to project owner to the developer or QA people is very much effective so as only the required features would be available to the specific people.
cons: Advanced JQL query in search filters can be made some what easy by showing what all user can use to apply filters. It would make the tool more helpful.

review_detail:
title: Jira - you might not want to use it, but it has all the features you will ever need!
pros: Jira can be customized to fit almost any workflow imaginable, whether it be a very simple Kanban board or very restricted and complicated workflows with approvals and automations. If you learn it well you can make it work in almost any organization - which is a skill you can use between jobs!
cons: Jira isn't very intuitive to use and setup when you first start using it. They are making a conscious effort to simplify it with the new next-gen projects, which does help, but the UI is often slow and requires waiting between screens loading too often, which can be annoying at times.

It has personalized filters on which to later visualize the information that is useful.
cons: I don't have much to complain about this tool, except that sometimes the interface is updated and it becomes a bit complex to adapt to the new features, but they are always improvements that ultimately help us to have better control with planning and administration. The interface could be better, a bit more user friendly to make it easy and intuitive.

cons: The Jira application is not optimized for mobile use, is riddled with bugs, and lacks important features that should be included. Furthermore, the mobile version of Jira is so limited that it's more practical to access it through a web browser. Although it is a basic software, it is quite expensive compared to other similar services that offer more functionality for a lower cost.

There has also been certain instances in agile sprints where it's difficult to find certain tasks and issues after assigning to a upcoming sprint which has not been started yet. But this is showing correctly in the sprint board after starting the sprint. Better if they can improve it in a suitable way.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Jira functionality

cons: It can be slow to load but once loaded it is fit for purpose

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: Avec Jira, innové de grande idée à partir des petites devient plus facile et simple. Non seulement, il a une interface simple et transparente, mais aussi, il permet de faire une bonne gestion des projets et un suivu de prêt. Je le recommande vivement pour toute personne morale et physique qui envisage développer des projets en équipe.
cons: Le prix par utilisateur pour chacun des plans de Jira est raisonnable mais, avoir une réduction en plus nous fera plus plaisir.

review_detail:
title: Review
pros: Its easy to use and makes collaborations easy as well
cons: I do not receive notifications of upcoming tasks

review_detail:
title: Great for bug tracking and program management
pros: Ability to track tickets via Jira as well as via email Accountability and transparency to see where a ticket is and who is dealing with it
cons: I think it can be overwhelming sometimes for a basic user
author: Yaacov

review_detail:
title: Jira as ticket system
pros: The interface is intuitive and easy to use, and can be configured for different needs. I use it for issue tracking and it has become a handy way to know the most common issues within my organization, as well as tracking tickets for different areas, I like that you can make comments within each of the tickets.
cons: Something I don't like is that at the moment of creating the case, it doesn't allow to attach images or documents, I can only do that at the moment of making a comment.
author: Juan

review_detail:
title: Project Excellence Tool
pros: Jira can be moulded and used in a variety of different ways to suit your project needs
cons: If you haven’t used this tool before it can be rather complex. More training materials need to be released
author: Steffan

review_detail:
title: Solid but expensive tool
pros: it's a good tool for basic project management tasks with a wide range of features.
cons: It can be complex to use, and its pricing can be expensive for teams with a large number of users.
author: Marco

review_detail:
title: Gestion de projet
pros: Jira est un très bon logiciel de gestion de projet et de coordination d'équipe.
cons: Quelques bugs par moment mais à part cela rien de spécial.
author: Maurice

review_detail:
title: Jira Software Review
pros: What I love most about Jira is the amount it helps a developing project function. Thanks to the multiple features of the software, I can easily track the progress of the project I'm working on from various sides, making the overall workflow fluent and coherent.
cons: There are not many downsides of the software, however, if I were to pick one, it is the UI functionality. It seems outdated and in need of a change, of a proper update.
author: Lecze

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management tool for Large enterprises!
pros: Jira is most secure project management tool available in the market, it can be easily integrated with on-premises security tool in the organizations and gives complete flexibility over that. the ticket creations and time management process is very simple and straight-forward and user interface is also quite decent.
cons: Overall Jira gives you all the important feature require to manage the project in well established way, the configuration part is little difficult in the jira but once we setup the things properly it gives us complete freedom and options to utilize to project management capabilities.
author: Rohit

review_detail:
title: Review for Jira as a user
pros: As a daily user of Jira, I like the ease of use. I love the dashboards, issue tracking, love the integrations and ease of getting apps over on the market place. I like the agile framework, roadmaps, and role assignments. I enjoy the ease of use and I find it easy for team collaboration and whether it be complex or simple projects, We are a large organization, but we segment for the multiple teams. I'm not sure about the other tools, but it world be hard to pull me away from Jira.
cons: I am not sure at this point, Jira was hard to navigate at the start, but I got the concept relatively quick, and now find it easy to use, still a range of functionality and features I have not touched.
author: Donavan

review_detail:
title: Un outil puissant de gestion de projets
pros: Jira permet une gestion de projet facile grâce à des fonctionnalités avancées comme la planification agile et la possibilité de personnaliser les workflows. Les tableaux de bord sont plutôt détaillés offrent une visibilité 360 sur les projets.
cons: L'interface est un peu complexe au premier abord, et le nombre de fonctionnalités peut parfois faire peur.
author: Pauline

review_detail:
title: Oui
pros: C'est un logiciel pratique pour la gestion de projet
cons: C'est pas tout à fait adapté à tout type de projet
author: Elfried

review_detail:
title: Jira review
pros: Jira stands out as a tool with a rich array of project management features, offering flexibility through its customizable options and fostering seamless collaboration among team members. What truly appeals to me about Jira is its remarkable versatility and its capacity to facilitate highly efficient collaboration and task tracking.
cons: Nothing so far, but the Jira interface lacks the intuitive simplicity and visual appeal found in some other project management tools.
author: Ibrahim

review_detail:
title: Sehr nützlich, wenn richtig angewendet

cons: Man muss sich strikt an die Rahmenbedingungen halten, die sich das Team gesetzt hat. Ansonsten wird alles von den Kollegen zugemüllt...

review_detail:
title: JIRA is the standard for any software project management
pros: JIRA is easy to use, has all features needed and customizability to no matter what kind of methodology want to use. It's a time saver and helps us a lot with organisation.
cons: The UI is outdated and not a lot of integrations with third party tools or via easy apps.

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: For Added the Effort in task u have to individuyally open each task and fill the details in a separate tab in which a time and related issue number option is available it will be better.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Decent Task and project tacking tool
pros: Jira is one of the most used tool by my current working company. We usually create tickets, log time on the tickets and change status of the tickets. Both the company and the workers are happy with this tool. By far this is the easiest tracking tool that i have ever used in my career. The UI and UX is well designed.
cons: This does not has much cons but they could improve their UI on the dark mode becuase dark mode feels a bit off. Also, i often forget to stop the log of time but i could later edit it. i hope they come up with an idea to fix this issues.
author: Ritesh

review_detail:
title: Un outil puissant et polyvalent !

cons: Jira est principalement conçu pour les projets complexes. Pour les projets plus simples ou les petites équipes, l’outil peut sembler trop complex avec des fonctionnalités inutiles pour certains.
author: Laura

review_detail:
title: Problemverfolgung mit Jira meistern
pros: Ich kann Jira perfekt an unsere Bedürfnisse anpassen; wir haben benutzerdefinierte Felder erstellt, um bestimmte Projektdetails zu verfolgen.
cons: Das Einrichten benutzerdefinierter Workflows in Jira kann etwas kompliziert sein. Ich habe beispielsweise Stunden damit verbracht, ein neues Projekt zu konfigurieren.

review_detail:
title: Wonderful and most applicable.
pros: The dashboard support is amazing for scheduling projects, follow up the progress and plan new ones. For agile planning and easily customizable.
cons: Jira is great compared to other tools in the same category.

review_detail:
title: JIRA - Get Your Tasks Done!
pros: - Allows us to easily create, track and manage issues and tasks. - Supports agile development and it has features like scrum and kanban boards. - Integrates well with Confluence and Bitbucket tools from Atlassian.
cons: - When saving a jira issue, it doesn't inform about all the missing fields in the form at once. - It has too many fields within testing, release notes, system impact analysis, etc. which could very easily confuse new users.
author: Akash

review_detail:
title: The Perfect Tool for Project Management
pros: Jira has great integration strengths, this makes it more effective in task management. It is very easy to use and very flexible. No need to hire experts to do some difficult tasks.
cons: I have not experienced any difficulties in this tool.It has great intuitive tools for project management. I have no dislikes.

review_detail:
title: JIRA importance

cons: There are many unnecessary options which are mostly not used by a tester may be can modify some options for tester profiles which would make easy to access even for the first time user ( only for the tester's)

review_detail:
title: JIRA - A must have tool
pros: The integration with test suites and defects management.
cons: Costing, User Interface can be made much more appealing to enhance user experience.

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: It has helped our team to go all on the same direction and to have more visibility

review_detail:

cons: Jira can be overwhelming to use if it's the first time you're using this type of software as it has a lot of different and complex functionalities

review_detail:
title: A solid task management tool
pros: It is a very intuitive tool, it is easy to create new tasks and keep track of them during their lifecycle.
cons: It is a little complex to work with subtasks and keep the board clean when these types of issues are being worked on.
author: Nuno

review_detail:
title: Jira feedback and review
pros: Jira is very easy to use, with most things being visual it can be set up and used with minimal training. Of course once you are up and walking, you can explore more advanced features with available help. Collaboration is my favorite feature as it makes working in large team environment easy. you can very easily track who is holding the ball on any task at any moment.
cons: This is other side of the coin. Since you have lot of features available on same screen, sometime this could be overwhelming for some people at beginning. I would also like easier way to create tags and ways to filtering using tags.
author: Abhishek

review_detail:
title: Very useful software
pros: I like the overall capabilities and the collaboration opportunities.
cons: There are some parts of Jira that can be a bit clunky but good overall.
author: Irina

review_detail:
title: great tool
pros: really easy to use, and to get the whole team connected to
cons: can sometimes be confusing due to all the views and tabs
author: Max

review_detail:
title: Software affidabile, utilissimo per per gestire progetti in ambito IT
pros: La semplicità di utilizzo e l'interfaccia grafica semplice.
cons: Non ho trovato particolari inconvenienti.
author: Davide

review_detail:
title: Good Project Management Tool
pros: I like sprint feature where I can setup all list of tasks for sprint and can view it in calendar
cons: I would say it's little bit tough to understand for a non techy person. I faced with couple of clients where they were getting confused while using Jira
author: Shyam

review_detail:
title: Jire - good for bug tracking and Prioritization
pros: Very easy to start a ticket when it comes to bug tracking. Its nice to be able to put a summary and then a follow up on exact details to reproduce the bug. The task scheduling and prioritization features are very nice in a project management setting, being able to set flags and levels of priority help to organize who is being blocked and needs helpI also like the amount of documentation and help necessary to get jira smooth
cons: The only issue about bug tracking is that with the setting of flags, there can an overwhelming amount of high priority bugs which detracts from the whole point of high-priority bugs. Maybe being able to set a limit to that would be useful?
author: Kenneth

review_detail:
title: Jira-a complete workflow management tool.
pros: It can accommodate bigger teams and handle several projects at once with ease. Additionally, it has a significant user base and facilitates community assistance.
cons: Bug tracking and task distribution in software development are two areas where JIRA excels. Its adaptability means it can be tailored to the specific needs of a particular project.
author: B. Naveen

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion de projets très utile
pros: La facilité de la gestion de projets et le suivi des tâches
cons: Un peu difficile à prendre en mains au premier abord
author: Tiphaine

review_detail:
title: Perfect project management product for enterprises.
pros: Extensive support for agile software methodology. We follows sprints planning for every two weeks, jira help us to create task and assign by priority.Jira Feature Ja Report help us to align our sprint goals help us to do the priority tasksJira bug tracking another feature make our production fixes smoothly.
cons: Jira send every ticked comments and updates to our email inbox., It is kind of hard to manage the inbox.
author: Prabakaran

review_detail:
title: Love and hate
pros: Jira is incredibly powerful to do all sorts of project management and workflows.
cons: Sometimes Jira is incredibly hard to use, even for apparently simple tasks that should be straightforward.

review_detail:
title: Manage your projects with Jira
pros: I am using Jira from last 2-3 years now and I can say this is one of the best project management tool available in the market. It's easy to use with its minimal and user friendly interface is great. I loved its drag and drop feature for Jira card progress.
cons: Sometimes it takes more to time to load than usual. I want to it be a bit fast in terms of loading and working.
author: Lakshit

review_detail:
title: Experience with Jira for over 5 years
pros: Communication, tracking, completely comprehensive for tracking work, issue progress monitoring and compasses every field I need to work with frok logistics to IT to engineering requirements etc .
cons: May be a preview for attachments without downloading would be great. A subject for issues would be useful for searching the issues later on.

review_detail:
title: Great experience

review_detail:

cons: I get lost with the navigation, going round and round trying to find specific tickets.

review_detail:
title: Easy to use
pros: Easy to create bugs, assign them and track themadding attachments is easyWe can add watchers for the issues that are criticalcommenting made easyCan have inbuilt test tracking tools
cons: Zephyr(test tracking tool) squad can be made better. It is cumbersome to create a matrix for requirement mapping.
author: Lsb

review_detail:
title: Jira page review
pros: You can easily manage your tasks See the workflow of each taskMake plans with detailReport bugs easily and assign them to the correct personTrack your previous work easilySee data of every aspect of the programSee all the tasks that need to be done in a dashboard
cons: Jira has not something that i didn't like.
author: Anastasios

review_detail:
title: Avis Jira
pros: J'utilise Jira avec mon équipe, car il me permet de gérer facilement la gestion de l'équipe. On est en mesure de voir les tâches à accomplir et effectué. Il y a pleins d'autres fonctionnalités, et c'est ce qui fait la force de Jira.
cons: Logiciel assez difficile à prendre en main la première fois.
author: Florent

review_detail:
title: Best for agile development
pros: Very easy to learn the use of jira. Can be used easily in agile. And can raise tickets and assign to different teams.
cons: As far as we have used in Agile team it has been very useful and cover all the options and found it very effective. Didn’t find any loopholes that affects the teams work.

review_detail:
title: Miglior software per lo SCRUM
