cons: Nessun consiglio, è perfetto così. Non ho nulla da dire
author: Francesca

review_detail:
title: My review about Jira
pros: It helps to manage the project very efficiently It breaks down the project into smaller sub tasks where we can concentrate more We are easily able to track the backlogs if any
cons: Product support from the atlassian side Complexity
author: Ramanathan

review_detail:
title: Good tuesday
pros: Su seguridad a nivel empresarial es optima es muy buena
cons: No tiene retrospectiva los flujos de trabajo no son buenos
author: Christian

review_detail:
title: Helpful agile tool once you get past the steep learning curve
pros: JIRA is a robust tool for agile project management with seemingly endless possibilities for customization thanks to the Atlassian Marketplace. Once someone is familiar with how the complex administrative side works, setting up new workflows customized to a team's needs is quite doable.
cons: There's a reason some organizations have full-time JIRA administrators. Setting up JIRA is not for the faint of heart. There's a lot of moving pieces in constructing workflows, setting user roles, and administrating sprints.
author: David

review_detail:
title: Satisfied with some drawbacks
pros: It is a beautiful tool for teams of almost any scale to plan and manage the software development process. The tool is highly customizable, to fit in almost every team structure
cons: Sadly there's still no dark mode. Also the performance could be better, especially if you use some third party tools which is for many use cases required as they improve many features, e.g. time tracking, or the bigger picture of your project
author: Laura

review_detail:
title: Software doesn't make you agile, but Jira supports as best as a software can
pros: Jira has a lot of freedom in how to adapt your process and your way of working. I like that there are thousands of add ons, which will meet your needs. I also like the community and that you can ask for featgure requests. I like that Jira has a lot to offer, like the ticket system. This reduces interfaces and copy/ past style of working.
cons: There is almost nothing in Jira I would wish differently. Maybe the only thing: More possibilities in the dashboards to track more KPIs in different graphs and so on.
author: Marcel

review_detail:
title: A must have for Scrum teams
pros: It has plenty of features out of the box. It has multiple layers (Teams, Projects) that can support the organization of the whole company, establishing enough separation, but at the same time, the right integrations between the different teams within the company. Can be easily integrated with the whole Atlassian universe (Bitbucket, Confluence), and I truly recommend doing so as you will have every single possible place to put any part of your project (code, backlog, sprints, documentation). It gives you all the needed tools to handle any Scrum or Canvas team, although you will take more advantage of using Scrum I must say. It can be easily integrated via code, and make very creative automated build ticket systems.
cons: It's pricy and having a lot of free options out there that can handle multiple people, it's hard to say that is the right tool for small indie teams. It is indeed the right one for companies, but for low-budget teams.. it's probably safer to go with free options that don't limit the members' amount.
author: Arnaldo

review_detail:
title: Jira : Collaboration of multiple people on same platform
pros: It's a very powerful tool. It provides many advanced features to collaborate with people. We can easily tracks things on Jira through our mobile devises and other gadgets. It helps us to plan the projects with tasks and sub-tasks.
cons: It is an expensive software compared to other open source software. I have worked with many software Jira is one of the most expensive product that we have used in our projects.
author: PRAVEEN

review_detail:
title: Everything You Need to Know About Jira
pros: Pro 1: Easy Time Tracking One of my favorite things about Jira is its time-tracking feature. You can easily track which team members spent their time working on certain issues, giving you insight into how your projects are progressing. (This could also be a con if you work in a more collaborative environment). Pro 2: Easy Project Management Prioritizing tasks is an essential aspect of project management. With its dashboards, Jira allows you to prioritize projects by quickly identifying which are progressing well and which need help. With a quick glance at your dashboard, you can easily prioritize what’s next for your project teams.
cons: Con 1: Technical Issues Projects created in Jira have an issue type called technical that is often confused with bugs. Because issue types are pre-defined by default, it’s hard to use your own words to describe what a technical issue is. When you create an issue for a bug or technical problem, there’s no way to group it with other issues about similar problems so users can focus on problems across several projects at once. Con 2: Difficult to Get Support The biggest negative about JIRA is that it's tough to get support when you need it. This is due to Atlassian's heavy reliance on their community forums, which are frequently inundated with low-quality questions from new users. If you have a complicated issue, or your problem isn't being addressed in any forum threads, Atlassian's usually helpful but small team of professional service agents (PSAs) may be a better bet than waiting for help from other users.
author: Solomon

review_detail:
title: Excellent software, easy to use and makes processes a lot quicker!
pros: Jira is a software that any company can benefit from, it allows users to easily set up ticket tracking as well as track their process from sprint to sprint to allow users to easily see an overview of where they might sit in a sprint t any given time.
cons: Jira can be a bit buggy with use on smaller screens or phones if you just wanted to see on the fly, I feel as if Jira can have a better interface or fix their interfaces on a phone/cellular devices.
author: Jayden

review_detail:
title: Powerful Ticket and Project Management Tool
pros: It is as powerful as you want it to be. A company could easily hire a full-time employee to concentrate on Jira. It also has a good marketplace, where you can find any plug-in you could imagine.
cons: Being as powerful as it is, some features and customizations are only fully realized when you make the commitment to dig in and learn the software. Thankfully, there is pretty good documentation, training, and forums available.
author: Aaron

review_detail:
title: The finest tool for managing and planning is Jira.
pros: The options for customization are nice. It is simple to organize activities and monitor progress because the tool can be customized to meet the unique requirements of each project. Using Jira's dashboard capability, we designed a customized Kanban board to visualize the status of all tasks on a single page, making it simpler to make choices and spot possible bottlenecks. On one project, we needed a comprehensive picture of task progress in real time. Making decisions and locating possible bottlenecks became simpler.
cons: Although it is designed to be flexible and adapt to every demand, it beautifully meets none of them. An enormous amount of overhead is required to guide all internal practises towards the same idea and implementation in order to operate at any scale. Although I'm not sure whether we could ever replace it, I am aware that it isn't the ideal choice.
author: Suvarna

review_detail:
title: A great intuitive product for Agile Project Management
pros: 1. Great interface and easy to use. 2. Rich user experience has been taken care. No specific form submission needed after each update. 3. Can integrate well with other product stack and diverse market place plug-ins available. 4. Rich reporting features
cons: 1. No proper feature for Test Management. Have to use market place products 2. Does not consider project/product discovery module. It's all about project execution. 3. Does not fit well for ITIL process like service definition or SLA measurement
author: Satyajit

review_detail:
title: One stop solution for Project Management
pros: The ease of use and updated UI makes it really easy for the users to navigate and setup tasks issues as per their need. Multiple projects can be created and managed simultaneously with effective task management and status management.
cons: Some of the basic features are missing like auto start sprint , effective time management tools etc. For majority of features we have to rely on marketplace.
author: Abhinav

review_detail:
title: The best option available, and a great value
pros: This software is so great, that you really don't need to train people on how to use it. Project managers will be familiar within a day, and users will understand it quickly because Atlassian put a lot of work into an intuitive user interface. This is the best option on the market if you want something that scales across your company without draining your energy. Not only will you run projects through here, but you can also setup all your standard business processes to run through here. Using the marketplace, there are some great extensions for Jira. We built our entire accounting team into Jira, and used it to know we were following through with our key daily, weekly, monthly processes. Using a scheduler plugin, we were able to create tasks, with subtasks, delegate them, follow up with progress, and print a custom summary report at month end outlining completion, completion date, user, and notes.
cons: You will likely want confluence or google sheets to keep overall big picture notes.
author: Aaron

review_detail:
title: The goto solution for project management solution
pros: Jira is highly flexible, extensible and easy to use. You can customize about almost all aspects of the system to fit your specific needs. It also integrates really well with other Atlassian software so you can have a much more complete experience.
cons: Jira came from a more technical oriented background, so it can have a bit of learning curve for users that do not have a technical background, although it is getting better with each new release.
author: Patrick

review_detail:
title: Atlassian's Jira is THE only option for Technical Program Management and Software Development
pros: Out of the box, Jira is very intuitive and very effective for any user. What I love the most is even after several years, hundreds of Software Developers, dozens of Atlassian University courses later... I AM STILL continuing to find more and more amazing ways to utilize this tool and not have to purchase other tools when Jira can nearly do it all!
cons: It being so very customizable, and having many folks using it, it's just the training period for onboarding new users. It's not awful and it's literally not Jira's fault, it's more of a people thing. Some folks just don't take the extra second to embrace the awesome powers of Jira.
author: Jessica

review_detail:
title: Jira is a Collaborative Powerhouse!
pros: Jira is an incredibly powerful collaboration suite with all the tools I could ever want. As a designer, it has completely revolutionized the way I work by organizing my workflow, allowing me to collaborate with my team in real time, and keep track of my assets and tasks. Their granular system for categorizing tasks has proven to be amazing for me and my team.
cons: I wish I could search by file name to quickly find assets for re-download or link a specific ticket to teammates who may need to reference a ticket where I know a specific asset is located. Otherwise, I have zero complaints about Jira. It is super powerful and has all the collaboration tools I could ever want.
author: Erik

review_detail:
title: Jira Atlassian software online is the best but could easily be so much better!
pros: I like how I can organize my team, so we're rowing in the right direction when it comes to software development. With Jira, it is easy to check the board for what the team is currently doing, what is not started yet, and what needs to be pushed across the finish line. It is honestly the best software out there for what it does. Backlog grooming is done well using this software as well. I like being able to customize swim lanes.
cons: If you want to do anything more than just customize how many swimlanes you have on your active jira board, it gets complex really quick with ticket statuses. I often times cannot do what I want to do without going into a million screens to figure it out. And even then, I end up not having enough permission to do what I want to customize what is displayed when you drag a ticket from one column to another, etc. Nightmare. Also, PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Jira, get with the program and follow standard linking convention. If I link to a web site that is NOT on the same domain, open it in a new tab or window. DO NOT open it in the same browser tab. This is just wrong. Local links (same domain) can open in the same tab, but foreign links should open in a new tab. Period. It drives me crazy when I click on a link in a comment and I get busy and then wonder where my backlog went! This happens way more than I'd like to admit. Also, one more simple game-changing request that the software currently doesn't do: When I'm backlog grooming, I'd like to group select a bulk set of tasks and figure out how much time estimate in aggregate they all are. Nowhere can I do this easily unless I literally make a fake sprint and shove them all in it. PLEASE add a summation at the bottom of the screen for when multiple tasks are highlighted, like how spreadsheets sum selected cells automatically! I should NOT have to go to great lengths just to see what several task estimates/story points sum to.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: Great tool for collaboration
pros: I liked managing tasks, easy creation of them and breaking down to multiple sub tickets to prioritize, schedule and assign to team members based on their expertise and visuality of the progress on those in a sprint timeline. Also there was Slack hooks which helped to get update in Slack easily, saved us from checking emails and the Jira web
cons: Dragging and dropping of tickets within sprint boards were sometimes confusing as the selection border did not cover all of the selected items. Sometimes it required to refresh the browser to see reflection of the update in one segment done in another related segment of the UI. Out of the box previews for uploaded MS doc files did not give correct preview of the files all the times.
author: FAZLE

review_detail:
title: The only tool Engineering, Product and Project Management teams need
pros: First of all, the tool is extremely lightweight from a deployment perspective and also from usability perspective as well. It allows for seamless saving of information as you type and that's a pretty good feature the user interface is very well laid out and is very easy to navigate through the tool across various screens. Teams across the organisation can view the status of the development items across different projects and across different boards, per developer. JIRA can also be used to track tasks and banwidth allocation for various teams as well. The extension of confluence is the best feature that you could extend to a JIRA instance for your developers
cons: The amount of integrations that JIRA comes out of the box with can overwhelm new users. It does have a slight steep learning curve, but once the user is comfortable using the system they should be able to navigate through the tool seriously
author: Chetan

review_detail:
title: Using Jira
pros: I like that Jira makes it easy to manage and see the tasks that are assigned to you through the dashboard, where it displays all of the tasks that you need to do, and through the sprint function where multiple projects can be put on one sprint. On this sprint page it's very easy to adjust what stage a task is in. Along with this the software makes it easy to log time to issues. In the bottom right hand corner there is a play button that you press when you start working on an issue and a stop when you are done. Once hitting the stop button it automatically fills out when you started working on an issue and how much time you spent on it.
cons: I feel as though the time sheet could be improved a little bit. Currently if you work on a very small amount of issues per time frame that you want the time sheet, it doesn't actually take up that much of the page. For me, I usually work on around 5-7 issues per week, and as such the issues really only take up a small portion of the page. I also feel that if you are assigned to a large amount of projects it can be cumbersome to go and find a specific project if you don't already know the link or haven't worked on it recently. Thankfully this doesn't end up being much of a problem that often, but when it does it is sort of annoying.
author: Edward

review_detail:
title: Review Jira
pros: Creates a lot of order in tasks, in this company he replaced a lot of the work that was previously done in emails and tools, creates order, organization and it is easier to keep track of tasks.
cons: the filters not really easy to be used , i am adding label with the name to track all my task .
author: Rotem

review_detail:
title: Jira - Worth It
pros: I think Jira is great that it allows us to build workflows for our support team, as well as for use as a project management system when planning out software development timelines and estimates. This tool has really reshaped the way we look at IT, and provides the metrics and analytic information to back us up.
cons: The learning curve is pretty steep with Jira, getting into some of its more advanced functionality like integrating with other software and initially setting things up takes some time. As well, the Confluence pages have great amounts of features, but the formatting is a little awkward on the web interface.
author: Tim

review_detail:
title: Jira improvisation
pros: Creating subtasks is quiet a task with jira and the notification does not always work well. However, it is very convenient to tag and mark tasks. It is more comfortable than our previous mode of handing tasks
cons: The stages to complete the task is quiet lengthy. The queue management can be made a little more flexible
author: Yashika

review_detail:
title: A substantial confederate to manage your business efficiently
pros: The customisable workflows and real-time updation of dashboards makes the journey through the project roadmap highly efficient. The significance given to minute details and updates from the step of project planning to it's management makes this process less cumbersome and regressive. The clarity in the reports and insights which inturn brings definiteness in the running, to do, reviewed tasks help in smooth functioning. The ease of editing and updating attributes, scheduling and keeping track of the project and it's ongoings indeed makes this a commendable software.
cons: The interface of the ongoing roadmap management template can be simplified.
author: Sahana

review_detail:
title: So many features that make it slow, complicated and annoying for the day to day
pros: I really like the level of detail and control you can have when it comes to team planning. When the cycles begin, when they close, the stages and hierarchies that can be built within the same project or task. I consider that for projects that require a great level of detail it is extremely precious and necessary to leave nothing to chance.
cons: Although I value all the level of detail that can be indicated for a task / project, when simpler tasks are required, follow-ups, daily operation, the little flexibility of the tool becomes totally annoying to ignore some unnecessary parameters. On the other hand, the responsibilities of the tasks always fall on a single member, which can generate an imbalance in the measurement of team performance, as one person is probably left with many more activities than others. What bothers me most from day to day is that on the activity board every time a card is moved to another column (example from "To Do" to "Doing") the board does not update automatically but it gives you an annoying signal It is not updated and until you refresh the page it will not allow you to move that card or any other, it will continue to show you "board not updated", this really makes the tool a little agile for larger teams and with precise and short follow-up meetings.
author: Andrea

review_detail:
title: One stop platform for agile software project management
pros: I like, it is a customizable tool. You can configure this as per your project requirement.I like the notifications when tasks are assigned or completed. This feature brings better transparency within the team.Our team can easily track the overall sprint status and it help us to plan better to meet our sprint goal.
cons: Only one, the price is the con but worth it. As this tool gives you so much flexibility to manage your day-to-day work.
author: Anjum

review_detail:
title: Head of Finance and Operations
pros: The structured and comprehensive setup in Jira is fantastic for development tracking. Its flexibility with workflows and integration options makes managing projects easier, and our development team relies on it daily. The platform's issue tracking capabilities and customizable dashboards help keep everyone organized and on the same page.
cons: While Jira is great for development, it isn't as intuitive or valuable for our operations tasks. The platform can feel overly complex for non-developers, and it's challenging to adapt it for non-development work, which is why we eventually moved away from it for operations.
author: Thanh

review_detail:
title: Jira - Great for Big companies
pros: It’s a very structured software. It allows you to thoroughly organize your processes and organize the teams responsible for them. As a ticketing system, one of the best.
cons: As I said in the pros, it’s a structured software. It can be as intricate and it can get difficult to use, it’s not friendly, nor intuitive. You might need a previous training for your team to learn to use it.
author: Aline

review_detail:
title: Great project manager
pros: Jira is a very reliable project management software for employees.
cons: Jira does not have errors or bugs of any kind.
author: Charlotte

review_detail:
title: An Overall Very Useful Tool To Connect the Company
pros: The ease it is to connect with different departments of the company to have them assist with any request or inquiry
cons: The only thing is that depending on your workspace, the tool might become cluttered with options to choose from and do stuff
author: Nicolas

review_detail:
title: Powerful Project Management Tool with room for improvement.
pros: Jira is super versatile. I love how it helps teams stay organized with features like Kanban and Scrum boards. The ability to customize workflows and integrate with other tools like Confluence makes it a game-changer for managing projects.
cons: It can be a bit overwhelming at first. The interface isn't the most user- friendly, and setting things up can take time. Also, the pricing can feel a bit steep for smaller teams.
author: Prashant

review_detail:
title: Review of Jira
pros: Integration Capabilities Advanced Reporting Scalability Community Support Friendly user clarity ira is an immensely powerful issue management tool Easy to set up a project
cons: slow working inappropriate case support incorrect setup, absence of memory space an excessive number of modules introduced absence of legitimate modules setup, obsolete instrument rendition
author: Tariq

review_detail:
title: Great Tool That Helps Get The Job Done
pros: It is a great tool that really empowers our Engineering team to make changes, manage tasks, and provide visibility of the status of a ticket for anyone that searches that ticket. There's a little learning curve to get familiar with the tool, but is easy to find things once you get used to it.
cons: As a Support lead, I use this tool in a different capacity from the Engineering team. I used it as a task or announcement management board for our team meetings. It replaced Trello for us, but it's such a powerful tool I actually found it hard to simplify boards and removes some of the little features we didn't need. Customizing the board was also a bit confusing and complex.
author: Rachel

review_detail:
title: Jira Ticket Request Review
pros: I like the queue-like ticket system, as it ensures that every request is accounted for and nothing gets lost. I also like that it can serve as a way to account for all work and responsibilities so that no task (no matter how big or small) would be forgotten about.
cons: Ironically, the part that I like most about Jira is also the part I dislike most about it. Sometimes, I find the ticketing system to be a hit or miss, especially the notification system. I find that I'm not always receiving email notifications to tickets I've created or have previously viewed - this has consequences (especially on tasks that are more time-sensitive)
author: Jag

review_detail:
title: Jira is your way to go with service desk
pros: We used Jira service desk and it’s easy for us to use the application, it’s in the cloud and we are using the free option
cons: The only thing is we’re coming from older software which has little feature where Jira has a lot so we need to adjust
author: Ali

review_detail:
title: Jira many in one
pros: The easiness of use and the gathering point of many tool of customer service
cons: Limitation of customization possibilities
author: Jérôme

review_detail:
title: Reliable and with a lot of features
pros: All the information always available. Easy to follow up on cases
cons: Sometimes it's not so intuitive. For some features you need a coursw
author: Giuseppe

review_detail:
title: Perfect tool for Agile development projects
pros: Best Agile methodology tool for manage our all Software development project
cons: Some times emails are getting late, after creating the story
author: Nagharjun

review_detail:
title: All things project management at one place
pros: One place for all things project management. What I like most is seem less integration with other Atlassian products. It helps maintain documents and information all at one place.
cons: Maybe better UI and night mode. Also automation tips whenever repetitive tasks can be automated.
author: Jaystha

review_detail:
title: One to rule them all
pros: Works great for both our development department as a traditional development management tool (creating bugs, features, epics and more) but also for our infrastructure department as a kanban board, work assigment tracking, idea registration and more.
cons: Nothing really. We still discover new things to use that help us improve.
author: Frank

review_detail:
title: Jason Jira Review
pros: Highly customizable, allows you to tailor boards, workflows, and fields to fit your processes.
cons: The interface can be complex and intimidating for new users sometimes.
author: Jason

review_detail:
title: Not the tool for the basic user
pros: Very customisable you can amend everything including workflow, dashboards etc. The reporting excellent makign it easy to find area is your projects that need inproving.
cons: As the number of projects grows the performance of Jira becomes much slower. Very hard for new users to adopt. Not the cheapest tool compared to other on the market
author: Daniel

review_detail:
title: The Best Project Management tool on the market
pros: Effective, easy to use, cheap and plenty of online resources
cons: It isn't user friendly to start off, and the subscription services with other Atlassian products wasn't clear.
author: Daniel

review_detail:
title: Super Helpful
pros: Jira is super helpful for tracking tasks and bugs. It also lets you customize workflows and has great reporting tools
cons: The price is also a bit high if you’re just looking for something simple
author: Federico

review_detail:
title: My preferred project management platform.
pros: Jira is highly customizable and my team has leveraged this extensively, to continuously tweak Jira to adjust to our workflow processes, no matter how complex. The above has improved project collaboration within my development team and led to increased visibility into key aspects of our internal software project management structure.
cons: Whenever we have an high backlog on Jira, there is the tendency of our Agile board crashing. When this happens, our collaboration flow is broken and it becomes challenging to prioritize key project tasks.
author: Lisa

review_detail:
title: Jira is an excellent tool for Agile beginners and experts.
pros: Jira is a flexible platform that really assists in managing Agile Projects. It has standard templated based on Agile best practices, but also has the ability to add custom fields, generate custom queries, and create custom reports.
cons: Jira is intuitive to use out of the box. However, when you want to do heavy customization it can be a little challenging to get the hang of, and its customization does have limitations.
author: Gary

review_detail:
title: Otttimo prodotto ma può miglorare
pros: La timeline, il kanban, la possibilità di creare diversi flussi in base all'area di interesse.
cons: La complessita nella parte amministrativa e la divisione da confluence, e la divisione tra jira work management e jira software, la difficoltà nella gestione e ricerca della conoscenza aziendale, il fatto che non ci sia una chat, difficoltà nel gestire i ticket tramite email
author: Roberto

review_detail:
title: Opinion de Jira
pros: Tiene muchas opciones para armar proyectos
cons: Se siente lento y no tiene la capacidad de customizar
author: Juan

review_detail:
title: Best in class
pros: Very versatile environment to manage and track projects, and specific stages/updates.
cons: Because of high functionality, it takes some time to learn all, but it’s not a big issue.
author: Meylis

review_detail:
title: JRA Review honest
pros: It has good connectivity with other apps or even if is not available a Zap can do the trick
cons: overcrowded can be more intuitive to use too much stuff on the screen or menus somewhat complicated
author: Diego

review_detail:
title: JIRA - IMPLEMENTING AGILE
pros: Jira is very easy to understand. Any newbie can learn And manage the JIra swiftly.
cons: Time logging feature is quite time consuming process.
author: Zeenat

review_detail:
title: Powerful tracking tool for projects
pros: Used Jira as the main tracking tool in a software engineering team working Scrum. For a normal user, it's a powerful tool that makes tracking work really easy while offering enough details to stakeholders. Big tasks can be divided to make them small enough in order for them to be easily understood and worked with, while also offering a big picture regarding work being done or not yet done. It has a lot of configuration meant to help the user set a customized workflow and offers support in adapting it, in the case it wasn't the right one. It can be integrated with other software development tools and applications and work together as a whole. It's a must-have tool for efficient working.
cons: Jira is the type of software that needs a lot of configurations when setting it up in order to make it personalized enough for the needs of the users. Some support may be needed in order to set it up the first time but from then on it's a clear path to success.
author: Alexandru

review_detail:
title: Get Agile with JIRA
pros: I am Automation QA Engineer. JIRA is useful everywhere starting from project requirement analysis to production release. We can create test condition in JIRA, create test cases in test set (suite) and track the execution and bug attached with cases. This all thing can be saved and useful for lifetime. Very impressive User Interface. We can do export of any ticket or issue and get a necessary details in simple excel workbench. We can write description or any details required for a ticket in CSV and import it to JIRA.
cons: Still it has very limited third party software integration, would be better to have more integrations to enhance tracking.
author: Ravi

review_detail:
title: I enjoy Jira software but there are few things that can be improved in my opinion.
pros: I like that I can really easily navigate between the projects because I am in multiple projects at once. I really like the possiblity to customize a lot of things, mostly the kanban board lanes and tickets details. I love linking feature, I find it really useful and I use it a lot. What is very important to me is also the Tempo application and I like how it's integrated in Jira, so I can really easily log my time into proper tickets. In our company we also use the Bitbucket and Confluence and I really enjoy that I can easily create feature branches, commits or pull requests from Jira itself. I also like the report tools to control my overall work.
cons: I have a lot of diffuculties with Tempo application search issues feature. Since I am participating in a lot of different projects it is really hard to search proper ticket, neither using ticket code nor ticket name is not functioning good enough. Sometimes I feel also overwhelmed with the amount of features which I don't use at all and I am getting lost in the user interface.
author: Marta

review_detail:
title: software di gestione dei progetti potente e versatile
pros: la sua interfaccia utente è intuitiva e personalizzabile: consente di creare facilmente board per la gestione dei task e tracciare lo stato dei progetti in tempo reale
cons: alcune delle funzionalità più avanzate richiedono un po' di tempo per essere imparate e configurate correttamente. Inoltre, alcune funzionalità aggiuntive richiedono l'acquisto di una licenza a pagamento.A volte ci sono problemi di performance quando si lavora con grandi quantità di dati o con molte utenze contemporaneamente
author: Nicola

review_detail:
title: Excellent organisation tool for inter-team and external tasks
pros: Jira is very well integrated with all other tools we use, such as Slack, Outlook, Confluence. Raising and keeping track of tickets is easy and intuitive. The integrations allow for updates and resolutions to be tracked without having to use the Jira interface all the time. Also, the possibility of team-specific waterfalling of tasks and requests ensures that Jira is not only suited for one team, but for the collaboration of the entire business.
cons: Jira is not very novice-friendly, requiring advanced training before having the ability to use it at its full potential. Making changes to existing workflows is also not the easiest as most of the time this will require and administrator intervention - the technical know-how is almost limited to experts only.
author: Dinu

review_detail:
title: A one in all project management tool
pros: I manage my entire sprint on Jira, and then use my sprint board to conduct my daily stand-ups. It makes it easy and efficient to create new tickets, manage features, track bugs and also see who is working on what. I can also manage my team's workload via jira by seeing who is working on how many story points that sprint.
cons: There are often downtimes with Jira. This might be because of my company's VPN. But when this happens, you might find yourself in a bottleneck.
author: Mona

review_detail:
title: Jira as daily basis tool to track your progress
pros: As manager Jira gives me an easy way to have the whole project tracking in a single place. I'm able to identify when our deliverables are at risk and based on that info I'm able to rectify and adjust based on the current status.
cons: By the time you want to create complex reports that needs to reflect dependencies between Jira objects: tasks, stories, features and so on, there is no an easy way to do it.
author: Rogelio

review_detail:
title: Great tool for Project management and tracking
pros: I like JIRA's functionalities and User interface. Its UI is very user-friendly. User will get required information in very short time of exploration, every page is so informative. Kanban boards are really useful to get the details regarding what features we released and how many releases we had and so on. Reports are very useful like past sprint tickets and burndown charts. Its very useful and a boss application in market as of now.
cons: I would like to suggest JIRA increase its attachments limit size, sometimes it's very difficult to attach documents of more than 2 MB in JIRA. We need to find other sources to upload and providing the link in Jira makes little more difficult for users. That's all please try to implement this feature, if it's feasible.
author: Murali Rao

review_detail:
title: JIRA is great once you configure it and get used to it
pros: How customizable it is and all the integrations it has. You can use JIRA to manager just about anything
cons: Wish it was easier to use and more intuitive. Once you get used to it it's fine but definitely not the best user experience or design so appears really overwhelming when you first start using it.
author: Sarah

review_detail:
title: Personal review for Jira Software
pros: I adore the format, checking history. Being able to channel the assignments. And we are ready to see each comment's points of interest just like the correct date. Moreover it is truly simple drag a report Being able to open the task in a modern tab is additionally so precious. Attaching cards to each other moreover makes things simpler.
cons: Some of the time due to the stack of errands we are taking care of it may allow us difficult time stacking a entirety page. When you attempt to look something within the look bar, it may evacuate some of the letters you're writing down may cause typo otherwise you have to be compose down the precise thing to find the right issue.
author: Ariel

review_detail:
title: Jira the project management with all team collaboration capabilities
pros: The most like feature of Jira is we can track all the project at one place. Even we filter it metrics like priority, issue, bug etc. Even it can easily integrate with third party tool and like life easier like slack, outlook, etc. We can track the team work and collaboration and also for induvial. We can easily puts our notes in the tickets.
cons: Sometime jira get hung and we have re-open it and it we have some third party tools we are not able to integrate with Jira. It has lot of features it get overwilling for me. If we try to upload big file to the ticket it didn't accept or the site get hung.
author: Khatibur

review_detail:
title: Lots of features but pretty mediocre at all of them
pros: There’s a lot you can do with Jira including creating custom views, JQL, and integrations with GitHub. I just wish it did a few things really well instead of a lot of things mediocrely. The interface is pretty annoying. I’ve wasted a lot of time trying to update a task only for it to glitch and then all my progress is gone.
cons: As I mentioned above the interface glitches a lot and is overly busy with the amount of fields you have to enter.
author: David

review_detail:
title: Jira Service Desk Review
pros: It is easy to set up a new Service Desk project and the query language for searching issues is easy to use with plenty of online help. I also like the scheduled reports that can be emailed on any desired schedule.
cons: Incident Management is not as ITIL centric as some other solutions. There are many available integrations and add-ins that we do not subscribe to and it would be nice if they were part of the base software.
author: Frank

review_detail:
title: Good tool to help track issues
pros: Good tool to help track issues, project status
cons: Nothing specific that I would like to highlight
author: Samantha

review_detail:
title: Very nice solution for agile teams
pros: Jira is a very complete software that provides support on every step of agile workflow. From issue tracking to sprint planning and from tasks management to tickets. I really appreciate that it is extremely intuitive and very complete: if you need something, there is probably a feature to do that on Jira!
cons: If you need a software versioning system, and if you use specific and advanced features of git, for example, you might find Jira a little less integrated with it than other platforms use to be. As an example, all platforms offering both repository management, automated pipelines and project management can look a little better integrated than a solution built with Jira and a git platform together.
author: Nicola

review_detail:
title: A standard tool across most of the software organizations
pros: Jira has high degree of adoptability across the software industry making it very easy for any resource joining the team and doesn't need any hands on from day 1 only. The software is feature packed. We use JIRA for product management, running our sprints, planning roadmap. All the epics, tasks, bugs are reported via JIRA only across the organisation. One can create different projects and a personalised task flow which makes it easier for the teams to work according to their process flow.
cons: While the JIRA tool is very handy and easy to user, there are few minor user experience issues. Like it the formatting tool bar doesn't stick on top and one has to scroll up every time to use formatting. Also, the tasks are not auto saved which with catastrophic sometimes if you internet goes off or you miss clicking on save button.
author: Ravi

review_detail:
title: Best for Project Managers
pros: Very comprehensive and easy to handle. User friendly and very useful for the internal communication.
cons: Little training is required for the initial set-up, rest no big cons.
author: Ritika

review_detail:
title: Great tool for organizing projects
pros: Jira makes you organize your team's projects with a lot of personalized features so everything is set up according to your team/company's needs
cons: It's a bit hard to understand how everything works at first and how to modify projects
author: Sagi

review_detail:
title: Jira - as used by a Marketing team
pros: As is the case with many SaaS companies, our technical teams leverage Jira to manage their workflows and projects - and as a marketer in a SaaS company, we have been asked to use Jira to manage our projects as well (to avoid investing in other tools). Initially I was skeptical, but we leveraged Kanban boards in Jira as a simple way to organize our work. Inputting projects and tasks were easy, the drag and drop functionality on boards worked well as a means to facilitate our standup meetings, and the team has enjoyed using the product.
cons: There are times that we are reminded this isn't a true marketing project management tool (e.g. when trying to leverage sub-tasks, create calendar views, etc) but it's probably 80% of a true project management solution.
author: Dan

review_detail:
title: Powerful and Intuitive
pros: There's a lot to like about Jira. This is a software package that very much understands exactly where it fits in the application development life-cycle. It supports integration with lots of different idea management tools like Aha! and Jama. It integrates well with email exchange systems such as Outlook so you can create issues through email. It integrates with source code repositories so you can associate check-ins to work. The user interface just makes sense. They've done so much to remove the noise that you see in many other software project development management tools. Managing users, permissions, project types (Kanban, Agile), creating epics, managing user stories, issues, bugs, metrics, burn downs etc. is just intuitive in this application.
cons: There's literally next to nothing to criticize about Jira. All the the features are easy to use and discover, its responsive and has no bugs.
author: Ryan

review_detail:
title: Jira User Review
pros: There are few things which are really good in Jira. 1. Ease of use. 2. Easy to consume API in automation. 3. Kanban board feature. 4.Easy to raise new tickets and subtasks.(bug tracking) 5. Tracking team work using Jira is easy and reliable
cons: Few drawbacks based on usage. 1. It is quite slow while uploading the files. 2. Pricing is high if any small companies use it.
author: VIKAS

review_detail:
title: Great tool for project management
pros: What I like the most is what I believe makes Jira different: the integration with Confluence. There are lots of solutions, and they can have even more Agile features than Jira, but there is none that integrates so well with a documentation wiki as Jira does. The couple Jira-Confluence wins all battles.
cons: I had an issue with subscribing to issues with email notifications and I had to ask a particular department of my company so they would contact them. I would have prefered to be able to do it on my own.
author: Javier

review_detail:
title: Jira for Ticket management
pros: I like that we can create different projects for each team, and still relate tickets together from each. Jira is very customizable. It is easy to track ticket progress and update tickets (tagging team members, relating tickets, etc).
cons: Our team does wish we could create ticket templates where users can click the template, fill it out, then submit it as a new ticket. This would save a lot of time and confusion. Especially if we could create templates that automatically have related ticket templates attached (ie an Epic ticket template for larger projects that require multiple teams)
author: Julia

review_detail:
title: Jira Reviews
pros: Easy to useEasy to distribute the taskEasy to create and manage sprinttask completion of members via chartschart management of product
cons: not have any cons.if I face any in future I will say through customer services
author: Mitul

review_detail:
title: Use in large teams
pros: It is a complete service, in which we can correctly track the projects, it is complete to see the phases and how the workflows are transitioned so that the work can be completed
cons: It could be better in its dashboards and charts to be able to track day-to-day
author: Pedro

review_detail:
title: Great for developer teams
pros: Easy set up and a lot of functionalities.
cons: Sometimes is really slow and takes a long time to perform basic tasks.
author: Gabriel

review_detail:
title: Soddisfatto
pros: il prodotto è stato facile da usare ed è stato semplice integrarlo nei processi industriali.
cons: in generale è semplice da usare, non ho riscontrato particolari difficoltà.
author: Cataldo

review_detail:
title: Jira for ticketing
pros: Jira tool i have used for ticketing purpose, its functions user friendly easy to use.
cons: i didnt find anything else , as i used less,
author: Chandrakant

review_detail:
title: An Exceptional Project Management Tool
pros: One of the things I love about Jira is its flexibility. It allows us to customize workflows, issue types, and fields to align with our specific project requirements. This level of customization ensures that Jira adapts to our unique processes rather than the other way around. Whether we are working on software development, marketing campaigns, or product launches, Jira provides us with the necessary flexibility to manage our projects efficiently.
cons: Complexity for New Users: Jira's extensive feature set and customization options can be overwhelming for new users. The learning curve can be steep, especially for those who are not familiar with agile methodologies or project management tools. It may take some time and training to fully grasp and utilize all of Jira's capabilities effectively.
author: Ara

review_detail:
title: Un outil puissant pour la gestion de taches
pros: Voici les 3 avantages clés de Jira :Gestion de projet agile, suivi des problèmes et des bugs, personnalisation
cons: Voici les 3 inconvénients de ce service :Son coût, sa complexité et sa courbe d'aprentissage.
author: Romain

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion des tâches
pros: Jira est un logiciel tres facile d'accès, personnalisable et disponible en plusieurs langues.
cons: Cependant on constate quelque bugues par moment, ce qui n'est pas cool.
author: Elysé

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool that offers robust features and flexibility for teams to plan, trac
pros: Allows teams to adapt and customize workflows, issue tracking, and collaboration features to suit their specific needs and processes.
cons: Its learning curve and complexity, which may require significant time and effort for users to become proficient in navigating and utilizing the tool effectively.
author: Heena

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion
pros: Le Jura est un très bon logiciel de gestion qui m'aide dans la gestion des projets de mon entreprise
cons: Ce logiciel a un prix très raisonnable que j'ai pas grand chose à dire
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: Effective tool to manage projects and track work
pros: The project's progress and any arising problems can be monitored via JIRA. The most useful feature is the ability to set limits on how far along a work can be tracked and then assign it to a certain individual. Here, we can keep tabs on how long each stage of a project takes, as well as any problems that arise along the way.
cons: For a first-time user to make sense of the system's many options, some training is in order. Getting more and more intoll kid tickets may be more trouble than it's worth.
author: Brandon

review_detail:
title: Jira is best tool I have ever used
pros: Creating tickets as per the customer issues. Once created all updates, progression of work, follow ups are clearly visible on the ticket. We can prioritize the ticket as per the customer needs is very helpfull. Easy to update the progression of ticket to customer that has created.
cons: Auto notification or reminder should be sent to concern team if there is no response after the given TAT.
author: Ajay

review_detail:
title: Jira improved our software development ad bug tracking productivity
pros: The web-based interface integrated well with our bug-tracking and software development databases. For new users it was particularly easy to use.
cons: At times it was difficult to export data as either .csv or .docx/.pdf files.
author: David

review_detail:
title: Uma ferramenta completa, mas pede reflexão
pros: Eu gosto muito da gama de opções que a ferramenta apresenta para que possamos gerenciar cada atividade dos nossos colaboradores, podendo identificar pontos de dificuldade, melhoria e até se existe um período considerável ou não de ociosidade do time, bem como a facilidade de integração e de anexar as documentações necessárias para cada task.
cons: Por ter um nível de complexidade altamente escalável, pode exigir um certo tempo diário ou semanal para a elaboração das sprints. Não gosto muito da maneira com que a interface apresenta o roadmap e da forma com que a ela gerencia a cadeia de micro-atividades para a finalização de uma task.
author: Giovanni

review_detail:
title: Jira - Empowering Project Management with Robust Functionality
pros: Comprehensive Project Management: Jira offers a wide range of features and functionalities that cover every aspect of project management. From task tracking to agile workflows, it provides a comprehensive solution for managing projects of any complexity.Customization and Flexibility: Jira allows extensive customization, enabling teams to tailor the platform to their specific needs. Custom workflows, issue types, and fields provide flexibility, ensuring Jira adapts to unique project requirements.
cons: Initial Learning Curve: Jira's extensive functionality and customization options can lead to a slightly steep learning curve for new users. It may take time for teams to fully grasp all the features and tailor them to their specific needs.User Interface Complexity: Although Jira offers flexibility, the user interface can appear overwhelming for some users, especially those new to project management tools. A simplified and more intuitive interface could improve the user experience.
author: Matt

review_detail:
title: Jira Reviews
pros: Tracking task, task management based on priority and status and we can easily find which user working on which task and how much task allocated to one person is it sufficient or not and so other cool things.. overall jira is one of the best tool
cons: Need to work on collaboration part link how people use this tool for collaboration between team
author: Deepika

review_detail:
title: Mon avis sur Jira
pros: C'est un bon logiciel qui permet aux grandes entreprises de bien se développer.
cons: Ce logiciel est compliqué pour les débutants et exige les expects pour pouvoir réussir les tâches dans une entreprise.
author: Kéface Israël

review_detail:
title: Valutazione tool Jira dopo tanti anni di uso
pros: Veramente molto intuitivo adatto non solo per gli specialisti del tool ma anche per chi non l'ha mai usato.Perfetto per tracciare tutte le informazioni condivise con il fornitore ideale per ci gestisce tanti progettiIdeale per la gestione dei progetti
cons: non ideale per la gestione dei requisiti
author: marco

review_detail:
title: JIRA is solid for software development
pros: I like how easy it is to start ticketing and managing a sprint. It can sometimes be hard to document everything you need done in one task with pictures and such, but it creates a good framework in general to work off of. Better for sprints than epics in my experience.
cons: Sometimes when many users across many parts of a project start interacting you get silos of data. It also requires constant attention to stay accurate and onboard new users.
author: Jake

review_detail:
title: Sistema Jir
pros: Facilidade para incluir as necessidades de regularização dos problemas apontandos.
cons: Não tenho nenhuma pontuação negativa ou que menos gostei.
author: Daniela

review_detail:
title: Must have tool for every project management
pros: One of its strengths is its flexibility and customization. Jira allows teams to create and track issues, assign tasks, set priorities, and monitor progress through various workflows and dashboards.Another advantage of Jira is its integration with other tools and platforms. Jira can integrate with tools like GitHub, Bitbucket, Confluence, and many others, which makes it easier for teams to manage their projects and collaborate seamlessly.
cons: One of the main criticisms of Jira is its complexity. Jira has many features and customization options, which can be overwhelming for new users. It can take some time to learn how to use Jira effectively and configure it to suit your team's needs.Another potential challenge with Jira is its pricing. While Jira offers a free version for small teams, its pricing can be relatively high for larger organizations or teams with more complex needs. Some users may find it difficult to justify the cost of Jira compared to other project management tools.
author: Muhammed

review_detail:
title: Information about Jira
pros: Jira very good software I searched it a lot and worked I found it best software
cons: It's great, it's great and if it can be improved, it will be great. I like this software very much
author: Yasar

review_detail:
title: Mature, best in class project & product management tool!
pros: Ease of use for teams to learn how to use the features, integrations with collaborations tools, and overall product/project management solution.
cons: I would like more flexibility with reporting before needing to create custom reports.
author: Harvey

review_detail:
title: Lifetime advocate
pros: Say what you will about Jira's shortcomings, but between the ease of use in the UI to the plethora of built-in features as well as the well-supported third-party options, there is very little that your business needs to organize and track that Jira isn't well suited for.
cons: Originally, I used a self-hosted form of Jira. With the forced move to using Jira Cloud, my only concern was with uptime and reliability. Though there have been some high-profile issues in the past year, my personal experience has been nothing less than exceptional. That said, you do still run the risk of extended downtime, so have a backup plan to keep things moving for a short period...just in case.
author: Thomas

review_detail:
title: Jira an essential tool for professional project management
pros: The bug tracking in the project, tasks and version control, and also the purely automated tracking system.
cons: From the beginning, it is difficult to master this tool for novices, even the integration is not so simple, it is difficult to find help in the Jira community, it is really a closed system that does not allow interoperability with other applications in the same sector.
author: Donatien

review_detail:
title: Allows teams to work together on tasks by planning and tracking their progress in real time.
pros: Using Jira, the team can plan and track their work, Jira is a powerful platform for managing tasks of different numbers and types for any type of product or project, as it offers the possibilities of collaboration as well as documentation of all databases and key documents related to all activities. The number of tickets that can be dealt with And because of the ability to integrate and customize it, which is very useful for organizing the affairs of tasks and team members, we can consider it a practical agile methodology that ensures the teamwork excels and achieves its goals. I love Jira's ability to filter missions, which increases our ability to see details of all missions, check the start and end dates as well as team member comments and attachments they've made. All this is done easily without much effort searching. I appreciate the reports that we get and the ease of customizing them to suit our needs, as they include the information that we want to display, especially related to a summary of the workflow during a certain period of time. I love the fact that Jira is easy to customize and integrates with many of the apps we use.
cons: It's not a bad thing for people who are looking for the right way to manage products and projects, even though Jira looks complicated and members need to put in some time and effort to learn how to use it well. This topic might not be right for everyone, which could hurt the quality of both the inputs and the results.
author: Angel

review_detail:
title: Jira : a Great Agile tool with lot of possibilities - plus integration of Add-On.
pros: Firstly, Jira has a lot of option, and with a good configuration, it can do a lot. Even if you are blocked - function not present - a lot of Add-on allow you complete the default functionality with a perfect integration.
cons: The cost of software can be a bit expensive for some compony, especially if you want to add add-ons for only part of the company (like Zephyr for Testers), the cost is often for "all Jira users".... So you can have some licence paid for no usage.
author: Christophe

review_detail:
title: Pretty Good Platform
pros: Jira has an intuitive interface making easy to use for users of all levels. Very easy to assign tasks ,create timelines and track. The Kanban board feature helps to visualize of tasks .Allow cross team collaboration making it effective when working on a project. Offer multiple connections with 3rd party apps.
cons: Jira is great but would recommend an improvements toward document loading and tracking.
author: Mahato

review_detail:
title: A reliable tool for ticketing or product oriented project
pros: Very efficient, I use a server version everyday at work, customisable, you can automatisé everything
cons: It's perfect until you want to do something without preset, using jql could be a bit intense sometimes, but with some forum help it work
author: David

review_detail:
title: The Best Task Tracking Software
pros: Jira is so easy to understand to use and it has a supportive customer service team. Jira's software is extremely good for issue tracking. Jira is also fine for product and project management.
cons: Jira is expensive to purchase for some people or some small organisations but i find it to be impactful to my needs.
author: Maryjane

review_detail:
title: Evaluation de JIRA
pros: Facilité d'intégration avec d'autres produits issus d'Atlassian comme Bitbucket Utilisation facile et simple pour la planification des projets ou des sprints et gérer les tâches avec la création des tickets Permet de mettre en place de manière très claire la méthode agile Une interface simple et pratique Pouvoir créer des tickets, faire des commits et les PR via l'interface
cons: Difficultés à avoir un support via le service client Pas très évident (pour une personne non développeur) de créer des filtres pour faire une personnalisation L'apprentissage prend du temps aussi pour se familiariser au logiciel car c'est un peu complexe
author: Theodore

review_detail:
title: The simplified way of projects and tasks alignment.
pros: It perfectly suits any kind of projects in both sizes and nature. Simplified version also very pocket friendly. Simple user interface that allows personal Access and self service portal.
cons: Jira is an extensive application that I have nothing shortcoming.
author: Abhi

review_detail:
title: Great for project management
pros: Simple to use, it is the industry standard and it works fantastic for tracking software development projects
cons: At scale it gets slow and buggy. I’ve used the free version, premium subscriptions and enterprise plans at multiple organizations. The only negative experiences I have had is when using it with over 200 users the system gets slow and while there are multiple people making edits in real time across projects, the system Can need to be refreshed very frequently so without automated refreshes, sometimes you will be editing a ticket while someone else is editing it and it can cause some hiccups
author: Joe

review_detail:
title: Excellent software team productivity tool
pros: It's easy to track the lifecycle of bugs and software issues for development teams. Any individual task is easily accountable to individual people and teams.
cons: I wasn't a fan of the latest updates to the user interface, I preferred the older view of kanban boards.
author: Norman

review_detail:
title: Jira is a tool for greater productivity in workplace.
pros: Jira utilized and supported kanban, Scrum within the agile methodologies it allows customizing of workflows, and processes assisting with real time cohesive team building to use collaboratively.
cons: Jira out of the box reporting functionality should have many other uses and additions.
author: Freda

review_detail:
title: A Powerful and Flexible Tool for Agile Project Management
pros: Integration with Confluence, Bitbucket, and GitHub Sprint boards and backlogs for agile teams
cons: Sprint boards and backlogs for agile teams and Detailed reporting and dashboards
author: Micheal

review_detail:
title: Jira, an already powerful project management tool you can power up even further.
pros: Incredibly complete and robust project management tool. Has basically everything, and gives you the ability to power things up even further by programming custom logics, both inside the tool and outside, by using its API.
cons: Figuring out which template works best, and what are their differences, can take a while.
author: Elias

review_detail:
title: Good enough for if you're already using Atlassian, but otherwise - no
pros: I was on an Enterprise plan via Atlassian, and didn't have the highest expectations for Jira - but I learned to love it. The UI isn't the greatest, but it's not bad for the price. Functionality-wise it's not far off from an Asana in terms of tagging and timelines. I like how they took from Confluence's UI to in the boards to help visualize tasks better.
cons: It's just not enjoyable to use, and your project management tool is something you need to enjoy using everyday. I think it's the UI. It feels cold. Everything is easy to use because it's natural UI, but it's not fun to use and my team agrees.
author: Leana

review_detail:
title: E2E With Jira
pros: Jira offers a lot of great features specially the end to end application life cycle management. Integration with test case management tools like ATM, Xray, Zephyr offer a great flexibility and options to manage test cases, execution and planning. I liked the Dashboard widget options and ease to create custom queries with Jira. The charts and trend give a lot of good insight into the project.
cons: I worked on many other tools similar to Jira but Jira is the best tool I liked. I don't find anything which I don't like about Jira. However, there were few times when I had to do some workaround to create the test execution reports but that's not a concern.
author: Nikhil

review_detail:
title: It easy to use and helpful
pros: I like the ability to assign tasks to multiple users and comments. It makes it easier to manage sprints,prioritize work and stay on top of deadlines,which improves overall productivity and collaboration.
cons: I have nothing to complain about the software.
author: Nicholas

review_detail:
title: Easy and effective way to manage work items
pros: Easy to configure and setup to manage work items for a team. Different views can be created to extract metrics and useful information.
cons: Backlog level' drag and drop features should be available to make prioritisation and planning easier.
author: Prachi

review_detail:
title: Track, collaborate, integrate CI/CD platforms in an agile environment using Jira
pros: I like the concept of agile sprint management which Jira is designed for. I like the way tasks are arranged on the Jira task board. It has a way of defining sprint points for each task which helps enables the team and stakeholders to identify the resource consumption and time taken to deliver the story. It also enables me to track the progress of my own tasks on an individual level and collaborate on a team level. It comes with integration with CI/CD tools like github as well
cons: The linking of tasks to current sprint can be more simpler. Also initial learning of this platform takes some time if you are from a non technical background. The UI has scope of improvement, can be more modular
author: Alfiya Ashfaque

review_detail:
title: Works as Expected
pros: The UI is clean and there is a lot of customization options with features like JQL, boards and projects. It's really easy to setup a project, a board, add people, and then customize the swimlanes however the team likes. This is for me a really important feature because even though we all follow agile, not everyone adopts the same principles and methodologies. Teams should be able to adapt the tool to their needs and that's a big step towards success. The reports are also ok, at least for a quick glance at the performance of a certain project (with burndown chart, velocity, etc.). I've also used the API for some automated actions, it works as expected for me.
cons: Bulk actions are quite hard to do. There are some easy actions (like moving a group of issues to a sprint) but if we try to do something more complex like closing a group of tasks as Done with a certain sub-status (ex. Cancelled, Won't Do, etc.) it's not easy for me at all. Finally, the pricing seems a bit high for smaller teams and starting companies.
author: Gonçalo

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: The way it can be personalized to work for you, the number of boards you can create and the features it offers. You can have it display in dark mode, you can create numerous reports, you can save filters and you can clone stories as needed.
cons: Filters are not always available and when using search, it provides a vast array of information that you have too continuously narrow down.
author: Raqel

review_detail:
title: Perfect tool for managing your IT needs
pros: I like most about Jira is its robust functionality for tracking tasks and managing projects, especially within Agile teams. The ability to create customizable workflows, track progress on Kanban or Scrum boards, and organize tasks with detailed labels, filters, and priorities makes it incredibly versatile.
cons: I like least about Jira is that it can be quite complex and overwhelming, especially for new users. The interface has a steep learning curve, and navigating between different boards, projects, and settings can feel cumbersome. Customization options are powerful but can lead to confusion if not configured carefully. Additionally, Jira can sometimes feel slow or laggy with larger projects, impacting overall productivity.
author: Volodymyr

review_detail:
title: THE BEST OF ALL TIMES PLATFORM FOR TASK MANAGEMENT
pros: It helps us manage our projects Easy to use It has an intuitive interface It is cost effective Its customer care services are one in a million It helps us track down tasks and bugs
cons: I sincerely has nothing against jira it serves the purpose
author: Dr.Enoch

review_detail:
title: Eyes on the prize
pros: Jira helps keep me on task and lets me stay connected with my collaborators. We all use it with the same purpose and we're able to accomplish are tasks for the larger project.
cons: There's a tremendous amount of specificity available. All the choices can be overwhelming if the admins are careless with the initial setup.
author: Winchell

review_detail:
title: Not Great, not terrible
pros: Jira? Yeah, it’s got its perks. It’s a tool that doesn’t just let you keep tabs on a job; it lets you really see it—track each issue, each lead, like it’s right in front of you. The workflows? They’re flexible, like good disguises. You can twist them to fit any shape. Agile boards help keep things under control—like a good stakeout, you get your sprints, your backlogs, keep everyone moving in the right direction. And then there's the integrations… fits with just about anything, like it was built to blend in. Reports and analytics? Those are the real truth-tellers. They don’t lie. They show you who’s keeping up, who’s falling behind. And the automations—well, those let you set things on autopilot. I like that. In my line of work, anything that does some of the heavy lifting for you… it’s a welcome tool. Yeah, Jira’s a good partner, long as you don’t forget who’s in control.
cons: Jira’s got its ups and downs. It’s a tool that tries to do a little bit of everything, but sometimes that means you’re dealing with too much noise and not enough signal. It can feel bloated, like it’s trying to be the hero of every job, when really, it just needs to get the basics right. Customizing anything? That can take you down a rabbit hole. You end up sifting through layers, settings buried under more settings, just to get it working how you need. Performance is another thing—it’ll drag its feet at the worst times. You want to get in, make a few updates, and get out, but it’s like you’re wading through molasses. And notifications? You’ll get hammered with them unless you shut most off, which kind of defeats the purpose. It’s powerful, sure. But it could use a little more finesse and a lot less complication.
author: Mik

review_detail:
title: A fundamental tool for ticket management.
pros: One of the most complete time tracking and ticket management tools. Provides the tools to build in-depth flows that fit your own workflow and adapt it to your own changes.
cons: It requires some pre-setup thinking and adjustment to properly match your workflow. It doesn't handle multiple assignees to tasks out of the box.
author: Giulio

review_detail:
title: Project and product management in one place
pros: Easy project management, allows collaboration, sprint management, issue tracking and reporting
cons: When moving one ticket to another project, we sometimes love some data that was available in custom fields, such as acceptance criteria. This can be found in history, but to re-add you need to reformat etc.
author: Renata

review_detail:
title: Clunky but widely used tool
pros: Widely adopted and great integrations with dev tools like GitHub. Feature sets are great and the learning curve is very easy
cons: The UI is a clunk. The intuitivity is lacking. The product can get horribly slow. Search is also terrible
author: Ketu

review_detail:
title: THE ULTIMATE TOOL FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT
pros: It is very easy to track my work tickets and to link up other epic tickets or other related jira to keep track of all events happening It provides planning and tracking tools so teams can run smoothly It provides comprehensive insights into projects progress and team performance
cons: Licensing is a bit costly but the services offered are of good quality
author: Bramwel

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: We have the flexibility to establish tailored workflows to each team's unique requirements for a specific project, aligning with various work styles. The platform offers seamless integration with a wide range of applications, from messaging tools such as Slack to customer relationship management (CRM) systems like Salesforce. Setting up the system is exceptionally quick, and making customizations is straightforward. The platform provides multiple boards and views to accommodate diverse team needs, along with a powerful reporting capability to address any KPIs relevant to a project team.
cons: Creating customized templates are bit complex. Otherwise everything is easy and helpful
author: Sankalp

review_detail:
title: Manages projects securely and confidentially
pros: Mostly adopted in industry, thus easy to manage.
cons: There is window of improvement in the UI and how multiple linked projects can be accessed.
author: VIJAY

review_detail:
title: Efficiency Unleashed
pros: I appreciate Jira's unparalleled ability to boost efficiency and collaboration in a team. The customizable agile boards and real time updates are really great for everyone to stay on the same page as well.
cons: As a constructive feedback, Jira's initial learning curve might be slightly steep for some, but the benefits definitely outweigh this minor consideration.
author: Emilija

review_detail:
title: Jira is a great product
pros: Functionality, the service works smoothly without any major bugs or issues, and you can always find help in their documentation or in any online community.
cons: The additional features like the Gantt Chart or other products are not always easy to use. Sometimes you are required to add apps from the store and pay for features that in my opinion should be supported for free. Configuration can be difficult for someone who doesn't have experience with Jira.

review_detail:

pros: Provides robust capabilities for tracking issues, bugs, and tasks across multiple projects.
cons: Jira can become overly complex and introduce significant overhead, particularly for smaller teams or projects with simpler requirements.

review_detail:
title: Can handle complex requirements relationships

review_detail:

We also use it as a knowledge base for product information. We also use Confluence for road mapping. It is also very good at keeping a history of changes, making it easy to collaborate or undo changes.
cons: Nothing that I can think of. It does what it's supposed to do.

review_detail:

pros: For Jira, we get to plan our project work and prioritize the more demanding tasks using boards which are easy to use. With these boards we are able to visualize our work and this makes it easy to follow and track how we have progressed. It offers smart reports which helps keep everyone on the know of our projects, their performance and how close or far we are from finishing them.

cons: I wish I could assign ONE ticket to MULTIPLE teams simultaneously so that they could all be working at the same time rather than having to go in a linear waterfall fashion to move things on, would be awesome if two or more groups could work simultaneously on a ticket.
