review_detail:
title: Used at 4 different companies - this is it.
pros: Jira is flexible and powerful. It's got all the tools you need to organize highly complex tasks and workflows, even in multi-team environments. I'd highly suggest it, but it may be overkill for things that are simpler than product development.
cons: There's a bit of a learning curve to set the software up to fit your actual workflow. It takes some degree of familiarity with the software and the framework you're using to get work done.
author: Sam

review_detail:
title: Jira falls short of expectations and is not simple to implement or use
pros: There are many customizable options and external apps that you can integrate with Jira. Expect to spend more resources on these options.
cons: Out of the box, Jira is more geared toward managing software development teams. Any other industry needs to seriously consider whether they want to invest the resources needed to customize Jira to their needs. Heavy customization will be required if you are not a software development shop.
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: Great Tool to keep track of Development
pros: Jira is highly customizable and there are many reporting features. Data may be organized easily, easy to create reports, dashboards, filters. It may be used for documentation of conversations and communications made by the teams. It allows integration with little efforts.
cons: Jira has limited scope for integration, it cannot perform specific filtering/ reporting. Without using addons, it is very difficult to plan and track project on a timeline. Jira is not easy and simple if someone had experience with competitor products.
author: Muhammad

review_detail:
title: JIRA Software Review
pros: This software makes it really easy to track progress in an agile development environment. We can easily divide Sprints into small achievable tasks and also generate reports on the progress of those Sprints. Also, the bug tracking use case is very user friendly as developers/QAs can change the status of a particular issue to reflect the actual work done.
cons: The performance of this software is its most prominent shortcoming. Using JIRA on a network with mediocre bandwidth is a challenging task because, the UI is not able to load all the tasks/issues on the screen instantly. Also editing a task/issue becomes a tedious task on lower bandwidths.
author: Jatin

review_detail:
title: Better than confluence, New users may find the UI a bit confusing.
pros: Tracking and searching for issues were easier. Assigning accountability and easy tracking of progress are some of the pros along with easy integration with 3rd party software like salesforce.
cons: The initial getting around for new users takes some time and there is not much available on how-tos.
author: Ankur

review_detail:
title: Best Agile Scrum Tool
pros: Sprint Ceremonies, Release Burndown chart, Backlog Management, Original vs actual estimation
cons: I liked each of its detailed features so nothing as such that falls under dislikes
author: Palash

review_detail:
title: Very useful tool but could use UI improvements
pros: We have used Jira for years to manage our development and support teams and have even found a way to include our sales staff into a weekly kanban. I appreciate how customizable the lanes can be based on the job and the ability to work cooperatively on any item of note.
cons: The setup and customization process is not easy nor self-evident. No one new to the Jira platform would ever say it's easy to figure out. It is a powerful tool but it is by no means self-evident in it's use.
author: Phillip

review_detail:
title: Best Agile Project Management Tool
pros: Project Management, Planning, scheduling, budgeting, ticket management, Agile
cons: set up customize as per requirements not easily populate

review_detail:

pros: It has a great breakdown of parent and child levels to help break up larger projects into more digestible tasks which become more achievable as a result
cons: It can be a bit fiddly at times and too complex with so many features - but that's down to a training and education thing
author: Karan

review_detail:
title: JIRA helps with IT issue tracking
pros: I like that you can see all communications with IT in your issue tracking area.
cons: What I like least is that items can easily be closed and you only have so long to reopen them before you have to submit a brand new JIRA ticket. Meaning you have to re-enter all the information again. This can be frustrating.
author: Sarah

review_detail:
title: The best project manager tool out there
pros: - All those 3-rd party integrations that are available. I combine this with Slack, IFTT, Trello and more - Well, the price definitely has to be part of the pros. Even in the free plan is too good for small projects.
cons: Usually, I am very critical and I am looking for something to criticize, but with this tool, I can't find even a small thing that is not valuable or is bad in any way at all.
author: Aleksandar

review_detail:
title: Great Product/Knowledge management Program
pros: I love the flexibility of setting up different spaces for yourself, your team members, and other departments. It's easy to organize your documents and the interface is extremely easy to use. When creating documents, they give you a lot of options to help best visualize the idea you are trying to communicate, normally with your team.
cons: I find it difficult sometimes finding specific documents that I may not reference on a daily basis.
author: Kathleen

review_detail:
title: JIRA does a lot more than people give it credit for
pros: Plenty of features that are available for free but with the cost for a business, the features go through the roof. You have the ability to create a workflow with so much customization that you can have your processes flow smoothly. Also, custom fields, custom layouts, custom issue types - everything is customizable that there is a lot of power in your hands.
cons: Administration can be a bit confusing. For example, there is a "People" tab but in order to actually edit and view users (or groups), you have to go into admin settings and go to Users. Admin settings is not the same website so you have to maneuver your way back to check if your issue is fixed. Also, some things in admin settings aren't clear that they were accessible via that section. Some things may be under Users and others may be under Issues, but it's never 100% clear except for the few they mention.
author: Prince

review_detail:
title: Jira - powerful but complex task management
pros: I like the whole Atlassian product suite which besides Jira includes BitBucket and Confluence. Separately these products lack in some areas like speed and support. Although when used in tandem they prove an irreplaceable source of company cooperation
cons: Jira is being dragged down by feature creep. My suggestion would be to introduce something along the lines of Jira Lite. Such a product could serve those who need something only a bit more elaborate than a Trello board
author: Mindaugas

review_detail:
title: Jira is one of the best solutions for IT project managment
pros: The management of work sprints, stories, tasks, sub-tasks and time tracking is handled really well. Collaborating and communicating with colleagues to solve complex tasks is really simple.
cons: For small teams and if you need project roles and advanced permissions it might cost a little too much considering 1 or 10 users cost the same.
author: Giuseppe

review_detail:
title: Bug tracking at it's finest
pros: - It is great for bug tracking, where you can have your own finite state machine for the different statuses of tickets- It is great for project management. It achieves so by sharing a team wide view on who is doing what- It great for both Agile & Kanban
cons: There can be better integration with Github and 3rd party CI/CD pipeline tools
author: Rishabh

review_detail:
title: One of the best software/Tool to track, visualization and management
pros: Issue tracking and easy to create dashboard.
cons: Sometimes it takes more time to create dashboard and slow. Compared to other software its expensive
author: Dipak

review_detail:
title: Jira: La mejor manera de administrar y optimizar proyectos en TI.
pros: La simplicidad de procesos y seguimientos, la presentacion ordenada de informes y la claridad con que la informacion puede ser expuesta.
cons: Quisiera poder crear una epica de bugs y asignarle todos los tickets de incidencia a lo largo de un sprint, para poder medir por ejemplo el esfuerzo total en la resolucion de incidentes o generar otras metricas de segimiento, por ejemplo, si la mayoria de incidentes son en frontend o backend, entre otros seguimientos.
author: JhonFredy

review_detail:
title: Intuitive Project Tracker
pros: I use Jira software to create and track web analytics tagging projects which need code updates from IT developers. I like the Jira board feature where I can categorize a specific tagging request by America vs. Canada. So, when I am working on a US tagging project, I go into the America online ordering board. And, when I am tracking a CA tagging project, I just go into the Canada online ordering board. I am also able to search a specific project I want to know status of (resolved or not, so I can test in SIT or UAT) using a specific keyword. I can post image attachments after submitting the new project, as well as, comments in response to follow-up questions from IT product analysts or developers or product owners. Overall, I am able to document updates to a project and test results for future reference. Finally, I like the fact that, Jira sends me an email update whenever there is a project update or follow-up queries from IT.
cons: Jira project tracking tool doesn't allow copy-pasting images from Gmail or from clipboard. So, every image which needs to be included in a Jira project, has to be first saved as a file in a folder and then uploaded as an attachment. This additional task of saving an image as a jpg file makes it a time consuming process. Business users who don't have agile or waterfall project management experience in IT, have a tough time adopting Jira. Since Jira isn't integrated with Google suite of tools. it demands additional effort to document and track web analytics projects which amounts to duplicate work.
author: Gaurav

review_detail:
title: Team Management Software
pros: The versatility of the system given the fact that it provides all team managers tools in one place makes it the best software to use for any kind of business setup.
cons: Its not easy for small businesses to easily adopt the software.
author: Gasuza

review_detail:
title: Technical Monitoring at Its Best
pros: I like the integration with almost every other tool at our disposal and it creates a flawless process for us.
cons: As project manager, I am also managing the overall finaces and JIRA is one of the most expensive tools at my disposal.
author: Sifa

review_detail:
title: JIRA tool best for project management and product development
pros: We are using Jira tools for many purposes such as bug tracking, product/project management, software development. Project tracking and management. It has various good features and it allows to track issues, but tasks and other work items. In my company, we were using Jira tool.for a long time and we could implement the project before the deadline.
cons: I have few concerns about the tools such as not the best mobile app, limited size uploads, few UI are confusing and complex integration. I believe, Jira team is working on these bugs so we will good to use Jira at all the times.
author: Karthikeyan

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management Tool
pros: I love the issue tracking in this tool its very easy, Team collaboration has improved very much after using this tool and we can integrate with so many tools like slack, confluence E.T.C, Working in Agile flow is very easy and there are so many build-in features to support this.
cons: Its little complicated while integrating the stuff related to coding, I used TFS also some ways' it feels nice, If you are working in a large project its feel like little complicated to understand, And I feel like its little over priced.
author: Sai Nikhil Chakravarthy

review_detail:
title: Jira is very big package comes with too many features - just overwhelmed
pros: Got too many features, specifically the user permission management got many options Very popular among developer community and people even use "create jira" instead of create issue. feature wise got everything including its agile scrum board
cons: Jira is extremely fragile when it comes to its integration with its other sibbling products such as bamboo, bitbucket, confluence etc - more frequently when the server crashes i had to do lot of troubleshooting to fix the integeration back up and running, i would say jira is too fragmented and wants to market as more than one product for its own good than customers ease of use bitbucket cloud has all the features from issue tracking to permissions etc all in one package but when it comes to jira server its simply fragmented and complicated to manage Jira is good at capturing details but fails miserably when it comes to reporting - too complicated to visualize the project progress
author: Karthik

review_detail:
title: Everyday tool for better project management!
pros: I would say that this is the best tool and we used extensively for all our development needs, tracking, coordinating and prioritizing task. We are able to document all related items and prioritize items based on the urgency.
cons: I don't see any negative about this, will be difficult for anyone to convince me to switch as I have been using this for past couple of years and never had any difficulty or limitation as it meet all our needs.
author: Shahid

review_detail:
title: Jira for your development needs
pros: I liked Jira's ease of use in regards to testing. I am able to navigate easily throughout jira in order to look at project progress, testing progress, as well as user stories for ongoing project. It is probably the best project tracking software on the market. For Agile development it's probably the best software money can buy, so teams can easily track the project progress, and is accessible by all team members. I also use this for bug tracking, and test case creation and execution, and I find that I am able to link all aspects of my testing progress to all associted user stories, test cases, and bugs.
cons: If you are coming off of another software, it might take a bit of time to wrap your head around off of the functions, and reports that are available in Jira. Jira is feature rich, and does take some time to get use to, and use it to it's full abilities, just like any other softwared.
author: Scott

review_detail:
title: Once The Best, But Now Falling Behind the Competition
pros: One of the most popular tools, many people are familiar with it. There are a ton of integrations. There is a decent API. Very good search functionality, JQL especially. Good customization options, although a bit confusing at first.
cons: Recent years have brought no new good features. Last 3 UI/UX redesigns have been alwful and have reduced the productivity of the tool. Lacking in dashboards and reports.
author: Petar

review_detail:
title: Great tool to manage your tasks
pros: Systematic tasks management via workflow
cons: Deleting task once created is not easy or user friendly
author: Dipti

review_detail:
title: One of the best tool for Agile project management
pros: Jira is extremely easy to learn and use 1)Supports all agile methodologies 2)Backlogs management 3)Issue Tracking 4)Roadmaps 5)Reports 6)Stories
cons: One way life cycle User Interface needs improvement
author: Aswathy

review_detail:
title: It is great tool for tracking product building
pros: It is really a simple tool to use for product tracking. It has almost everything- Epics, Stories, Tasks, Kanban, Scrum board. Also, we can tracking the whole product building lifecycle and can collaborate with the teams easily
cons: The thing I like the least about it is the fact that the UI of it in mobile browser is not so great. There can be improvement.
author: S Nitesh

review_detail:
title: Jira Easy tool for project tracking and Management
pros: Filtering of issues/tasks based on projects /owners is a very good feature.
cons: Nothing in particular all features are easy to use.
author: Chaya

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management software that I had woked with, very extensible and easy to use.
pros: The User Interface is really clear, has a Dashboard that can be customizable to adapt at your own needs, reports and results are easy to look and understand. Agile teams can take a lot of advantage of this tool, workflows can be created to match the actual process of the team. Each tickets are created with an identifier (customizable prefix) and it's capable to store other data related like: title, attachements, images, gif (this will be played), points, espected time, time spent, links to other tickets, etc. Besides, has a marketplace where you can find a lot of helpful plugins and has a wide suite of other sofware to combine according to each needs: Confluence (Documentation) Stash (Git Repository) Bamboo (Continous Integration System) Saves a lot of time and post-it's .
cons: For some startuppers could not be suitable due to its cost, this is an product that gives advanced features for project management.
author: Tony

review_detail:
title: Jira is need of companies
pros: Well Jira is always about tickets and assignment to people for me. Its easy for me to break down tasks and then assign to people and get it done on time bases. Also to see the situation of projects
cons: Its a little complex UI but I will say Jira have a lot of features in it so being heavy or complicated is natural.
author: Muhammad

review_detail:
title: Good experience with the Team/Project Management
pros: Jira is highly customizable. In my project I have used different versions of Jira and it's highly customizable and user friendly. You can set up your own project team members/ group/ project/ Type of project as kanban/scrum and it's ready to use. You can track your team member's progress as well as yours and Organize project tasks. Jira as a product of Atlassian has very good customer support and service desk is very helpful. All kinds of IT professional use Jira as per their own requirements and that's very recommendable about the software.
cons: For the administrator's it takes about 30 minutes to set up a project which is a very lengthy and manual job. It's quite complicated for the beginners. Also it's very expensive as the license comes with the user basis. Hence if you are on a budget then need to track if the users are really using it and active on the platform or need to take action against it.
author: Priyadarsani

review_detail:
title: best tool I found so far
pros: Has enough features. intuitive enough to use. Good support for keyboard shortcuts, high level of customization, such as quick filters, additional columns. lots of integrations(bitbucket). I need something that works fast, where I dont have to spend too much time updating what I need. Jira is good for this.
cons: Nested tasks could be more convenient to work with, particularly when wanting to quickly create a nested tasks. perhaps there is w ay and I have not found it.
author: Asaf

review_detail:
title: Jira is essential for any IT company
pros: Jira is wonderful in many aspects and it is designed to be user-friendly, with a simple and intuitive interface that makes it easy for users to get up and running quickly. It is a powerful and flexible tool that can be used to support a wide range of software development projects and processes.
cons: Jira tends to be a bit slow sometimes and I think it may not be suitable for very large organizations or projects with a large number of users. In these cases, it may require additional resources to manage and maintain and that means more costs.
author: Nelson

review_detail:
title: A good agile product management tool
pros: Its UI is very user-friendly. We can tag tickets so that we could get the importance of the ticket just by looking at it. We can control user permissions to move tickets, and easily get history on which user did what.
cons: I sometimes have difficulty writing the description of the ticket, sometimes creating a table in the description is a headache. Understanding sprint reports is also difficult.
author: Rajshekhar

review_detail:
title: Jira of software development
pros: The software is easy to use and can be easily integrated with other software development applications like helpdesk, source code tracking, and advanced reporting.
cons: Some of the add-ons available in the market are not very compatible or not easy to setup a safe access as Jira
author: Firas

review_detail:
title: best software to manage all kind of process in the project
pros: it provides templates that helps us in the development of customized workflow
cons: cost of the software is very huge for smaller projects
author: Abhuday

review_detail:
title: Best in segment Project Management tool.
pros: JIRA is great, and is very flexible, the user interface is clean and beautiful. Also everything needed is right where it needs to be. It is also easily customizable. The Kanban feature is very effective to quickly and easily create and categorize tasks. Mobile application by them is very informative, decisions and updates can be made easily from the application.
cons: The product is great but their are few bugs or glitches, like you can't move a task card back to the to-do once you have moved it to in-progress. Also statistical analysis of the bandwidth allocation in the team is not entirely visible. The worst is the one when you have to mark every state of the ticket as closed to close the ticket entirely, their should be a single button feature to mark ticket as close.
author: Chetan

review_detail:
title: Jira - Best tool for Corporate Product Management
pros: JIRA has many cool features. The best thing I like about JIRA is the dashboards that they provide. Being from the Product team at ZS, my team uses a variety of JIRA dashboards including a burndown chart (to monitor if the tasks are progressing smoothly, or whether they are abruptly marked complete at the end of the sprint), and a team progress report, where the number of tasks assigned and completed by each team member is clearly visible. Overall, dashboards help provide a big picture of the sprint status and help monitor sprints effectively.
cons: The tool is great, but it has certain limitations. The dashboards in JIRA, cannot be downloaded as JPG images when trying to present these to the Leadership team in the form of PPT reports. Many a time, the Snipping tool needs to be used to cut the images from the screen and paste these into the reports which present us with two issues: 1. Low-resolution images which appear blurry when enlarged, and 2. Hassle for opening additional tools to extra the images. It would be helpful if JIRA provides the capability to download the images as JPG, PNG files (or an even better option would be to download the dashboard as a PPT file)
author: Nachiket

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: Jira offre numerosi vantaggi, tra cui la gestione completa delle attività, il monitoraggio dei progressi, la possibilità di personalizzare le visualizzazioni, la funzionalità di notifiche e l'integrazione con altre applicazioni. Inoltre, la funzionalità di monitoraggio dei KPI e la possibilità di creare report dettagliati consentono di valutare le prestazioni del team e di identificare eventuali aree di miglioramento.Personalmente, mi è piaciuto molto l'interfaccia utente intuitiva e la vasta gamma di strumenti di visualizzazione disponibili. Inoltre, la possibilità di personalizzare le notifiche e di gestire le dipendenze tra le attività ha reso la gestione del progetto molto più semplice e organizzata.
cons: Come modello di linguaggio, non ho una preferenza personale e non posso fornire una recensione oggettiva basata sulle mie esperienze personali. Tuttavia, ho notato che alcuni utenti potrebbero lamentarsi della complessità dell'interfaccia utente di Jira e della curva di apprendimento relativamente ripida per gli utenti meno esperti. Inoltre, alcune funzionalità avanzate, come l'integrazione con altre applicazioni o la configurazione dei connettori di dati, potrebbero risultare difficoltose per alcuni utenti. In generale, Jira è uno strumento molto completo e potente, ma potrebbe richiedere un certo impegno iniziale per la sua configurazione e l'apprendimento delle funzionalità più avanzate
author: Gaetano

review_detail:
title: Jira revolutionises cross-team collaboration and project management
pros: The kanban boards and project roadmap tools allow for a simple and strategic view of operational workloads, development projects, bug management and many more. This tool will change how your business teams can operate and how their work can be best appreciated in terms of time taken, effort produced and content provided
cons: The only gripe that I have is not to do with Jira itself, but with the integration with Clocify. A very minor issue whereby if you stop your timer on Clockify itself when it had been started from a task in Jira, it will not update the value for 'Time Taken' on that issue / bug / task.
author: Terry

review_detail:
title: JIRA usage for Agile projects
pros: - Manage multiple projects under one project in JIRA and works well for a complete program - Email notification when any changes made in JIRA makes collaboration efficient - JIRA board (Scrum Board) in JIRA and defining specific project JQL to filter the issues in JIRA makes it more user friendly for scrum masters who are managing multiple scrum teams in a program - Automated dashboard creation and ability to create different charts makes it very easy for showing management rpeorting on different scrum teams progress in a sprint - Sprint and version reports (out of the box) which provides burn down charts and which issues are lying in one state for more than a specific period of time helps scrum team to move forward and resolves impending issues - Ability to link issues for dependency and flexibility to define SDLC life cycle for an issue on a board makes it very handy on any type of project
cons: - No single view is available to see clearly how dependencies are moving forward - There are times when single issue has to be given to multiple people like in pair programming one way is to create sub task but that is not an approach that was liked by scrum teams - There macros / gadgets that comes with the JIRA product are very minimum they should add more gadgest for reporting purpose. - Yes, there are different third party gadgets but sometimes those are not JIRA / atlassian recognized and for enterprise application and corporates using JIRA does not go ahead to deploy those third part gadgets on the server model.
author: Abhishek

review_detail:
title: A must have tool for an organisation to manage the projects
pros: I have been using JIRA for more than four years and the best thing about this tool is that every IT organisation that I worked with during this time uses JIRA for nearly the same purposes. In this sense, it feels like a defacto tool for managing IT projects. This way, the users feel productive from day one and the organisations do not have to spend money on training (except for freshers). There are many good features such as - Ability to classify tickets based on a wide range of identifiers (tags/labels, sprint, phases, severity etc.) - Criteria-based (e.g. blocked by, requires, is required by etc.) - Linking to other tickets - Dashboard - Kanban board - Rich UI - Availability of a wide range of templates, reports etc. - Sprint velocity tracking - Powerful search feature These are some of the most commonly used features but the ever-growing list of cool features is huge. Although I am not an administrator of this tool, whenever I request some feature, most of the time administrators make them available in minutes simply by some configurations.
cons: 1. It requires training for new users. It took me more than a week to be able to work effectively with this tool. 2. Keyboard shortcuts are limited. 3. Sometimes I faced issues with copy-paste text in sections e.g. when I try to paste text in a section, the text gets pasted out of the section. Although it is a minor problem, it becomes frustrating when I am in a hurry.
author: Arvind Kumar

review_detail:
title: JIRA Review
pros: Project planning, tracking teams and team members along with the tasks makes the planning much easier and more fruitful. Definitely recommended for project management even for non-IT projects.
cons: Individual settings per user so that the user can choose to be notified or not for the updates on the tasks instead of providing rights to the administrator.
author: Brinda

review_detail:
title: A staple in the industry that set the standards
pros: JIRA continues to be a staple in the software development industry, where it plays a critical role in the daily management of software projects. It features an easy to use interface that is well designed and responsive and offers lots of options for configurability and reporting.
cons: JIRA can feel slow as more and more data is added. This can make it less appealing the longer a company or organization uses it and their data use starts to go up.
author: Mustaqeem

review_detail:
title: Jira is good enough, but definitely needs more improvements
pros: Well, the basics. Assignments, delegations and being able to reply to the assigner and to the client him/herself.
cons: I'm a UX/UI Designer. So, the workflow is convoluted. The interface needs proper blockings because there are so much thing happening on the main page. Take a look at Monday.com for comparison.
author: Roldan

review_detail:
title: Jira - Perfect for QA
pros: Very usable for QA, to enter tickets for developpers, assign work, create epics and manage general issues within a project. I love the advanced search feature particularly.
cons: Calendars can be a bit difficult to use. It's possible to setup dates and deadlines for items, but not that easy to have a visual calendar of events/tickets.
author: MarcAndre

review_detail:
title: Clean platform with useful sidebar
pros: I appreciate that Jira tickets have a sidebar that houses critical information, including project labels and areas to submit briefs and live urls. The Kanban boards are the most useful feature so I can visibly see where everything is in the pipeline. It keeps my tasks organized and everything looks clean.
cons: There are some bugs that I’ve experienced. For example, once I reassign the ticket to another person and change the status, I click outside the pop-up to return to the Kanban board. Sometimes the system keeps me caught in a loop and will keep showing me the ticket that I’ve already sent off. I can’t navigate away from the ticket. Instead I need to close the browser and relaunch Jira.
author: Kimberly

review_detail:
title: One of the best Project Management Tool
pros: Well ! there are many Pros, but I would like to point out 3 common out of them: 1. Data Visualization in form of graphs and charts 2. Wide range of customizable options 3. Easy integration with different applications
cons: Well, I can't mention it as a "Cons" but definitely a point where some work will be appreciated. It has very plain and simple UI/UX which seems like we are using old and legacy application. Jira should work on improving its User Interface and User Experience.
author: Nitish

review_detail:
title: Must have for agile projects
pros: Easy to use, can be integrated with multiple standard tools in the industry, efficient for project and task tracking.
cons: Tracking the % progress at the individual task level. It's a nice to have feature though.
author: Srikanth

review_detail:
title: Task progress flow and management
pros: I liked that anyone working on the task can update the team on their progress on this platform and everyone is always updated on the progress of the project. It has offers a lot options as it has many features on it which allows multiple customizations depending on the individual or organization needs.
cons: It was a bit complex to use in the beginning but once I got used to the platform it became like second nature to me.
author: Gerald Kagiso

review_detail:
title: Jira: best software for Scrum and Agile Management
pros: I like the most the integrations available (Bitbucket, Slack, etc) and how customizable the software is. You can define which detail to include in any new created task, project, etc.
cons: I liked least the format used for uploading files. With this purpose Jira works together with conduent in a "Pages" format but I would prefer a File Management System based on folders.
author: Angelo

review_detail:
title: Need to Know About Jira Atlassian
pros: Jira is the best venture the board programming for spry groups and programming engineers. This light-footed arrangement makes it simple for colleagues and task chiefs to change all through the total undertaking life cycle. Jira has apparatuses like scrum and Kanban sheets that are great for getting sorted out errands and overseeing agile groups. Jira is worked for agile and Scrum project the executives. The product accompanies scrum loads up and Kanban loads up so groups can picture work processes and see the improvement of undertakings continuously. It's simple for administrators to comprehend which undertakings are progressing nicely and which ones are deferred. Jira upholds deft runs and various undertaking sees, similar to client stories and story focuses.
cons: Loads of undertaking the executives programming accompanies a Gantt outline or course of events view. Jira doesn't. Timetables are valuable for seeing which assignments and subtasks are associated with each other. With a timetable view, project directors can change plans assuming an issue emerges in one errand that will affect others. To get this kind of usefulness, you'd need to get a different Gantt outline application and associate it to Jira through the Atlassian commercial center.
author: Triyanshi

review_detail:
title: Great task and project management platform
pros: For us the best features are task and project management, IT service desk - awesome, especially with its portal to task creating.Searching and filtering possibilities help to track issues and bugs easily.Agile and Kanban boards - are amazing!
cons: Jira query language is little bit odd and searching mechanism is not user friendly.
author: Konstantin

review_detail:
title: The user interface of JIRA is often praised for its user-friendliness and intuitiveness, rightfully
pros: The user interface of JIRA is often praised for its user-friendliness and intuitiveness, making it easy for both technical and non-technical users to navigate and utilize its features effectively. Furthermore, JIRA offers extensive customization options, allowing users to tailor the tool to their specific needs and preferences.
cons: Setting up the workflow and advance reporting features is complex. However, it is worth the time. If documentation and tutorials get better, it would be great. The application provides advanced reporting and analytics capabilities, empowering teams to gain insights into their project metrics, track performance, and make data-driven decisions. JIRA also facilitates seamless collaboration among team members, with features like comment threads, activity streams, and notifications, ensuring everyone stays informed and engaged.
author: Christopher

review_detail:
title: Flexible, powerful, simple to use and grows as you go
pros: Jira is clean and it is simple yet powerful. You can use it for your basic ticket workflows from the get go and expand as you grow or the tasks you wisch to cover branch out. It is easy to customize the ticket views to contain the information you want to use and avoid cluttering. The Workflow editor is one of the most powerful I came across in all my professional career. It might not seem so much of an importance but believe me, when your business grows unexpected necessities will arise and you will suddenly be required to track tasks you never though about. Jira will have you covered and allow you to add different task types which traverse task-type specific phases and have corresponding stati. Also you have all the world of notification and responsibility tracking ping-pong covered as you go. Two further things are woth mentioning: First the Atlassian World (the Wiki Confluence and build system Bamboo and many other products) integrate flawlessly and it actually really makes using them fun. Jira is one of the tools, that make you smile when you are required to use it no matter the task to track, its jus smooth, convenient and above and beyond provides a rich ecosystem for free and commercial plugins even for rather exotic use cases. Also, the license Model behind it scales fantastically. When we introduced it we were a small company with 8 people (we are now going strong towards the 200) and it was critical to keep cost for our tools reasonable. Jira got us covered.
cons: When we scaled, the License was not as flexible in higher user tiers as it was in the lower ones. Also once upon a time an update went wrong and we had to invest a bucketload of time and brain power to get everything back up to speed. We did run jira on premise and hat some custom plugins so there might be some of the tripwires: In case you use plugins they must be available in the version you wish to upgrade to and this might require some research prior to updates. Also, you can make a science out of the workflow and notification configuration. In case it is not documented well when you do it it might get you into trouble.
author: Janosch

review_detail:
title: Boost Your Team's Productivity with Jira.
pros: Jira Software is a powerful project management tool that offers numerous benefits to teams and organizations. One of its key strengths is its flexibility and customization options. With Jira Software, users can create custom workflows, issue types, and fields, allowing them to tailor the tool to their specific needs and processes. This can lead to increased efficiency and productivity, as well as better project outcomes.Another major advantage of Jira Software is its robust reporting and analytics capabilities. The tool provides a wide range of built-in reports and dashboards, which can be customized to display the data and metrics that are most relevant to the team or project. This can help teams identify areas for improvement, track progress towards goals, and make data-driven decisions.Jira Software also supports Agile methodologies, making it an ideal tool for software development teams that follow Agile practices such as Scrum or Kanban. The tool includes features such as backlog management, sprint planning, and burndown charts, which can help Agile teams stay organized and focused on delivering value to customers.
cons: it can be complex and difficult to use, particularly for teams that are not already familiar with Agile methodologies or project management best practices. This can lead to a steep learning curve and require significant investment in training and support.
author: Noureen

review_detail:
title: A macho application in managing project workflows.
pros: You can easily manage hectic and big project workflows.You can stay on track even when the roadmap changes.Has effective roadmaps that help to put up the big picture ,communicate plans with team members and ensure that teams stay on the same page.
cons: No dislikes.You can easily automate processes on one single platform.It is highly customizable.A great tool in scrum and development cycles management.
author: Dennis

review_detail:
title: JIRA Ticketing
pros: We are able to categorize tickets by type of request / responsible team which makes organization and assigning tickets so much simpler. I like that tickets remain available for years after being completed as well, as it's very helpful for historical knowledge.
cons: Sometimes we receive automated emails with every single update from the ticket, and often they are not ones that are necessary.
author: Amy

review_detail:
title: State-of-the-art issue tracker
pros: Great software for tracking issues / items / tickets. Highly configurable. Really state-of-the-art!
cons: As JIRA provides many configuration options, it's hard sometimes to find the right configuration option and to properly configure a project.
author: Stefan

review_detail:
title: Don't bother
pros: Quite frankly, there's not a lot to like about Jira! Under the right circumstances, used correctly, it might make task management less worse than if not using any software at all...
cons: It doesn't seem to make much sense. People don't know how to use it. It's not user-friendly at all, so everyone ends up frustrated from the managers setting up the tasks to the team members collaborating on them. It just doesn't seem intuitive. It's also slow and glitchy as anything. It takes forever to load, comments disappear, and so on...
author: Lois

review_detail:
title: The standard for running agile software projects with room to improve filters and queries
pros: The goto standard for running software projects including agile ones; powerful and flexible ways to customize boards, projects, issues types, rules, etc. etc.
cons: Filters & queries can be difficult to create and resulting JQL queries can be inefficient.
author: Tony

review_detail:
title: JIRA review for DevOps Teams
pros: Extremely easy to navigate through and has the most efficient hierarchy where we can add epics, stories and tasks. Also extremely easy to track status and follow up on the tasks. Used widely across my organisation for assigning engineering tasks.
cons: I always liked Jira and prefer using it for project management but I think sometimes other options are looked into because of the license cost or JIRA. If it is made a little cheaper I would like it even better.
author: Sai Sharan Reddy

review_detail:
title: Ótima ferramenta de acompanhamento de projeto
pros: Ótimo para gerenciar os projetos e acompanhar a evolução da demanda junto com a equipe.
cons: Sem contras sobre a ferramenta Jira, por enquanto.
author: Marcos

review_detail:
title: Es mi software de gestión de proyectos favorito
pros: Es muy fácil de utilizar y de implementar en un proyecto en el que trabajen varios equipos de desarrollo, ya que permite llevar el seguimiento de varios tableros a la vez, permitiendo así un tablero para front end otro para back end, un backlog de incidencias... Su interfaz es sencilla e intuitiva.
cons: Al principio es posible que los más novatos se vean desbordados por tantas funcionalidades que ofrece y se pueden perder fácilmente por el software pero una vez le pillas el truco es muy sencillo crear una tarea, dividirla en subtareas, cambiar los estados...
author: Jose Antonio

review_detail:
title: Jira helpful tool to track and manage your projects.
pros: Jira is a great tool that helps you to track and manage different projects within your organization. I am also fond of the time tracking and project management features that offer a wide range of possibilities for the beginners and savvy users.
cons: Setting up your first project and workflow may be a little difficult at the beginning, but luckily Atlassian has made it as easy as possible. Also migrating from hosted to cloud instance may be a quite a headache if done incorrectly, so definitely it would be great to understand your company needs for the long run and then decide how you implement your Jira!
author: Meelis

review_detail:
title: A great project and bug management tool
pros: It is very easy to use and also good UI and having great user experience
cons: Price is high it is worth it because having lots of features
author: Chirag

review_detail:
title: Great management system
pros: It allows us to have a clear visualization of the internal requirements of the collaborators, additionally it allows us to get clear reports that let us visualize the general approvals and thus track the dependencies.
cons: To change the approvers can not be customized depending on the form but of the division, which makes the process a little difficult because in the same dependency, the form must have specific approvers.
author: Maria

review_detail:
title: Professional work management tool
pros: Professional, ease of task management, project management and ease of use
cons: We love Jira and there is nothing which we don't like
author: Khevana

review_detail:
title: JIRA is a MUST have for orgs
pros: Excellent software platform that keeps our teams organized and is vital to centralization of organizing teams, tracking items and many other tasks
cons: Sometimes the software can become slow and clunky depending on size of projects.
author: Jonathan

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management Software for Enterprises
pros: Easy to Manage the User Stories, Defects as well as Project management is very easy.
cons: Licensing cost for small scale enterprises need to be reduced
author: Naveen

review_detail:
title: Jira A Powerful Tool
pros: Jira streamlines the process of software development making things easy for me. With Jira planning is easy. Integrating with other applications is easy.
cons: Everything is fine. I have no issues with Jira.
author: Emmanuel

review_detail:
title: Jira is must-have for all companies
pros: Jira (especially Cloud version) is awesome. Boards, Gantt charts, Report - those are great features inside Jira. The tool looks great and works awesome.
cons: Sometimes there are performance issues what slows down the work. Selecting some values from dropdown are challenging as there is no search capability and the list might be very long.
author: Janek

review_detail:
title: Love the real-time insights to make accurate project decisions.
pros: Dreadful to easily match teams processes with workflows customization.
cons: Seamless integration for third party application with Confluence.
author: Jane

review_detail:
title: Makes projects flow easily
pros: You can track your projects easily, and you can assign projects to different people, it makes tracking projects a lot easier
cons: Getting into the admin side of it can be frustrating, and with better design this could be resolved. Adding uses can be frustrating as only admins can add users and this can take time, but I can see why people need this functionality
author: Ian

review_detail:
title: Setting up process using Jira.
pros: Jira is good when it comes to tracking tasks, managing workflows, and keeping teams aligned. It's especially helpful for cross-functional collaboration and transparency across departments.
cons: The learning curve can be a bit steep, especially for new users.
author: soonhong

review_detail:
title: Jira's a Great Tool
pros: I love how easy it is to create tickets and collaborate with other coworkers. I love how I can help my employees focus on what needs to be done this week instead of the whole picture.

review_detail:
title: Jira is great for issue and contributions tracking. Recommended.

cons: I would prefer to have a new tab opened after creating a card. This would avoid missing the pop-up with the link and having to search in my recent issues for the new card.
author: David

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management tool available in the market
pros: The aspects about JIRA which I like the most are as follows: 1) Due to the customization that it provides, whenever the Service Team or Production Team registers a CPI case or ticket, they need to give the exact details of the problem/issue in the product along with the supporting documents like images, which thus defines the problem in great detail. 2) Another very useful feature is the feature of linking one CPI case to another CPI case as there may be cases when there are some dependencies or sometimes solving one CPI case may automatically solve the other CPI. So, all these cases can be handled perfectly. 3) It helps in tracking the status of each CPI ticket and allows me to put comments to ask any clarifying questions. We can also assign any participants if we need help from other engineers.
cons: I don't have much to dislike about JIRA but one thing which I feel can be improved is its user interface. I understand that because of having a rich feature base, it is quite complex but if the user interface is somewhat simplified, it will help quite a lot of new engineers or users who are assigned CPI cases on JIRA.
author: Abishek

review_detail:
title: Meine Meinung zum Jira
pros: Jira ist zu einem wichtigen Werkzeug für unser Team geworden, das leicht zu erlernen und im täglichen Einsatz zu verwenden ist. Die Integration mit anderen Entwicklungstools ist nahtlos und ich mag die Möglichkeit, Workflows so zu organisieren, wie man es möchte. Die meisten Funktionen sind leicht zugänglich und es vereinfacht die Verfolgung von Bugs erheblich.
cons: Ich habe eigentlich keine größeren Probleme mit Jira. Die mobile Schnittstelle könnte nur etwas schlanker sein, das ist alles.

review_detail:

pros: In jira we can create bugs, issues, stories.. set time limit for it..we can prioritize task. Add time worked on it. Using comments section easy to collaborate between team. Dashboards give high level understanding where the project is..how many bugs assigned to which developer.. various state are present like new, resolved, testing, fixing etc which shows in which state the issue is present.
cons: I think jira is a bit expensive..so many projects cant afford it. Some level of learning required for new users

cons: La curva di apprendimento è ripida, soprattutto per nuovi utenti, e può risultare complesso per team piccoli o con esigenze semplici. Inoltre, alcune funzionalità avanzate richiedono piani costosi o plug-in aggiuntivi.
author: Andrea

review_detail:
title: Jira: A Versatile and Powerful Project Management Tool with a Steep Learning Curve
pros: The aspect I appreciated the most about Jira is its versatility and powerful customization options. It allows for detailed tracking and management of projects, making it highly adaptable to various workflows and project requirements. The extensive integration capabilities with other tools and the robust reporting and analytics features also enhance its utility and effectiveness in project management
cons: The aspect I liked least about Jira is its steep learning curve. For new users, it can be quite challenging to navigate and fully utilize its features without substantial training. Additionally, the complexity of configuration and customization can be overwhelming and time-consuming, often requiring dedicated administrative resources to manage effectively
author: samah

title: Jira helps to change business management. This tool is essential for success
pros: Jira OS app is a game changer for business operations management. Jira is robust and multi-functioning with enough power to set everything up in one place which enriches the management, tracking, and report writing capabilities of our projects. Customizing interfaces are easy thus aligning all stakeholders on one page as regards the kinds of work structure they have adopted while at the same time ensuring that every member conforms to set procedures leading to successful project completion and delivery. It also offers advanced analytic tools enable quick decision-making process while repeatable patterns foster innovation even during uncertain economic times; this fosters knowledge sharing according to some scholars.
cons: Collaboration within real time and integration into other critical systems make it quite handy for grabbing any information or managing team operations even when someone’s away from office desk or working remotely.

pros: Lots of features and a big ecosystem of add on. You can customize most sections to make your projects work inline with the software and the way it works. Easy for clients to see, review and update tickets and comment on issues. Easy to create Epic, Stories and Tasks for work to be completed. Easy to create and track sprints.
cons: It is VERY expensive and you pay for every person you add including your clients. This means you either limit the amount of access your client gets or you pay alot of money to let them have a user in the system. It would be nice to see a limited client account. The cost of many add-ons can bring your total cost of ownership higher that you might expect. Things like time tracking require and add-on and can get very expensive. No built in GANTT and reporting is mostly covered in 3rd party add-ons Can be complicated to setup and manage. You need a person who is dedicated to the software.

It would be a great opportunity to have this feature, even if it didn't cost Jira much. After adding the 'Issue', of course, an 'issue' related to a great user interface can be edited, but there is no such interface at the time of adding.

review_detail:
title: Organized and Clear with Some Room for Improvement
pros: You can assign projects to co-workers and tag them in content for the projects, which triggers an e-mail that is sent to each individual throughout the process. The percentage is clear and shows how far the project is in the process. Easy to lay out the steps needed to achieve 100% completion. People take responsibility to complete their tasks, or else it sits. E-mails are automatically sent with every update or change.
cons: Depending on the project and who owns it, sometimes the individual who started or owns the project needs to grant access to other users to view and receive the updates. In order to receive all of the e-mails when assigned a project, you must ask an admin to add the appropriate people as a group or team, versus the individual being able to request access/being able to add themselves to a project. You have to manually check off that you saw alerts in the Notification area.
author: Gretchen

review_detail:
title: Top Tier project management tool
pros: I love how easy and efficient project management has been made possible through this software. With the ease in tracking the progress of any project in the system pipeline, as a project manager I am able to quickly manage resources including client expectation in completion of projects
cons: It is not the most user friendly for a newbie, coming from Trello and Oracle Netsuite I easily understood how to navigate Jira features however, for a completely new user to project management software It can be a challenge to learn the ropes.
author: Charles

review_detail:
title: Robust project management tool
pros: Plan and track your work easily even by a beginner user Seamless connection with BitBucket Highly customisable
cons: Initial set-up could be more user friendly Mobile app is not at pace with the web version
author: Diego

review_detail:
title: Thoughts on JIRA from a non-programmer: Still easy to use
pros: I am a technical writer who used JIRA as my first introduction into working in a close-knit, agile programming environment. I really appreciated the clean design, multiple ways to accomplish tasks, and logical visual representations of concepts. Is something assigned to you? It has your face on it. We had several development teams working in tandem and JIRA allowed for each team to structure their sprints according to their own preferences (some had more traditional set up and others used kanban). As time went on we were able to add more projects to JIRA, after transitioning off of ClearQuest for our baseline fixes, and while there is certainly a learning curve getting established programmers who have used one system of tracking for 10+ years converted to using JIRA, most everyone was able to transition and feel comfortable within a few weeks. Speaking as a non-programmer, I found JIRA to be incredibly useful and easy. Tracking writing and editing projects through development didn't require any specific setup or features and it was all around a great tool.
cons: While it was great that every project could be tracked from our one JIRA site for my relatively small (30ish people) development team, any time fields needed to be added for one specific team to track something for stories or bugs, it was there for everyone. This led to having rather cluttered add screens that meant for a good deal of scrolling. I know some of this was surely user error, but having a bit more control would be nice. Also, the search function occasionally would just... not work. At all. As adorable as the sad faced little magnifying glass was when this happened, it would be very frustrating to lose functionality without warning. Being browser-based always makes for risk and some days would just be constant checking of if JIRA was up again so untracked progress didn't fall through the cracks.
author: Kristin

review_detail:
title: Issue Management done Well Enough for Most Software Development needs
pros: Its quick and works quite well for what its meant to do. I've been using it for most of the past 12 years. It is highly customizable and can be as light or as heavy of a burden on your employees as you want. For the most part, it stays out of your way of getting work done. If you can get your developers to update their tickets appropriately, it will generate a lot of nice reports for managers that can be used for future planning and to see how teams are doing. If you are a medium sized organization (more than a couple projects and/or dev teams) you probably want to have someone who's job it is to manage tickets in Jira: triaging bugs, making sure feature tickets are actionable, that tickets have the correct information, that they get updated appropriately, etc.
cons: Like a lot of project management tools like this, you can get too much information. There almost needs to be a developer view, a tester view, and a manager view of a ticket. There are sooo many fields on a ticket and each role cares about a different subset of them. You kind of learn over time which ones you need to pay attention to in each role.
author: Michael

review_detail:
title: Great Transistion from Small company to larger company Task tracking tool
pros: Quick responsive time, no loading screens or waiting on tickets getting created. Easily able to mass produce tickets, change tickets, and use automation to handle routine tasks. Interface has a good modern look and has great UI for the project management and road maps so that others looking at it can view progress done and it looks professional.
cons: You have to pay for each user that uses the ticketing system. This means that if you have a lot of people in the company you have to pay for each person that uses the system so not everyone can submit tickets if there are issues.
author: Lucas

review_detail:
title: Comprehensive, Customizable Task & Project Tracking - Designated Administrator Reccommended
pros: Jira is *incredibly* versatile. You can customize almost every aspect of your Cloud instance, Project, Boards, & Workflows to fit nearly any use case, and across multiple departments. Permissions to your Jira instance can be restricted at a very granular level if need-be, but can be more broad if the occasion calls for it. Additionally, and probably the largest reason we transitioned from enterprise Jira to a Cloud Jira instance is the pervasive availability of integration across the market. Speaking of market - Jira has a growing 3rd-party market that offers enhancements to the Jira platform that Jira does not natively provide or are too complex for an untrained Jira administrator to script themselves. Of those that are "approved" by Jira, we are extremely happy with the breadth of functionality, integration and ease of use. With all that I do have to say that our favorite thing with all project leads is Jira Automation. Once you understand the "SmartValues" language that automation runs on, the use cases for automation are truly endless. It is one of the many strong features from a project management perspective.
cons: Jira takes a village. Atlassian has an incredible resources in the "Atlassian Community" and they do a great job of having experienced users there to answer questions but, because each instance can be set up so differently, the actual customer support request portal is limited to bug fixes. As a result, much of my time administering Jira is spent researching how to fix a roadblock or how to modify permissions - a lot of "learning by doing". Generally speaking, Jira can be difficult to use from an administration perspective, *but* for the purposes of moving ticket along, the UX is pretty good and the UI is fairly intuitive.
author: Sarah

review_detail:
title: Anyone can use it, but few learn how to utilize it
pros: Jira allows for collaboration across multiple organizations and inter-departmental teams. It's great for tracking work, and allows for someone to hand off a project to someone else if they need to pivot to something more critical or their shift ends. Improved dissemination of work.
cons: Integration with third-party ticketing platform is not straight forward and requires a lot of finesse.
author: Davis

review_detail:
title: The most complete and the best solution in the market
pros: Over the years I have worked with different implementations of the same tool, the most successful being Jira Cloud, in a software project. In this project we use different boards and the ticket system for everything related to the development and maintenance of our projects.In this case, as all members of the organization have access and having well-defined workflows helps us to have better communication and always be clear about the needs or possible blockages that may arise.
cons: What I like least about the tool is that the configuration of certain things can become complex. Having a wide variety of functionalities and configurations, it is important that the organization is clear about the type of implementation that it requires.
author: Samuel

review_detail:
title: Just the apt project management tool!
pros: JIRA comes in handy with hosts of features such as issue management, automate task creation, backlog management etc. What is more compelling about this software is the sheer volume of work that it manages seamlessly besides generating reports for the management. Needless to say it’s easy to integrate as there’s a dedicated support team you could reach out to with all of your queries.
cons: Nothing in particular that I could think of. Although for a beginner using this tool for the first time it might not be as straightforward in which case it might help to have some user guide from JIRA.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: The Ultimate Business Productivity Suite
pros: The fully integrated task and project management boards with extensive levels of detail to run Kanban maintenance boards, complex sprints and even visualise recruitment pipelines. In collaboration with Confluence and BitBucket, the Atlassian product suite make the management of a growing software team seem easy.
cons: JIRA has quite a steep learning curve for less software native users and can appear too complex for the average operational or commercial person. As such, it can be difficult to convince new people to use JIRA without extensive training and hand-holding. This could be improved by guided tours and a simpler interface for "new starts".
author: Selby

review_detail:
title: Industry strength tool for professional project / development teams
pros: Jira is very flexible and can work in many different configurations for project management and types of project. It's possible to create a project configuration for almost any other agile methodology, or make your own. Its also useful to capture passing ideas, concepts and suggestions in a loose 'scrapbook' kinda way before a project gets too serious.
cons: It's flexibility is almost a con, as its tricky to get things set up if you're new to the software. Ideally, get help from an experienced user to bypass some of the initially confusing PM / Jira terminology. Having set up projects incorrectly in the past they seem to leave lots of options available within the Jira system, which is annoying as I haven't worked out how to remove them to prevent future confusion ;-)

review_detail:

cons: Troppe mail in caso di modifiche ravvicinate. Non sempre l'assegnazione automatica dei bug è efficiente. Quando un utente lascia l'azienda o comuqnue viene cancellato a volte ci sono problemi con ciò che aveva segnalato lui/lei
author: Paolo

review_detail:
title: Great project and product management tool
pros: Great tool, super customizable, easy to adapt on most parts. Allow you plan ahead on your tasks based on any method you like .
cons: Missing better mangers features like Gantt, more high level plan overview and need to update the old dashboards layout and way of build.
author: Avner

review_detail:
title: Herramienta crítica y alto desempeño para el seguimiento de proyectos y equipos ágiles
pros: Lo más me ha gustado de jira es lo intuitiva que es la herramienta, los íconos y toda la UI es completamente intuitita para el usuario, ya que entiendes perfectamente dónde puedes hacer cada cosa y qué puedes hacer. La visualización de la herramienta respecto de las opciones de seguimiento a proyectos es extremadamente clara, puedes hacer seguimiento desde lo micro a lo macro y poder ver avances de todo el equipo, como también avances por integrante del equipo, o mejor aun, avances donde participa más de un equipo de trabajo en todo el proyecto ágil.Lo otro que valoro mucho de jira es la capacidad de automatizar flujos de trabajo, tableros y poder parametrizar lo que se te venga a la mente. En mi caso utilizo scrum con mi equipo, y poder automatizar los flujos en carriles es lo más óptimo para ser eficientes y que se asignen de forma rápida los tickets a los usuarios que corresponda.Cabe mencionar que la capacidad que tienen de integrarse con toda la suite de atlasian es fenomenal, así como poder adjuntar fragmentos de códigos, videos, páginas de confluence, flujos de figma, etc te soluciona la vida profesional en el área de producto y TI.
cons: Lo único que no me gusta es que el buscador de tickets capaz no es tan bueno, dado que es bastante exacto entonces debes recordar una palabra muy clave para que te aparezca el ticket que estás buscando, esto ocurre en mi caso ya que trabajo desde hace años con proyectos ágiles y por ende a veces busco tickets muy antiguos, no me parece malo el buscador, pero si perfectible para hacer más eficiente la búsqueda y poder quizás hacer mejores filtros que te ayuden a encontrar más rápido lo que estás buscando.
author: Francisca

review_detail:
title: Great for time tracking and task management, but some functionality is overly complicated.
pros: I love the KabBan task view, our company uses this every morning for a company-wide standup meeting. We have set up a customized board with cards that display budget/due date/time spent/etc. and it has been invaluable to us during COVID-19, as we are all working from home and need to stay connected. Jira's time logging via Tempo has some buggy elements, but has been absolutely crucial in maintaining a clear view of task progress and budget maintenance. The time logging tools are incredibly reliable and allow the perfect amount of editing control by both administrators and users.
cons: It is a big pain not being able to assign more than one user to an issue at a time, especially when making Jira issues for meetings, as the purpose here is to provide an issue to log time against. It has also been difficult for our company to systematize and homogenize project structure, as there was such a large learning curve to Jira project setup, and we have a large number of open projects. The functionality between projects differs greatly, and I think a large part of this is due to complicated project setup and maintenance. While Jira is very developer-minded, and many of our developers like it, it seems a slightly less appropriate fit for our designers/strategists and project management team. I also lack the ability to export some reports I need, for example a clear Estimates versus Actuals report in CSV form.
author: Rachel

review_detail:
title: Great in project management and API integration but UI/UX is a little obsolete.
pros: As we work in the RPA Team, API integration is the best part of JIRA offering, but also overall project management with Scrum and Kanban has proved to be really useful for us.
cons: The UI could be made a little simpler and UX can be improved especially with access controls and resource access management. The charts of Scrum and Kanban board also tend to fly away making it hard to understand and sometimes adds in extra effort for the managers or scrum masters.
