review_detail:
title: Jira is a fantastic issue tracker for any company
pros: I love how customizable and configurable Jira is for my company and our teams. All teams have different needs, whether it's kanban or scrum and Jira can handle any need we have. It keeps us organized and ensures we capture all requirements and all bugs so we don't miss anything. The reporting and queries are fantastic and so are the dashboard capabilities.
cons: The queries are great, but I would like better reporting - we had to add Jira apps to our instance in order to get good reports. I do think Jira is pricey as well.
author: Gala

review_detail:
title: The best task management software I have used.
pros: I have used Monday, Asana, Admation, Planner and Jira is by far the best and easiest tool I have used for task management and planning. It integrates with everything, the support is fantastic and it is easy to use.
cons: Sometimes moving sub-tasks from parent projects is a little rigid, but their commitment to support and development makes me sure they're focusing on improving it.
author: Ripley

review_detail:
title: Excellent work management tool
pros: I like this tool called Jira for being an excellent work management tool for software teams who need to organize and track any work in the best and easiest way. Jira is incredibly flexible and can be customized to work with the your team's specific workflow. Initially it was used for software development, serving as support for requirements management, development status monitoring and later for error management. Jira can be used to manage and improve processes, thanks to its functions for organizing workflows.
cons: There is nothing I dislike about this tool, it is excellent, it works very well as a planning and overview of any project, which helps optimize the volume of work within an organization.
author: juan

review_detail:
title: I really enjoyed Jira features
pros: The most features I like about Jira are its Customization, Powerful Reporting and Analytics, Issue Tracking, Automation, Community and Support.Jira is relatively easy to use but after a while of practice and dedication the user will be completely comfortable using it.One more powerful feature is its integration with a wide range of other software tools and platforms that might be necessary to use for some projects.
cons: Depending on the edition and the number of users, Jira can be relatively expensive.Moreover, learning how to use Jira can be complex and overwhelming for new users, especially those who are not familiar with project management methodologies
author: Mouna

review_detail:
title: Large, Complicated (in a good way) full of features software
pros: It's rich, too much management too much organization, customizable to the max, many many many addons on top of jira to facilitate the work.
cons: It's complexity, being so rich and customizable makes the software hard to learn and to maintain
author: mhamad jawad

review_detail:
title: Best way to track bugs and incidents
pros: It's super easy to use and to corrdinate with multiple global teams. Several options to structure the information and to integrate with other ticketing systems from different departments, which makes it ideal for bigger companies.
cons: I find that the reporting options are limited or not as user friendly as the other features the tool offers.
author: Andrea

review_detail:
title: Service were good, but experiencing down time, and slowness.
pros: We basically could do all the bug management staff in this
cons: I and my team, usually experiencing some down time, or slowness. Downtime is mean it need to update or maintain. Sometime it is hard to use.
author: Jiawei

review_detail:
title: Thank you 🙏
pros: The quality of the products are very high and original
cons: The reality is the title of jira What you see is what you'll get
author: Jaouad

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de planification
pros: Jira est un logiciel qui permet aux entreprises de gagner du temps dans les travaux à cause de son efficacité et de sa fonctionnalité Je le recommande vivement
cons: À voir jira pour le moment je n'ai rien trouvé comme inconvénients le concernant
author: Rufine

review_detail:
title: Good for Large-scale Project Management
pros: This product is great for largescale project management. In particular, the ability to create epics allows you to group projects into smaller, related chunks.
cons: Attaching links to the JIRA story descriptions is a little bit tedious as the linked text is transformed into markdown that you have to fiddle with.
author: Molly

review_detail:
title: For all tickets, both internal and external, we use Jira
pros: Bug tracking and task allocation in software development are two areas where JIRA shines. Because of its adaptable nature, it may be fine-tuned to meet the specific requirements of any given project.
cons: There isn't anything to be critical of in JIRA. New users may find the process flow to be a bit challenging at first. The UI might use some modernization in terms of aesthetics.
author: Kelly

review_detail:
title: Reseña de una analista funcional
pros: Lo que más me ha gustado es que en primer lugar permite tener todos los proyectos en un solo lugar. Lo segundo es la increíble ayuda en la gestión de carga de horas de trabajo
cons: Me parece que la herramienta tiene bugs a nivel de performance. En ocasiones se crean tareas o se quieres mover elementos y funciona muy lento. Y no es tan intuitivo
author: Dayan

review_detail:
title: Jira: The Best Management Software
pros: The best part of the software is its user friendly interface. The ability of integration easily with other is another facility which I like most about jira. It’s best for team work. Jira is impactful for business.
cons: It is tough for small business to get its paid software for high price. File size is limited for attachment uploading is disturbing sometimes.
author: Md. Abu Sadek

review_detail:
title: One stop solution to cater ALM needs for small, mid and large size of organizations
pros: Easy of use, almost no need of training while onboarding someone new to tool, easy integration with huge number of add-ons to offer Agile, DevOps and DevSecOps solutions.
cons: For scaled Agile, it needs to depend on some add-ons which are very costly.
author: Smrati

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool
pros: It is a very powerful project management tool. It is recognized for its flexibility and extensive customization options.
cons: It has a complex setup can overwhelm new users.
author: Alan

review_detail:
title: Jira is the platform for easier project management
pros: In terms of features, the sprint view its very easy and straightforward, the Gant chart helps big time too, the easier to understand tasks and assignments, time tracking per task, assignees, as well as the connection between third-party services such as Slack, that allows real time update status tracking when a new action has been performed (updates on a task or new tasks created).
cons: not really cons, its simpler and easier to use
author: Guibson

review_detail:
title: A great piece of product to manage your time
pros: Jira has been an awesome tool, as it is very easily customizable by need, based on the size of the project and i have been able to integrate Jira into my work place very easily. i can have real time communication with my team through Jira and it has helped keep us updated about the projects.
cons: The add on cost factor has been a drawback for me as it piles up quite fast and largely. The other factor is the system resource used intensively.
author: Samip

review_detail:
title: Solid product
pros: Ease of use and ability to include team members when needed for an assignment.
cons: Some of the reporting needs a refresh, trying to track who does what and when after completing a task is somewhat painful.
author: Nick

review_detail:
title: Easy to get started with and easy to use.
pros: Task tracking and integration with bitbucket PRs.
cons: The search UI might be a little confusing when you're search with a keyword.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: Fondamentale per Ticketing/IT
pros: Il prodotto è facile da usare e molto intuitivo poichè la dashboard evidenzia tutte le possibili attività e servizi da sfruttare. Ottimo per gestire ticket IT e personalizzare admin di progetti + organizzazione attività.
cons: Il prodotto per quanto riguarda la mia opinione e l'uso che ne è stato fatto lato mio, non ha particolari difetti poichè è sempre stato utile e mai incomprensibile o di difficile utilizzo.
author: Andrea

review_detail:
title: Atlassian Produkt mit einfacher, übersichtlicher Bedienung
pros: sehr preisgünstig und skalierend wenn man mehr als die kostenlose Version braucht mit guten Anbindungsmöglichkeiten
cons: sehr umfangreich was es ggf. Neulingen erschwert sich zurechtzufinden (im Gegensatz zu z.B. Trello/Asana)
author: Anna Lena

review_detail:
title: JIRA- Project Management assistant for Sales Support PM team
pros: I liked being able to organize several different projects into sprints and being able to assign them as well as see the progress of others. I also liked the visual arrangement of projects. I found it easy to track. Lastly, JIRA is still easily accessed via my mobile phone.
cons: I do not like the data cap for uploaded or attached documents. When using JIRA to assist with uploading and upgrading documents. You have to find another means of working outside of the system to complete these actions.
author: Jillianne

review_detail:
title: NEW NROF TOOL USES JIRA FOR DIFFERENT SPRINTS
pros: It is useful for us from Rating Team due to our new NROF Tool. Jira makes our pending sprint more visible.
author: Misty Mae

review_detail:
title: Highly recommend
pros: I like the fact that I can easily manage my projects and tasks efficiently
cons: Sometimes it gets very slow and it hangs
author: Chisimdi

review_detail:
title: Un excellent outil de gestion des tâches
pros: L'interface très visuelle : en un coup d'oeil il est très aisé de se rendre compte de l'avancée d'un sprint en cours.
cons: Le chargement assez long de l'application.
author: Florian

review_detail:
title: Plataforma eficiente para metodologia agile
pros: Buena herramienta para llevar a cabo metodologia agile: kanban o scrum
cons: demasiada complejidad para tener una base sólida de conocimiento
author: David

review_detail:
title: Centralized Jira for efficiency
pros: It is organized and it makes our workloads easier because we can easily prioritize our task, manage our tine in using it and ease of use for data collection.
cons: None as of the moment, it still serve its purpose.
author: Jomasel

review_detail:
title: Production On Jira
pros: Jira ease to use and lot of feature to maintain production cycle.
cons: Jira Video player can be better and more option to handle it.
author: Nitin

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management softwares in the market
pros: It is a very complete software, it serves to administrate any type of project. Also, it makes it easier to develop it in a organized way
cons: It takes time to understand its configuration. It is not very easy to learn how to use the software, but it just takes time to get to it
author: Axel

review_detail:
title: Good tool to get control of your tasks in a project
pros: Jira is an easy tool to keep track of you project tasks with great flexibility and gives a good overview.
cons: You can go down the "rabbit hole" in configuration so my recommendation is to keep it simple if you can.
author: Erik

review_detail:
title: A GREAT APP, MEETS YOUR NEEDS
pros: a tool that allows you to monitor your tasks and monitor all stages of your task
cons: I haven't found anything yet that I could exclude as something I didn't like.
author: Mateus

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Flexible Project Management Software, project boards real time data
cons: Jira's extensive feature set can be overwhelming for new users
author: Jennifer

review_detail:
title: Powerful and complete Project Management and issue tracking tool
pros: Jira is very useful thanks to its scalability, which allows it to be suitable to company of different sizes, and its automation features, which help reduce manual task. It is also well integrated with other third-party softwares and has a good reporting feature.
cons: It is a bit expensive and not always so easy to understand, due to its complexity and all its features. It may take a long to become totally familiar with this software and to master many of its functions.
author: Virginia

review_detail:
title: Great product for SCRUM
pros: It is very extensive with lots of features. It is also very flexible so if you do not need all the features you can use the ones you need and then anytime in the future you can start using the others. It is fairly user friendly, easy to get the hang of it.
cons: It does not have a lot of reports. Some detailed reports that give you more information about the stories (duration, added child issues by date).
author: Kunal Laxman

review_detail:
title: Mi reseña de Jira
pros: Lo que mas me ha gustado es que permite encontrar fallas.
cons: Que hay que especializarse un poco para entenderlo.
author: Enzo

review_detail:
title: Un très bon logiciel de planification de projets
pros: Jira supporte et encourage les méthodologies Agiles comme Scrum et Kanban. Il permet de gagner en efficacité et de facilité la collaboration même à distance. Le suivi et la planification des stories et des bugs est facile et pratique.
cons: Jira pour moi deux inconvénients : Il est assez couteux et la courbe d'apprentissage est un petit peu difficile au début, notamment pour des personnes peu formées aux méthodologies de gestion de projet.
author: Vincent

review_detail:
title: Jira is great for software development or other agile methodologies
pros: Jira is robust in tracking minute details and keeping them in a backlog which will then be worked.
cons: Jira's ability to report in a meaningful way, outside of the tool itself, is not great. It is very difficult and I found that pushing people into the tool was necessary.
author: Tanner

review_detail:
title: Easy to use - Das ideale Tool für Einsteiger und Fortgeschrittene im agilen Projektmanagement
pros: Die Möglichkeit, Anforderungen aus verschiedensten Use Cases über eigene Boards innerhalb eines Projektes ausformulieren, priorisieren und organisieren zu können. Somit bleibt das Board für die Entwicklung stets sauber.
cons: Ohne die Nutzung von XRay fehlen mir persönlich weitere Bug Kategorien. So kann bspw. noch in der Projektphase zwischen einem Hotfix im Produktivsystem und einem Bug im Testsystem unterschieden werden. Ohne dafür eine Brücke bauen zu müssen.
author: Kevin

review_detail:
title: Jira - Klassiker der immer noch modern ist
pros: Großer Funktionsumfang und Stabilität des Systems. Einheitliche Datenbank vereinfachen integriertes Arbeiten.
cons: Userfreundlichkeit und Oberflächen nicht immer State of Art.
author: Heiko

review_detail:
title: great for tracking
pros: it's a great software for keeping track of employees time sheets
cons: nothing i liked least. it just wasn't for my business
author: Amber

review_detail:
title: An Ideal Project Management Software
pros: It's really a good project management software which is very versatile and it offers us various useful features such as agile development, bug tracking, project management, etc.
cons: The user interface is not too simple for everyone to easily maneuver their way through.
author: Charles Boampong

review_detail:
title: Jira great service fast
pros: bringing visibility to work and the ability to deliver great service fast
cons: the limited file sizs uploads as well as comfusing user interface
author: ilian

review_detail:
title: Task management that keeps you on track
pros: It's reliable to use and you can track the task flow and prfioritize critical tasks.
cons: It has a lot of features so it may a little while to get familiar with it, but it's still good.
author: Nia Maria

review_detail:
title: Good for agile teams !
pros: It helps my team to work easily in an Agile software model. It helps to track and resolve the bugs on time. The ticket management system is good which allows to customize its content according to need. Jira is a good project management tool that allows to delivery of the software in less time.
cons: When new team members join in a project he may require some time to understand things because of the project customization.
author: Shaikh

review_detail:
title: Jira best alignment tool for sales and development team
pros: What we like about Jira, is how easy it is to create a ticket and communicate with our dev team. This helped our team address more bugs in our app and properly set estimated time of repair to our clients.
cons: Nothing as of now, but will update this review if we found any.
author: Ryan

review_detail:
title: Jira Rocks!
pros: Jira was very easy to navigate and user friendly.
cons: Once I got accustomed to the Jira layout, there wasn't much I disliked.
author: Jadin

review_detail:
title: Have been using Jira for 10 years and would always recommend it over competitors
pros: The beauty of Jira is that it is entirely customizable to each individual team's needs. Separate teams can still work together and still use separate workflows.
cons: One major downside to Jira is that it is complicated to configure. With so many available customizations, if people don't know what they are doing, it can get very messy and complex VERY fast.
author: Erica

review_detail:
title: The standard what we aim for.
pros: Very easy to use. Very open to different types of project and time management applications. Seamless integration with Cyber security tools such as Darktrace and Bitdefender.
cons: A little rough in terms of deployment a lot of users were un familiar with how to use the product correctly.
author: Travis

review_detail:
title: JIRA Technical and Management Review
pros: One of the top attractions I found in Jira is the UX/UI aspect. The minimalism approach definitely hooked me. Moreover, the tutorials, documentation, and community forums are a great asset!
cons: From my standpoint, I didn't notice anything missing in terms of features. I didn't face any glitches or downtimes. Thanks, Atlassian team!
author: Mohamad

review_detail:
title: Effective Application.
pros: high degree of interoperability and wide use. connects to a variety of different tools for increasing productivity. The product team continuously makes enhancements. The program is exceptionally lightweight both in terms of deployment and use. It enables for continuous data storage as you type, which is a fairly fantastic feature. The user interface is also quite well planned out and easy to use across a variety of displays.
cons: The absence of a sound notification option in Jira is the only negative I have come across while using it. Jira, for instance, doesn't play a sound when a new ticket is created while the user is working with tickets.
author: Ruhul

review_detail:
title: Honest Jira Review
pros: Continuous Improvement and Tracking of Jira stories.Also details of each story in the form of jira comments and hours logged on that particular story.
cons: Permissions to edit the stories.As a developer , i can’t edit the story or add/delete stories in between the sprint.
author: Akash

review_detail:
title: Powerful & Awesome Ticket Manager!
pros: I love that JIRA is cloud-based so you can access your tickets from anywhere. I also love that it's very easy to see what your team is working on. It's also very easy to manage your own tickets and collaborate across teams and with other people by sharing the ticket with them.
cons: A few years ago, JIRA updated to their most recent version, and it was a rather large update. I wish that I had had more knowledge about the update from JIRA, or more notification that the update was scheduled, and what pertained to the update.
author: Regina

review_detail:
title: Feature-rich and powerful with minor UI quirks
pros: - Easy to set up - Powerful features - Collaboration is excellent
cons: - UI especially for action items like showing a task history need some rework
author: Abdul Mateen

review_detail:
title: JIRA the best Developer Tasks Management
pros: For me JIRA is the best tool for manage Tasks on develop teams. We love the task management, the attributions and the customizations that we are allowed to do with JIRA.
cons: For us, some bad things on JIRA are the BackLog Management, we don't use this resource because is very hard to separate our tasks, and normally or backlog has 200 tasks that never go away, and too never are deleted.. We need to separate that tasks in a different manner.
author: Robson Jean

review_detail:
title: Jira - The Project Manger's right arm
pros: Backlog management is the most important thing in project following Agile methodologies. Without proper management of the backlog, the project is definitely bound for failure. The ease of which backlog items can be created, processed, moved up & down makes the life of Scrum Master & Project Manager very easy.
cons: Time reporting is something I had some difficulties to use, but I'm not saying the feature is bad. I believe this could be made much simpler and easier to use for developers specially who are always complaining about time sheets..
author: Parvez

review_detail:
title: There's a learning curve for setting up projects, workflows, etc. but it works great
pros: It provides all of the collaborative tools we need to manage our work and maintain documentation for future reference and it doesn't break the bank.
cons: I hate that support is only through email (unless you get escalated and even then they're hesitant to get on the phone!), particularly when the bulk of the support you receive is from non-native English speakers. Some of their support staff are great at asking clarifying questions and quickly working to a resolution but more often than not, their support staff may not fully understand the scope of the issue and will offer half-baked solutions that leave me as a user feeling misunderstood and frustrated. I may not have the vocabulary to convey in "Jira" terms what I need, but they as support agents should be able to bridge that gap. A simple conversation over the phone would help address this as a series of clarifying questions could easily help use come to a consensus but with emails going back and forth, it can create a time-consuming and extremely frustrating support situation. The setup and configuration process could be streamlined and made more intuitive. Because its so customizable, it makes sense that it will take some work to get it setup properly, but for simple user cases like ours, it really should be an easier process.
author: Matt

review_detail:
title: Best Option for Scrum But Not the Best If you need Flexibility
pros: If you follow Agile Development specially scrum and stick to its principles Jira is tailor-made for that. The UI is easy to use and looks clean. You have all the features like maintaining a backlog, sprints, epics, bug tracking, etc. to succussfully manage your scrum project.
cons: It would be the flexibility and pricing. You feel you are stuck to this scrum style project management and there is less flexibility. As a company that works on multiple projects with different styles of management according to the project type, it was hard for us to manage them with Jira
author: Yasith

review_detail:
title: Fairly new user , it surprised me but can improve
pros: I didn't need more than an hour to be set and start planning and assigning and creating epics, stories, tasks and so on, but there are too much to do that I thing I need a proper course to use it fully
cons: Too business oriented, I wouldn't use it for small business or personal
author: Abraham

review_detail:
title: Avaliação do Jira
pros: O que mais apreciei no Jira foi sua habilidade de administrar projetos de maneira rápida e efetiva. O Jira facilita o processo de criar tarefas, atribuir responsabilidades e acompanhar o progresso de cada etapa. .
cons: No começo, foi um pouco difícil entender todas as funcionalidades.
author: Iran Marcos

review_detail:
title: Jira as a ux designer
pros: Easy to navigate, clean, nice colors, very efficient and has alot of features that allow for scrum and agile methods
cons: Sometimes it edits an issue or task or i cant change the estimate of time or change the time spent on the task
author: Stephanie

review_detail:
title: A seasoned software product setting the precedent for project management.
pros: The entire Atlassian ecosystem creates simplicity and ease of use across agile methodology through devops to deployment.
cons: Minor nuances with onboarding and getting up to speed to configure Jira to maximize its potential.
author: Matt

review_detail:
title: Regular usage feedback
pros: Ease of access and data storage with the audit trail feature
cons: Needs little training to understand the orovess
author: Ankita

review_detail:
title: Most comprehensive solution for task tracking and agile management today
pros: Jira has a huge bredth of features. It's not even possible to compare any of the competition to Jira in feature depth, as Jira has so many features even disabled/hidden by default, and they need to be enabled by administrators per team requests.
cons: Sometimes the page loads can be very slow, even if Jira is running on per recommendations platform technically.
author: Janne

review_detail:
title: Jira Software Review
pros: Jira is one of the best software for online project management, time tracking, issues tracking, and product management. It allows the users to assign and track their needed tasks easily, which saves a lot of their time & effort and consequently provide accurate tracking.
cons: Jira is a little hard to set up and get used to. Initially, the users might find its UI to be a bit complicated to understand. Thus, its user interface can be improved.
author: Saksham

review_detail:
title: Review OF Jira
pros: One of Jira greatest features is its flexibility in workflow customization. This allows users to design workflows that align with their specific project management needs.In addition, Jira is well-equipped to handle Agile project management, supporting methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban, making it simple for teams to plan, monitor and control their projects.
cons: I don't have any dislike for this software.
author: Arbaaz

review_detail:
title: Amazing tool for an Agile team
pros: We used Jira mostly for sprint tracking and daily development. It has a lot of functionalities that we used on a daily basis and can support very complex and large projects with larger teams. It is used with not much trouble by both technical and non technical folks. It can be modified to cater to different needs like sprint tracking, project tracking , issue tracking, project documentation etc. Also has integrations options with other third party tools like slack, jenkins etc.
cons: Some find the UI interaction confusing due to multiple overlapping features and options. It should allow customisations for user categories, priority etc. and should allow teams to add new fields to stories out of the provided ones. Also it would be great if we can assign multiple users to same story (may be with multiple roles other than assignee and reporter)
author: Greeshma

review_detail:
title: Best large project management
pros: I liked the organization of data under epics and stories and bugs and integration with different apps like github and bitbucket
cons: The mobile app sucks, notification don't work most of the time
author: Hadi

review_detail:
title: Progress from ticket to development to communication
pros: Jira offers our organisation the best way to go from a Freshdesk ticket to an idea or bug and communicate them to your team. Create your (sub) tasks and plan them in your development leap. Keep track of all history and customers linked to that idea/bug and communicate back to them what your next step will be. It also offers a good search functionality.
cons: Knowing/discovering about the benefits of (more) integrations would be a benefit. Also rights & roles managements is quite complex. It goes very deep into detail which is sometimes a disadvantage for new and existing users.
author: Daisy

review_detail:
title: Jira as test management tool
pros: You can do there all the task related to testing, create subtask for test designs, file the bugs that you found in all the kind of test that you have to run, create test suites with test cases per brand, install other plugins like Xray and etc, check the user stories and their status, create reports etc
cons: the way to import test suites from other tools
author: Rodrigo

review_detail:
title: If you do a business, Jira is there!
pros: As a software architect, I use Jira when release an application to production environment. We fill requirements documents on Confluence which integrated with Jira. It is great tool for task and issue management across teams in different departments or domains. Also we integrated Jira with BitBucket. So, when a new release is ready, we get last commit from BitBucket on Jira. This is another powerful feature of Jira. All Atlassian products can be integrate with Jira easily.
cons: Jira is not an easy to use platform. Training is must to learn how to use Jira. I have more than +10 years experience and can say that I got confused when I faced Jira at the first time.
author: Mahmut Can

review_detail:
title: Excellent software for Project Management
pros: Jira is feature-rich and fully customizable software. My team and I used Jira for Project management and defect tracking. I customized the defect state lifecycle as per our project requirements which I find a handy feature. Using Jira, you can also write test cases and run workflow before software release as part of build acceptance testing. You can also generate test reports, export defects and create test workflows and use many other advanced features using Jira software.
cons: When I was executing test cases, the user interfaces for running the test case and updating the status of the test case were confusing. For running test cases, The XRay Jira provides a tabular structure, and if there are too many columns in the table, you have horizontally scroll to find the "Play" button to run the test case. I think this user interface can be simplified and made more user-friendly.
author: Ranjit

review_detail:
title: My personal experience
pros: I like it,because is made so easy,even a beginner wont find anything difficult
cons: Everything is perfect,no complain,i will strongly recommend this product to a lot of folks
author: chima

review_detail:
title: Best software to manage project and track the progress
pros: If gives me flexibility to create sprint and also track all of my colleagues progress. We can even add a comment so that any person need not ask for status of the task
cons: If someone created a ticket but other than a person who has been assigned to that task moves the ticket we'll not get to know who moved the ticket
author: Chethana

review_detail:
title: A useful task management tool!
pros: When I started using it, I thought this is gonna be a challenge, but seeing how JIRA allow me to keep track of mine and team's task is amazing. I love how it allows to add confluence link with the Jira task. Otherwise, we have to go for word or doc files. Also, it notifies me about every modifications done in my created task or my assigned one.
cons: Although none, but it glitches sometimes when internet is slow.
author: Rehnuma

review_detail:
title: Parfait pour le développement de logiciels AGILE
pros: Une fois bien configuré, il est très facile d'utiliser Jira pour pouvoir développer des logiciels avec plusieurs parties prenantes. La vision Dashboard permet de suivre plusieurs projets en parallèle.
cons: Le logiciel est très complet mais il est difficile à prendre en main
author: Bastien

review_detail:
title: Jira is an excellent tool for organizing tasks, tracking progress, and collaborating in a team
pros: I use Jira at work everyday. It helps me organize my tasks, keep track of my progress, and connect with my team more efficiently. Jira allows me to customize my workflow, issues, and fields to fit my unique needs. This flexibility helps me to avoid confusions, and improve my productivity.Furthermore, Jira integrates with more than a thousand third-party tools, such as GitHub and Slack. This integration capability is very important because it facilitates cross-functional communications.Jira's reporting features are very essential. It allows me to monitor my progress, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions. The reports can be customized and exported in various formats.Jira helps me to prioritize work, and deliver value faster. I totally recommend project managers and company employees to use Jira at work. It helps you be more productive at work.
cons: In my opinion, there are no cons for Jira. The only thing I can mention is that the software can be overwhelming for new users due to its rich features and complex interface. It requires some training and patience to fully utilize its capabilities. However, I do not consider this as a dislike. It is a faily user-frienly software. I enjoy using Jira at work!
author: Setareh

author: Pramodh

review_detail:
title: Jira is my ultimate solution for efficient project management and issue tracking
pros: 1. Issue Tracking: Jira Software allow my team to create and track issues or tasks.2. Support Agile Methodologies: Jira Software supports Agile methodologies. It provides boards to visualize and manage work, backlogs to prioritize tasks, and sprints to plan and track iterative development cycles.3. Integration: Jira Software integrates with various tools and services commonly used in software development, such as source code repositories (e.g., GitHub, Bitbucket)These integrations enhance collaboration and streamline development processes.4. Reporting and Analytics: Jira Software provides built-in reports and metrics, and that helped me to track project progress, team performance, and issue resolution.5. Customizable Dashboards: Jira Software helped me by creating personalized dashboards to monitor key project metrics, track assigned issues, and view activity streams.
cons: 1. Complexity for beginners: Jira Software can be difficult for users who are new to the platform or project management in general. The extensive customization options and complex configuration settings may require a learning curve and additional training for some users to fully leverage its capabilities.2. Expensive: While Jira Software offers a free tier for small teams, the pricing can be quite steep as the team size and feature requirements increase. This can make it less accessible for small or budget-constrained organizations, especially when considering the additional costs of integrations and add-ons.

cons: If I had to point out cons, I would say there are two requiring issues. First, (I can't believe I am saying this, lol) some parts are to interactive versus automative if that makes sense. I love the ability to do pretty much anything. However, when it's required for every single step, you can easily create a rabbit hole for yourself. I truly believe the user, like myself, who use Jira every workday would appreciate a more streamlined automatic simplified approach. Maybe a pick your own experience type of deal! Classic view or updated automated.

review_detail:
title: Disappointing attitude!
pros: Seems like a very good software, is very powerful and is reasonably easy to use.
cons: We found it through our Trello account, after Atlassian took over Trello. We were using another service desk software but noticed that Jira Service Desk could offer all the features we needed, and all for free! Or so we thought! The plan we chose is for small teams (which we are) and is advertised (still to this date) as "Always free for 3 agents". "Free" is further highlighted at the top of the Plans & Pricing page and a large "$0" is displayed. Well, it took some time to get it set up and to import our tickets (this is not easy and we needed support which was quite difficult to get). Once we got set up, it took some time to learn about it (no phone support on free plan!) and we devoted many hours to this. And all was well for about 2-3 months......then we receive an email to say that payment is due! And that our account would be cancelled if we don't pay! What? We contacted Jira, only to be told that we are on a temporary free plan, like a free trial, and that payment is due after 3 months I believe it was. We explained about the "free" plan that we signed up to but the Jira support member just reiterated her point and was quote blunt and unhelpful. We went back to check out the "Plans and Pricing" table on the Atlassian website, thinking we obviously missed the small print. But we didn't!!! They were still brazenly advertising "$0" and "Always free for 3 agents" and there is no mention of a free trial , anywhere on this page at all!!

review_detail:
title: Robust Features; Challenge to Use
pros: JIRA offers a very robust list of project management and notification features that are essential to both agile and waterfall style software development. It can be customized to your preferred method of operation, which makes it very malleable to your specific business model. There are also a number of great add-ons and integrations that can loop many of your essential software licenses together, which helps instill uniformity and precision.
cons: JIRA can be very complicated to use. The problem with having a software that is this customizable is that your options are seemingly endless. Unfortunately, there is no real "instruction manual" for the software, and I find that the online wiki is often several versions out of date, which makes troubleshooting extremely difficult. In addition, it's very difficult to track down a customer service representative for assistance. In fact, at this point, I'm not ever sure how to.

cons: Although the product is very mature, feels also like a big giant monolith although its plugin architecture. Also, plugins are too much expensive for just simple features. There should be much control from the Atlassian Marketplace, which should follow more an App Store logic like Apple's or Google's one.

review_detail:
title: Best Issue and Project management tool ever
pros: - Perfect for agile projects. Wide variety of features to support agile projects like kanban, burn down charts, sprint/user story related reports, task assignment, workload management. - Tonnes of customisations for issues, workflows, reports, timelines, forms, scrum boards. - Wide variety of integration options available for most of the popular softwares on Atlassian marketplace - Ideal to implement the seemless devops experience. - Seemless integration with confluence document management.
cons: - The reports dont look very pleasing to the eyes and very few options available out of the box to beautify reports. I would prefer downloading the data to excel and create my required charts. - Too much customisation and the UIs feel less intuitive and cluttered.
author: Abhishek

review_detail:
title: Perfect Combination of Customizable, Detail-Oriented, and Easy to Use
pros: I love JIRA. I use it professionally and personally. Even though it is primarily a task manager for software development, I have found that it is flexible enough to be used for all sorts of projects. It is amazing how customizable it is; you can configure your project settings to your already existing workflow, whatever it may be. While the initial setup can be time consuming, once you have your settings configured, using the tool is a breeze. It takes seconds to create tasks, start springs, evaluate progress, etc. I find that this makes JIRA standout from other task managers. In most cases, if the software allows for detail-oriented task management the process of inputting and tracking the tasks themselves is cumbersome. Entering and tracking tasks should not have to be another time-consuming task! The JIRA web application is also excellent, making it easy to enter or track tasks on-the-go.
cons: I think there is a lot of potential with Jira's NextGen projects, however, the software rollout has been uneven and often not well documented. I wish this process would have been better thought out to make transitioning to NextGen projects smoother.
author: Rachel

review_detail:
title: Jira has been of great help
pros: The user interface looks so simple, almost everyone can use it. It requires so less training
cons: It has been working well. I have no issues when using Jira. I love it

review_detail:
title: L’ Aiuto che ti mancava
pros: Tutto procede bene e senza problemi, consiglio vivamente questo servizio.
cons: No ho avuto problemi. Consiglio vivamente questo programma
author: Roberto

review_detail:
title: From Jira Newbie to Workflow Ninja: Lessons Learned
pros: First off, the Kanban boards are fantastic. Everything is laid out visually, so it's easy to see where each task is in the pipeline - no more wondering if something is stuck or forgotten. This keeps everyone on the team on the same page and helps us avoid bottlenecks. Plus, for us Agile folks, Jira just fits. Sprints, user stories, backlogs - it all integrates seamlessly. Prioritizing tasks within each sprint cycle is a breeze, and tracking progress feels smooth.
cons: Now, let's talk about the learning curve. When I first started with Jira, it felt like there was a whole new language to learn. Between the interface and all the project management jargon, it took some time to get comfortable. For new team members, especially those without experience with project management software, this can be a bit of a hurdle. There's also the whole customization thing. Don't get me wrong, the ability to tailor Jira to your specific needs is great. But if you go overboard, things can get messy fast. Overly complex workflows just make it harder for everyone to navigate the system and keep things on track.
author: Brian

review_detail:
title: Jira review
pros: What I love most about Jira is its customization options. It lets you tailor workflows and boards to fit your team's unique style perfectly, making project management a breeze.
cons: The only downside I've found with Jira is that it can be a bit daunting for newcomers. There's so much flexibility and customization available that it takes a while to get the hang of it. It's like trying to navigate a new city without a map – you'll eventually get there, but it might take some time to figure out the best route.
author: Akhil

review_detail:
title: Efficient but Complex
pros: I liked that Jira is highly customizable and powerful for project management. It allows for detailed tracking of tasks, bugs, and issues. The integration with other tools, like Confluence and Bitbucket, makes it easier to manage the entire development workflow in one place. The ability to create custom workflows and dashboards tailored to specific project needs is a huge advantage.
cons: The complexity of Jira can be overwhelming, especially for new users. The learning curve is steep, and it can be challenging to configure the tool effectively without proper training. The user interface can also feel cluttered at times, making navigation less intuitive. Additionally, performance issues can arise when working with large datasets or complex queries.

review_detail:
title: Jira Review

cons: Cons include a bit high cost, some performance issues when using large datasets. Dependency on add-on features which could be included as general feature.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Project and product management tool
pros: A proper organized tool for developers and team. Good UI platform will all the information related to the issue either in past or present can check in one place.
cons: A lot of basic features needed third party paid plugins. Customer support is very less interactive as per the users using JIRA.

review_detail:
title: Great tool overall!
pros: The ease of use of Jira has been amazing. Not only that, but the ability to have multiple projects while setting up a specific pipeline to follow for each project has been absolutely instrumental in our project management.
cons: While it is an amazing product. I feel that it can easily get unorganized if the project is not kept up to date.
author: Anthony

review_detail:
title: Great ticketing software service
pros: Super easy to submit support tickets to other departments and to get responses back.
cons: I wish it was integrated into the software we already use like Microsoft Teams or Zoho One. It's another login and a rather complex one at that sometimes.
author: Greg

review_detail:
title: Jira Review: A Powerful but Complex Tool for Agile Teams
pros: Tailored Workflows: Jira allows teams to design custom workflows to match their unique processes
cons: Expensive for Smaller Teams. Pricing Structure: Jira’s pricing model can be expensive, especially for smaller teams or startups.
author: Shumani

review_detail:
title: Great tool
pros: The workflows help my team and me manage projects. I love the task management feature, as we work in an agile environment, and this is how we organise our sprints.
cons: It has taken me a long time to learn and still don’t feel I am using all the features available.
author: Claire

review_detail:
title: A great experience for SDLC management across all areas
pros: JIRA is the best SDLC tool I have used, it allows control of all tasks related to work progress
cons: Custom configuration of elements / items, gets tricky sometimes
author: Cesar

review_detail:
title: Very easy for project's collaboration.
pros: Its user-interface friendliness and lack of complexity makes a difference. Being able to easily set "@name" status update notes for collaborators is also very convenient as it triggers automated email(s) to the corresponding inboxes. No training is required to start utilizing it. Intuitive by design.
cons: Hard to say... maybe the reporting capabilities can be taken to the next level.
author: Ariel

review_detail:
title: Best In the Market Project Management and Test Management Tool
pros: I use it for Project Management and Test Management. It's User friendly and have useful integration with tool like Jenkins and BitBuket.
cons: I can't find anything to dislike which I can term as Cons.
author: Rajat

review_detail:
title: High quality software
pros: All project management features has high quality functionalities.
cons: Integration with 3th party applications
author: Sergio R

review_detail:
title: JIRA is an amazing tool in a very useful suite of project management software.
pros: JIRA is a great way to track items that need to be done or defects that need to be fixed across a business. If you take the time to customize the interface, add fields, workflows, etc. that match your business model, JIRA can make your organization so much more transparent and efficient. Combined with it's siblings Confluence, BitBucket, et. al. you have an amazing suite of productivity tools. Each individual may feel that they are doing a little more than they used to when adding information into these tools, but the time saved in meetings, querying peers for information & not having the full picture will soon become apparent. To get the most of JIRA, be prepared to customize and train. Without those two pieces, you may end up with users who don't see or feel the benefit.
cons: The least appealing thing about JIRA and the other tools in the Atlassian suite is the fact that you must buy plug-ins to get a lot of functionality that should have been built in. Atlassian is proud of their App ecosystem, but, from an end user perspective, it can just feel like it is a place grabbing your money.
author: Tim

review_detail:
title: Extremely confusing software, not user friendly, just complicated
pros: The amount of possibility that gives you are endless. Usefull in really big teams especially when you have to log and keep track of software issues and failure. It helps to easily manage the status of your issues and easily communicate with your or other teams.
cons: Not user friendly. It completely makes you forget why you are using it in the first place. Too many "solutions" and often not a single one is worth it. The price is extremely high, considering that you are not receiving the same assistance and software quality of their competitors.
author: Dario

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: I liked its customizable workflows which were helpful in handling tasks in a way that aligned my development methodology. We used multiple methodologies for different projects and Jira was perfect as it is adjustable to any method. I liked its integration feature with GitHub and Slack which made our task flow smooth.
cons: In the beginning, it was complex because of its extensive customization options. For me, it was a bit harder to set up the projects and flow initially.
author: Bishal

review_detail:
title: JIRA - A very complete tool from Atlassian portfolio.
pros: The Scrum boards are very light weight and handy to manage backlog and Sprint planning and execution
cons: Customization is a bit a of an issue. Eazy BI report plugging is bit lethargic and difficult to operate upon
author: Manish

review_detail:
title: Exceptional project and Task Management tool
pros: Jira's ability to be customized to meet the unique needs of any organization and its comprehensive set of features and integrations make it an effective solution for tracking and managing tasks, monitoring project progress, and collaborating with stakeholders.
cons: The least liked thing about Jira is that it can be difficult to learn, especially for those who are unfamiliar with the project management software.
author: Crispussia

review_detail:
title: It is very easy to keep track of assignments at work
pros: I loved Jira such a ton that subsequent to moving positions I took it with me and utilized their free form just to help track my own personal errands but none of my other colleagues were utilizing it. Jira has made my work life simpler particularly during a period where we as a whole need to work distantly. It assists me with dealing with the undertakings and follows side by side of the jobs being finished. The product is very simple to know and hence the wealth of clear how-to recordings is incredible.
cons: Estimating has gotten truly wild as of late. it had been once extraordinary worth however since they should be cornered a major market fragment they're truly draining it for all its value, Jira like most programming highlights a tad of an expectation to learn and adapt.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Useful tool for agile development
pros: The tool works great to keep track of an ongoing software development job. Multiple users can get involved within the platform and have different subtasks assigned to them. Having the possibility to create workflows keep things simple and easy to see what's the current status of the whole task at a glance. The platform allows for customisation as well, this comes really handy as no project is identical and you may need to add some automations to the process to meet your specific needs. Thanks to their recent Boards implementation, you can see the next tasks that need to be worked on and as well as what's already been done and what's in progress.
cons: The platform might be a bit overwhelming when you start working with it for the first time. It's hard to know all the possible functionalities until you have worked with it for a while. Although it's possible to customise, some parts can get a bit tricky to perform if you don't have the knowledge. On the other side, you can also reach out to them if you need help. In terms of pricing, it can get a bit expensive if you need a lot of users.
author: Pedro

review_detail:
title: Using JIRA with Corporate Learning and Development
pros: Ability to collaborate easily with SCRUM teams; everyone has access in real time to the most up to date information for each JIRA story; ability to mock ups and to add comments @ team members who are notified immediately and vice versa when they respond. It allows us to accurately track to our L&D deliverables related to the SCRUM’s JIRA stories, as they may change over the course of a sprint.
cons: Sometimes you have to download a mock up instead of it opening directly in Windows viewer, not a big deal but just an extra step; JIRA is a much more technical application, it definitely requires a learning curve to use it, it’s not a super simple interface.
author: Marcy

review_detail:
title: Among the top 5 best project management tools for Software Development
pros: This is a pretty interesting and simple to use software platform by developers, testers & managers in the software industry. It is mainly adopted by teams following the agile methodology. The overall usability and user experience are unbelievable and the smoothness through which we can switch between different sections of the platform makes it a very usable product. It helps to create Scrum and Kanban projects as well as create and manage tasks, user stories, etc. by these teams. Developers can easily use GIT or TFS to check-in or commit data on the respective servers whereas testers can file relevant bugs or issues encountered for the relevant tasks under a User story. Overall, this is a great project management tool to use.
cons: As compared to other platforms like Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly Visual Studio Team Services), this tool doesn't provide much more features and support for functionalities. Anyone would prefer to use Azure DevOps as it is a complete DevOps solution as well as a Project management tool with decent pricing for corporates and also free pricing for a team of 5.
author: Siddhant

review_detail:
title: The best solution for Team Project Management
pros: A lot of plugins and tools are available on the Marketplace. The tools are used a lot amoung the Video Game Industry, making it a standard for task management and bugtracking. Offers a lot of options to present to the data to the users as well as gathering information from the backlogs and rendering charts for project managers.
cons: Lot of options and tools, makes it hard to master. Not always easy to find its way in the options, especially because the tool is revamping and evolving often, making tutorials or classes quickly out of date.
author: Cédric

review_detail:
title: Great for Backlogs and Organizing Software Releases - Bad For Agility
pros: The backlog and features for managing the backlog with different methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum, or Kanban + Scrum hybrid are very flexible. Planning sprints, releasing sprints, and looking at history of what was done is very organized.
cons: Cumbersome to setup. Workflows for issues and UI/UX for creating them is not easy to understand. Sure you can figure it out, but it will require a lot of facepalms. It's good for larger organizations with several cross-functional teams, but if you are a smaller organization stick with Trello and checklists for the cards if sub-tasks are needed. The sub-tasks in Jira are just plain awful to work with, and will end up wasting a lot of time for your team.
author: Adam

review_detail:
title: Could be simple or complex - all up yo you
pros: I've been using JIRA on an off, for about 15 years with several employers that I have been. It is very customizable, and can be as simple or high lever as administrator/users require it. If you have several users working on a project, no matter how complex - JIRA is your tool. You can create tasks, subtasks, assign them to different users (who will receive email notifications when they are mentioned or any changes are made), request updates, etc.
cons: Some of the users I worked with overcomplicated the process - but this is not fault of JIRA at all.
author: Oleg

review_detail:
title: Task Management Leader
pros: i can easily track the lifecycle of the task and easy to write a ticket instead of taking notes for task allocation
cons: some features doest work sometimes and some tickets which i create from a parent ticket using issues is always takes home in backlog what is this i am breaking down tasks so they should be directly shown on bord but now i don't know why but it always goes to backlog issues
author: Madhav

review_detail:
title: Projet Manager Tool -JIRA
pros: The smoothest features of the app and tremendous project management features and the main thing I like is it has a finest mobile app
cons: I have been using this software for the past 2 years and personally found it the best in the market the only con is about the paid features I feel

review_detail:

pros: It is a powerful tool to order, prioritize and visualize the tasks that are part of the different projects.
cons: The initial learning curve was a bit steep, more support during the implementation phase would strengthen the after-sales service
author: Jenelin

review_detail:
title: Best of the Best tool for any kind of tracking
pros: JIRA is very very flexible and there is no end to the add-ons to improve the functionality or need. JIRA allows lot of customization. Hence, this was customize to used by a team who manages the deployments and version controlling. This usage is very different than the usual usage for issue tracking. These features makes the life very comfortable and it helps people at onsite and offshore collaborate well and communicate well.
cons: Sometime due to many option/boxes to fill for tracking, it make monotonous. This may confuse the first time users a lot. Mastering this tool is little difficult too.
author: Raghavendar

review_detail:
title: It does it all - then they add more for free
pros: I have been using the cloud version of JIRA for over 9 years. One of its best features is they keep expanding its capabilities and don't change the cost. Don't get me wrong the tool has always done what I expected it to do and done it well, but with each release the generally add some features and capabilities it did not have before. I love that they allow Kanban boards and sprints on the same project - if that's how you want to work. Super flexible, fast and easy to use, even when I'm doing Admin work that I don't do everyday and can't remember exactly how to do it. Additionally the tool has lots of add-ons - we use Tempo for time keeping and have used Gliffy in the past for diagramming. I'm not sure if
cons: My least favorite thing is that they have changed the interface several times while I have been using it. However each time after I spend time getting used to it I find their redesign to be significantly better. I really find this when I use locally hosted older versions and see what I used to do - I really realize how they improved it.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: JIRA : One of the software for project management.
pros: Task management. Bug tracking. Dashboard Watchers Attachments
cons: The size limit of the attachment is 20 MB. Sometimes there are multiple options, that are confusing so it will be better to have a quick demo.

review_detail:

It is then tracked by higher management using a dashboard. It is easy to use and has lot of option and we can define diff workflows for different type of tasks in jira

Thus, you can monitor the current status of your work. Also, we use it integrated with slack. We can see any action on Jira as a notification in slack.

review_detail:

pros: Disfruto gestionando el trabajo en proyectos y ayudando a las personas a trabajar juntas y colaborar en esos proyectos planificando y definiendo rápidamente las tareas de todos, así como el tiempo y el análisis. Por cierto, me encanta el diseño de tu suelo, es genial. Puedes ver todo en un solo lugar. Me encanta usar flujos de trabajo para automatizar procesos. Además, se analizan las limitaciones de tiempo y los retrasos en la ejecución del proyecto, así como el número de proyectos que se muestran mediante gráficos de barras. Ahora también está disponible en dispositivos móviles, por lo que es de fácil acceso.
cons: La plataforma de administración es muy clara, hay muchas formas de hacer cosas aparentemente simples, es difícil acostumbrarse a dónde configurarla y es fácil analizar la poderosa plataforma y el tiempo de espera para iniciar sesión. Trabajar. Sería un poco problemático si sigues usándolo.

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: It was a little tricky allowing our non-IT groups access, but there is a good chance that was an us issue & not a Jira issue.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

There are options to tag, highlight and prioritize tasks too, and the reporting tools are also very useful to stay in track and follow performance of different projects.

cons: Security features are not good once the ticket info is pasted to somewhere like Slack as it ignore security groups and post all jira tickets in project. But all together we don't have issues with this toolset.

review_detail:

cons: Il existe des solutions open source tout aussi efficace

review_detail:
title: Jira is a comprehensive product for better project management.
pros: There is alot things we have come to like about Jira after using it for close to 4 years now. Mostly, we find 8t very useful on how it gives us a shared workspace where we can easily connect and collaborate when going about our projects. It is great tool for planning and we are able to set timelines for our work to allow us complete projects as per the deadlines. It was easy to customize it and set it up into a way it conformed exactly to the solution we were looking for.
cons: Personally, i fail to find any specifics that i don't like about Jira since i have seen all its features work really well.
author: John

review_detail:
title: An exceptional management application tailored for the technology sector
pros: One of Jira's most outstanding features is its incredible versatility in terms of card and board sharing, as well as seamless integration with Slack. As you become acquainted with its diverse range of functions, you'll appreciate the ease with which you can generate reports, track project timelines, and more.
cons: Jira could benefit from enhancements in both its user interface (UI) and user experience (UX). At times, it might come across as somewhat plain or lacking depth. Regarding project settings, there's room for improvement, especially in streamlining the application of board configurations, task templates, and workflows, making these processes less complex for users.
author: Erick

review_detail:
title: The gift that is Jira
pros: Jira is not an insignificant piece of software. It's undoubtedly one of the best in terms of task and personnel management since I discovered it. It has facilitated communication within my team and synchronizes perfectly with my other work tools.
cons: Apart from the cost of certain features, I think Jira lives up to our expectations.
author: Georges

review_detail:
title: Jira : Best platform for Bug Tracking and Management
pros: JIRA is a fantastic project management tool and multi-project management tool. Business analysts can utilize JIRA to create user stories, which developers can then allocate to understand requirements and work on. After understanding the need, the tester can use the same ticket to attach the test case, test results, and supporting documentation, as well as to report their work.
cons: the application's robust reporting and analytics features, teams can monitor performance, analyze project KPIs, and make data-driven.

review_detail:
title: JIRA FOR PROJECT MANAGEMENT
pros: The ability to create custom fields allows me to track information that is important to my project. Workflows allow me to automate tasks and ensure that projects are completed to specifications. Reports provide me with an overview of project progress and help me identify areas that need attention.
cons: Cost: Jira is an expensive project management tool, especially for small teams. Complexity: Jira can be complex to learn and use, especially for teams that are not familiar with agile methodologies. Performance: Jira can be slow for teams with large amounts of data.

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: Jira's interface to be overwhelming or complex, especially for new users. Additionally, some users have reported issues with performance and responsiveness at times.
author: Ahmed

review_detail:
title: Eliminate Unnecessary Steps in User Onboarding Process
pros: Customizable workflows: Jira offers a flexible workflow system that can be tailored to fit the unique needs of a team or project.Agile project management: With its agile methodology and tools like scrum and kanban boards, Jira makes it easy to manage and prioritize tasks.Integration with other tools: Jira integrates seamlessly with other tools like Confluence, Bitbucket, and Trello, creating a comprehensive solution for managing software development.Powerful search capabilities: The advanced search feature in Jira allows users to easily find and filter issues based on multiple criteria, including custom fields and tags.Issue tracking: Jira's issue tracking system is comprehensive and enables users to track and manage issues throughout the entire software development process.Reporting: Jira offers a range of reporting options, including customizable dashboards and real-time progress reports, providing teams with valuable insights into their projects.
cons: Jira's open API and marketplace of add-ons and plugins allow users to extend the functionality of the platform to meet their specific needs. Jira's collaboration tools, like comments and notifications, make it easy for teams to communicate and work together, no matter where they are located.
author: Arpan

review_detail:
title: One Stop Project Management Tool
pros: JIRA is one of the best, simple, and user friendly project management tool. We have been working for almost 3 years now and the user experience it offers is applaudable. You can create your agile boards for scrums and can go KANBAN as well. You can create as many different teams and squads. Link your issues to stories and trace it to the feature, Track how much effort is being spent on an item; Track for how long an item has been been sitting idle; Prioritize your issues, backlogs; Create dashboards for ease and convenience; generate reports, traceability matrix, velocity burndown charts; add/remove user access. You can customize it as per requirement and with ease. Recently it has moved to cloud, so down time has been relevantly decreased which is an added bonus. Best part I like about using JIRA is that its very easy to handle, we can do bulk update on items and it takes very less time to understand. This is one of the best tools that is out there and I believe almost every organization is using it.
cons: There is nothing much to add in this section. Practically I am all thumbs up for JIRA. I have a suggestion though. JIRA needs to have a Instant Messaging option enabled so that an organizations do not need to look out for a separate tool. I think if Atlassian would be able to achieve it, not only they would be able to enhance their customer base but they would be able bring a lot revenue.
author: Divayanshu

review_detail:
title: Jira- A must have for software development
pros: Jira is a very powerful tools to track tasks for your team, create bugs and track them. The fact that it is very customizable really helps having only the important information you want for a specific project.
cons: Since it is a very powerful tools and very customizable, it is also hard to learn everything you can do on your own. You must follow tutorial or classes to make sure you use it at its full potential.
author: Vincent

review_detail:
title: Great PM and Ticket management tool
pros: Jira is very great for project and task management. It provides lot of flexibility around custom fields and reports. The easy to use reporting functionalities allow to have one simple view across multiple projects and initiatives
cons: While the interface is simple to use.. it feels very simple. Our users are not very adaptive to Jira as it doesn't have jazzy UX. It's not clean and modern looking like other alternatives out there.
author: Viral

review_detail:
title: The "Ticket or No Ticket" Debate
pros: The best part about JIRA is the ability to keep track of all work being done via tickets. I love that JIRA works for all kinds of styles of work. We work within an Agile environment, with some teams using Scrum and other teams using Kanban. No matter how the team is structured, they utilize JIRA tickets. This is great because there is a single repository for all work being done and we can easily search for tickets across all the different teams. The use of Epics vs. Stories is very easy too. We can keep track of what tickets belong to which effort with ease and show the progress of work through the tickets. We can also easily maintain a backlog of tickets. If two separate people submit a similar ticket (or at least two tickets that reference the same work effort), we can combine those tickets easily so that we aren't feeling overwhelmed with more tickets than actual work.
cons: The biggest debate among our team members is when it is necessary to create a ticket. JIRA has created a culture of needing to log every little thing, even if it takes just a moment to complete the work. Sometimes, it takes longer to create the ticket than to complete the task at hand. That tells me there is too much reliance on JIRA to report work completed. It causes some in management to show that their department is succeeding simply by the number of tickets completed. But the tickets don't tell the whole story, especially because there isn't a time component to those tickets being completed.
author: Joshua

review_detail:
title: JIRA - The monolith everyone uses
pros: JIRA is an industry standard tool, due to this it's very well known and a colloquial metaphor for "tickets" in and of itself. JIRA is able to handle monolithic projects and the many related projects with regard to them. JIRA is very good at allowing and automatically building self-referencing tickets within it's comments and ticket parts, if you put a ticket title into a ticket it will automatically reference the actual ticket with a link. It is also very good at adding to existing tickets with related tasks, sub-tasks, and prioritization. JIRA also is considered in almost every third party tool with a massive volume of software that offers "JIRA plugins" considering it's high stature with the IT community.
cons: JIRA is "the tool" but it's not "a good tool" for every project and company size. JIRA is like other commercial grade products that just aren't designed for simple day to day use. While it opens up nicely and begins to make tons of sense in larger projects, larger organizations, and larger teams it often doesn't show the same beauty with simple projects and day to day ticket tracking. Additionally, the JQL language is ridiculous follows in the foot steps of many other proprietary languages that are only great for constant users of JIRA. While that's the implied scenario because as mentioned JIRA is "the tool" it's not always the case. When my day is split 20 ways, I have little time to sit down and do more than plug in a JIRA ticket number to get to the issue to investigate, review, get sign off on a fix, and apply. JIRA is also having what appears to be a lot of difficulties this year staying online with their new data center providers. I don't remember ever having these issues prior to their most recent move.
author: Michael

review_detail:
title: Mandatory tool for a good management of your project.
pros: The ability to connect with other systems and automate processes is also a great feature that saves time and improves team productivity. Overall, Jira Software is a reliable and user-friendly tool that can be easily adapted to any team's needs.
cons: Jira can have a lot of features that may not be necessary for some teams or projects, which can make it difficult to navigate and find the specific tools that they need.
author: Javier

review_detail:
title: A Review of the Jira Reporting Tool for Agile Environments
pros: Jira's versatility is something I really like. This makes for a real impact on keeping all the pieces current and easy to maintain. When I use another PM program, I like the built-in support for Fix Versions the most. The ability to attach a fix version to each sprint and build makes it simple to examine all of the tasks and issues in a whole release or a single build. This leads to an easy integration to other tools needed to help monitor and report on the project's activities.
cons: I have no strong dislikes because it includes a number of features that are really beneficial when communicating with team members on project stories. The most important thing I've learned is that individual pieces must be kept current or else the other dependent elements will become out of synch. It's simple to use and integrate with other business systems.

It is also very successful that it can integrate with Microsoft teams.

author: anil kumar

review_detail:
title: Minimalist, easy to use, feature rich and easily integrable
pros: Jira is a defacto project management tool in most companies, given its agile oriented layouts of Kanban, and recently introduced Gantt and Timeline views. Task assignation, subtasks, stories, time estimation are easy and even new hires can easily onboard and use it effectively. My favorite was its super clean sync with Slack and its fast alert system, so that any assigned tasks, deadlines and updates would never get missed, even with my team working across different time zones.
cons: JIRA has numerous free alternatives, and tbh, I find it slightly overpriced in a competitive market. While my company pays for the official tool that we use, I am usually unable to use JIRA for my personal projects since the free tier limits are very small. I really think JIRA should create a personal project plan that would allow access to some of their services for free/much more reduced cost.
author: Dushyant

review_detail:
title: Best-in-class and Reliable Project Management Companion
pros: 1) Integrate seamlessly with development tools like Slack, Github, or Bitbucket. 2) Workspace is very configurable; you may customize the components of each task on your board, as well as create your own icons, labels, and automated processes. 3) Connect all issues/tasks to Epics and view the anticipated outcomes in the Product Roadmap. 4) It offers the flexibility of a kanban board, which provides the user with a clearer view of what has been accomplished, what is in process, and what remains. 5) User story statuses may be used to monitor progress and control workflows. 6) Allows for bulk import of epics and user stories, which speeds up administrative duties if this information was previously recorded in another format, such as CSV.
cons: 1) Only internal users may be allocated to tasks and user stories. This might result in unnecessarily long delays when external users want immediate input or participation. 2) When many boards exist within a project, statuses (user stories) cannot be established explicitly for each board. 3) User stories may be assigned to just two categories of users: assignees and reporters. JIRA does not permit the assignment of numerous assignees to a single user story.
author: Meraz

review_detail:
title: Jira is a top platform for issue management and tickets for the company
pros: The issue management is, for me, the best part of Jira. It allows the organisation to raise up topics, follow them and close them, adding pictures or text and even tagging people for answers. The ticket feature is also very interesting and it works very good.
cons: The platform is that powerful that at the beginning it can overwhelm you, a short introduction or training I think is needed. Once you know the most important features, you are all set.

If you are an agile shop---it's the go to tool for collaboration and getting your teams effectively working on a small increment of workable software product. Easy to add epics, easy to link epics to user stories and tasks to user stories.

pros: I love the backlog planning feature as well as the reporting features. It is easy to use compared to some of the agile project management apps I've used before.
cons: I Do not find the project pages feature very useful for now. I also feel that they could have had a ready integration with Accelo. Integration to our current business process was okay.
author: Granville

review_detail:
title: It works, but...
pros: JIRA certainly has a lot of features that should make Project Management easy. The mobile app is adequate, and the web site works well enough. There are a whole lot of places to enter data, which ends up being a bit of a downfall. When JIRA is set up well, it does support PM. When it is used as a vanilla Agile product, I think it falls behind other offerings.
cons: JIRA has so many configuration points that it takes forever to get it working properly for your team. They have also been changing the UI a lot recently, which has obscured where some data is, which - predictably - has slowed down our use. If JIRA could get a more consistent UI, I feel it could be a much better product.
author: Robert

review_detail:
title: Advanced Project & Task Management Features...But How It's Configured is Key to Success
pros: I've been using Atlassian products, JIRA in particular, for over 12 years. It's come a long ways in this span in terms of advanced functionality and additional configurable content, and it's consistently proven itself as a market leader in project and task management services. JIRA reporting, dashboard, task tracking, and project development activities are comprehensively impressively designed, easy to use, and highly collaborative for internal teams.
cons: The success an end user will yield from the software is highly dependent on it being configured in a manner that aligns with the business needs of the customer organization. For example, I've experienced instances where there are growing pains in how internal teams learn to standardize the way they tag tickets for project and task tracking and then use these identifiers to develop reports, create dashboards, and track schedules. If not setup properly by System Administrators then the ROI will be delayed, making it essential for teams to be properly educated and trained on the system. JIRA provides a wealth of content for training & education but worth noting the difficulty an organization can face if not approached strategically and with strong design plans during the discovery phase of implementation.
author: Brad

review_detail:

pros: This product is great for tracking a project, what issues need work, how much time is expected to work, even story point voting. Every type of issue you wish to track, whether for software development, or for work within other potions of a company, can be tracked in this tool.
