review_detail:
title: Jira Software Review
pros: There are a lot of good features I have come across when using this software. Some of them being:1. Prioritization - Very Easy to classify certain types of Tickets raised through Jira if they are Critical, Medium or low priority. Definitely helps to Manage on what issues need to be looked at urgently and Manage the tickets so they get completed on time. 2. Editing/Updating Features - Very easy to update the fields in the Tickets if there is an error. A thoughtful feature. Even allows to update the people who log the tickets on the progress. 3. Easy to Use - Very user friendly. When I was first introduced to the software I was skeptical on how to use it but after 1 day it was very very easy. Did not face any issues and always kept whatever was assigned to me up to date and ensured they got completed on Time.4. Collaboration - Makes it very easy to Collab with colleagues if your working on something and need their views or expertise.
cons: I have not faced much challenges when using Jira, but some additional things that can be improved are: 1. Issue Type - There should be a better issue type system that could come in Place. There are some issues which come up but the issue types which are available make it confusing on which type of issue to assign it as.

I also love the new ability to filter comments in different timelines, which helps with figuring out where we are in the QA process. We heavily use Confluence (sister product?) for a MASSIVE documentation effort and it has been amazing - from a company with limited documentation to one where we have it all it has been revolutionary to our processes, and Jira/Confluence gave us that.

One major example of this is the kanban board which is good for product managers as well as the engineers who work on a project. It helps our teams stay on track and beat deadlines for releases. In addition, as a tech support administrator, I can submit issues and provide context and severity for the engineers and product managers to consider.
cons: For those of us that do not like kanban, there is a limited amount of alternative "views", which isn't enough for some of our employees. Next, the learning curve can be a challenge for some of our new employees and users (the UI is confusing for example)

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: Certains utilisateurs trouvent que l’interface de Jira peut être complexe et difficile à naviguer, surtout pour les nouveaux utilisateurs. Une amélioration de l’interface pour la rendre plus conviviale serait bénéfique, bien que la personnalisation de l’utilisateur soit une solution possible, cela peut causer des problèmes.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Jira - Gestion de tickets

cons: Le fait de rentrer dans le détail du ticket pour en suivre l'avancée - perte de contact humain dans la gestion hotline
author: Matthieu

review_detail:
title: Jira - A unique system that provides an advanced overview.
pros: Jira allows users to track all tasks from project start to finish. It allows users to easily see at what step in project each team is on and which tasks have been completed. With just a glance, it can be set-up to show the flow of processes for all project team members. The ability to assign which section of the flow belongs to which team can be mapped out and easily communicated. It also allows for team members to easily see any gaps or missing steps in the flow.
cons: Jira allows users to look at all the detail in data and the system needs to be set up with filters that will work for users by a team member that knows the system well.
author: Jennifer

review_detail:
title: The best project management tool
pros: Jira has an exemplary user interface and is very easy to use. It has many functionalities, from tracking tickets, work progress and planning workflow. Searching is fantastic, especially with the use of JQL. It also supports integration with many valuable applications like GitHub and X-ray which makes it more fun to use
cons: Jira web pages tend to be a bit slower as compared to other websites, according to my observation. In the future, they could allow people to delete issues they created themselves and not need admin permissions for that.
author: EBENEZER

review_detail:
title: Jira helps professionalize your business
pros: • Jira is a powerful tool for a predominantly agile organizations; you can easily set up a scrum or kanban board and get to work. • The reporting functions are relatively strong compared to many competing tools, especially through Advanced Roadmaps in the Premium plan. • Through the app marketplace and integration with other software, even more flexibility is added. • Jira is relatively easy to use, even for non-techies.
cons: Because there are so many features, there is still a bit of a learning curve. Like with any tool, users will need to invest in it to make the most of it.
author: Marc

review_detail:
title: Makes working from home incident raising a breeze
pros: Effective at raising and resolving issues

cons: its confugiration is a bit complex. And Sometimes its UI is also not very much friendly

review_detail:

cons: It gets a bit complex once you reach a number of different projects and boards. A more linear interface might be better to make everything more navigable.

review_detail:
title: More effective project management and monitoring
pros: I appreciate that it's straightforward to set up, can be customized to fit any team's needs, and integrates with a wide variety of apps (from chat rooms like Slack to customer relationship management systems like Salesforce). simple, simple, simple, with a variety of dashboards and views to accommodate any team's needs.
cons: The configuration process is not my favorite, and it could prove to be rather difficult for my team. There's also room for improvement in the user interface (UI), as it's not always reliable and can be frustratingly slow at times.

review_detail:

cons: Toutefois, malgré sa simplicité,il faudrait à toute personne n'ayant jamais utilisé un logiciel du genre une formation préalable avant de pouvoir l'utiliser. Jira bugue aussi parfois.

Our solution required a couple of custom fields and I was able to set them up in my board very easily. The same applies to workflows and dashboards so this saves a lot of time for us as Scrum Masters when setting up the Jira project from scratch.
cons: Nothing related to the tool, we have been using Jira for more than 5 years and never thought of migrating to anything else.

review_detail:
title: Best tool for project management
pros: I love how powerful this tool is. It has been very easy to use and learn. I also love their pricing.
cons: I do not have anything bad to talk about Jira. It has been the best. I have used it for more than two years.
author: Jocelyn

review_detail:
title: Jira is the working greatly
pros: With Jira everything is possible. It is very simple to manage and organize my projects. It also allows integration of other tools.
cons: So far so good. I have nothing bad to talk about Jira. It is now more than two years and it has been working well.
author: Hammond

review_detail:
title: Keeps my team on track
pros: With Jira, I can have a granular view of team velocity and pin point bottlenecks in the cycle. This has fit well into our agile workflow and enables everyone to be on the same page of what comes next.
cons: JQL for custom queries is a little bit of a pill to digest using the search filter logic, though. During sprint retros I had to double check filters often.
author: Mohammad

review_detail:
title: Best in the market
pros: It is built for teams in a very realistic way. For example, it allows us to do standups, to organize our work in active sprints, etc.
cons: There should be more transparency on all the changes made to a ticket. Sometimes it is hard to track who made what changes.
author: Sheen

review_detail:
title: Made a notable impact on the way we report, manage and track bugs to resolution
pros: We've been using Jira Software for the past few months. First of all, it's pretty good tool for tracking and managing tasks, but there are a few things that could be improved. One thing I really like about Jira is the ability to create detailed tasks and sub-tasks. It helps in breaking down our monthly goals and KPIs into manageable pieces. This makes it easier to track progress, assignments and stay updated on the overall completion stats. Everyone has visibility into what they need to do and when. . It can be frustrating when you're in a hurry and the page takes forever to load. I've heard from some colleagues that this is a common issue, so I hope they improve the performance soon. The integration with other tools is great. We use Slack and Intercom, and the way Jira connects with these tools is really convenient. It makes communication much smoother.
cons: I found the interface to be a bit overwhelming at first. There's so many features and options that it was confusing for me at times. It took me a while to get the hang of it, and I had to read up docs (which were not so easy to understand) on how to use the Jira automation feature. Maybe it would be better if they simplified the layout a bit. Another thing that I found annoying is the speed. Sometimes, Jira can be really slow, especially when you're dealing with large projects like ours.
author: Manjunatha

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: What I like the most with Jira is managing project. They have a lot of visualisation tools which makes it easy to keep track.
cons: I think that the UI could be improved, sometimes hard to find tasks/projects.
author: Gaelle

review_detail:
title: JIRA is second to none when it comes to team task tracking
pros: Good at task management within an agile team
cons: Setup can be complex and pricing could be better
author: Torlock

review_detail:
title: Very usefull tool for everyday project management
pros: Jira Atlassian is one of the most usefull tools on the market. It has so many functionnalities that are easy to understand.
cons: I don't have any negative reviews to say about Jira Atlassian. The tool is necessary for everyday work in the organization.
author: Andy

review_detail:
title: JIRA is great for IT projects based on agile methodology
pros: I like how easy it was to work with tasks and backlog, check team performance with calculated metrics and see project progress.
cons: I needed some time to get used to and navigate UI because JIRA has a lot of modules to explore, which might be complicated if person doesn't have enough access permissions.
author: Mariia

review_detail:
title: Jira: Essential Tool for MLOps with Room for Improvement
pros: As an MLOps engineer, I have found Jira to be an invaluable tool in managing machine learning projects and workflows. One of the standout features is its powerful project management capabilities, which align perfectly with agile methodology — a necessity in the fast-paced world of machine learning.
cons: As an MLOps engineer, I've identified several drawbacks of Jira. The steep learning curve can slow onboarding for new users, and its extensive features may feel overwhelming for smaller projects. Occasional performance issues, such as lag, can hinder productivity, and there are customization limitations that frustrate efforts to adapt workflows.
author: Rajvardhan

review_detail:
title: Review on Jira Task Management Tool
pros: I am able to work on the Scrum model for my team and am able to customize the workflows to fit the diverse team needs. I am able to integrate it with other tools like Confluence, bitbucket, perforce, and other internal tools boosting effectiveness. I am able to track performance of my team who is working on what task and how effective as a team we are working. Enabling deadlines and assigning tasks and providing signoffs.
cons: It would like it to track the PR approvals on bitbucket and then mark status automatically. Just like how it works with Perforce.
author: Anish

review_detail:
title: Jira, un outil incontournable des teams produits mais complexe

cons: La complexité d'utilisation, l'outil est très complet et trop complexe à utiliser techniquement. Il m'oblige à demander à des personnes sachantes de paramétrer mes boards / Kanban lorsque j'en ai besoin. La prise en main n'est vraiment pas évidente en comparaison à des outils comme Trello ou Notion

review_detail:
title: Manage projects and team work
pros: Nira is very helpful for tracking the project enhancement as well as bug. And for every type of tickets we can set workflow of tickets Move. And also apply validation of required fields Nd most important you can create custom text box as per requirement and can setup automation on fields. Jira is very good for managing your project.
cons: It consumes lots of resources of you PC means if we open it in browser ram and cpu utilisation increases due to this pc performance reduces. Rest all good.
author: Pinki

review_detail:
title: Personal experience with JIRA
pros: It is helpful in doing needful planning of a sprint with respect to software development and making the entire process agile in nature. We can create issue, task, story with story point that helps in managing deadlines.
cons: Sometimes workflow diagram does not behave properly.
author: Salil

review_detail:
title: Jira a valuable tool in project management
pros: What i like most about jira is mutiple user possibilities. It flow chat allows easy communication with stakeholders
cons: There always room for improvememt but at the moment i am 100% happy with jira
author: Oladotun

review_detail:
title: Excellent for Agile Project Management
pros: Managing workflows via the backlog and kanban boards is very easy-to-use and highly customizable to fit any organizations needs. The level of customization that Jira allows makes it an essential tool for project and team management. The user-interface is great out-of-the-box as well.
cons: The out-of-the-box reporting functionality isn't particularly robust, which means lots of manual or third-party reporting options would need to be employed.
author: Vondrae

review_detail:
title: Im tired of the constant changes
pros: I used to love JIRA and we migrated almost everything it is about our business to a JIRA workflow. It a very complicated and configurable app which is awesome. You can really set it up for literally everything. BUT... it will take a lot of time to set it right and your employees better be young and computer savy because it's as complicated for them as it is to set up.
cons: And here is why im moving away from JIRA. They constantly change it. They change the UI from one place to another w/o warning and I live trying to figure out where everything is. IT takes me hours to setup and by the time I have to make a change (could be months right?) everything about the UI changed. So now I have to waste time figuring out where they moved buttons I knew ... and then retrain some employees that arent really young and quick learners.
author: Francisco

review_detail:
title: Excellent Project Management Tool - JIRA
pros: - Jira has the most critical features that every small to enterprise companies use to manage project management, application development, time tracking, workflow automation for various business use-cases, integrations with external applications like Copado (CI/CD) tool for Salesforce - Jira has very important usage in our company. All the teams uses Jira to manage all the deliverables and for tracking project management, feature releases, etc.
cons: - The pricing of jira can be cheaper when compared to other alternate solutions available in the market - The support of Jira can be more available in all times to resolve critical issues - The UI can be more customized to better fit every customer needs without lot of overhead time
author: Santosh

review_detail:
title: Simplify Team Collaboration And Help To Track Any Issues In Project Management
pros: It is simple to organize activities and monitor progress because the tool can be customized to meet the unique requirements of each project. Users always have access to a complete view of the status of their projects thanks to a wide variety of tracking tools, including Gantt charts and dashboards. An excellent visualization for analyzing data and other information is provided by various dashboard views. Making projects, epics, tasks, issues, and other things is simple.
cons: There are many resources that need to be upgraded, and the Jira mobile application itself needs to be updated. If JIRA offered "suggestions" while creating Gherkin lines, it would be beneficial.
author: Udit

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: From my point of view, we find the best project management tool now, we can assign tickets to anyone and also we can track issues with our tickets, the ticket is basically worked on a project which makes updates about the project status, and has many tools for project management and has many too about customization also, we can also report another person for ticket and assign ticket bout issue ad also we can chat on separate ticket also so this all thing make jira different and must be recommended
cons: For your info, jira is not a free tool for tracking this project information we need to pay for this, other things need us to take a little time, that's it no other issue with jira and hose are not an issue just info about it
author: Krunal

review_detail:
title: Run effective scrum and kanban boards for development projects !
pros: JIRA helps to run critical development projects using agile methodology . The JIRA helps you with various metrics such as burn down charts , velocity of the sprint etc. , which is key for any projects. It also helps you to inherit the best practice the scrum or kamban follows.
cons: The API integration of JIRA to integrate with other application can be tricky . The better documentation could help the users here!
author: Madhankkumar

review_detail:
title: Nothing better than jira
pros: Helps in planning entire roadmap And daily management of scrum calls. Also helps in managing entire team ETA cycle
cons: No integration with mixpanel sometimes feel little handicapped but its fine on overall experience since we use GA
author: Puneet

review_detail:
title: Must-have project management tool.. also for marketing teams!
pros: As a team, we adopted Agile Marketing. Jira helps us a lot with our marketing planning, Kanban boards, collaboration on our tasks - sharing and commenting, checking the progress and more. It is very easy to use and customize. The reporting section is great for more insights and to see the bigger picture.
cons: Not sure if it is a big deal for non-tech users/teams but JIra doesn't have Gantt chart by default. You can easily get one in the marketplace but you need top pay for it. The recent price push for the cloud version was impactful but still a good value for this app.
author: Faruk

review_detail:
title: Indispensable para los proyectos agiles
pros: Me encanta y recomiendo Jira al 100%, lo que más me gusta y utilizo a diario es el tablero para estar actualizada de cómo vamos como equipo (saber si me asignaron una tarea, actualizar el estado de mi tarea esta, y así mismo poder saber cómo van los otros miembros del equipo con sus tareas, si surgió algún bloqueante, si vamos acorde a los tiempos planteados. El tener mi propia etiqueta de rol donde solo muestre mis tareas es genial pues me permite enfocarme mejor. también se agradece la integración con otras herramientas como confluente (esta la usamos para tener toda la documentación del proyecto). sin duda tiene muchas opciones necesarias para hacer un buen seguimiento del proyecto.
cons: debería mejorarse el performance pues cuando se llega a una gran cantidad de proyectos (más de 500 en el caso de mi compañía) la herramienta presenta demoras en cargar todo el contenido, pero es entendible por dicha cantidad, en mi caso personal lo que hago es dejar la página cargando unos segundos y listo.
author: Geraldine

review_detail:
title: A strong tool
pros: As someone who is not a developer but needs to know what they're working on, Jira is very strong. I can easily see what the development board looks like, as well as view work that individual development teams are working on.
cons: Sometimes I believe Jira is a little hard to navigate as someone who is not in the product all day, every day, but that would be my only criticism. It's a big one, though. I want to quickly see what's going on, not have to dig and find it. That could just be how we have it setup, though!
author: Maggie

review_detail:
title: It is good enough to track daily operations
pros: I like how there are options for scrum board or kanban board, where you can choose whichever you prefer based on the management method you use with your team. Every time I've introduced this tool to a new team, I had to have 15 min quick overview of how to use it after I set them up, but most of the people get it right away. I like how it follows the scrum and kanban methodology, with points, sprints, backlog, burndown feature, etc, it works well for the team who's trying to implement the scrum or kanban method to their work.
cons: When I work on a bigger and longer project, I still need to create a Gantt chart but Jira's Gantt chart feature is very basic that there is no way for me to track details of the project. So I usually have to use different tools for the detailed Gantt chart along with Jira's scrum board to track work for each sprint. I also had a hard time duplicating tickets between two scrum boards, when a task belongs to two separate projects and needs to be tracked by both boards with both audiences.
author: Asami Furugaki

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: it is useful for project management and implementing agile method
cons: visual content for easy use should be introduce
author: Samuel

review_detail:
title: Jira the professional management software
pros: Very easy to setup new projects, views, boards and board columns. Customizable through the use of tags, columns and team management. Once set up, it’s easy for the team to understand what the tasks at hand and for the team manager to assign task.
cons: Sometimes opening task in the browser can be slow. Poor support for rtl languages. Working on tasks in backlog screen is cumbersome (the view is too small).
author: Harel

review_detail:
title: The best task management platform for any department
pros: We use Jira for task management. People from other departments always register their requests/issues on Jira, this helps our team to understand our tasks much more clearly. We have been using Jira for several years, and it is inseparable for our line of duty (IT dept). The best thing is that Jira provides a centralized platform where we can see our tasks, deadlines, and priorities.
cons: So far there is nothing particular that I do not like about Jira, since it is highly customizable. The biggest concern that I have for Jira is its reporting features. It would be great to have some KPI measurements prebuilt in Jira, so that we do not have to do it ourselves.
author: Mariam

review_detail:
title: JIRA - A fantastic project management tool.
pros: I adore the user interface; it is incredibly intuitive, For being kind and justifiable, I adore it for allowing me to be organised and complete my tasks and projects all of these reasons. Many different functionalities. On a fundamental level, it is logical. several options for modification and adaptation. Connecting to other apps is comparatively simple.
cons: Jira lacks an auto-refresh function. The user must reload the website in order to see the most recent Jira ticket update. In the event that a user types a mistake into the search field, the search function should be improved. The cost per user is the sole drawback, in my opinion. At first, it seems affordable, but as usage increases, the cost benefit decreases and robustness is lost.
author: Swapnil

review_detail:
title: Finest application for the Agile software lifecycle
pros: Easy to create Agile dashboards to track bugs in different development life cycle. We can also extract informations regarding the user specific tickets created and worked for any period of time. Also we can attache documents to gives an entire idea about the the bugs and time tracker in comment section provides how much time it takes to fix the bugs. In the software industry JIRA is one of the widely used Bug tracking platform. The idea of classification of tickets like EPIC,Task are very useful to identify the work load needed for that ticket.
cons: Need exact date and time of the ticket creation and comments when the ticket gets older, right now it describes like the ticket is "created more two weeks ago". JIRA also needs to integration with CICD tools for more information regarding the bug tracking and fixing. JIRA should provide a dashboard for each user how much time he worked on a ticket to track the overall work time and also it will be very easy for the Administrator also.
author: Ajesh

review_detail:
title: Project Management for Everyone
pros: With its simplicity JIRA can be used by all kind of users Engineers, IT, HR, Finance. I have seen its growth from bug traking to kanban to scrum and now business projects. No other tool has this simplicity and versatility.
cons: limitation of scheduling, roadmap and timesheet.
author: Vinod

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: This software features a simple, intuitive user interface that lets you create and plan both short- and long-term projects. It also features a number of customization functions
cons: I didn't find any drawbacks, especially as the price seems affordable, so it's fine.
author: Frusquin

review_detail:
title: Been using JIRA for years
pros: Having used JIRA on prem, then on demand, then service desk and service management, both as a client, and vendor, including project setup and training, I think it has all you could ask for. Once you're familiar with the UI, you're good to go. It's highly customisable. Great NFP offering
cons: With permissions, screens, schemes, and custom fields, there can be some complexity. I'd be surprised if anyone implements it without at least one add-on
author: Bridie

review_detail:
title: A robust application that can be used for everything from task management to software development
pros: Jira has a weekly release schedule which means the product is always being improved or changed. This is usually a good thing, although I will admit that sometimes it isn't. Jira is also incredibly functional for a broad range of use cases, from managing a simple to-do list, team task tracking, process automation, to software development. They do a good job of making it user friendly and easy to onboard, especially since they started making drastic UI improvements a little over a year ago.
cons: A consequence of being capable of so much is that it can be hard to configure initially. More specifically, which features you need and which can be disabled. There are a lot of great features but some just complicate the workflow, and it usually takes time to figure this out.
author: Brandon

review_detail:
title: Ottimo strumento di collaborazione
pros: Le funzionalità di base sono molto intuitive e di facile utilizzo per l'utente.
cons: L'integrazione con gli altri sistemi è complessa e va fatta mediante costom. L'assistenza è presente ma lascia poca knowhow all'utente che dipende dall'assistenza per ogni richiesta.
author: Antonietta

review_detail:
title: Jira: Solución económica para centralizar información de compañías y seguimiento de proyectos
pros: La centralización de la información que maneja la empresa.
cons: La única aplicación que permite exportar datos Google Drive de manera sencilla, los arrastra en formato plano lo cual no permite visualizar de manera agradable la información debido a que en los reportes que se hacen en nuestra compañía, usualmente se comparten imágenes, links o archivos PDF que no logran incrustrarse de manera correcta, además no es un proceso automatizado sino que se deben pulsar varios comandos para poder sincronizar los datos. Sería genial pudieran encontrar un método para poder exportar esa base de datos de manera más sencilla y con un diseño de fácil acceso visual y de esa manera poder filtrar los datos.
author: Laura

review_detail:
title: The Gold Standard for Issue Tracking
pros: JIRA feels like the gold standard for ticketing software, and for good reason. It has a long history, and lots of buy-in throughout multiple industries. It helps to keep individuals and teams organized, plan out resourcing, and provides an easy to access historical record of bugs/issues/projects.
cons: One thing that's often difficult is the ability to create recurring tickets for issues/projects that occur on a regular cadence. You can clone existing tickets which works, but it's not exactly efficient. There's also a bit of a general learning curve - creative views and dashboards is possible, but it's not as intuitive as some of the drag-and-drop competitors that are popping up.
author: Craig

review_detail:
title: JIRA provides essential tools for creating, tracking, and deployment new applications!
pros: I like that most of the features of JIRA are quite intuitive. When I started using JIRA as a tech support specialist, I was able to easily utilize everything I needed to create bug tickets without needing specialized training. As a project manager now, I have had to review more detailed documentation to use the more complex features and tools, but application development is quite complex in itself so that's definitely understandable and expected.
cons: The thing I like the least with JIRA is that when you're managing tickets within sprints or backlogs, some features are only available within one specific view. For example, you can't clone a ticket within the backlog view, you have to open the individual ticket for the cloning option to appear. It's hard to remember which options are available within a specific view. I'd like JIRA better if options were more universal but I do understand why certain operations are limited to certain views.
author: Jason

review_detail:
title: Jira - Strongest and Flexible tool for Project Management with best user experience
pros: Few of the strongest and highlighted features as per my usage statistics - Test Execution ReportSprint Planning and Task Management ToolUser experience is so flexible and implementing the same is quite easy for mid and big size project Performance of tool is simply awesome with minimal or no performance glitches
cons: As of now I can't think of any feature but certainly would recommend to have mobile version for this application. I believe it will certainly help the respective users to be more in connect by the time they are not available on their respective computers/laptops
author: Gulshan

review_detail:
title: Scrum master
pros: It is easy to use for regular scrum activities. I would expect jira to become one stop shop for all agile activities.
cons: Many improvements are possible. 1. Ability to host and track retro for a team . 2. Easy integration with outlook whereby if we send email to a I’d it should put comments in jira 3. Ability to put meeting recording 4. Ability to generate custom reports
author: Sudarshana

review_detail:
title: Jira is a good software development tool
pros: Jira is developed for software developers and agile teams that need to work in an iterative way to complete their work. This is great for me, as my team is very agile and this tool lines up with our needs.
cons: Jira isn’t incredibly intuitive at first and takes some getting used to.
author: Max

review_detail:
title: Jira the task management platform for professionals
pros: The most important feature the kept us on JIRA for years would have to be the task management in between projects. With the ability to have dashboards to see across projects it is critical to our weekly sprints.
cons: The thing I like least about this software would have to come down to speed. Sometimes we want to edit and move tasks fast in sprints and it never moves as fast as we want it to.
author: Cody

review_detail:
title: La mejor solución para trabajar en proyectos complejos
pros: Me encanta su flexibilidad, que se adapta fácilmente a cualquier forma de trabajo en equipo. Su interfaz limpia y minimalista también ayuda mucho.
cons: Quizá la curva de aprendizaje es algo alta. Tiene tantas funciones que puede ser un poco abrumador al principio. Se necesita tiempo y estudio si se quieren exprimir todas sus posibilidades.
author: Juliana

review_detail:
title: The Go-to Agile Management Tool for the Enterprise
pros: We began our Jira journey years ago and have been using the tool successfully for just as long. As a team taking on Agile methodology in an enterprise where is was a very new concept, we needed a tool that was easy to learn, intuitive to manage and one that provided integration with extensions for our Agile ceremonies. Jira provided all of these things at an affordable price that has kept us working at a large scale enterprise level for many years. Navigation is simple, intuitive and while there is a small learning curve, most of our new team members have been able to pick up on things within the first few months. As our team's ScrumMaster and Product Owner, I enjoy using this tool to manage sprints and stories and generally never have to wrestle with the tool to make it do what I want it to do.
cons: The only drawback I have had with this tool is that sometime extension/plugin management can be a pain, wherein it is tough to locate what you have overall and how it is costing you. We've also had issues with duplicate versions of the same extension/plugin that led us to Jira support, which does leave a bit to be desired as it took a while to arrive at a resolution.
author: Nick

review_detail:
title: Excellent Business software for using as a ticketing tool
pros: This software is so easy to understand and use that some times it seems that I am working in my local machine in word file locally installed.
cons: Frankly, there is nothing we could say that we don't like or like least about this software. This software is the best for usage as a ticketing tool in Business.
author: vikas

review_detail:
title: A powerful tool for a number of different users.
pros: Jira is a great and user-friendly tool that supports a number of different use cases. If you want to simply have a Kanban board with basic tasks, you can do it. If you want to dive deeper into the world of Scrum, you can also significantly improve the way you categorize and estimate ideas and product management tasks. The number of integrations available also makes it the best tool out there for all kinds of workflows.
cons: Jira can be used in many ways and is infinitely flexible, it is possible to go down a rabbit hole of trying to use too many features and learning how each individual team uses it can be challenging. Aside from that, I find it to be a great tool.
author: Sebastian

review_detail:
title: The Best Tool For Agile-Focused Businesses !!
pros: First and foremost, one of the most important elements for me is the ease with which I can monitor all of the activities or difficulties linked to the project. Second, you may produce a statistics report from Jira at any moment to examine the project's overall performance. We may also provide the member the option of establishing a certain sort of job. As a result, we may block members from generating task kinds that they are not permitted to create.
cons: When it comes to Jira's drawbacks, I can mention that it may be overly complicated for beginning users. There are also a limited amount of gadgets accessible in Jira; thus, I believe that additional gadgets should be supported.
author: Kunal

review_detail:
title: A powerful Agile Project Management Platform & tool for Managing your Work
pros: The best and most useful of all its capabilities is the ability to smoothly and seamlessly manage our projects in a very detailed and well organized manner. It makes life easy by helping you stay on top of your epics, stories, tasks and issues at all times.
cons: It fulfils all our requirements and is great in terms or flexibility and availability of features, however, it would be great if the UI or UX could be made even more simpler and the integrations of popular platforms, for example ServiceNow, with Jira, could be deployed more quickly and with least efforts.
author: Hazbar

review_detail:
title: In teams, jIRA is used to organize and automate collaboration.
pros: JIRA is a highly complex and dynamic system that can be used to map all, even the most complex, tasks in projects in teams without the use of programming. As a result, all task-related processes can be created and tracked at the granular level. Workflow functions, as well as the concept of roles and rights, help with task management and ensure that the process runs smoothly. Jira can be integrated with any team tool, making it your primary source of information. The advantage stems from the documentation produced, which is primarily used for task distribution, management, and tracking. Time can be tracked and accounted for, as can projects. Everyone keeps a time log and records their questions, answers, workarounds, and other details.
cons: Sometimes it is difficult to see the full complexity of a solution, which is all possible. Furthermore, because the results are frequently irrelevant, an optimized search would be advantageous. It took a lot of AddOns to make it "round." Costs should not be overlooked. My inbox is overflowing with emails.
author: Francisco

review_detail:
title: A well written and highly flexible tool but it can be too complex for your business needs
pros: Very flexible, intuitive design. Many things can be done with it regarding project and task management. It can help track team speed and capacity if all team members log their work and keep Jira up-to-date. It can be a good meeting point between product & project management and dev.
cons: The dashboards and processes built on Jira can become too complex. With Jira there's an administrative cost. The more feature is used, the more time it can take to keep things up-to-date.
author: Omar

review_detail:
title: Jira una buena opción para la gestión de proyectos
pros: Excelente herramienta de gestión de proyectos, no sólo agiliza la gestión integral, sino que también ayuda a evaluar los progresos individuales de los equipos como así el progreso general del proyecto.
cons: Como administrador, la gestión de usuarios, roles y permisos se hace compleja, dado que hay múltiples niveles de permisos, globales y específicos de un proyecto. Si bien es algo positivo, lo negativo es la falta de documentación detallada sobre lo referido a la administración de la herramienta.
author: Danilo

review_detail:
title: An excellent program for monitoring projects
pros: What I like the most about this software is that it allows me to continuously monitor the assigned projects, in the same way I like the way in which I can see each task to whom it was assigned, the commitment time that the person has with the itself and the follow-up that said team gives to the tasks, it is also a program that allows me to carry out a good administration of the works because I can verify the person who has less assigned tasks and the one who has more so that I can balance the load of tasks so that they are carried out in a more effective and safe way.
cons: What I like the most about this software is that it allows me to continuously monitor the assigned projects, in the same way I like the way in which I can see each task to whom it was assigned, the commitment time that the person has with the itself and the follow-up that said team gives to the tasks, it is also a program that allows me to carry out a good administration of the works because I can verify the person who has less assigned tasks and the one who has more so that I can balance the Loading of tasks so that they are carried out in a more effective way
author: Isaelm

review_detail:
title: Highly customizable, but big learning curve.
pros: JIRA is a great highly customizable tool once you get through the steep learning curve on the software. I was able to build good workflows for teams, build a sellable product, and manage team tasks using the software.
cons: The integrations bit doesn't always work, JIRA support blamed the integration party and the integration party blamed JIRA. It was frustrating. There was a lot of customization ability, but the internal guardrails to show you the impact of any changes you were making didn't exist. So if you weren't careful you could screw up something for the entire company with just correcting spelling errors, etc. on data fields.
author: Charles

review_detail:
title: JIRA for 10 years.
pros: The ability to track stories of all team members in one place, ability to visualize the time and the effort taken by the team. The ability to convert almost all information into a dashboard. Time tracking, engineers and people work velocity.
cons: it has slowly become too complex and there are too many details which someone overwhelms the user. The real motive of project management software is that it should work behind the scenes and not over shadow the work that needs finishing.
author: Vashita

review_detail:
title: One Stop solution for managing all Project Types!!!
pros: Easy Project Management, especially manages scrum and Kanban boards effectively. From Epics to Bug tracking it is a one stop solution for a project management need. Jira also helps track issues in enterprise tool implementations and collaborations. Overall a trustful and secure companion.
cons: Some custom reports generations are complicated, Little bit on costlier side.
author: Aadhavan

review_detail:
title: A clunky product that is getting better all the time.
pros: Widely used and a high degree of compatibility. Integrates with a number of other productivity tools. Regular improvements being made by the product team. Gradually adapting to being used for more than just software engineering.
cons: JIRA is not a simple tool like Trello. It takes time to understand how it works and the user experience can be clunky and frustrating. The lack of insights and reporting can be frustrating.
author: Douglas

review_detail:
title: The convinience of using Jira
pros: For almost 2 years of using JIRA with the 2 companies that I work with, I can say that it is very convinient to use. The user interface or visual interface is very user friendly in a sense that the options/buttons/tabs for executing an action are easy to find. For example the "create" button for submitting a ticket is highlighted on the upper part of the interface. I also love the option of setting the prioritization level of concern, that way the department who will handle the concern can easily determine if the ticket needs an immidiate action. I also wanted to highlight the feature where we can receive real time to time notification via email from the moment that the ticket is assigned up to when the ticket has been taken care of.
cons: Its just that Jira is a bit hard to setup at first and there is no actual messaging ferature within. But once setup is complete, everything is good to go. Also the communication feature has been compensated by the option to respond on the comment section of ticket.
author: Giovanni

review_detail:
title: Jira A Powerful Tool with Room for Improvement
pros: Jira flows for different type of status.
cons: Complexity it can feel overwhelming for beginners or teams with simpler workflows due to its extensive features
author: GAURAV

review_detail:
title: Les avantages de Jira pour la gestion de projet et la collaboration d'équipe.
pros: son intégration transparente avec d'autres outils et sa capacité à suivre efficacement les projets et les tâches en font un choix attrayant pour la gestion de projet et la collaboration d'équipe.
cons: Des tarifs supplémentaires pour les fonctionnalités avancées et des performances parfois lentes lors de la gestion de grands volumes de données.
author: Mamadou saliou

review_detail:
title: JIRA: The Gold Standard in Troubleshooting
pros: For project management across teams, this software is great. It allows for efficient task delegation and identification of blockers. Overall, it sets the standard for project management.
cons: With it's vast configurability, having many users can make it complicated and a bit difficult to maintain simplicity unless team standards are set.
author: Rajneet

review_detail:
title: Handy project management tool with lots of features
pros: I simply love that there is no limit to further customization of Jira – I can plug it in any workflow my team can imagine. No more cringing at having to fit in to software that wouldn’t work for us.
cons: Sometimes the interface can feel a bit clunky and overwhelming especially when you have to manage complex projects. Its a bit difficult to find your way around.
author: Oni

review_detail:
title: It's good if it makes sense for your uses
pros: Jira threads through a lot of our departments and can be used in a multitude of use cases. Different departments can utilize its functionality, which makes is simple to use and adapt. It's got good tracking and reporting capabilities, and integrates with other apps. Good for enterprise or companies that work with a lot of different clients.
cons: The UI is not the best. It feels clunky and older. Definitely a features over looks type platform.
author: Alina

review_detail:
title: JIRA: A Versatile Tool for Agile Project Management
pros: Offers excellent support for Agile methodologies like Scrum and Kanban with features like sprint planning, backlog management, and customizable workflows.
cons: New users often find it challenging to navigate and understand due to its extensive features and complex interface.
author: Samraat

review_detail:
title: Switch to jira
pros: Amazing product. organizes milestones and to do list etc
cons: Initial setup is difficult especially for teams that used a lot of excel for tracking
author: marc

title: JIRA enables easy tracking and communication on SDLC projects
pros: The main advantages of Jiras search are its power and versatility, as well as how simple it is to create educational dashboards. From a managerial standpoint, keeping track of work completed and time spent is beneficial.
cons: The abundance of issue types in Jira makes it difficult to keep track of which ones apply in what circumstances, which is one of my pet peeves. The fact that features are frequently hidden and must be found by accident or through reading about them in Atlassian update emails is another thing I detest. Jira offers numerous separate products that at times I wish were really just one thing.

review_detail:
title: Detailed Review of Jira
pros: The thing that I like the most about Jira is that, it is very easy to use and makes it very easy to track the tasks that are currently assigned to me. Jira by Atlassian is a strong tool for project manage­ment and issue tracking. It has many useful fe­atures that provide teams with a comple­te system for planning and completing tasks in a fle­xible work setting. With easy te­amwork and changeable work processe­s, Jira greatly improves how much people­ achieve and how well proje­cts do. A common choice for teams wanting effe­ctive and organized project manage­ment.
cons: Jira, while capable, can be bewildering for people unfamiliar with its intricacy. There is a steep learning process, and the abundant choices may lead to puzzlement and an inconvenient experience, particularly for smaller groups or easier projects. Finding the way through the interface can feel tangled sometimes, requiring a substantial commitment of time and energy for expertise. Considerable progressions in user-friendliness would enhance the general experience.
author: Preeti
