review_detail:
title: Jira easy project management
pros: the task assignment feature is equipped with an interface regarding the workflow being run. This makes team members, even other teams, know the progress of a project. Scrum and Kanban boards. With this feature, it is easier for a team to brainstorm. This feature is intuitive enough so that each team member can collaborate with each other to determine their work priorities. Not only that, team members can also find out about various problems from other members that were obtained during the process. There is a roadmaps feature that can let team members know about the future. With roadmaps, team members will be more focused on what they are doing. In fact, the team leader can have complete control over the various jobs that are done. Through roadmaps, the team leader can see a complete picture of the project, making decision-making easier. Jira can Connect with other applications easily, they have a lot of templates and then they have a strong community to make this software to be understood, lastly, this software has a good design, so simple, so clean and is easy to use.
cons: Support for using a slow website, sometimes it takes too long to access the website, there are still errors in these new features which are very unfortunate because these new features are very useful to facilitate project management and lastly the prices are less competitive
author: Eka

review_detail:
title: Useful but Difficult
pros: I love how it can be deployed on a diverse range of operating systems and this is very advantageous for software users on different platforms. The software comes with an impressive assortment of different languages to choose from and I think this is a really great feature when we put non native English speaking users into consideration. Users have the liberty to personalize a lot of articles as the software is highly customizable and in particular I love how I can even create custom workflows. I like how the software offers seamless intergration and collaborates with tools like confluence which helps me plan and run my project more coherently. Lastly, I really appreciate how the software is great at issue management, bugs can be tracked and recorded which gives me an eyeshot of all the items in my backlog so that I can prioritize which features to work on.
cons: First and foremost, I have found that the software comes with an overwhelming amount of features which can make task management very difficult, particularly for new users. In addition to this, the software is difficult to set up and to get used to as well. I found the user interface to be complex and this in turn makes task management to be a bit difficult. The default configuration is quite tricky and as a result presents a steep learning curve.
author: Mashudu Hilary

review_detail:
title: Jira the test management tool
pros: The most important feature of JIRA is the ease in which epics , stories, tasks , subtasks can be created and tracked.When the project is broken down in such part it is highly unlikely that something is left.Dashboard and Reports are really helpful during project planning And execution.
cons: Jira should give the option of text to speech so that user can report a defect quickly.It will be easier for the user.
author: Shelly

review_detail:
title: A game-changer for team collaboration
pros: Switching to Jira revolutionized our project management. It's intuitive, scalable, and integrates seamlessly with our existing tools.
cons: its initial setup can be a bit complex. It takes some time to customize it to fit our specific workflow needs
author: Yana

review_detail:
title: Buono
pros: Lo usano molti enti pubblici e non, per la gestione intelligente dei ticket sia in sviluppo che in help desk
cons: Nella media nulla, normale come gli altri non offre di più o di meno
author: Fabrizio

review_detail:
title: Jira FTW
pros: Love it's flexibility and ability to be customized. Extremely powerful.
cons: None that I can think of. I've had a great overall experience.
author: Jared

review_detail:
title: Jira user for more than 3 years: My Review
pros: 1. I've been using Jira as a major Atlassian product. I like this very much since it helps my team to collaborate better 2. Jira is integrated into other tools that I use like Confluence and Trello 3. Jira has many functionalities integrated into it based on your need. In my case, Zephyr is integrated to it and they work smoothly
cons: 1. If you belong to a large team that also uses Jira, there is a tendency that Jira to experience some downtime and data traffic -- which can cause hassle. 2. Some items in the Jira marketplace can be very expensive -- but some are worth it, after all.
author: Lougene

review_detail:
title: Feature-rich but often confusing and unusable
pros: There are features and customization options to provide granular control over almost every aspect of Jira.
cons: The user experience can become a real blocker in trying to focus on your work. Often, managing Jira becomes a task in itself apart from the work that you need to do.
author: Hussain

review_detail:
title: Could be a powerful tool but I wish it was more intuitive
pros: We moved to Jira after adopting Agile principles of project management and Jira allowed us to work within that framework which is its key selling point for us.
cons: Prior to Jira we used Trello which sits within the Atlassian family and it has been very hard to convince staff to use Jira fully because by comparison to Trello it just doesn't feel very intuitive. We have had Jira in place since 2019 and I still received feedback that staff find it takes longer to work out how to log tasks and project updates on Jira than it does to actually do the tasks themselves.
author: Gm

review_detail:
title: A useful tool for managing projects and issues in real time
pros: It is critical to have a tool to coordinate software development operations. It features a decent dashboard feature where available team items may be presented, as well as the ability to apply filters on a number of intake tickets available in the development team. In addition, developers can write comments about their progress when an issue ticket is forwarded to the next step in real time. This combination of key tasks is good for beginners, and the more complicated choices make Jira an enticing tool even in commercial settings.
cons: Its query language is strong, but it needs good skills, which are uncommon among scrum managers. With so many modifying options, it might feel cluttered at times. The web interface might be improved. The usage of search criteria to detect bugs using JQL queries is not particularly user-friendly.
author: Parth

review_detail:
title: Broadly used and easily customized/integrated task and project management toolbox
pros: Browser based and easily accessible. Can be configured and customized as per project needs. If used to store product backlog, it can be the one source of truth for both business and development teams.
cons: There are some minor usability glitches here and there and due to possibilities for customization, it can take a while to learn to use it effectively. Not the lightest solution for small business or small ad hoc teamwork.
author: Sampo

review_detail:
title: Jira is needed, but not beloved
pros: We can track the requests needed from other teams. So much of our work is documented, so we can dig into the archives and discover what has happened in the past, and find clues for the future. We can track time against tasks, show progress, and comment as things progress. We can check in on the status of a project or request, and see how things are moving. The functionality is all there.
cons: I dislike the search, which I find less than intuitive, though it has improved in the more recent cloud version. I dislike that many companies keep it behind a VPN, which makes it difficult to access. I dislike both how it's hard for me to use and how it's hard for others to use - I run into instances of people misunderstanding the software all the time, which creates mistakes and wasted time. I don't like using it as my to-do list, because it's an unfriendly user interface with which to start and end my day.
author: Kayla

review_detail:
title: The Best Project Tracking Software
pros: Jira Software has an effective mobile app that allows us to work remotely. A lot of software functions can be performed on mobile. Jira has an extensive search feature that allows us to filter out the tickets based on categories, status, and team members. It won't take long to find an update of a certain task or ticket. We can easily customize the dashboard according to our needs. It easily integrates with other software tools.
cons: The user interface is not very friendly and the setup might be a bit challenging.
author: Mounika

review_detail:
title: Great for dev collaborating
pros: I like how easy it is to plan and track software development.
cons: Sometimes there are some functions that aren’t available compared to the competition.
author: George

review_detail:
title: Using Jira in the Professional Services world
pros: Jira is one of the project admin tools that we use here. It has basic functionality and is not my favorite, I prefer Atlassian, personally. I don't have a lot of positive feedback.
cons: My experience with Jira left a bad taste in my mouth. The interface is very busy, it takes a lot of training for a new project manager to navigate. . The tools in Jira are a bit cumbersome and I feel that the UX is not intuitive.
author: Paul

review_detail:
title: Great and easy to use
pros: Jira is very simplified and easy to use. No problem logging tickets and it has a quick chat service which is convenient.
cons: None could not fault Jira as per pros, its great and easy to use.
author: Zoheb

review_detail:
title: The defacto standard for Ticket Tracking and project management
pros: - Very easy Kanban board and ticket tracking - Linking tickets is very intuitive and useful - team collaboration through pointing, filtering - Full of features - Expandable with plugins
cons: - wish epic management could be done better. E.g., wish you could have epics of epics - wish it was more intuitive to search past tickets, however reporting is available. - Sometimes performance seems slow - For people who don't need very complex task tracking, JIRA is a bit too bloated with features.
author: S. Alexander

review_detail:
title: Using Jira Software and Service Desk
pros: Extensibility. Jira really can be all things to all users. There are so many business workflow processes that we have implemented and all in Jira: advanced software development, workflows for processing contracts and invoices, and support work with incidents and service requests with approvals. Lastly, with the large dev community and a large pool of app add-ons, we are confident we could extend Jira to be what we need it to be.
cons: If you don't understand the principles of Agile software development, there will be parts of using Jira that will be foreign to you and will likely go unused. There is a steep learning curve on the administration-side. With so many functions and features, it can be difficult to know all of your options. The "schemes" that power the project administration can also make it difficult to troubleshoot your setup.
author: Derek

review_detail:
title: It feels like Jira got too comfortable while being ahead of the pack
pros: * Does all the things you would expect from a project management tool* New Ideas flow is very promising, haven't tried it yet, but it looks great
cons: * Sometimes Overcomplicated* Not as versatile and visually pleasing as Notion for example
author: Vanisha

review_detail:
title: Jira review
pros: We can keep track of all the task from single platform. Easy for managers to track the progress of task assigned to teammates. Based on time tracking we can decide accordingly the delivery of products & features.
cons: The least i liked about it was not able to fetch data from any cli . UI was still very interactive & useful
author: Prabhat

review_detail:
title: Great tool to improve your workflow and project organization
pros: I like JIRA thanks to the versatility it offers. The type of boards and features whether it's for AGILE or SCRUM project development or for it's tickets organization and how easily I can assign tasks to myself or other coworkers. Also I like their support desk system since with the portal I created, My customers can report issues through the system, I'll get a notification and get on it as soon as I can, or it'll be created as a ticket/issue and I'll get to it when I'm available. Also I can assign this task to someone else for them to take care of, or if it is related to another department.
cons: I would say they have improved with the time, but one of the minor things I disliked about JIRA is how slow it felt sometimes. Like if you have a project or board with a lot of issue/tickets, it's takes a lot of times to load, or performing actions on it can feel sluggish, not work or just bug itself. Another thing, that they have greatly improved with the recent re-designs, it's how hidden some features were under a menu (...) menu, when before there was a dedicated button for such important features (moving issues, closing etc). Now, they've changed it but I don't know why they made the change to begin with.
author: Luis Daniel

review_detail:
title: Excellent project tracking tool for teams
pros: - Can deploy within your organization - Create projects or teams with their own tasks or projects within a dashboard. - Backlog for activities or tasks that you can review later. - Kanban dashboard for visually view the current pending tasks being worked on or to be worked. - Filters to see tasks per group or per person within a dashboard. - Report for anything like to see how many tasks being worked currently, done, created or the time it takes them to be fixed. - Git and SVN linking for commits in order to link related commits to a ticket. - Link tasks to see the related tasks from other teams or simply another ticket withing the same team.
cons: Not very useful to setup for very small organizations or for personal usage. Better use a online tool for that.
author: Alejandro

review_detail:
title: Not the best for marketing teams
pros: Jira's functions are okay in terms of task and time management, but no one from our team likes its user experience. Only logging and tracking work is easy.
cons: The interface is so old-generation and there are a lot of terms, menus, etc making it very difficult to navigate your way through. Its reports always have to be manually adjusted, and it's definitely not the best for marketing teams, since there aren't many designated spaces to add, edit or comment on visuals, campaigns etc. Might be more suitable for crowded non-creative teams.
author: Tuana

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Work Management is the Most best feature i love about Jirra followed by Sprints managements
cons: Taking license for the independent functionality making it expensive to use specially for temporary needs
author: Ishtiaq

review_detail:
title: Great overall Porject tracking and management software.
pros: I enjoy the clean interface and fairly easy to use as a developer looking at a sprint and picking tasks to work on or logging bugs. Works nicely to see how much work there is, time estimated for the work and prioritization. The iPad app is super nice as well with its simplicity, ease of use and smooth experience. The software is great for logging stories and assigning tasks, planning before a sprint and assigning work to different individuals.
cons: Sometimes it feels slightly clunky on the browser. Moist times its good but it feels slow at times. A Windows app would be nice to have as there is currently nothing available but there is one for MacOS and iPadOS.
author: Osher

review_detail:
title: Undoubtedly the market leader, but possibly for the wrong reasons
pros: Since the rollout of the new UI in 2018, Jira is now a modern and easy-to-use SaaS product (I use the cloud version, don't know if the on prem version is still available). It has everything you need for running projects using Scrum, Kanban or other frameworks. It also has a decent support ticketing module.
cons: The major problem with Jira is its 'flexibility', i.e. it actually encourages you to customise it. If you want a tool that enables you to run Scrum/Kanban/XP out of the box and doesn't need loads of configuration, there are cheaper options that are much easier to adopt and maintain. Jira is *very* complicated to set up and administer, due mainly to its legacy of always having been a 'customisable' platform. Worst of all, the project creation flow actually distracts you away from using templates set up by the admin, and when someone does this it's a lot of work to recover.
author: Aidan

review_detail:
title: Good Ticketing Tool for all modes of Production
pros: Jira's most impactful feature is the traceability of tasks across different platforms and different departments so you quickly see which person works on what task or project
cons: The interface is intimidating to new users. There are a lot of tabs and toggles you need to check up on when you are reporting something for the first time or when you are searching for a task
author: Sigmund

review_detail:
title: Jira5
pros: It is a popular and widely-used tool for project management and issue trackingIt has a wide range of features and integrations that can be customized to fit a variety of workflows and use casesIt is user-friendly and can be easily navigated by both technical and non-technical team membersIt has a large community of users who can provide support and share tips and tricks
cons: It can be expensive for large teams or organizations with multiple projectsIt can be overwhelming for small teams or projects with minimal needsIt can be difficult to customize and may require a significant amount of setup timeSome users have reported performance issues when dealing with a large number of issues or users.
author: Tagie

review_detail:
title: Useful and Simple
pros: Very fast to manage teams and task. Very simple to create template for ripetitive tasks
cons: The platform can be accessed from anywhere and also via Smart fone or tablet and can be conneted to diiferent external suite like G-Suite
author: Mauro Riccardo

review_detail:
title: Project/task management made easy
pros: Easy task management Easy time tracking for time spent in various takes Easy release planning Integration with various tools
cons: User interface can be little bit more modern
author: Alok

review_detail:
title: Great project and resource planner
pros: I have been using jira for 8 months and I like hot easy it makes me plan the project, conduct sprints, detail out tasks and plan resources needed according to agile methodologies. I can easily assign tasks and add watchers to the cards.
cons: The only downside I felt the UI is a bit complicated which makes it difficult to navigate in the app.
author: Akul

review_detail:
title: Essencial tool for big development projects
pros: Issue tracking and project management is great using Jira. There are many fields to add and UI looks comfortable. Dashboards and Kanban are also a good tool.
cons: Searching could be improved, sometimes while writing a query it doesn't detect projects with space between words
author: Arthur

review_detail:
title: Titillating software with Gantt charts and kanban board.
pros: Very impressive software with kanban board. The dashboard is straight forward and ease of use. Elegant with task prioritization. Great with documents management. Efficient with workflow management.
cons: Great and more convenient with task management.
author: caroline

review_detail:
title: Now Process/task management and progress tracking is Easy and efficient
pros: We can easily create groups and share/split tasks among a group of people and also queries can be shared and solved fastly. Tracking the progress is very useful since diagrammatic representation is also available. So the things are more understandable.
cons: I didn't find any dislikes since i started using. All the necessary features are available. This is an very useful tool that helps to track the process and plan accordingly. And also we can fix things more fastly since team work and coordination is good. It plays an important role and I highly recommend it.
author: Jibin

review_detail:
title: A smart application to manage everything within an organization
pros: I like that here we can set the importance of the tasks and respectively know what to focus on first. I use this application every day to communicate with colleagues and this facilitates the verification and accomplishment of tasks in a timely manner.
cons: For me, from the beginning, it had a complicated menu and I could not select the functionality I needed. But, once you start using this application it becomes easy to use in practice.
author: Tatiana

review_detail:
title: Gracias a Jira ya que por ti, Mejoró mi vida Profesional y Personal
pros: La aplicación es sumamente sencilla lo que ha mejorado demasiado mi trabajo
cons: Para ser honestos toda la aplicación me ha gustado y me ha servido demasiado para mis labores cotidianas en mi trabajo
author: Martha Leticia

review_detail:
title: From a developer
pros: The overall workflow along with clearly partitioned tasks is JIRA's will be my most liked feature. It makes tasks management and collaboration very easy.
cons: It's difficult to get started with. For new resources, the platform could be a little overwhelming, just the look and feel of it.
author: Tushar

review_detail:
title: Best software development & tracking tool
pros: The software development of segregated into issues, stories ans tasks. It has really helped to get collaboration from different teams like new feature approval and testing team approval, etc. It has reduced the time that development team spend on email to and back communication.
cons: More and more options are there and need a proper training to use the product to the fullest.
author: Ruban

review_detail:
title: Best work management tool for programmers.
pros: Jira's features are focused on programmers/scrum teams. The features are specific for a niche public and as a result it doesn't look overwhelming with unnecessary tools. The bug tracker works perfectly.
cons: Jira is very niche so it has not the necessary features for projects related to other areas.
author: Andrei

review_detail:
title: All tickets together.
pros: You can see all the tickets opened for IT or HR on one page, and you can access them faster. The design you have made is of course important, but the site is very easy to use. You can be instantly notified of a new ticket or a comment made to the ticket by email.
cons: I like everything. Its really useful program.
author: Cagatay

review_detail:
title: Jira is a very powerful and popular project managment tool
pros: It's quite easy to get started using Jira for new employees. It's very powerful for advanced users as well with custom queries and ability to customize the ticket's fields, Sprint Board and ticket lifecycle.
cons: Ticket vs. Story vs. Sub-ticket - The distinction isn't really clear on when you should really use each of them. It is often confusing for people and leads to mistakes. Your personal experience with Jira would vary heavily based of your project's administrator's decisions to configure the ticket lifecycle, custom fields, JIra board appearance and so on. As a user that is not an administrator you can't tweak or create a personal view of Jira that is convenient for you, so often you rely on your administrator's judgment of what is good for the company/project. Since each Jira project can have different settings, it is often painful to re-assign a ticket between projects as they require different type of fields which sometime you don't have the right context to know what they mean in a big organization. Each custom field should have a hint to explain what it means and provide an example. Each project/component should have a default assignee to triage the ticket if you don't know to whom you should assign it.
author: Rami

review_detail:
title: JIRA a great bug tracker
pros: We use to have the software installed in our company as a change management and collaborative tool, it comes with the great features like the confluence work as a document repository, activity tracked to manage and collaborate work with other team members. Apart from that JIRA has a great way of designing workflows to resolve bugs, way to issue management and triage them. Moreover, it can be integrated with the code repository like Bitbucket to show code changes and comes integrated with Bamboo to show build activity. It works on JQL a powerful query building language using in order to search various activities happening throughout the issue database. It has added feature call Greenhopper which is an addon that makes it possible to follow work to implement on Agile methods, there are several addons that facilitate QA task as well, JIRA market place has hundreds of Addon that you can use for various tasks.
cons: Its cost incrementally increases when the number of users increased
author: MOHAMED

review_detail:
title: Herramienta ideal para el mundo del software
pros: Permite llevar un control integral de todas las tareas qué se deben cumplir en casa uno de nuestros desarrollos.
cons: La curva de aprendizaje es muy alta, requiere de un gran tiempo de estudio de la herramienta.
author: Fernando Matías

review_detail:
title: Features of Jira
pros: Easy to track the details, comments, history, and other functionalities make the process easy.
cons: Everything is good,I will recommend there should be a user manual as Jira has a lot of features .
author: Anjali

review_detail:
title: JIRA for Software Development and DevOp Pipeline
pros: What I love most about JIRA is being a part of Atlassian, complete suite of tools aligning with the goal of providing a interactive online environment to track software project progression, schedule, and tasking. With the growing number of companies and projects following an agile software development approach to reduce cost and have an early iterative prototype for customer demos, JIRA works great at tracking bi-weekly scrum cycles and daily stand-ups for ensuring the project stays on schedule.
cons: What I like least about JIRA the representation of dependency view between created tickets on the board view, or also known as the swim-lanes view in some cases. When adding a dependency between one ticket to another, JIRA creates a whole new row for the dependent tickets on the header of other tickets which has a separation effect that may cause one to forget about the top row of dependent tickets. I prefer to have all the tickets together in a single-multicolumn board instead of "two separate boards" on a single page.
author: Han-Tsung

review_detail:
title: Big learning curve
pros: Great for managing tasks, and creating a customized workflow for what your team needs. Can create complex workflows to fit into various needs. There are several
cons: The UI on the tool leaves much to be desired. It has a long ramp-up process to figure out the best workflows for your team. To do any kind of advanced functionality like time tracking or recurring tasks usually requires an add-on.
author: Suzie

review_detail:
title: JIRA is a giant but now there are other options
pros: Original approach to bug tracking, that evolved to project Scheduling, with an easy integration with other Atlassian tools.
cons: Sometimes is hard to see the big picture. Other, new platforms have better approach for small projects
author: Daniel

review_detail:
title: Easy to implement, ready to go
pros: Easy implementation is best feature of the software, especially cloud environment. Also it's a good example of all-in-one task and project management software.
cons: Dashboard feature is not advanced, and price is a little bit high.
author: Erdinc

review_detail:
title: Crea proyectos específicos para equipos de trabajo
pros: Lo que más me ha gustado de este programa es que es muy personalizable, y permite cubrir amplias necesidades de equipos de trabajo. Resulta fácil de seguir las tareas, y cuenta con una comunidad amplia por si tienes algún problema. Además, permite la interacción con otros sistemas.
cons: Si lo personalizas demasiado, puede costar un poco de aprender para otras personas. Esto también hace que para las personas nuevas cueste un poco de aprender.
author: José Antonio

review_detail:
title: Jira is great
pros: I like all the capabilities of the software. My team uses it for project management and tracking for video production and i think its a great tool. It tracks the stages of our projects well, time tracking is easy, the way it holds resources and holds project information is really detailed too and organized. It helps me stay on track and in the know of what I’m working on as well as being able to check in with teammates with ease on their projects.
cons: I’m not a huge fan of the update to the interface but thankfully i can still switch to the old view which is what i use majority of the time. Sometimes moving a project stage can be a pain as well cuz there seems to be more of a stepper system vs a just drop down and click system.
author: Gabriela

review_detail:
title: Makes the most sense for software projects and products
pros: Since Jira has agile-oriented Kanban mappings and recently added Gantt and Timeline views, it has become the de facto project management tool in most companies. A new hire can quickly learn how to assign tasks, create subtasks, write stories, and estimate time appropriately and effectively. As my team works across different time zones, Jira's clean integration with Slack coupled with its alert system is a game-changer. 1) Releases provide the ability for multiple individuals in the same project to work simultaneously. 2) Like releases from the parallel sprints, we have a lean team, so we simultaneously work on feature features and polish/bug fixes. 3) Custom Filters
cons: A few features have been removed from the product, making them different products. All of these products are now paid for, and for those tiny features, you must purchase extras. As an example, Those are the pages
author: Sullivan

review_detail:
title: Very powerful tool for project tracking and managing.
pros: Jira provides user very customization it it, one can create his\her own Dashwood. I am using Jira for last 1 and a half years. I can also assign the ticket to myself self or I can also be the reporter you don't need to use different tools for both. We can easily manage our worklog as well. It provides very easiness in tracking any ticket suppose you have assigned any Jira to someone so you can see the whole roadmap of that and you can update it any time.
cons: There is nothing that I don't like about this powerful tool. It has everything which I think there should be any Project tracking or management tool.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: One stop platform for ticket/task management
pros: You can manage a ticket/story/task/project from initiation to completion in one product while being able to track each mile stone, prepare accurate health history etc.
cons: None that needs a fix. Happy with the features explored so far.
author: Naveen

review_detail:
title: Jira for software project management
pros: The first thing to say is this is really simple application with user friendly interface. So it won't take much long for anyone to adhere to it. Also it has vast number of features where you can create user stories, brake them down in to sub tasks, create issues, dashboards, filters etc. whole lot of features which will simplify your project work brake down. What I love is we can every thing it the task so any one who access the task will know what changes happened and the current status. And also it really help me in sending reports as I can send a detailed report about open issues, completed issues etc.
cons: Nothing much that I don't like in this. But recently I am unable to upload some files directly to the tasks. Sometimes it fails in the middle. So better to have a look into this
author: Dedunu

review_detail:
title: Easy to Use, Promotes Productivity
pros: Jira is very easy to use and intuitive it takes off the burden of having to learn the product so that developers can immediately be productive with it. Even our non-IT staff are able to work around it with minimal onboarding. It also is compatible with a lot of other tools that we use like Slack so it helps a lot with collaboration within the team. At some point it was able to minimize the automated emails by collecting all changes to a certain period of time so we dont get spammed with a lot of alerts.
cons: Frequent app and UI changes in the past made it difficult because some features or design one likes are sometimes deprecated before we can even get accustomed to the look and feel. However it’s not much of a problem since their changes are mostly for improving the look and feel so we end up liking the new look.
author: Lourdes Tupas

review_detail:
title: Review for Jira
pros: The most impactful feature is the drag & drop for prioritisation.
cons: Portfolio feature is hard to use and keep track/interpret all the information.
author: Gustavo

review_detail:
title: JIRA - Great tool for Project Management
pros: In my opinion it is best tool for tracking issues/tasks ,managing projects. I habe been using it in my all projects. It has great features of assigning tasks to individual and keeping track of same via projects/ sprints. It has dashboards , where we can see all relevant issues together. We can create filters for particular teams. It also provide features of labelling which helps us in filtering. We have all information at one place and available to everyone in open, easy to access by all level of management.
cons: One of the issue I have faced using this tool is that , sometimes attachment doesn't attach in one go & it give error once & in another try it went well.
author: Jigyasa

review_detail:
title: Jira is great for Agile/Scrum teams
pros: I like that Jira has great features for creating issues (user stories, child tasks, defects/bugs, etc.). It also makes it very easy to prioritize the backlog and organize sprints.
cons: Jira should have better visualizations that are easier to use in order to see dependencies across stories. That would make it more organized.
author: Myra

review_detail:
title: Ideal software for requirements management & bug reporting
pros: Jira has managed to raise the way we think and act in software projects to a different (more agile) level. As someone who still learned the classic "waterfall" in my studies, Jira was an eye-opener on how to approach it differently and still achieve meaningful and sometimes even better and faster results. It is well adapted to a more agile work process, you can map the main part of the work that actually occurs in it. For conceptual preparatory work, however, I would recommend a connection with Confluence and/or Trello, where one devotes oneself more to the "big picture" and comprehensive functions in their entirety, while in Jira one then plans, accompanies and works through the concrete step-by-step implementation.
cons: The notification mechanism in JIRA, as in almost all Atlassian products, has never really been thought through. All notifications still work via email. With several projects, this can easily lead to a flooding of the email inbox. A good notification centre and optimised task dashboard within the software are necessary.
author: Martin

review_detail:
title: Much more than a bug tracker
pros: JIRA is a software you start using it for one aspect and then you cannot do without once you get to know the other features. In my employments, I have seen companies where it is used for bug tracking, project tracking, even time reporting and project budgeting. It really has it all. I must also give a honorable mention to the integrations for technical side, especially BitBucket integration.
cons: Nothing. And it keeps getting better with every release.
author: Burak

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: We are using jira for everyday task management. Fast, easy and useful software. I like it very much.
cons: Everything is Ok, but design and user interface may be better.
author: Zaza

review_detail:
title: A very good application for our projects
pros: I truly appreciate working with Jira to make everything truly more arranged and simpler to follow every one of the undertakings. Makes a ton of requests in errands, in this organization he supplanted a great deal of the work that was for starters done in messages and instruments, makes requests, affiliation and it's more straightforward to monitor undertakings.
cons: It would likewise be great to see the improvement, particularly in compelling errands. Simply in progress isn't genuinely informative. I additionally wish the interface was somewhat more adjustable.
author: Sara

review_detail:
title: Best Software Management Tool
pros: The Projects planning and tracking of projects status is really helpful in my business.
cons: Jira is the best for my project management. Here is nothing which I dislike.
author: Tarun

review_detail:
title: Great issue tracking software for software teams
pros: JIRA allows easy tracking of issues, making it ideal for use by teams everywhere. It is adaptable as well - I have a client who uses it for keeping track of writing assignments. All details regarding the issue are kept on a single page, which is extremely helpful if you are assigned to the issue. What's more, you can set it to send notifications in case there are updates to the issue page. Chances of you missing updates are, therefore, practically nil. You can also set the issues page to follow your own custom workflow. The GUI is so easy-to-use that I don't even have to read the manual/documentation to know how the update an issues page the first time I used the software.
cons: I'm hard-pressed naming a con for this software - there's practically none. I've used other issue tracking softwares, but this is practically the best among the lot.
author: Julius Renato A.

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management Tool at affordable price
pros: Essentially used to track the application development process, assign tasks and set priorities. We love the ease with which our functional team is able to use Jira without having to train them. We went agile last year and Jira was an obvious choice. We love the real-time, visual data reports that JIRA provides. This is especially beneficial while communicating with the client the progress and timelines. This has been a great value for money product. But if you are hosting it on-premise. It is free for up to 10 users and minimal annual charges for more users.
cons: I love the product that it's hard to really say what i don't like about the product. We had some hard time while setting up JIRA initially due to some web server issues. We had a little hard time digging into documentations or community forums.
author: Ravinder

review_detail:
title: Good tools for project management
pros: It allows me to keep track of tasks, assign tasks to different team members, and monitor the progress of projects in real-time. Jira also offers great features, such as customizable workflows, which help streamline and simplify the process. Additionally, it provides detailed reports, which help me to get a better understanding of how our projects are progressing. Moreover, Jira is a very secure platform, which helps to ensure that all of our data is safe and secure. Last but not least, Jira is very user friendly and intuitive, which makes it easier for our team to use and navigate
cons: Overall, Jira is an excellent tool for project management and I would highly recommend it to any team looking to improve their workflow.
author: Sunitha

review_detail:
title: JIRA Manage Projects at ease
pros: Jira is very easy to use and very simple UI where any user can work swiftly. Jira has helped us a lot as a ticket tracking system as well as Managing our Sprints in the Project Road maps. You can integrate various apps very easily.
cons: Some of the features like planning vs Actual working charts should be there for the older sprints where we can measure the story points of a particular user.
author: Sayam

review_detail:
title: Organise Your Chain of Events
pros: Jira is popular for project management and keeping its clients happy and so we recently decided to shift to Jira and found it working great with our current environment setup. Many functionalities like pinning down the defects or more precisely the bugs at every step of development is the feature we did not see in other tools yet. Moreover, all the different departments are compatible with this tool and can help each other and track wach others progress which help ultimately help to plan their schedule in the future. We also noted that it can be expanded with various plugins and the available plugins and extentions are in THOUSANDS! Even you will find most popular applications are available for contributing to the tool.
cons: We are new to tool but still many of our developers and marketing teams had difficulty while interacting with the tool. Personally using this tool also made me realise that UI is more focused for technical people and is difficult for regular user. Progress tracking coukd have been better if the cloud storage was more. They literally expect you to upload files near about 15mbs. Actually we are paying for the tool but still it does not allow us to make an offline copy of the reports. It would be better if atleast we can download, even with some less specifications for our clients to show them progress but that feature is long awaited.
author: Divyang

review_detail:
title: Enterprise Issue Management for Teams
pros: Jira is highly configurable, allowing you to set it up exactly as your team works rather than having to change how you work for the software. It provides a huge amount of flexibility that is difficult to match in the crowded issue management category. This is the industry standard when it comes to software development and agile process management.
cons: Only use Jira if you are ready to get stuck into the administration and management of the software - it takes a significant amount of setting up to get it right. You are rewarded with strong features and it is highly configurable but it can also have a managament time impact.
author: Adam

review_detail:
title: Product Management At Its Best
pros: You can literally do anything within the JIRA boards and its options. JIRA even enable you to use some basic SQL in order to organize your tasks and boards easily.
cons: Sometimes you can find yourself lost within the options and features. To be fair, with all those features and integrations, i couldn't think the other way but, sometimes when you in a rush, it's just confusing to not find a thing you are looking for.
author: Yagiz

review_detail:
title: Customer service and issues report
pros: One of the things that I like about JIRA is how their information is organized for every one project, report, story, etc. They have a unique way of categorizing some of the user stories which can lead to the product owners and to start solving their issues. Another thing that I like is the dashboard. It’s simple and it’s great if you want to monitor something. The best thing about JIRA is that it allows people to use their tools and templates which most of the software companies don’t allow. Plus you can use it for basic workflows tickets and it’s easy to customize the views of the ticket to have the information that you want.
cons: What I don’t like is that sometimes you can’t close out the ticket if you are not the creator. To close the ticket, you need to create one. That can be a little frustrating. Another thing is the price. I feel like you pay more for upgrading every time than you paid for the first time. Furthermore, they have a complex layout which means that sometimes it’s hard to find something that you are searching for. It just takes away too much of your time. Plus I think that you need to have some previous experience in this area to work with JIRA.
author: Binujaya

review_detail:
title: Best tool to track projects
pros: From the perspective of a scrum or DevOps team member, the most important functions are simple to learn and use. It also provides a variety of options for organizing workflow among multiple agile teams. Different levels of tasks - and visualizations for them - are possible. I like how you can link everything and organize multiple boards. To avoid making a mess, it takes a little bit of consistency in sticking to the rules.
cons: It has a steep learning curve at first, until you get a handle on how to use it.
author: Suresh

review_detail:
title: JIRA - One stop shop for everything related to Agile/Scrum/Project-Management
pros: Our Engineering team doesn't look beyond JIRA for project management, bug tracking, bug lifecycle, sprint planning and a plethora of agile items. It's probably the best suite for any org.
cons: It has by far solved all the requirements we have wanted, may be the only thing we are looking for is more integration with automation related technologies.

review_detail:

pros: Since this is mostly Kanban, agile we can use it for project management/time management

review_detail:

pros: I would 100% unequivocally without a doubt advocate that every development team use JIRA. I have been using this product for nearly a decade and would be lost without it. It contains everything for agile product development that you need plus customization options that help us meet our goals. I will never use anything else with my team for sprint planning and project development.
cons: The customizations are endless, but can be sometimes confusing (screens v screen schemes, etc.) which is why I gave "ease of use" 4 out of 5 stars, but that is not necessarily a bad thing; it just takes some getting used to, and sometimes I have to use forums to figure out how to accomplish something but this should in no way deter anyone who is considering the product.

Existing customers need to switch to Jira Cloud or Jira Data Center. - Many features are not available in Jira directly and customers need to buy 3rd party plugins from the Atlassian marketplace. - Training must be done for new users of Jira to cover the basic features of the tool.

pros: I use Jira on a daily basis, mainly as the main contact with developers in terms of tracking and updating bugs of the products my company offers: videoconferencing hardware. What I like the most is the advanced search engine, which allows you to use several combinations, even more than famous search engines like Google. This makes Jira a fairly comprehensive database for known or already created problems.
cons: The integration with Salesforce could be better, since Jira in general has several essential options camouflaged in others that are less used, for example, I do not find utility in the tabs: Metrics, Root cause, Other, although they are important, they almost go unnoticed given the design of the page itself.

review_detail:

pros: It is easy to use, simple to set up and has all the basic features for the users.
cons: Sometimes automatic email communications can be a hassle, be sure to configure it so it doesnt overflow the teams emails.
author: Ricardo

review_detail:
title: A Highly Effective Tool for Project Management and Collaboration
pros: I liked that JIRA was very user friendly and could be customized to fit whatever project or workflow I was trying to manage. It was also great that it allowed for collaboration among team members and was able to track progress and tasks with ease. Additionally, I loved the fact that JIRA could be integrated with other tools and services, which allowed me to easily create reports and manage my tasks and projects with more efficiency.
cons: The least liked thing about JIRA is the complexity of the system and the difficulty of learning how to use it. It can be quite overwhelming for users who are not familiar with the system, and it can take a long time to learn how to use it effectively. Additionally, the cost of the system can be prohibitive for smaller organizations.
author: Hina

review_detail:
title: Review About Jira
pros: 1. This software gives you multiple tools for task management for example burn up/down charts, scrum and kanban boards, etc. 2. Your teams can start with a project template or they can create their own custom workflow. 3. Good thing about this software is that it supports agile development methodology and it works best for everyone both its development team and management. 4. It has customizable permissions that enable admins to determine who can see or perform which action or task.
cons: 1. It's a little bit difficult for newbies to understand. 2. There is room for improvement in GUI. 3. Sometimes I faced lags and delay work progress. 4. Price is a little bit higher than other tools.
author: waqar

review_detail:
title: Review on Atlassian JIRA
pros: A team needs a ticket/issue tracking system and JIRA Atlassian seems to be used widely in the industry. As a user, it's easy to use for the most part. Besides having the option of hosting the application in-house, it also has the Cloud edition so from the Systems Team perspective, there's no need for servers, backups, security, keeping the service up (with fault tolerance), etc.
cons: From the administration aspect of the software, JIRA still has a long way to go: 1) As an administrator, as far as I can see, one can *not* even do such a simple thing as change the Display Name for a user (I suppose it's a "feature" but I can't see why that's a good feature). Instead, an invite is sent out to the user, who can then set the Display Name after signing up. 2) As an administrator, one can login as another user to test permissions. That's normally a nice functionality for administrators. However, for some functionalities, while you are still logged in as another user, you suddenly go back to your normal identity. That's very confusing and thwarts the purpose. One potential good use is being able to login as another user to set/update the Display Name (see #1). 3) Setting permissions is not that easy. I tried to set permissions for an account that's used for scripting (using the REST API) but it seems very difficult (really, it should be easy) to get the permissions done correctly -- sufficient but minimal privileges. 4) The REST API is not great. The online documentation is often outdated and sometimes things don't work (with errors). Even when things run without errors, it might not actually do the thing that it's supposed to do (so you write the code for nothing when you expect it to work).
author: Ding

review_detail:
title: JIRA Software for Scrum Team Projects
pros: JIRA has the vital features necessary for effective Scrum team projects. Important features include: * Supports having multiple teams that each have their own sprints and backlog * Create epics, stories, tasks and sub tasks to break down feature development into manageable chunks * Write up and track bug reports * Estimate project timelines via story points * View sprint progress via a board of columns of progress (To do, Blocked, In Progress, In Validation, In Review, Done, etc) * Communication on tickets/stories via commenting and email notifications
cons: JIRA's user interface can be a bit confusing. Things like completing a sprint and starting a new one can often be harder than they sound because of things like stories/tickets still being in progress. There isn't a good way to account for partial carry over in estimation as stories/tickets either fully carry over or are completed. Some of the actions on tickets have different user interface depending on what view you are in. After creating a story/ticket, it can be hard to find where it went if you forget to add certain labels like which sprint it is included in or what team it belongs to.
author: Adam

review_detail:
title: Service management for more than just IT
pros: Service desk form creation is simple. The 'backend' management of the raised requests is also relatively simple with the added benefit of customisable approval flows to ensure any offline process your team follows can be matched within the flow in Jira. The ability for requestees to also rate closed requests is useful from a customer engagement perspective.
cons: Some system labels are not as easily editable (which mostly only affects teams not using Jira in the traditional IT realm). The number of automated system emails can be daunting until you customise that feature to suit your needs.
author: Jason

review_detail:
title: Jira integration with worklog and activity timeline
pros: Task management, issue tracking, easy to use, integration with other tools like Activity Timeline and sync with Afas Online it’s one of our most important tools
cons: The price when you use it with more than 10 users! Bur it’s the price worth!

review_detail:

pros: I appreciate Jira's ability to cater to various use cases, which is why even non-development teams in my company use it. However, the reporting feature is what truly sets it apart. The real-time insights it provides into my team's performance have been invaluable for measuring peer-to-peer performance and overall productivity within our software projects.
cons: Team collaboration plays a crucial role in software project management. However, Jira's limited collaboration features beyond Scrum and Kanban boards make it difficult to ensure smooth collaboration among team members.
author: Chelsea

review_detail:

review_detail:

pros: I enjoy the ease of use and ability to easily teach new users how the software works.
cons: Nothing comes to mind; Product is great.
author: Neil

review_detail:
title: Jira for bug tracking and project management
pros: We used several bug tracking tools in the past but Jira is by far the best one. What I like most: - user friendly interface, provides a nice user experience - Agile SCRUM/Kanban support out of the box - extremely configurable on almost everything - extendable through custom scripting, either built-in or via addons - very collaborative - there are thousands of addons in the marketplace; you can even write your own
cons: Being so flexible to be configured, the learning curve for admins is a little steep. The price is based on the number of users and if you experience wide user adoption in a big company, you end up in paying more for upgrading to the next tier, than if you would pay for that tier first time.

review_detail:
title: Jira effectiveness
pros: Jira Is very effective, especially for start ups, when we first started up with our projects, jira helped alot, and even when we reached a place where we thought we were better, we never stopped using it. On top of this.jira has a well managed mapping and and issue tracking abilities which is very useful.
cons: Having alot of helpful features is great, but still jira has a few problems I noticed, for a start the platform starts looking so complicated as you are trying to get to the next level of it, this makes it hard to get used to the platform, and this helps with discouraging collaboration and team work, since some people would prefer to use other platform and hence a division.

review_detail:

We've been able to expand the platform across many departments as well with relative ease. For example, when I created out new Product team, we were able to create a new "project", add a product roadmap, create swimlanes for stories and manage a backlog easily.
cons: Not many issues have been experienced lately but when we first moved to the platform, we had some major speed issues. That subsided when we updated to our own hosted version.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: It allows the organization of activities in a dynamic way, it also facilitates the estimation of time
pros: The dynamic structure to organize the activities and the income of the estimation of the execution times of each task, since it facilitates the application of agile methodologies in software development projects. Jira also allows the inclusion of those responsible for the development of each activity, in addition to notifying the person in charge of supervising it, facilitating an early detection of impediments and / or progress during the course of the tasks that are carried out. Also, the integration of Git provides valuable help when verifying changes in the development of the source code. It also has the possibility of sharing information through files of different length (.txt, .pdf, word, .mp4, among others) in order to provide greater ease of understanding to the person responsible for carrying out the informed task. In addition, this tool offers precise search filters, saving time in the handling of the interface to focus on what the user wants to obtain.
cons: 1- The synchronization time of Git with Jira slows down with some internet connections, limiting the use of the benefits of this tool in some users. 2- The user has a lot of freedom to make changes in all the modules of the tasks. Although notification of the change should be a hierarchy of charges to perform them.

author: Jatinder

review_detail:
title: A steep learning curve, but an invaluable tool worth the investment
pros: I love Jira because of the Atlassian ecosystem. Our Product Management team lives out of Jira for our day-to-day task management, and we work in a 2-week Scrum style. We use Confluence for our documentation and product requirement documents, then Jira Product Discovery for road mapping, prioritization and idea tracking. All products in the Atlassian ecosystem work seamlessly together. Jira gets a lot of hate for being complicated and hard to implement, but like many things, its biggest strength is also its biggest weakness. I love Jira because its flexibility means it's a tool that our whole company uses, from Development to Customer Support to Product Management. This makes it easy to collaborate with other teams, without having to jump between and learn other platforms. Having a couple of people in the company who know Jira inside out mitigates any implementation challenges some may complain about.
cons: I despise that Jira third-party tools/addons are billed by the number of active Jira users you have. This means that if you want to use an addon for a small team of 5 users, but you have 100 Jira users, you have to pay for 100 licenses. This billing model makes no sense and means it is financially not feasible to use most addons, which our teams could greatly benefit from using
author: Liam

review_detail:

pros: It is easy to be used by beginners and helps us alot
cons: Itcomfortable to be usedand supports us a lot in our business

cons: Requires a conscious setup, which is not easy for beginners. Might be overkill for small companies, who need a simple Kanban board for small projects.

review_detail:
title: Everyday Project Management Tool - User Experience
pros: -> powerful issue tracking capabilities -> provides a structured and customizable platform for managing tasks, bugs, and other work items. -> suitable for Scrum and Kanban boards, sprint planning, and backlog management. -> regularly releases updates and improvements are done as per the requirements by the IT Industry.
cons: -> Jira's pricing structure can be a concern for smaller teams or organizations -> free version of Jira, has limitations. -> too much customization can make things confusing and hard to keep the same across different projects. It's like having too many options that might make things more complicated instead of simpler.
author: Nishtha

review_detail:
title: Jira is needed by all.
pros: The ability to plan projects and collaborate on work.
cons: I didn't find any cons with this software.
author: Elizabeth

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Great for Agile workflows: Jira is known for its robust support of Agile project management methodologies like Scrum and Kanban. This allows teams to work in short iterations, prioritize tasks, and track progress effectively
cons: Limited out-of-the-box functionality: Some users feel Jira lacks features they need without additional customization or plugins. For instance, there might not be built-in functionality for specific types of workflows or idea management
author: Stephen John

review_detail:
title: Très belle application facile à utiliser
pros: La rapidité a laquelle on peut l'utiliser et la facilité d'accès a la grande communauté JIRA où trouver facilement de l'information sur comment configurer ou utiliser l'application.
cons: J'ai trouvé l'aspect statistiques moins friendly users. Mais avec des recherches sur la communauté JIRA j'ai pu mieux comprendre.
author: Cathy

review_detail:
title: Game-changer for cross-collaboration
pros: It took a minute to adapt to Jira coming from more colorful PM tools like Monday.com, but you really cannot beat how well Jira works across different teams. Now we can track the same epic across copy, design, automation, dev, etcEvery team can record their time, every task has its own history, and it's easy to search and backtrack information for months-long projects
cons: it's a bit dull. This may sound like a "nice to have" instead of a "must have" but I wish they would add color-coding. It can be incredibly useful, especially for more creative teams
author: Marta

review_detail:
title: Extremely capable project management platform, but almost too flexible
pros: Jira offers great flexibility: it can be adapted to any custom workflow, and readily supports custom fields/attributes. Also has fantastic API support for external integrations.
cons: Jira's flexibility is also its achilles' heal. It's relatively easy to create workflows that aren't intuitive, or worse, leave users in "dead end" states that require admin assistance. Further, their implementation of Agile tools is still a bit awkward (probably because they acquired a 3rd-party set of plugins, and didn't really make the corresponding fields native). Finally, Jira's pricing represents a slippery slope - you can get started relatively inexpensively, but adding on options here and there rapidly adds up, and can make alternatives more price-effective.
author: Ryan

review_detail:
title: A full-featured tool
pros: The simplification of communication between scrums allows us to save a lot of time and reactivity in our responses, whether internal or external.
cons: For several months now, we have been experiencing random slowdowns that occasionally lower our productivity.
author: Christophe

review_detail:
title: Que pienso de Jira
pros: El programa es agil y ayuda a eficentizar el trabajo en equipo, a mejorar el servicio al cliente y gestionar varios equipos que brinden soporte.
cons: La adpatacion a principio debido a que son varias funciones en un solo programa y mas cuando es usado por varios equipos.
author: Karla

review_detail:
title: Issue And Project Management Tool For Everyone
pros: It is essential for project management techniques to assign, prioritize, and shift tasks. The most helpful thing for developers is a single solution for project backup and direct connection to other services. Our productivity can be measured by the number of Jira tickets we resolve daily, monthly, or yearly.
cons: Beginners can find it a little confusing; I did when I first used Jira. However, it gets simpler to use as you get used to it. When multiple subtasks are added to a single task, changing its status becomes challenging.
author: Ramgopal

review_detail:
title: Best for Complex Digital Project
pros: Especially great for projects including more than one stakeholders if you think you are working in a multinational, that's unavoidable but Jira is supporting us the best.
cons: It gets sometimes little complicated especially in the comments sections where things get a little messy and also table creation is not responsive requires unnecessary scrolls.
author: Deniz

review_detail:
title: Has every bell and whistle you might need. Can get a little overwhelming the larger your org gets
pros: JIRA is the standard when it comes to project management. It has everything you could ever imagine when it comes to organization and customization. Whatever your organization is looking to capture or however you run your technical process, JIRA will be able to accommodate.
cons: The searching. As a product manager you will often times a close a ticket thinking you will never need it again but of course 3 months later something comes up that requires you to find that original ticket. With JIRA this can be a bit overwhelming if you've been using the software for a while because of the number of tickets that probably exist.
author: Ian

review_detail:
title: Not so easy to use but it has all that my team needs to keep track of work in an agile team
pros: That they are constantly improving and releasing new features that make my life easier as a QA working on an Agile team. My team relies on this software of keep track of what we are doing. It has lots of nice features that we use such as to link issues to one another, link tickets, put labels of versions to be released, link to pull requests on Git Hub and scale priority and story points. My team also uses a lot the Stories, creating Tasks under them. It's also nice that I receive emails whenever I am watching a ticket in specific to keep track of it. My entire company uses JIRA across different boards and when you want to contact a team in specific it's easy to just open a ticket or link it to another. As a QA I also use the filters a lot to find issues that are assigned to me or have been reported by me. My team also creates boards separating them by Sprints. Which is a very easy feature to use, it considers the back log and it's pretty simple to have a Planning or Retrospective section looking at it. We're happy with the features that JIRA offers.
cons: The person that organizes the board and tickets need to know a lot about the software to be able not to let it look messy. It's easy to create unnecessary tickets and put them on different places and end up losing track of it. Also, it's not easy to configure the boards to fill in correctly the burn down or any kind of chart.
author: Mariana

review_detail:
title: Jira control tool
pros: The ability to organize tasks related to a project
cons: Some of the features are complex to use or link.
author: Carlos

review_detail:
title: Vital task tracking tool for cross disciplinary teams
pros: Managing tickets for multiple engineers across several disciplines is no easy task. Jira sets the bar high in tackling this issue and tracking all work being done across each sprint and before/after. It's crucial to have everybody on the same page and to know what's being done or what needs extra help from certain people. Without Jira, our productivity would be very low.
cons: It's difficult to get up to speed on using all the available tools and functionalities. With the new look they just integrated, it was even more difficult as our team was already accustomed to the legacy version. Thankfully they had a toggle for the legacy view. The functionalities are great - it's just a bit hard to navigate and find what I'm looking for.
author: Isaac

review_detail:
title: Track projects and timeline in the easiest way
pros: The most important feature is the communication and the project tracking feature, one can understand what other team mates are working on, can get a fair idea of work load and also progress of works can be tracked within a team.
cons: There are a lot of tools which allow access and integration with third party apps Jira needs to look at that, and make the UI a bit simpler as it becomes to use as a first time user
author: Ankur

review_detail:
title: JIRA is to task management, as Google is to Search
pros: The implementation of JQL, JIRA's dialect of SQL has the very powerful type ahead feature that allows you to quickly compose statements to seek the data that you are looking for. Paired with their Scrum board, Kanban board, and Dashboards your projects truly are at your finger tips.
cons: What I don't like about product is that when exported a filter queryt to excel there are two short comings. First being is that the file created is in .XLS format and not .XLSX format. The first dates back to 1987, the second to 2004. Also, when exporting time estimate fields these estimates do not retain their time value. For example, a projects is estameted to one hour, a value of 3600 is exported. That value is course the time in seconds.
author: Erick

review_detail:
title: A open box to find what you need
pros: The customization is the best and worst part of JIRA. It allows you to mold the platform into what you need, however if you do not mold it correctly it can become a complicated process for the end users to adopt.
cons: The customization again! because all configurations are isolated and separate, making sure you cross all your T's and Dot you I's is critical to a successful deployment of JIRA

review_detail:
