author: Koz¿owski

review_detail:
title: Jira can help you tremendously if user the "right" way, or you can shoot yourself in the foot
pros: It's rich in features it offers and it's amazingly configurable, two organizations can have Jira installations that are nothing alike!
cons: It's not a big issue for me, but I think they should offer more best practices in terms of templates for less experienced users to save them from headaches - they are already taking steps in this direction. Since it's a very large product there are some inconsistencies, doing the same thing in two different parts of Jira can feel like a very different experience.
author: Mirza

review_detail:
title: Proper Project Planning Ensured
pros: The level of collaboration and ease of use make it the perfect tool for team use. Issues are managed easily and debugging becomes easy due to the issue tracking that it offers. It also integrates well with other tools and increases productivity overall.
cons: It can be quite daunting to set up at the beginning. But I would say this is common to other tools as well.
author: Abdulbasit

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management tool for Product Owners
pros: It's straightforward to track and update the progress of any Project which is working in Agile Framework. It has a very interactive dashboard, where the tickets /user stories created can be assigned to the respective team member. We can even add or tag, individual team members in the user story.
cons: There is nothing that I dislike about JIRA.
author: Debnita

review_detail:
title: A giant of software development
pros: Jira is an incredibly large and flexible tool to the point that you can virtually have any kind of project - software or not - managed inside it. But though it is large, it is also relatively simple to being with and can accommodate simple workflows even for smaller teams, with some neat ready-to-go templates. But its abiity to grow into a platform that can support a large corporation is amazing. Scalability is definitely their main power. Jira also bennefits from a very large marketplace of plugins that can bring more functionality and fit the granular specificities of each company or project. It also has a very cheap pricing for smaller teams.
cons: Some basic functionality if just not there, which is rather unbelievable considering the size of this tool. For example easily planning a sprint, doing capacity tracking or even moving or changing issues can be very difficult and you may need to resort to plugins in their marketplace (with their own pricing). Some of the more advanced functionality (like workflows) is a bit complex and confusing and requires quite a bit of studying. Their pricing after the first tier (for startups) is just unbelievably expensive. It's a jump from $10 to $1000 when you add your 11th team member. Because of this we will sadly not keep using the software after that threshold.
author: Paulo

review_detail:
title: Love/hate relationship with JIRA
pros: * Allows the issue flow to be perfectly configured to match your software development practices. * Highly customizable process management - define the properties of issues and how they transition between states. * Integration with many other products, like Slack & GitLab
cons: * "Next Gen" project type lacks many features of Classic projects. * Classic Project configuration is full of bloated features and complexity * Next Gen projects sometimes have frustrating bugs and limitations that don't get fixed for years. * Issue transition between Next Gen and Classic projects is not smooth (custom properties don't carry over)
author: David

review_detail:
title: fairly good product that delivers important application development tracking
pros: can add different projects to track, labels are useful to organize
cons: hard to navigate backlog sometimes and mark stories with subtasks as done
author: Abbi

review_detail:
title: JIRA Fades into the Background
pros: As tooling should, it isn't obstructive. Though this may be a function of how our processes and JIRA are married or skilled operators. I like how it can be integrated into the other tooling and processes that we use.
cons: There are a lot of settings that can be configured so it's a double edged sword and the error codes that we see on the front end don't necessarily express what is wrong. But admittedly support is able to get back to use quickly
author: Christopher

review_detail:
title: Quite complicated in the beginning but awesome once you get into it.
pros: It can do everything, literally. I have not experienced it at any moment that I needed a functionality and Jira didn’t have it. Besides, it’s super customizable and can cater to exactly my Workflows.
cons: It’s complicated in the beginning. Since there’s a lot of functionalities, I found it tricky to just start using it, I did have to go into the help section, read manuals, ask colleagues. But the support section actually mostly does have all the answers to my questions.
author: Anna

review_detail:
title: It wouldn't be possible to be Agile as a designer without Jira
pros: The dashboard and categories/columns are critical for our cross-functional team to, well, function. I'm a UX/UI designer and Jira has helped our design team transition to be Agile and to participate with the greater team of developers, project owners, and SEO team.
cons: It would be helpful to have some design-themed features like a field for "mockups" or "prototypes" and maybe have a feature to pull in those images in a more intuitive way. I know this software wasn't really made with us in mind and that's ok, but I think more designers are becoming part of cross-functional teams that are Agile and it would be great to have that acknowledged in such prominently used software.
author: Brittany

review_detail:
title: An essential tool for agile teams
pros: What I liked most about this platform is its easy-to-use and friendly interface. I have no prior technical experience, but I found it very easy to navigate the platform and use all its functions. Additionally, the ability to customize the dashboards and views to my needs was great as I was able to tailor it to my specific workflow.
cons: The cost is a little high but although it offers a free edition for teams of up to ten users, as the team grows, additional licenses must be purchased which can be expensive.
author: Raul Antonio

review_detail:
title: The most used agile tool on the market
pros: It's the "standard", everybody knows it, everybody uses it. Every company I've worked for uses Jira, so there you go...
cons: Support is far from good and they miss some simple, key features, for no reason. One good example is the fact you cannot add a simple checklist to a task (unless you pay for an expensive add-on that over complicates a very simple thing).
author: Leni

review_detail:
title: Best modern project management tools
pros: As a software engineer, it is mandatory to divide and modularize workload. Jira helps arranging, calculating effort, describing and organizing every team task since the first day we started using them. Its integrations with Github, Jenkins and Slack helped us to maintain a complete CI/CD pipeline and a many healthy pull request.
cons: There are no cons with Jira. Since they were incorporated to Atlassian it is possible to host your own Jira service at your very own domain.
author: Fidel

review_detail:
title: Good way to track support tickets
pros: It is a great way to manage support tickets, track submitter interaction, etc.
cons: The user interface could some interface overhaul
author: Jean

review_detail:
title: Good features let down by a difficult hard to use UX
pros: We moved to JIRA from Visual Studio online because it supported Kanban better than Visual Studio Online at the time. On the plus side, it integrates brilliantly with Slack our team communication tool of choice. You can tag stories, create reports and link to tasks easily and very efficiently with the tags displaying in Slack conversations as JIRA links. Working with Visual Studio Git we tag all of our stories with the JIRA story numbers and they link together very efficiently. Confluence is included which is a Sharepoint equivalent. This allows you to create knowledge bases of information about your projects which you can use to document your product. You can easily embed reports into this using tags or the query tools. There are a great set of features and this tool integrates well with other systems
cons: The UX changes on a fairly frequent basis and from experience not in a good way. It is still quite difficult after a year of using it to remember where things are because the controls are not as intuitive as they should be. There are a number of bugs with how the UI displays (particularly in swimlane kanban mode) and although it has fault reporting options, you don't feel that any changes you suggest or bugs you report are used. Confluence often feels like a poor persons version of sharepoint (which is not a recommendation) as it feels clunky creating pages, sections or defining navigation. The query tools are a bit like sql and partially fill in with suggestions but can be fiddly for the BA to create. This is a tool I would really like to recommend given how trendy it is but sadly after a year using I can't because whilst it's features are excellent it lacks ease of use.
author: Jonathan

review_detail:
title: Why you should use jira ?
pros: the ease of usage, the tasks representation, kanban and scrum view, reports,
cons: Coud have customised view, more colors or theme available, possibility to expand or collapse part of the column view with one click
author: Frédéric

review_detail:
title: Best Option for SaaS Development Management
pros: I have used Jira at a number of SaaS companies over the past 6 years and have found it to be easy to use for the most part. It is highly customizable and easy to implement; we migrated our current process from Pivotal Tracker to Jira with relative ease. In comparison to other similar products I have used in the past, it exceeds the competition in flexibility, integration opportunities, ease of use and implementation, as well as configurability.
cons: I find myself running into minor bug-type issues somewhat regularly; like being unable to imbed an image in an item description at creation and only being able to do so in the edit view. Also have experienced issues with multiple users editing the same item and saving over one another's changes. Only issues have been minor that we've learned to work around.
author: Britt

review_detail:
title: PM. Agile. Cloud. It works for me!
pros: As a Project Manager, we have a lot of things to do and think about. Good thing I stumbled upon JIRA. It is a very powerful and collaborative PM tool which supported my PM role in an Agile context. (I was on a standard/waterfall project methodology for years... Agile is rather new to me) It is highly configurable, meant to suit any niche, industry, or user scenario by combining the powers of Kanban and Scrum. You can set up just about any of your workflows, project states, fields, action/issue items, etc, via the default settings (that surprisingly some have worked out of the box), or by easy customization on demand. Data analysis is easy as well. JIRA collects from all data points you set up into a single data hub that is extractable, searchable, and comprehensive (with all your historical data). The core program and its APIs are pretty mature and with proper documentation. Our devs didn't really have a hard time since they were provided with a rich toolkit to begin with. JIRA also comes with its mobile app so that you can manage your projects on-the-go. It is cloud-based via subscription which relieves the admins from the difficult part of infra and server setup. I have not experienced any downtime as of my 1 year use of this service.
cons: It is cloud-based so you have to make sure you have enough bandwidth provisions to support this (rather challenging for bigger teams working on the same location at the same time). The usual loading times may take longer with poor connectivity. A rather steep price for small businesses to use. Self-hosting JIRA will also make things more expensive (and risky) as the number of users grow.
author: Josemaria

review_detail:
title: Track and analyse your developments with Jira
pros: 1. Solid integrations: are available with Jira. You can integrate with any well known CRM and also use Jira for anlyses. 2. Ticket management: is made very easy with Jira. Now, tickets can be easily assigned and tracked and the work can be done effortessly with Jira. It has tons and tons of functionalities avaibale such as tagging tickets and due date/ expiration. These values can also be utilised in analysis module for reporting.
cons: There are no major cons for Jira. Atlassian has provided a very exhaustive documentation for Jira which is available online on their website. One can simply head over to the online documentation/ FAQs and resolve most of their problems. If not, their customer support service is also great and answers back quickly. Also, a wide online community is available to support Jira, therefore, anyone new won't face much problems.

cons: The new Active Sprint view limits or restricts users to understand the main story and its subtasks. It is difficult to navigate or track the original ticket in an Active sprint view. As an alternative to this, we navigate to Backlog view and from there we track the Active Sprint tickets. The Active Sprint view should provide option to enable or disable the view of sub-tasks for the tickets. I mean, more customization here would really help users to make their own choices.

review_detail:
title: Business analyst - Awesome tool - Software administration
pros: As a business analyst, I have been using Jira for last 3 years and I think it's the best software management tool around. I have found it really helpful when it comes to providing upgrades to the projector to administer a project in development stages. It's all in one package. It has the board where you can re-protize your user stories in backlog by shuffling through pick and drop feature for the development team through tasks as well as can prioritize issues reported by the customer. You can write the user stories and just need to manage on the board. You just need to monitor the board to track the progress of the critical item and estimate overall progress. Workflow templates are available that can be selected to select the process a team wishes to follow or a path to take to address the release or apply patches on customer system. You can add the workflow by create one in the system and add the additional steps like unit testing, system testing etc as per the team. Another helpful feature that I love about this tool is that I allows integration with multiple other tools that makes it even better. Overall I think it's a remarkable tool that is making the software handling experience easy and simple.
cons: The only thing that I hate about this tool from atlastian is that it have a lot of the patches applied and part of constant changes. We need to scratch for sometime when configuration have to be modified or any existing thing changed. It takes for a while to get your hand adjusted on the system but when are down it's always good experience using it

Another incredible advantage is its mobile APP that guarantees monitoring outside the organization and allows us to always stay connected.
cons: Jira allows us to start with an unlicensed model to carry out tests and ensure that its use is what we really need, but after that we must consider that the licensed version is necessary for constant growth in our organization, so it is also important to consider the number of users that we are going to have to license for a successful implementation, and if we can afford it, we will have an excellent platform in our organization.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Powerful but Complex Project Management To

Its customizable workflows and integration capabilities make it highly adaptable to various project needs, enhancing productivity and efficiency.
cons: The steep learning curve and complexity of Jira software can be overwhelming for new users, making initial setup and navigation challenging.

review_detail:

cons: The extensive customization options can be overwhelming. For teams without a dedicated administrator, it might feel like navigating a labyrinth to set up or modify workflows effectively. New users, in particular, may struggle to grasp all the features.

review_detail:
title: Great tool, very resourceful.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

pros: I used to think Jira was only for dev and support teams, but having used is both in a marketing agency and in a marketing capacity for a tech company, it’s clearly much more versatile and can help streamline and simplify project & task management for teams large and small. The time tracking feature is useful for managing resource too.
cons: Not a con as such, but it takes a solid project manager to build out a great project management tool instance; don’t cut corners as it’ll be difficult to undo later on.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

Collaborative efforts are also supported via Kanban boards and sprint management. Be advised, however, that it has a learning curve and necessitates instruction

review_detail:

Most important feature is that it enables us to track the project progress in realtime. In addition, it is compatible with many external apps and facilitate the smooth workflow.
cons: Extensive features and customization options can make the initial setup complex, especially for newcomers to project management tools. Its lacks built-in idea management functionality, we need to use some additional tools for brainstorming and concept development. Also, the pricing seems to be bit high and it may not be an affordable option for small teams or startups with limited budgets.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

With the functionality to integrate with different development tools and the powerful API that we could use, we can push this Jira service exactly where we need and speed up our development process.
cons: Jira has a robust suite of features to support developers, project managers, and testers, but the interface can feel overwhelming for new users and there is a steep learning curve for some of the more advanced functions.

review_detail:

pros: Planning the sprint and dividing task with team mates based on story pointer respective of their experience in professional work. It helps in monitoring the work progress and completing the sprint on time.
cons: Everything is fine , i find all functionalities useful on jira

review_detail:
title: Pins projects in place including on the finance side.
pros: Although Jira is primarily set up for dev teams, I’ve found it super helpful in keeping track of what’s going on finance-wise. Particularly when co-ordinating with tech or billing. I love that I can tag different people on my team and assign due dates, and keep track of who did what, which is so useful when you’re auditing or following up on approvals.’
cons: It is not designed for financial people. Many of the terms and ideas (sprints or epics, for instance) don’t really work for accounting work, so it took a while to translate the workflow. I also wouldn’t recommend it for reporting or any real number-crunching. It’s just for tracking tasks.

review_detail:

We need solutions that seamlessly connect strategy, customer research, and proposition development with the people responsible for building and delivering those customer experiences. Compared to the new tools available, Jira feels pretty rigid—you can’t easily tweak fields or settings to fit the way different teams work

review_detail:
title: Jira meets our needs
pros: The ease of use in Jira explains it all. The user interface allows one to navigate so easily.

review_detail:

pros: Easy to learn, easy to configure, easy to use every day. From Projects to Boards to Forms, Jira helps to keep us organised across all departments. Integrations with other apps are well designed too.

review_detail:

cons: Jira’s interface can be a bit cluttered, and the complexity of its features sometimes feels unnecessary for simple design tasks. It takes a while to fully understand its full potential.

cons: It took me a bit to understand the different dashboard views within Jira, jumping to see just my tasks, all projects I'm apart of, and kanban views. I know it well now, but I remember some initial frustrations with that when first learning the system

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Best blessing for IT startups
pros: Jira has powerful features for creating reports and supports multiple integrations.
cons: In free plans Jira gives limited features.
author: Prasad

review_detail:
title: Great requirement management tool
pros: I can customize workflows, issue types, and fields to match different project needs.
cons: Jira can be overly complex, especially for new users. The interface has a lot of features, making it overwhelming for simple task tracking.
author: Mia

review_detail:
title: Jira has been the best for a while and nothing has changed
pros: The search capabilities are amazing, I can easily find tickets from a wide variety of departments. They have very nice permission settings for different user groups. The organization and tracking within Jira are some of the best in the business. I also feel that for cross departmental work, there is not a better tool in the marketplace. There is a reason almost every software company uses Jira.
cons: There are not a lot of cons with Jira. I will say that Enhancements or product development are not very often. I have also tried to use Jira as a customer facing projcet tracking tool and it was not possible.
author: Jace

review_detail:
title: Jira: Powerful tool for issue tracking and Project management
pros: Some of the features that I love about using Jira are Customizable Workflows, Integration capabilities with third-party softwares like slack and the reporting features
cons: Not a lot of cons but I have noticed that some of the first time users have a little hard time using it
author: Vinu Prasad

review_detail:
title: Improves productivity, but misses a few basic features to make it even better
pros: The standout features are the high level of customisability and the development integrations. I was able to set up automations based on our pipelines. We used Bitbucket from Atlassian as a version control system, so the integrations worked even better. I like that the platform is fairly friendly for smaller dev teams, too. While some features are price-locked behind higher tier plans, it's doable for small teams with lower budget, too. When you need extensions, that's also manageable because most of them are free or cheap under 10 users.
cons: I had two major problems. First on is that automations are very limited in executions on the lower tier plans. Actions like "assign on transition" should be a basic thing that's included in all plans, unlimited. Assigning tasks to the right person at the right time is crucial for lean operations. Second is that project duplication doesn't work very well. You lose some of the issue schemes, workflows, etc. At the same time, every time you create a new project, Jira creates new schemes/workflows for it - even if you use the same ones for all of your projects. That creates clutter, and to my knowledge it was impossible to set up a project template in Jira cloud. Other than that, at times, the interface can encounter bugs. That's understandable with the complexity of the product, but it's still annoying.
author: Dawid

review_detail:
title: Undisputedly fast and Reliable Tool for Project Management and Service Desk Support.
pros: I really love how Jira is easy friendly, easy to learn how to navigate through the program.Fantastic dashboards thats makes customization easy and fit every specific need.Nice mobile functionality. More secure.Greatly support kanban boards .
cons: The support and services are amazing since day one ,I have nothing against to say

review_detail:

Its filters are very powerful, it is especially important to create a board for your own use. Nice to save a time with jira
cons: There is no part of it that I can specifically say I didn't like. But I expect Jira to get more support from AI to make our work easier. Each issue can be assigned to a team member, allowing teams to have a centralized view of all project tasks and easily monitor the progress and evolution of the project. It's a great management tool.

review_detail:
title: The best tool around for project management!
pros: This tool is extremely user friendly and allows for efficient management of tasks. My team uses this tool as part of a Scrum framework, where we create tickets to be completed on a biweekly basis. We have a project owner who creates the "tickets" or tasks for the team. We then have a Scrum master who prioritizes them with the team after ranking based on business need and developer complexity. The team can then work through the tickets and drag and drop them into buckets to virtually update the team (ex. to do -> in development -> UAT in progress -> hypercare -> deployed).
cons: I have no negative feedback for this product. I find it extremely intuitive and it fully fills our business need. It is also very aesthetically pleasing.
author: Jaimie

review_detail:
title: High quality task management using JIRA
pros: Performance is awesome. being able to access on the web is great. Collaboration is great. reporting is also great.

cons: Tool can sometimes overcommunicate status updates when the ticket isn't actually closed.
author: Matthew

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Jira is a tool that allows you to easily track the project progress and history. It is easy to learn and use. One of its major achievements is that it has a good reputation and almost everyone working in an agile way has used id,listened of it or at least tried it once. It is a powerfull tool to micromanage a team ,track the tasks, monitor the blocking tasks and measure the contribution of team members.
cons: Jira comes with some deficiencies. When the team scales it becomes much more expensive,something that is difficult for small teams to afford. It is quite difficult to track the history if you haven't used everything from naming to giving the proper tabs something that might be difficult from the early steps of the project to be known. Last but not least , JIRA is user friendly , though it is quite difficult to structure the project inside it , and i cant imagine how a large group of lets say 20 people can communicate properly using JIRA.
author: Ioannis

review_detail:
title: The most complete tool you will ever need
pros: It allows you to create projects, account for billable and non-billable hours, see who did what and when. Jira allows project managers to create projects, their backlogs, and Kanban boards. You can move tasks through all phases of a project, from Backlog to Done, set as Ongoing, duplicate them, attach files to them. You can see tasks in retrospective to check how the work was actually performed and find deviations, among other features.
cons: As with any tool that is useful and complete, it is complex. It takes time and dedication to learn all that has to be learned about Jira. I do project management of a limited complexity and have had to do the full walk around of the tool to be able to feel comfortable using it. I have been using it for over 6 months now and I feel fully confident that I can find everything I need to find. One thing that could definitely be improved is that task cards do not allow to create checklists, which I find to be very useful. On the other hand, each card has a content field that allows you to create lists (numbered or bulleted), as you would do in Word. This is my workaround solution to checklists.
author: Arturo

review_detail:

pros: Easy to configure the flow and setup process ready to use again and again.
cons: User display has too many option to access. It make it very complicated.

cons: That we cant add more than one assignee to the task (could appear as a list). But non the less a great tool

cons: I feel the dashboards are confusing and not very user friendly like the other jira pages. Also certain tools are not integrated completely
author: Athira

review_detail:
title: The most sober-minded and reliable project management software on the market for agile equipment.
pros: I have tried different project management software, and I can affirm that "Jira" is the most complete and formal software I have worked with. It has a sober and intuitive interface, similar to other project management software. However, at the beginning I needed some training for its use. What makes it attractive are the following features: 1. You can work Agile and Scrum with Kanban or Scrum boards. 2. It is oriented to incidents. So it has a very powerful engine for its creation and management. 3. Planning of agile roadmaps. I think this is what fascinates me most about this tool. Portfolio for Jira helps you create a plan, get an overall perspective, track progress and share your plan with stakeholders. That saves many inconveniences, since you can visualize if something is not working out as planned and in this way apply other strategies. 4. Finally, this software is scalable. Have the project management designed for teams of any size or condition, allowing you to add or change fields.
cons: There is nothing bad I can say about the operation or performance of the software, since both the company that did it, as well as other companies that have developed plugins keep it updated and functional. The only disadvantage is that in fact the license is not cheap, and if you want to add add-on you have to pay for each of them. Therefore, this tool is intended to be used by large companies.
author: Francis Carolina

review_detail:
title: A true software for SCRUM and more.
pros: Jira is an excellent ideal tool for managing work teams, what I liked the most is how easy it is to adapt projects to Jira, especially SCRUM is a tool that fits perfectly with this teamwork methodology, it has everything, backlog, sprints, user history, etc. It is quite practical when delegating functions to other team members, it has a very nice and intuitive interface, the subscription price for each user is quite acceptable.
cons: Despite the fact that the interface is very pleasant and easy to understand, Jira offers a wide variety of options to configure the projects, but if done correctly it can cause unforeseen restrictions in the project. However Jira is continually putting out new updates to improve the user experience.
author: Winston

review_detail:
title: Decent tool for Project Management
pros: As a small team of 6 developers, Jira is one of the easiest and best tools with multiple project management methodologies supported. As it has free pricing for members less than 10, there have been no blockers since the start of the current project, and following scrum has been no problem due to its features.
cons: Although there have not been any blockers on the project due to Jira, there could be a few interface changes that could benefit everyone. Currently, there are no easy ways to know that an issue contains child issues without clicking on the issue and viewing it, and the outer interface provides no clue about it. The user interface can also feel complex at the beginning and learning it might take a bit of time.
author: Ozone

review_detail:
title: Best ticketing tool to use and track Issues
pros: Ease of use and filters and customizing dashboard based and sharing across team
cons: All good, when downloading any incidents it should consider all the attachments and download in the particular incident.
author: Vinayak

review_detail:
title: Great tool to help team build an amazing project management team
pros: Task scheduling, task management, timeline creation, team assignment, agile techniques, reports and analytics are some of great features I have used for many of my projects
cons: It's harder to learn when you get started. Backtracking the project and KT is easier but sometimes hard to navigate
author: Ayush

review_detail:
title: Jira is a fundamental tool, not only in the IT area but for all.
pros: Dashboard: With it I can manage which stage is missing to accomplish and situate myself on the current status of the project.Backlog: As I said in the feedback, it is essential so that there are no pending issues and we deliver a quality service without delays.
cons: In the beginning it takes a while to learn how to use the platform, as it has a lot of functionality (which is a positive point) we get a little confused to know where each functionality is.
author: Maria

review_detail:
title: Perfect Tool for Task management
pros: Smoothness and their user-friendly User Interface. they are smooth and we can put our task list in it and can be assigned priorities and labels based on their importance.
cons: Nothing so far. I have found some bugs in beta features but we can expect bugs in beta versions .
author: Vishnu

review_detail:
title: Outstanding platform
pros: Ideal for asset the board and issue following, great for project directors to discover where the group is investing most extreme energy and helps in data transmission portion, understanding group speed. With the Atlassian Suite, Jira + Confluence is a dangerous couple.
cons: Assuming you coincidentally click on some unacceptable name, the submitter gets a notice when it is relegated, and afterward another notice when you fix this by doling out it to the right name.
author: Nyakueka

review_detail:
title: Streamline your workflow with Jira
pros: I've been using Jira for over a year now and it has been an absolute lifesaver. It's helped to streamline our workflow and given us better visibility into our tasks, allowing us to prioritize what's important. The reports are also incredibly useful in helping us determine which projects we should focus on, as well as tracking our progress. All in all, Jira is an invaluable tool that I would highly recommend!
cons: I've used it for more than a year and have found that it has a wide variety of capabilities; up to now, I haven't run into any restrictions.
author: Dipak

review_detail:
title: JIRA helps your teams improve their velocity
pros: JIRA is the best Agile/Kanban took our teams use to track the work getting done. It’s super easy to link to other issues or relevant features. We used it standup to talk about what we are working on and what was blocking us from delivering the work.
cons: It was pretty expensive to use, and to its fullest capacity only with other other Atlassian products (bitbucket, bamboo, etc). Would have liked to see it place nicely with other software besides itself. Authentication is kind of hard to setup
author: John

review_detail:
title: Feedback on JIRA Usage
pros: The best thing i like about this software is the "Comments" Option in the JIRA . It's so easy to interact with the JIRA assignee or the reporter. One can by simply address someone by typing "@" and the name of the person(which gets auto populated as you type the initials of the name). Moreover, any important text can be highlighted by using "per-formatted" option available in the "Text" or "Visual" Format options. It allows your comment to be readable to selected audience as well based on the selected option.
cons: The only thing which i hate or would like to get changed is the Window size while creating a new JIRA. A small window instead of a new page pops up while hitting the "Create" option. This makes a bit difficult for user to punch in the required details to open a new JIRA.
author: Rajan

review_detail:
title: A smooth user experience within the Atlassian stable
pros: Tight intergration with other Atlassian products like Bitbucket and Confluence. Smooth interface and ease of use - - Drag and drop stories/subtasks in Active Sprint and backlog means easy organisation of your workflow - Creation of stories/tasks is very easy - there is autocomplete in drop downs etc, that allow you to link to other users/tasks/stories/confluence documents/other story boards and epics. - Ability to tag stories for ease of search - Abilty to track hours worked per story Plenty of workflow related charts (Burndown, etc) Almost unlimited customization.
cons: - The unlimited customization is also almost a weakness. Story/Task creation dialogs can become over crowded so the administrator needs to be judicious about the customized design. - The reports seem a little rudimentary at times, however this may be due to a lack of user diligence in keeping their stories up to date.
author: Greg

review_detail:
title: JIRA Review
pros: Having used JIRA for project/task management at both small and larger companies, I think JIRA's greatest strength is the sheer scope of the product and the breadth of features and integrations that it offers. Everything from GitHub hooks, customizable status flows and testing suite integrations are available and easy to work with.
cons: In my usage, I feel that JIRA often feels bloated and sluggish, especially with regards to the amount of time it takes to load a ticket page. Additionally, JIRA pages often become quite cluttered and there are frequently large lags between when certain components on the page load. For example, if I want to change the user assigned to a ticket, I often have to wait for the name of the person to actually load while the ticket status loaded several seconds beforehand.
author: Ronald

review_detail:
title: THE all-in-one product lifecycle management tool
pros: THE agile tool to manage product lifecycle from roadmap and ideas, to user stories, detailed tasks for engineers and QA, and experimentation design and tracking.
cons: The hierarchy, while flexible, can be daunting and too complex for smaller enterprise clients/startup.
author: Laure

review_detail:
title: JIRA review.
pros: It is very easy to track my work tickets, collaborate with colleagues, and link to other Epic tickets or other related JIRA to keep track of all events for a specific issue and who is involved.
cons: The only issues I have had with JIRAs in over 10 years of use is only when there is an issue with access to the JIRA environment.
author: Sean

review_detail:
title: Managing My Business With Jira's Incredible Software
pros: This is an all-in-one software that has modern tools and features that make project,task,workflow & business management process to be easier daily.
cons: Jira works well and it does not have issues, since i started using Jira i haven't had challenges all i have is fantastic times.
author: Darlington

review_detail:
title: Best For Team GTET
pros: It has feature of bulk task update, manage task more efficiently, it has best customer support , it's easy to track other's activities , helps in collaboration.
cons: It's take so much ram to run if multiple tab of jira is running , which slows down personal computer.
author: Surbhi

review_detail:
title: My Outstanding and Remarkable Experience with Jira.
pros: It is simple to build, deploy and scale applications with Jira. It is simple to plan ,manage and execute projects with Jira. It is simple to track project progress with Jira. It is simple to track and fix bugs with Jira.
cons: Jira works perfectly and I therefore lack anything to complain about.
author: Sachin

review_detail:
title: Great tool for managing projects!
pros: Jira offers an excellent platform for managing multiple projects efficiently, especially when working across diverse teams. It provides a highly customizable experience, particularly in terms of time tracking and effort estimation, which makes tracking progress clear and comprehensive. Adding details to tasks and subtasks is straightforward, ensuring that nothing important is overlooked. The ability to clone tickets is a standout feature, saving time when similar tasks need to be created or duplicated for different projects. Additionally, the state management on the boards is smooth, allowing users to easily move tasks between statuses and keep the whole team in sync on project progress. Overall, Jira is an essential tool for organized, effective project management with great flexibility to meet team needs.
cons: One area that could use improvement is email notifications. They often feel cluttered and overwhelming, making it difficult to focus on the most relevant updates. A more streamlined approach to notifications would enhance the user experience and help prioritize the most important information.
author: Alan

review_detail:
title: THE REAL "G" PLATFORM FOR MANAGING PROJECTS
pros: It is an excellent platform for project management It is easy to use It is cost effective It helps us keep track of tasks
cons: There's nothing to complain about jira it is the goto for project management
author: Titilayo

review_detail:
title: The world of software engineers through eye of Jira software tool.
pros: I like jira most features like jeera integrate with variety of quality assurance apps like sonarqube, Jenkins etc. Using jira software developer can customize Jara project with configurable and organisation structure work flow level of agility maturity.
cons: As per my opinion the learning for work means within the jira it's difficult to learn especially for new users might be too complex. Personally I faced problem while uploading more number of files size issue as the limited file size upload.
author: Pradip

review_detail:
title: If you become and advanced user there's no limit for what Jira can do for your project management needs.
pros: The usability, and the great dashboards and customized filters are so practical for task management and visibility
cons: I would like to see new features for more interactive dashboards to incorporate some Kanban board approach
author: Clara

review_detail:
title: A Must Have PPM Program of this Era: Jira
pros: Jira is a complex PPM tool that allows me to save time by automating task and project management processes.
cons: The free plan lack advanced capabilities. However, this is not a big issue since I upgraded to the premium plan.
author: Saad

review_detail:
title: Comprehensive Review: Jira – The Powerhouse for Project Management
pros: Jira's versatility, customizable workflows, visibility, integrations, automation, and Agile support.
cons: Jira's steep learning curve, and occasional slow, cluttered interface for beginners.
author: Rowson

review_detail:
title: Best Project Management Tool
pros: Jira is the best project management and issue-tracking tool I have ever worked with. It allows me to customize my project workflow and track progress with the Dashboard feature.
cons: Sometimes the customization It provides decreases the speed of the workflow.
author: Parth

review_detail:
title: Prefiero a Jira por encima de muchas otras, ¡Es el mejor software de organización!
pros: Lo que más me agrada de utilizar Jira es la facilidad de crear compromisos y conectar con los demás colaboradores, dar seguimientos a tareas y tener conocimiento constante de los avances realizados.
cons: No tiene un tutorial correspondiente. O sea, cuando incié Jira, vi los videos y alguien me explicó su utilidad, pero tiende a ser confuso sin un tour general.
author: Vielka

review_detail:
title: Jira makes agile easy
pros: It makes it really easy to see tasks and work in an agile way to achieve our goals as a team. I like the sprint boards that you can customize with different headings so there is transparency about the status of tasks across the team.
cons: It can be a little bit buggy at times. Some days it seems to run really slowly and be quite laggy as you are navigating around the site. It also doesnt auto update when someone is making changes to the board - you have to refresh to see what changes have been made which can be a little annoying and lead to some repetition
author: Heather

review_detail:
title: Go to for large dev teams and enterprise
pros: It's probably the most popular PM application in the tech space, especially in enterprise or if you manage large teams for agile practices
cons: Administration can get complex at times, mainly if you are not dedicated or focused on being a scrum master or PM
author: Danny

review_detail:
title: Jira is a rockstar
pros: Keeps everyone on the same page so there is little room for guessing on whats happening
cons: The search option is not always helpful....there are lots of options to choose from and that can get in the way
author: David

review_detail:
title: Streamlined Project Management with Jira
pros: Jira’s flexibility and customizable workflows are fantastic for tailoring project management to any team’s needs. Its integration with tools like Confluence and Bitbucket enhances collaboration, and the reporting features provide valuable insights.
cons: The initial learning curve can be steep, making it overwhelming for new users. Configuring advanced workflows might also be complex.
author: Abu

review_detail:
title: Still a great product that needs to clearly define it's course.
pros: - Great set of functionalities. - Great automation. - Fantastic integration with other tools.
cons: - Team-managed and company-managed are an unnecessary distinction that create a lot of overhead and annoyance on the project management process. - Team-managed projects have functionalities that are not present in company-managed projects and vice-versa. - Lackluster documentation.
author: Nicolas

review_detail:
title: The project management tool for anything & everything
pros: Jira is the perfect project management tool for me. It has very much customization options for projects to perfectly match what I want to achieve. I like the different project types and the templates, they are useful to just get started. It also integrates perfectly in Confluence and other Atlassian products.
cons: The Web interface is a bit slow, especially when navigation much through different tasks. Although the mobile app is super clean, there are some missing features overall.
author: Nicholas

review_detail:
title: Great Ticket management tool ?
pros: One of the best ticket management applications. Ease of setting up plugins Large number of extension features
cons: Searchability sucks. High dependency on project setup and structure of the fields. JQL has become so complex .. only power users can use it. Once the project is over and due to the fluidity of jira structure. Its impossible to get all the information in a consolidated manner. It is as good as the people who are managing it. Tool should be able to provide information the absence of processes but its other way around with JIRA .. Use AI.
author: Srinivasa

review_detail:
title: Jira is AWESOME!!!
pros: The collaboration and transparency the tool creates inter-departmentally and cross functionally between companies is phenomenal.
cons: Would love a way to request permissions within the product. I currently need to reach out to parties outside of the platform via email when I don’t have permissions to certain documents or boards, or want to be a watcher on a ticket. It would be nice if there was an ask for permission button within the browser.
author: Mary

review_detail:
title: Overall top product for software development task tracking and management
pros: Jira, as a part of other Atlassian products, has been improved a lot in the last year. When we started with Jira, we were only using it for development task tracking, nowadays we are using it, along with Confluence and Bitbucket, as the backbone of our technical records. Jira takes time to get to know to, but they are improving the UI towards more user friendly way. I have not yet found any possible alternatives for the overall capabilities of Jira.
cons: Some part of settings and some more advanced options in Jira are still a bit hard to reach. But you just need to use the docs and search for help from the internet when you feel like you are stuck. There are a lot of Jira users out there and many of the issues you will face when using it, have been recognised and people have found word arounds.
author: Antti

review_detail:
title: Detailed project monitoring for diving operations.
pros: Jira makes it easy to understand task management and collaboration among teams, with boards displaying what's in progress for vessels, equipment checks, and marketing. Templates and rapid filters enable crew and office personnel to remain synchronized on a daily basis.
cons: Customer support is slow for lengthy workflow questions, and setup involves some learning curve to install fields and automations for new users. It is some adjustment to keep the screens free of clutter for non-technical team members.
author: David

review_detail:
title: One of the best task management tool for Agile teams

cons: The filters are not always working the way we think giving us a bit of frustration

Jira is update there tool time to time.
cons: we can manage the sprint planning of entire the team , we can track the progress using chart diagram, also we manage team work items, etc.

review_detail:

pros: Built with the user experience in mind and great for ticket management. Everyone I know also loves it!

review_detail:
title: A Review of Jira's Project Management Features
pros: If your team embraces Agile methodology, Jira is practically its best friend. The platform's features like user stories, sprints, and Kanban boards are like a built-in Agile coach, helping teams stay flexible and responsive to changing priorities.
cons: With all that power comes some potential complexity. Setting up custom workflows and automations can be time-consuming, especially for teams that aren't familiar with Jira's intricacies. If you need a simple and straightforward project management tool, Jira might be a bit much to handle.

review_detail:

cons: addition information that needed to be put in and it took time away from the team

title: Jira by Atlassian: Streamlining Project Management with Precision
pros: What I like most about Jira is its flexibility and customization options, allowing teams to tailor workflows and processes to suit their specific project needs seamlessly.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Powerful Project Management, But Can Be Overwhelming
pros: Jira excels in managing complex projects with customizable workflows and robust tracking capabilities. Its integration with other Atlassian products is a strong advantage for teams already in that ecosystem.
cons: The interface can be overwhelming, especially for new users. It takes time to learn and configure, and some features feel unnecessarily complicated.

review_detail:
title: The gold standard for managing stories and tasks.
pros: We use JIRA to manage all of our work for product design

author: Jaymer

review_detail:
title: My Views on Jira Usage Outlined in a Filled Review
pros: With Jira, I have been able to meet my deadlines and due dates when submitting proposals in all my 4 current organizations.
cons: I am a daily user and I find nothing to dislike on this program.
author: Steve

review_detail:
title: Great tool
pros: Ability to tailor the workflows to our teams way of working
cons: Cost of licensing especially for data enter edition
author: Andy

review_detail:
title: The use of Jira
pros: Jira goes very hand in hand in the scrum development lifecycle. It keeps tracks of what part of the projects that need to be worked on and what exactly is being done to rectify any upcoming problems. This allows for all members of the team to be in communication and on the same page concerning issues. I also liked, that when finding a bug I can attribute it to myself.
cons: Getting the initial flow of how Jira works with other atlassian products may seem confusing at first but eventually I got the flow. Also, if the team found an issue as a collective, I didn’t like that I could not attribute that to the whole group but instead it was just one individual who would receive credit. When it came down to add supporting evidence the text box didn’t have markup tools that were helpful like including tables.
author: Mary

review_detail:
title: Jira powerful
pros: Jira is celebrated for its adaptability and efficiency. Its ability to streamline task management, customize workflows, and provide insightful reports are standout qualities.
cons: Customizable, effective for agile teams, strong reporting features. Cons: Can be complex, time-consuming to set up, potentially expensive for small teams.
author: Andreas

review_detail:
title: Agile Methodology Practice Using Jira
pros: Jira is a great tool for agile software development. The kanban board helps to manage your IT projects and sprint planning. The tool helps developers to prioritize and keep track of issues, bugs and features.
cons: It is more difficult to navigate through the application than it is for Azure DevOps for instance.
author: Thelma

review_detail:
title: Great tool for handling sprint related activities
pros: Efficient way to handle sprint with various items like stories, defects, features all in the way of flow!
cons: Nothing much when compared to other tools in the same space!

review_detail:
title: Jira gibt mir regelmäßig den geforderten Überblick

cons: Manchmal muss ich etwas suchen und mich durchklicken, bis ich das finde, was ich suche oder machen möchte

review_detail:
title: Benefits of using jira
pros: What I like most about Jira is the visibility of each task in each project as well as the options you have to write user stories in a detailed, easy and understandable way. It is easy to know what each user is up to, what task they take and how much time they spend on it, as well as being able to leave comments on each task also helps a lot.
cons: It lacks a little more in the area of projects, such as the creation of a gantt, a project plan or a roadmap to be able to relate it to each task, it would be incredible if that could be done
author: Veronica

review_detail:
title: Good agile management system
pros: Fully featured agile management system for either scrum/sprints or Kanban. Highly customisable and it integrates with the other Atlassian tools (BitBucket, Confluence)

review_detail:
title: Efficient Task Management with Some Performance Hiccups
pros: How well it organizes tasks across different teams and people. It makes assigning tasks and tracking them so straightforward. Plus, the interface strikes the perfect balance—not overly fancy but not too minimalist either. It’s just right for staying on top of things.
cons: That it can get pretty slow at times, especially on desktop. Plus, the app has more bugs than I’d like, which can be frustrating when I need to check things on the go.

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool!
pros: It’s the best project management tool in the market. Tracking tasks, sprint planning, effort and time management, everything is amazing in Jira.

review_detail:
title: Good platform, bad learning curve
pros: Jira helps a dev team follow their workflow fluently; you can see the board and track an issue, and make it a good tool for those developers in their daily lives.
cons: The learning curve makes it difficult to understand at the beginning.
author: Luis Alberto

review_detail:
title: Jira Review:A Comprehensive Look at the Pros and Cons of Agile Project Management

cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users due to its extensive customization options and features. Setting up workflows, boards, and permissions often requires a learning curve, which can be frustrating for teams that need a simpler, more intuitive tool

review_detail:
title: A Welcome Upgrade from ClickUp
pros: I recently made the switch from ClickUp to Jira, and I must say, it's been quite a positive change. Jira offers a more streamlined and user-friendly interface, which has made my daily tasks easier to manage. Its project management capabilities, including custom workflows, boards, and enhanced reporting, have significantly improved my team's efficiency. The integration with other Atlassian tools like Confluence has also been seamless, enhancing our collaborative efforts.
cons: Of course, it's not without its drawbacks. The pricing for Jira can be a bit on the higher side, especially for smaller teams. Additionally, there's a bit of a learning curve when transitioning from ClickUp to Jira, but with patience and practice, it becomes more manageable.
author: Chris

review_detail:
title: High quality software
pros: All project management features has high quality functionalities.
cons: Integration with 3th party applications
author: Sergio R

review_detail:
title: JIRA is an amazing tool in a very useful suite of project management software.
pros: JIRA is a great way to track items that need to be done or defects that need to be fixed across a business. If you take the time to customize the interface, add fields, workflows, etc. that match your business model, JIRA can make your organization so much more transparent and efficient. Combined with it's siblings Confluence, BitBucket, et. al. you have an amazing suite of productivity tools. Each individual may feel that they are doing a little more than they used to when adding information into these tools, but the time saved in meetings, querying peers for information & not having the full picture will soon become apparent. To get the most of JIRA, be prepared to customize and train. Without those two pieces, you may end up with users who don't see or feel the benefit.
cons: The least appealing thing about JIRA and the other tools in the Atlassian suite is the fact that you must buy plug-ins to get a lot of functionality that should have been built in. Atlassian is proud of their App ecosystem, but, from an end user perspective, it can just feel like it is a place grabbing your money.
author: Tim

review_detail:
title: Extremely confusing software, not user friendly, just complicated
pros: The amount of possibility that gives you are endless. Usefull in really big teams especially when you have to log and keep track of software issues and failure. It helps to easily manage the status of your issues and easily communicate with your or other teams.
cons: Not user friendly. It completely makes you forget why you are using it in the first place. Too many "solutions" and often not a single one is worth it. The price is extremely high, considering that you are not receiving the same assistance and software quality of their competitors.
author: Dario

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: I liked its customizable workflows which were helpful in handling tasks in a way that aligned my development methodology. We used multiple methodologies for different projects and Jira was perfect as it is adjustable to any method. I liked its integration feature with GitHub and Slack which made our task flow smooth.
cons: In the beginning, it was complex because of its extensive customization options. For me, it was a bit harder to set up the projects and flow initially.
author: Bishal

review_detail:
title: JIRA - A very complete tool from Atlassian portfolio.
pros: The Scrum boards are very light weight and handy to manage backlog and Sprint planning and execution
cons: Customization is a bit a of an issue. Eazy BI report plugging is bit lethargic and difficult to operate upon

review_detail:
title: Exceptional project and Task Management tool
pros: Jira's ability to be customized to meet the unique needs of any organization and its comprehensive set of features and integrations make it an effective solution for tracking and managing tasks, monitoring project progress, and collaborating with stakeholders.
cons: The least liked thing about Jira is that it can be difficult to learn, especially for those who are unfamiliar with the project management software.
author: Crispussia

review_detail:
title: It is very easy to keep track of assignments at work
pros: I loved Jira such a ton that subsequent to moving positions I took it with me and utilized their free form just to help track my own personal errands but none of my other colleagues were utilizing it. Jira has made my work life simpler particularly during a period where we as a whole need to work distantly. It assists me with dealing with the undertakings and follows side by side of the jobs being finished. The product is very simple to know and hence the wealth of clear how-to recordings is incredible.
cons: Estimating has gotten truly wild as of late. it had been once extraordinary worth however since they should be cornered a major market fragment they're truly draining it for all its value, Jira like most programming highlights a tad of an expectation to learn and adapt.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Useful tool for agile development
pros: The tool works great to keep track of an ongoing software development job. Multiple users can get involved within the platform and have different subtasks assigned to them. Having the possibility to create workflows keep things simple and easy to see what's the current status of the whole task at a glance. The platform allows for customisation as well, this comes really handy as no project is identical and you may need to add some automations to the process to meet your specific needs. Thanks to their recent Boards implementation, you can see the next tasks that need to be worked on and as well as what's already been done and what's in progress.
cons: The platform might be a bit overwhelming when you start working with it for the first time. It's hard to know all the possible functionalities until you have worked with it for a while. Although it's possible to customise, some parts can get a bit tricky to perform if you don't have the knowledge. On the other side, you can also reach out to them if you need help. In terms of pricing, it can get a bit expensive if you need a lot of users.
author: Pedro

review_detail:
title: Using JIRA with Corporate Learning and Development
pros: Ability to collaborate easily with SCRUM teams; everyone has access in real time to the most up to date information for each JIRA story; ability to mock ups and to add comments @ team members who are notified immediately and vice versa when they respond. It allows us to accurately track to our L&D deliverables related to the SCRUM’s JIRA stories, as they may change over the course of a sprint.
cons: Sometimes you have to download a mock up instead of it opening directly in Windows viewer, not a big deal but just an extra step; JIRA is a much more technical application, it definitely requires a learning curve to use it, it’s not a super simple interface.
author: Marcy

review_detail:
title: Among the top 5 best project management tools for Software Development
pros: This is a pretty interesting and simple to use software platform by developers, testers & managers in the software industry. It is mainly adopted by teams following the agile methodology. The overall usability and user experience are unbelievable and the smoothness through which we can switch between different sections of the platform makes it a very usable product. It helps to create Scrum and Kanban projects as well as create and manage tasks, user stories, etc. by these teams. Developers can easily use GIT or TFS to check-in or commit data on the respective servers whereas testers can file relevant bugs or issues encountered for the relevant tasks under a User story. Overall, this is a great project management tool to use.
cons: As compared to other platforms like Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly Visual Studio Team Services), this tool doesn't provide much more features and support for functionalities. Anyone would prefer to use Azure DevOps as it is a complete DevOps solution as well as a Project management tool with decent pricing for corporates and also free pricing for a team of 5.
author: Siddhant

review_detail:
title: The best solution for Team Project Management
pros: A lot of plugins and tools are available on the Marketplace. The tools are used a lot amoung the Video Game Industry, making it a standard for task management and bugtracking. Offers a lot of options to present to the data to the users as well as gathering information from the backlogs and rendering charts for project managers.
cons: Lot of options and tools, makes it hard to master. Not always easy to find its way in the options, especially because the tool is revamping and evolving often, making tutorials or classes quickly out of date.
author: Cédric

review_detail:
title: Great for Backlogs and Organizing Software Releases - Bad For Agility
pros: The backlog and features for managing the backlog with different methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum, or Kanban + Scrum hybrid are very flexible. Planning sprints, releasing sprints, and looking at history of what was done is very organized.
cons: Cumbersome to setup. Workflows for issues and UI/UX for creating them is not easy to understand. Sure you can figure it out, but it will require a lot of facepalms. It's good for larger organizations with several cross-functional teams, but if you are a smaller organization stick with Trello and checklists for the cards if sub-tasks are needed. The sub-tasks in Jira are just plain awful to work with, and will end up wasting a lot of time for your team.
author: Adam

review_detail:
title: Could be simple or complex - all up yo you
pros: I've been using JIRA on an off, for about 15 years with several employers that I have been. It is very customizable, and can be as simple or high lever as administrator/users require it. If you have several users working on a project, no matter how complex - JIRA is your tool. You can create tasks, subtasks, assign them to different users (who will receive email notifications when they are mentioned or any changes are made), request updates, etc.
cons: Some of the users I worked with overcomplicated the process - but this is not fault of JIRA at all.

These features makes the life very comfortable and it helps people at onsite and offshore collaborate well and communicate well.
cons: Sometime due to many option/boxes to fill for tracking, it make monotonous. This may confuse the first time users a lot. Mastering this tool is little difficult too.

review_detail:
title: It does it all - then they add more for free
pros: I have been using the cloud version of JIRA for over 9 years. One of its best features is they keep expanding its capabilities and don't change the cost. Don't get me wrong the tool has always done what I expected it to do and done it well, but with each release the generally add some features and capabilities it did not have before. I love that they allow Kanban boards and sprints on the same project - if that's how you want to work. Super flexible, fast and easy to use, even when I'm doing Admin work that I don't do everyday and can't remember exactly how to do it. Additionally the tool has lots of add-ons - we use Tempo for time keeping and have used Gliffy in the past for diagramming. I'm not sure if
cons: My least favorite thing is that they have changed the interface several times while I have been using it. However each time after I spend time getting used to it I find their redesign to be significantly better. I really find this when I use locally hosted older versions and see what I used to do - I really realize how they improved it.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: JIRA : One of the software for project management.
pros: Task management. Bug tracking. Dashboard Watchers Attachments
cons: The size limit of the attachment is 20 MB. Sometimes there are multiple options, that are confusing so it will be better to have a quick demo.
