title: JIRA Review.
pros: Project management and version control is a breeze with JIRA
cons: JIRA cost continues to rise yearly - this made us look at alternatives but we stuck with it.
author: James

review_detail:
title: Tons of features, but not well organized
pros: JIRA provides a powerful way to organize your project either in a SCRUM or Kanban style project. It allows you to create custom workflows (swim lanes) as your stories/tasks are worked on which is valuable if your team does things in a non-standard manner. Most items can be easily modified through inline editing, and the reports and status board provide a good way to get a feel for where you're going and where you've been.
cons: While there is a lot of data within JIRA to manage your project, it is poorly managed in a lot of pages. For example, you must assign a story to a sprint in order to be able to assign points to it. This prevents you from doing some early pointing of stories before they go into a sprint. Likewise, certain fields are only available in certain views, which makes it a hassle to manage on a day to day basis. While I can appreciate the diversity of options JIRA provides, a more streamlined flow to the system may make it easier and more productive to work with as a whole.
author: Sean

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: It is a very configurable platform that can suit many workflows or processes
cons: The marketplace can be very expensive if you have many uses but only a few users need the addon
author: Simon

review_detail:
title: Jira review
pros: Easy Management, Activity tracking daily progress
cons: Training required to understand the tool
author: Srinivasarao

review_detail:
title: I've never used a better project management tool.
pros: The user interface has been designed to be incredibly user friendly, which is my favorite aspect of Jira. I've been using Jira since 2019, or nearly three years. I had a lot of trouble getting started with Jira, but I must say that the designers have made so many enhancements that I can now use it regularly. The best part is that it can now be used by any team to track and complete tasks.
cons: I have no complaints about utilizing Jira software. There is still room for improvement, but it isn't anything I mind. Sticky formatting options should be included. To format the Ticket description, I have to navigate up.
author: Deepak

review_detail:
title: Good collaboration tool, not great
pros: Things can be shared easily and it is easy to track tasks. It allows making different Sprints, Backlogs.. so things are classified easily and usually are easy to find. Very useful if you work with an Agile methodology
cons: It is heavy, so it can take a while to load. It does not refresh automatically when more than one person is managing a Kanban / Sprint board. It is not as easy as I would like it to be: I can't find completed sprints, the flow in the tasks is not very clear and tasks can get lost if you don't tag them as it expects you to
author: Vicente Jose

review_detail:
title: Best software for Scrum team management
pros: We use the Jira everyday to create new userstories in our Sprint. It allows to organize all the progress and completed tasks. The reports are also a very good feature. We can look into Sprint burndown chart, Velocity chart.
cons: The integration with the other softwares can be improved a little bit. Example, if we are using Pega with JIRA, it should have a link from pega itself.
author: Meghana

review_detail:
title: Best agile project management tool i have used so far
pros: JIRA is popular issue tracking and project management tool developed by Atlassian. JIRA has all advanced features a agile project management tool provide like scrum tracking, Sprint burndown chart, Agile reports, velocity charts. JIRA supports estimation of tasks in points as well as hours and does also rack the actual time spent on task. We have customized JIRA based on our project workflow like a sequence PO Review, Start Progress, Unit Testing, Code review, QA Testing, Done. JIRA Supports estimation and lifecycle of sub-tasks also.
cons: Although JIRA supports all advanced features of agile project development but still there are some area of improvement in it. User has to make 2-3 click to edit task details. It is bit hard to understand the features of JIRA for beginners and for administrators. It can be very complex to customize to the way you need it. I found JIRA bit hard when i wanted to move multiple tickets from current sprint to next sprint. If you stuck somewhere defining the workflow scheme in JIRA you would have to contact your senior or search for help on internet.
author: Ashish

review_detail:
title: A powerful solution for teams
pros: Jira has become an essential tool for our project management and issue tracking needs. Its robust features for creating, organising and tracking tasks and issues have greatly improved our team's productivity. Customisable workflows, dashboards and automation rules allow us to tailor Jira to our specific project requirements. Integration with other Atlassian tools, such as Confluence and Bitbucket, improves collaboration and documentation. Highly recommended
cons: The pricing structure, particularly for larger teams, can also be a concern
author: Fernando

review_detail:
title: First time user who has seen the light
pros: I have never worked with this sort of software with other team members before. Previously I was using solo project tracking software so I don’t have a lot of other team apps to which I can compare this one. That said, I have really appreciated the many features and functions of this software. But I appreciate most is the ability to hand off tasks to other members with minimal data input. Some software makes it difficult to input information, and I find this one doesn’t require a lot to get a new task started. I also quite appreciate the ability to set priorities and timelines. In the past, software like this made it easy to forget long-term goals or less important tasks that would later become more important. I need to do more delving to find other features, but another perk would be to tie this program in with my I calendar for better personal management within the project.
cons: It’s perhaps a small silly thing, but I would like to be able to change the colour of the app. Blue on white is really getting old, to my designer eyeballs.
author: Rhiannon

review_detail:
title: Jira a great agile solution
pros: - All agile features - Boards agile and kanban are great - Automation and plugins help a lot - Link of Confluence, bitbucket and Jira is great - Widgets really help for management - JQL is very powerful - Cloud and on prem otions
cons: - Can be complex to understand set-up, does require central admin management, for good enterprise coordination or it can turn into a zoo
author: Alejandro

review_detail:
title: Scrum aligned project management solution
pros: How the whole platform is aligned with the Scrum methodology and the seamless implementation not only for the on cloud solution but the actual usage with the developers, managers and stakeholders, as it has a nice interface and everything is well segregated according to the user roles. Jira also comes with a vast variety of built-in reports to analyze your team velocity, burndown, burnup and more key primary indicators to support decisions of the project directory.
cons: Can't said there is something that I don't like, but if there is something worth mentioning is that some custom widget/components that you add as options for your user stories details are extra and not included with the platform licencing price, however, some components are totally worth it and deserved to be bought.
author: Damian

review_detail:
title: Slim, fast and intuitive
pros: Jira came to our organization few years ago and it is proving how much we had missed for not adopting it earlier. It is very intuitive and demanded very little training to start using it as end users, such as project managers, team leaders and developers. We can now quickly visualize project status, update information and register new tasks than the previous solution we were using.
cons: You must be careful where you click on the Jira cards. Some buttons may change for example status without warning to the user.
author: Flavio

review_detail:
title: A review about JIRA
pros: It helps in the organization and execution of projects or task
cons: There is nothing I don't like about Jira
author: Naquentta

review_detail:
title: Robust Project Management for Development Sprinters
pros: In one word, scalability. We were able to deploy and integrate our software development team contributions with continuous integration, QA testing, and sprint schedules. Project management of several groups was a breeze. Our teams were across 15 timezones and in-house.
cons: It has a steep learning curve upfront. I came from Trello and a small in-house team so learning to use JIRA and apply it to a QA team with a remote user, a remote development team, a supervisor for reporting, and in-house developers was a bit of a struggle at first. Up to that point, every task was in Trello and we had no sprint schedules implemented.
author: Lee

review_detail:
title: Versatile tool for team tasks management
pros: It offers built-in tools to manage a Scrum Team but it can also be customized to your business needs. Every project can share or have as many custom behaviors as they want and you can go further by making use of the webhooks for external systems interaction. Jira can fit any type of team management needs, not only software developers. And it can handle multiple types of user access and authentications. It has an API that allows to query and control using web services.
cons: It could have a better UI for admins when configuring fields and schemes, since it can grow out of control when having the same instance for multiple teams in a large scale organization. The list of fields and schemes are not paginated so it can take a while to load the page when there are thousands of elements to be displayed.
author: Emiliano Gibrán

review_detail:
title: Best Tool for Project Management, Bug Tracking, Document Management
pros: Too many useful features with JIRA to create stories, tasks, sub-tasks, confluence etc. Provide agile scrum board and kanban as well in order to match both agile methodology of software development. Easy to track progress on each task, easy to change priority of work etc. Provide different reports which helps in order to track efficiency as well.
cons: Initially setup part, project setup, work flow setup is time consuming and little bit complex. No collaboration feature available to directly communicate on JIRA tasks or stories.
author: Vivek

review_detail:
title: Useful for organizing team work
pros: A useful and compeling software for organizing team work. The functionality of giving and customize different types of status to tickets is specially valuable, and the options to set up sprints with different types of boards like Kanban or Scrum is a good point as well. It is also nice how it synchronizes with other Atlassian soluitions like Confluence. The UX is easy and intuitive while having many different options for all types of users.
cons: If you set up many boards or sprints at the same time you can sometimes get a bit lost, it is not much transparent which boards you have created and which tickets are inside. Some options could not be done to specific issue category, for example, you can only create subtask issues from an issue set up as a "task", it would useful if this type of options become available regardless of the issue category.
author: Mario

review_detail:
title: A good project management software with flaws.
pros: Jira is the industry standard for tracking software projects. It's widely used and because of it, there are multiple integrations of external software that enhances how the system works. The Jira query language (JQL) helps easily find, filter, and keep track of tickets.
cons: Managing users in Jira is extremely complicated. It is virtually impossible to invite external parties with limited access. The self-hosted version of Jira, used by most big companies, is usually buggy and always lacking behind the cloud version. The experience feels dated and convoluted.
author: Victor

review_detail:
title: There is a feature for everything
pros: Jira provides me with the ability to do whatever I want as there is a way and a feature for everything.
cons: Things can get very complicated to implement and if we want all the features, it gets expensive really fast
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management tool
pros: Jira is the perfect tool to manage projects regardless of the how big or small the project is. I really like the way how each project can be assigned to different people, have SLA's assigned to them and see a live dashboard of how long each project has taken.
cons: From my experience, unless you have full integration you are not fully able replace your email system. Whilst it is good to manage projects, send emails internally, it does have a major flaw when you try to replace your email client with Jira - Dont get me wrong, using it as your email client does work and the automated replies does add value but when you get attachments sent back that is when it struggles.
author: Mareen

review_detail:
title: A user that is happy by using Jira

review_detail:
title: Best tracking for IT project management

When I am looking at the sprint board and a dev wants to ask a question about a specific story I don't want to leave the board, I just want to open the story. The little right side view is too small and scrunches all the data.... it would be far better to open in a new window. I have seen a lot of people do this as well.

cons: One aspect that I felt could be improved is sometimes the platform is not intuitive. When first starting to use the tool, there were too many features to learn that contributed to the steeper learning curve need to develop an understanding of how to efficiently use Jira.

review_detail:
title: Strengths, Challenges and best use cases.
pros: I would definitely recommend jira to a friend or colleague. It's a powerful tool for project management and issue tracking. Especially if you are working with Agile methodologies. It helps keep tasks organized,allows for easy tracking of progress, and integrates well with other tools.
cons: Our common critique of jira is its complexity and steep learning curve. The extensive range of features and customization options can be overwhelming for new users or teams without dedicated training. Additionally, the user interface can sometimes be less intuitive, leading to a longer setup time and potential frustration during initial use.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Jira is the way to go
pros: features are very useful, track multiple projects, collaborating with team and make sure task and deadlines are met without having conferences or making a phone call or email somone

author: Kiel

review_detail:
title: excellent resource for agile teams
pros: Jira facilitates team collaboration by allowing us to prioritize projects and issues, track time spent on them, and use the comments area. Dashboards provide a high-level understanding of the project's status. Different statuses, such as new, resolved, testing, and fixing, are displayed to indicate the current stage of the issue.
cons: From my experience, I noticed that the fundamental UI/data structure is slow and lacks context. It is slow to use and has low acceptance rates across the workforce. Supervisors may log items in the system but continue to run Google Doc spreadsheets for tracking in parallel, resulting in data fragmentation. That, to me, proves that it is unsuitable a little for the purpose we need it for.
author: SALIH

review_detail:
title: JIRA nailed it!
pros: It very useful for ticketing services. We were able to fix all technical issues with this application
cons: I would suggest, for everytime I would create a ticket, I will receive a notification on my email and it will automatically be added on my calendar but other than that it is the best.
author: Ian Christian

review_detail:
title: Jira- Best Project Management tool
pros: Jira offers seamless integration and insightful reporting tools for enhanced team collaboration.
cons: Jira sometimes experience lag or slowdowns, particularly in large projects with extensive workflows or high volumes of data.
author: Harshita

review_detail:
title: You must get this...JIRA
pros: An amazing collaboration tool to get relevant parties to work on the same purpose. A tool which enables the task management in more holistic way as Jira shows you dashboard view to manage task effectively.

review_detail:

pros: 3rd party integrations, simple dashboard, AI support for query and reports after each sprint.

review_detail:

pros: Jira makes it very easy to keep track of project statuses across multiple teams and colleagues, giving the ability to view any tickets within the business. Colour-coded tickets are helpful. Timetracking ability is a nice function for organisational matters.
cons: Some of the page layouts and filters can take a bit of getting used to, but for the most part it is easy to use.
author: Alex

review_detail:
title: Manage our agiel development workflow
pros: Good connectivity between items (epics, user stories, and so on). Overall, it serves the basic needs of R&D management and collaboration with products.
cons: Comnersum, many simple activities have bad UX and are hard to use quickly. The filters are not intuitive, and the navigation between different screens is not apparent. The UI looks old. Lack of many capabilities that would make product managers' work easier.
author: Avishai

review_detail:
title: Our business runs on JIRA
pros: No work gets done in our business without a JIRA. We have choreographed custom projects and workflows that suit our business needs from person to person and department to department. It allows us to create rigid development processes that are enforced Track estimates and actual time taken Manage releases Audit trails so so much and more.
cons: Its very complex. The support is lacking as its difficult to find out how to get support but the commuity out there is large and that helps. But initial setup and even going in to modify existing projects and workflows is hugely complex and time consuming.
author: Alex

review_detail:
title: Corporate Time&Task Tracking Instrument
pros: - very straightforward for the user (if the admin set up the workflows correctly) - has a lot of additional plugins and settings that you can customize for each given project (at our work we have different projects with various requirements in terms of the workflow) - automatic assignment of the tasks according to the column/action (for example, when the task moves from the development to quality assurance, the task gets automatically assigned to the QA engineer)
cons: - like many corporate tools, this one requires quite a lot of time spent on setting it up (unlike Trello, for example, which is also an Atlassian product) - sometimes, if the workflow hasn't been set up correctly, it can create havoc in the processes.
author: Zee

review_detail:
title: Jira for SW Development
pros: Our Team has been using Jira for some time now, and we were able to issue 2 major and several minor releases of our elearning application. All of this while working with a remote team and collaborating among 5 different companies. Jira has been ideal to adapt to our agile model and to our scrum development style. It also helps that it integrates easily with other Atlassian products that we use and with Trello.
cons: Although it has tried to pivot to be appealing for non technical project teams, Jira still is an ideal tool for technical-minded teams and often not the right tool for the non-engineer. Also, collaboration tools are still a tad limited.
author: Massimiliano

review_detail:
title: Manage you process with Jira
pros: Application is richer in features and the functionalities. It provides more flexibility when working on it we can manage several projects at once by allocating peoples to those projects. Application provides better details about the projects via charts. we can create custom filters and custom charts as we wish. Most of the people use jira for manage Agile methodology but we can use it for Kanban also.
cons: Application is complicated at the first sight but it gets familiar once start working.
author: Prabath

review_detail:
title: Agile Work Management Solution
pros: Jira enables collaboration across teams by helping to plan, assign, track, report, and manage project work. Jira comes with templates crafted for a variety of project lifecycles and allows for visibility and transparency through easy to consume real-time dashboards.
cons: Jira setup and initial use can be challenging. Users who are first exposed to Jira can be overwhelmed with the number of options and configurations. It takes a while for you to become familiar and comfortable with the product enough to use if to its fullest capability.
author: Christine

review_detail:
title: Great agile management tool
pros: It’s very nice software in the agile world which provide company to effectively management the resource within the team and track overall progress and backlog task management for the product .
cons: It’s great software and didn’t see any cons .
author: Nikhil

review_detail:
title: Top Change Management Solution for Agile Way of Working
pros: Monitoring Project daily activities become easier, Sync up meeting time is saved, Transparency in project is increased. All this is possible using JIRA solution for change management, JIRA provides optimization and best performance in project. Collaborative way of working.
cons: New users cant understand JIRA easily, interface is little bit complex. Scrum master shall be knowledgeable to manage change requests well. Sync with other integrated tools takes longer to update which is little confusing.
author: Vijay

review_detail:
title: Very mature project planning tool
pros: Breakdown of work as Epics, Stories and task is very useful. Time tracking helps us to track efforts
cons: None usually, integrations are seamless mostly
author: Chirag

review_detail:
title: Best Tool so Far
pros: Easy to use compared to other previous PMO software used in the past, great at team management.
cons: Time it takes to Customize a board end to end
author: Florea

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion
pros: Jira est un meilleur logiciel de gestion qui me permet de bien gérer mes activités et grâce à ses fonctionnalités, j'arrive à atteindre mes objectifs
cons: Jira est un logiciel qui n'est pas trop cher et ses fonctionnalités sont mieux utilisables
author: Abigaelle

review_detail:
title: Have been using JIRA from 8 years
pros: I am using JIRA form the last eight years and it's an awesome experience and help developers a lot to manage the Sprint and Tasks and also log the effort for a task. The most I like most is setting priorities and tracking the activity and time. Also, the dashboard and kanban board is a great feature where we can see the complete status of the project in a single window.
cons: I don't see any cons till now, things are very flexible and almost everything is changeable using configurations.
author: mohammad rashid

review_detail:
title: Fully featured Project Management software
pros: I like most of it that you can customize it to your needs. There are many options to choose from on how to setup your project.
cons: Getting into Jira takes quite a steep learning curve. There are so many features available that you need to dive into them to understand them better.
author: Jim

review_detail:
title: Best issue tracking software
pros: -It can be easily integrated with a git management tool like bitbucket so that we can quickly check progress on code development for a particular feature. -It shows the related pull requests and their status.
cons: -There is no real-time communication among the stack holders of an issue which makes things slow. -The UI is not very good.
author: Priyank

review_detail:
title: Great tool to work in collaboration with teams.
pros: The tool has enabled productive workflow in our organization with planning and tracking goals. The kanban board features are very useful for easy understanding of the time hurdles and issues. Also I like the bug reporting and tracking for its closure quite a lot since our organization is finding it difficult to keep track of the bugs, now its easy to strategize the tasks and handle the issues.
cons: The application cannot be used as a complete CRM since many management systems are lacking and thus we need to integrate other applications for managing overall work management for the organization.
author: Aslam

review_detail:
title: Great Tool for organizing and Project Management
pros: Jira is simply amazing, a very flexible tool with much room for customization and making it your own and adding any field you can imagine and would require to successfully track your projects and tasks.
cons: The implementation for that flexibility and customization is very unintuitive and takes a while to get a hang on, but once you do it really pays off.
author: Gilberto

review_detail:
title: Powerful project management tool
pros: Jira is a powerful project management tool that excels in organizing tasks and enhancing team collaboration. Its customizable features and intuitive interface make it a top choice for efficiently managing projects of any scale.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users due to its extensive range of features and configurations. Setting up complex workflows and customizing the platform requires a steep learning curve, potentially slowing down team productivity.
author: Elena

review_detail:
title: i am the user and i like it
pros: It have the access to work on this tool as i mainly work on the backlog items. JIRA is an agile management tool where we can have scrum meetings with the client . The software is used for tracking the project and we can know where the project is lagging behind. We can add tasks on our profile so what everybody in the team will know we are working on this topic. from Jira board we can create backlogs ,reports ,roadmaps and we can manage all the developments projects on a single tool. The software is very friendly when we learnt the how to use the jira board well.
cons: required time to learn deeply. need authorization to use this tool. no Proper training will be given
author: Varshika

review_detail:
title: An easy to use agile project management software
pros: JIRA is easy to use without much training. It allows for great separation of projects by type and has powerful progress, prioritization, and colloboration tools to make sprints run smoothly. Very customizable for a variety of business units. We use JIRA for marketing and web publishing queues with great success.
cons: Nothing particularly major! I would say that sometimes I have a bit of trouble tracking down certain tickets since I can see everyone's tickets within the organization but overall if you filter properly things are easy to find and open/active tickets are readily available on your main dashboard.
author: Sienna

review_detail:
title: Using Jira daily
pros: Possibility of text formating when you need to add info from huge logs for further analysis. For example {noformat} will add margines to that text box making it easy to navigate through Jira. This way we don't habe to deal with "wall of text" while scrolling infinitely to get to bottom.
cons: It would be nice to have a Pie Chart on the right solide of every case. It could be placed under Date Created field. This chart would track foe how long your case was sitting as "More Info, In Analysis, In Dev, Not Started etc...
author: Dean

review_detail:
title: Review for Jira as a developer
pros: Jira is excellent at keeping track of our issues and linking between them on a kanban board. It was our introduction to a Kanban system of tickets. There are also many features we see ourselves using that we are on the verge of delving into, allowing us to focus on the tickets now but expand in the near future. I like that tickets are easily linked to each other. Our previous system made it difficult to know which tickets were related, while Jira has several options for relating tickets (related to, duplicates, blocked / blocks/ etc)
cons: I think the price can get high depending on how big your team is. We were just over the free limit which becomes a large cost, especially once you include subscriptions to confluence etc. I think the load times and UI can get buggy at times, there are multiple times a day I have to click through menus several times for it to register. This is by far the most frustrating thing, especially when you have many tickets on a page. One issue we had was that our current ticket system allows us to CC users onto tickets so they (+ anyone else we add) can get an update. This was not possible through regular Jira, however something similar could be done with effort on the Jira Service Management side.
author: Darian

review_detail:
title: Jira: One Of Our Biz’s Best Decisions
pros: This has helped us get our task management into a wonderful spot. Jobs are completed now in a timely, accountable manner.
cons: Nothing so far. Very easy to use and train others on.
author: Jordan

review_detail:
title: Very amazing product for daily task management
pros: I really like the way it helps to manage daily tasks, issues, and roadmap. It really helps a lot in scrum and timeline management too. It is also quite easy in communicating with teammates about the task discussion and issue discussion. Easy to manage works in backlog and roadmap.
cons: It is sometimes slow and sometimes difficult to find the necessary action buttons.
author: Biren

review_detail:
title: Great way to achieve agile project management
pros: Great UI experience. We can create boards project wise and add work to a specific board. Very easy to create user stories/bugs and assign to a specific team. We can create sprint structure and slot stories in those sprints. Best tool for teams using agile SCRUM methodology.
cons: Jira is a heavy tool with a lot of features and functionalities. Any person new to Jira may find it a bit difficult to use it. Also, there are a lot of shortcuts. Initially, it is difficult to remember them. Once you get it, it makes your life easier.
author: Ekta

review_detail:
title: Jira user on dialy bases
pros: easy to manage task, when tester find any bug then they update on jira and developer easly manage the,m and resolve them
cons: Not so good for project management, facing issue for that
author: Areeb

review_detail:
title: Jira
pros: As a Super Admin of Jira, I have seen the changes implemented from Atlassian for this product. I do really like how the UI has changed over the years and how easy it is to get a user set up and up to date on how to navigate through projects and other tasks.
cons: I do however, not like how slow the customer service is when we are in a critical situation. This should become better over the next few years as Atlassian grows, but customer service should always be number one on their list.
author: Mohammed

review_detail:
title: Limited in ways, amazing in others
pros: for the purpose of overview the entire process and tasks - very easy and flexible to use. everybody can have their own column and tasks are easily updated and passed between teams
cons: limited file attachment (in these days, you need more then 10Mb) without admin permissions - you can get stuck types of tasks (epic/bug/story) can't move to all columns which is limiting
author: Yossi

review_detail:
title: Jira the best
pros: It offers innovative solutions to streamline workflow, automate tasks, and enhance decision-making processes to plan, track, release, and support software development processes with confidence.
cons: Can be complicated for new users They offer very limited free plans
author: Menatalla

review_detail:
title: Jira- The Perfect Project Management Tool
pros: The Jira dashboard makes you realize the stages of projects and helps you to track projects with ease. Summary board allows the best management and analysis of project.
cons: Not at all, Jira is most loved app by my team.
author: NEHA

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Ability to asses rapid implementations and exportations
cons: TRANSFERANCE AND TENDER ADJUDICATION AND ADJUSTMENTS
author: NATHANIEL

review_detail:
title: A Powerful Tool for Streamlined Project Management
pros: Jira offers valuable features that significantly support my business, including project management, customizable workflows, reporting and analytics, and centralized collaboration.
cons: Jira has been instrumental in helping me manage my business and achieve our objectives. However, the platform’s complexity can occasionally pose challenges for some of my team members. While we provide the necessary training to equip our team with the skills to use Jira effectively, it would be beneficial if the platform offered comprehensive training modules on its key features to support new users in getting started more smoothly.
author: Ahmad Farhad

review_detail:
title: This is my agile project management tool.
pros: Jira is like my trusty sidekick for managing projects. It helps me keep track of everything, from tiny tasks to big features, and makes sure everyone on the team knows what's going on. It's super flexible, so we can set it up to work exactly how we need it to.
cons: It can be a bit overwhelming at first, with all its bells and whistles. But once you get the hang of it, it's a lifesaver.
author: Christopher

review_detail:
title: My Insight for Jira
pros: Jira offers collaboration, project and task management capabilities in one place which streamlines business processes.
cons: For the past three years, I have never come across any bug.
author: Alexandra

review_detail:
title: One of the best product
pros: I like that I can just open the board and see right away what's stuck or moving. Helps me follow up with the right person without needing to send a bunch of messages.
cons: Some parts take too many clicks, like when I want to change the view or find a specific sprint. Wish the search was a bit smarter, sometimes I type something in and still gotta scroll to find what I need.
author: Olga

review_detail:
title: Thankful for Jira!
pros: There are so many way to sort through the information that is provided. It is clear, concise, and I am able to sort and arrange the information as need.
cons: It did take me a little longer than normal to get comfortable navigating.
author: Linda

review_detail:
title: Best at small scale delivery
pros: It’s highly customisable- can be as simple or as complex as you need (which means it will work for you and not you for it). Usually, with this though, come specialist roles that you need to hire for (e.g. ‘salesforce specialist), but jira has easily the most extensive publicly available knowledge base. Every question or issue you may ever have, someone has had (and solved) before. Excellent community that also ways has a step by step for you. Continuous intro of new functionality. Integrates with pretty much everything out there
cons: Not so great when required for large scale delivery. Planner tries to do this, but feels like it doesn’t have the same level of user insight as the rest of the atlassian suite.
author: Maggie

review_detail:
title: Jira - An awesome tool for Agile project management
pros: Very productive to projects in Scrum or Kanban in Jira. Easy metrics reporting as well.
cons: It is sometimes very slow. Better documentation would be nice to have for JQL.
author: Karun

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Jira’s adaptability, agile focus, and user-friendly design contribute to its widespread adoption by organizations worldwide. Whether you’re a project manager or a software team, Jira simplifies project management and enhances collaboration
cons: Speed and Loading Times. Complexity Lack of Native Features
author: Mando

review_detail:
title: Jira deserves 5 stars!
pros: It is so easy to learn and use. The customer support always respond on time.
cons: Since I started using Jira, I have never experienced any issues.
author: Joseph

review_detail:
title: Jira the perfect too for Agile Teams
pros: It's the perfect tool to implement and manage an Agile methodology.
cons: The cloud price was raising on the last years.
author: Oriol

review_detail:
title: Using Jira for sales team
pros: Best way to communicate with tech, product and ops teams and to track incidents internally
cons: We don’t have control over the progress of the ticket, it would be useful to add real-time tracking, similar to what Trello offers
author: Constance

review_detail:
title: Effective and Efficient
pros: I love using jira as a communication and management tool with the team for my projects. The ease of use and a user friendly interface makes it easy for all members of the team
cons: I would say it can be quite complex for a first time user, but this gets better with time and after several tries
author: Oluwalonimi

review_detail:
title: Efficient yet hard to complex to manage
pros: The tickets queue management is crucial and important for our team.
cons: Projects Administration and configuration are a bit too complicated to manage sometimes, also the automation can be improved.
author: HOSSEIN

review_detail:
title: Jira for Agile Project Execution
pros: Has all the features that can help to execute a project using the agile methodology. Kanban boards, Bug tracking are some of the features I use frequently
cons: Exporting data as a report to an excel is a bit of a long process and there are multiple options to be selected to make a document export
author: Netra

review_detail:
title: I use JIRA because it is the choice of tool at my work
pros: Versatility. The tool is actually quite versatile at my work. Its support for team collaboration work is good.
cons: Look-and-Feel. The Look-and-Feel is quite rudimentary and unappealing.
author: NOBLE

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Jira can be customized to work with a variety of processes, including non-technical teams who require simple task management or Agile teams that use Scrum or Kanban. Its ability to integrate other platforms such as Slack, Confluence and several third-party apps, all of which improve development workflows and teamwork is quite commendable. Jira has some reporting features that allows users to create visually appealing and engaging dashboards, sprint reports etc. With Jira teams can effectively manage access to project data, which ensures security of project data and information.
cons: One of the issues I ran into using Jira was performance, especially when a lot of projects are being managed and large data sets are involved, this could slow down performance. Similarly, with larger teams, Jira can become quite expensive. The steep learning curve can be daunting and complex for new users, particularly at the set up stage. Would be good to see more user friendly manuals.
author: Esther

review_detail:
title: Multifunctional task management tool
pros: Jira is easy to use and has many helpful features and paid add-ons to help with project management and time tracking. Also, the free plan is very cool.
cons: When I used Jira to test integration with the add-on that we were developing it wasn't easy to create custom workflows.
author: Mariana

review_detail:
title: Solid PM/issue tracking with some setup and training burdens up-front
pros: Good for Agile - native Scrum and Kanban boards Customizable workflows and automation Plays nice with other Atlassian products and 3rd-party tools
cons: Bit of a learning curve Cluttered interface Occasional performance lags Not easy to set up and required some user training
author: Benjamin

review_detail:
title: A Powerful Project Management Tool
pros: What I liked most about Jira is its flexibility and customization options. The platform is highly adaptable, allowing teams to tailor workflows, issue types, and project structures to fit their specific needs. Its robust tracking and reporting features provide deep insights into project progress and team performance, helping to identify bottlenecks and optimize processes.
cons: One of the aspects I liked least about Jira is its complexity and steep learning curve. The extensive customization options and feature set can make the initial setup and configuration overwhelming, especially for new users. The user interface can feel cluttered and unintuitive, with a lot of navigation required to access various functionalities.
author: Victory

review_detail:
title: great tool for Agile and Devops follow up
pros: possibility to customize features to your own needs
cons: setup takes a while but when done it works very well.
author: Wannes

review_detail:
title: It fits well into our agile workflow
pros: Jira has eased my life and has helped me to organize the dev work. Tracking bugs, sprint planning and following up tickets are all things that I’ve used it for without losing a block of momentum.
cons: It sometimes made it confusing to see all the tickets in all the sprints that were currently active across different boards.
author: Jaya

review_detail:
title: A Great Tool That Helps Me Keep My Projects Organized!
pros: I absolutely love Jira—it makes project management a breeze! The @mentions keep everyone informed, the API integrates smoothly with my other tools, and the access controls keep everything secure. The activity dashboard, tracking, and reporting features are fantastic for staying on top of progress, while the Agile methodologies and alerts ensure I can manage workflows and stay updated effortlessly.
cons: I found that the interface can feel a bit overwhelming for new users, and it took me some time to get fully comfortable with all its features. However, once I got the hang of it, Jira became incredibly powerful and efficient!
author: Samuel

review_detail:
title: improving cooperation and efficiency

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Good Project Management Tool

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Multi-functional
pros: Jira is a great way to organize tasks and to-do lists, easily moving tasks to 'in progress', 'pending', 'done', etc. Creating tasks is easy and you can include images and files, assign to those responsible for it's completion, make notes back and forth, and add due dates that send reminders when a date is coming up.
cons: I can't really say there's anything that stands out as a Con for Jira, my position just doesn't require it's use as much as others in my company.

review_detail:
title: So far So good
pros: Very prompt responses and easy to use for a new user
cons: Nothing really. I must say i was pretty pleased with the set up
author: Cortney

review_detail:
title: Excellent Project Management Platform
pros: Very easy to organize projects and schedule tasks while keeping control of everything
cons: The interface, at first takes a little time to get used to
author: Robert

review_detail:
title: JIRA review
pros: I like the quality of the JIRA product for the times I have to use or understand it here in my role.
cons: It does seem like it is a little difficult to learn and navigate up front
author: Donovan

review_detail:
title: Forced to use it, but it does the job.
pros: It does what it is supposed to do and that's it.
cons: When it comes to software development, it's annoying to use and frustrating with teams. Workflow isn't great.

review_detail:
title: JIRA is the best powerfull platform for tracking and managing work
pros: project management by dividing tasks for each individual which improves collaboration between teams and helps to stay up-to-date, and good reporting, and visualization tools that help to keep track of progress.
cons: set up phase: it needs a steep learning curve for first-time use, and the multiple options and various configurations can be overwhelming for simple projects.
author: sineen

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Ease of use and speed in solving problems. The user interface is beautiful and understandable.
cons: In my experience, I have not seen any noticeable negatives. It may be possible in the future, but currently I have not seen any negatives.
author: BISHOY

review_detail:

review_detail:

pros: Very easy to manage your task progress and understand in which step/person is paused,/currently on.
cons: In the beggining, not so easy to understand where all the features are.

review_detail:
title: Great tool for task management!
pros: I like most of the features of Jira, especially being able to assign due dates, prioritization, acceptance criterias, etc to the tasks and being able to relate the tasks to each other.

review_detail:

cons: We found it a little difficult to edit the projects easily once a project had been set up. It became a bit too administrative heavy.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: JIRA Rocks
pros: easy to use - issues - product boards and work flows

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: Student assistant
pros: Jira is built to be easy to use and coordinate, while still being extensible.
cons: It has a limited file storage. It can feel complicated, especially for new users.

review_detail:
title: L'outil de gestion des tâches le plus complet du marché
pros: Son interface très complète et en même temps relativement simple d'utilisation, la réactivité de l'outil, la possibilité de segmenter en projets/groupes
cons: L'effet un peu "usine à gaz" parfois. Certaines fonctionnalités sont fastidieuses à mettre en oeuvre
author: Segolène

review_detail:
title: Great for Project Management, but Can Be Overwhelming
pros: Jira has been a powerful tool for managing our projects and keeping everything organized. What I like most is how customizable it is. You can really tailor workflows and boards to fit your team’s specific needs, which makes it extremely flexible. It’s great for tracking progress and making sure tasks are moving along.
cons: However, the downside is that Jira can be a bit overwhelming, especially for new users. The learning curve is steep, and it takes time to get everyone up to speed on how to use it efficiently. Sometimes it feels like there are too many options, which can complicate things if you're not careful.
author: Rupert

review_detail:
title: Jira a tool you really need
pros: Jira is easy to use and has many help features to help with project management and time tracking. The software also provides robust reporting and integration with other software in your work flow
cons: On occasion the software can be slow to respond during peak hours.
author: Terrence

review_detail:
title: Efficient but Overwhelming: My Experience with Jira
pros: I liked how Jira helps organize tasks and track progress easily. It allows teams to stay on the same page, prioritize work, and ensure deadlines are met efficiently.
cons: Sometimes Jira can feel a bit complex or overwhelming, especially with too many options and features. It can take time to navigate or set up workflows for new users.
author: Nayan

review_detail:
title: Powerful for Project Management, but Has a Learning Curve
pros: It offers powerful problem tracking, project management, and better workflows. Also it can be integrated with DevOps tools like GitHub, Jenkins makes it more efficient.
cons: It can be complex to set up and its speed is slow with the large projects.

review_detail:
title: Great for Tracking Work, but Can Feel Sluggish
pros: Makes it easy to track tasks—just yesterday, I spotted a blocker in a sprint and updated the team in seconds.
cons: Searching for an old ticket took longer than expected, which was frustrating during a meeting.
author: Mohsin

review_detail:
title: Not flashy but effective
pros: Ability to share requests with teammates. Categorizing of portals for different ticket types. Integration with email for updates.
cons: UX in ticket seems a bit outdated. Can update to make dashboard-type interface with latest 3 comments plus visualization of progress most visible within request.
author: Sam

review_detail:
title: Jira the scm management
pros: The user interface is the best which I like, we can customize it according to our needs. We can create customer Tasks like Epic, feature, etc. Integrety with another tool which makes Jira more special, we can connect it with like MS Teams, Azure DevOps, Etc... It Provides various extensions and other 3rd party tools that help in migration from other SCM tools like monday.com, azure boards, slack, etc It also provides a Dashboard so we can see all project reports at a single point which makes this fabulous.
cons: Cost is a barrier for the startup/ small size company like 10 to 20 members in an organization, it could be free for them. Some Other tools are for the same like the Azure Board which is free for 5 people in the organization. Its migration/sync was not easy and free with other tools like.. migration from Azure board to Jira take time to understand the process. There are lots of extension / 3rd party tools available that are not free and charging costs are high. Sync will automatically affect after 180 seconds of update in Azure board which is not good, or we can refresh manually by refresh button which is inconvenient.
author: Tej

review_detail:
title: My experience on Jira
pros: Jira allows extensive customization to tailor workflows, issue types, and fields to fit specific project needs, we can integrated with 3rd party tools and customizable dashboards
cons: The notification system can sometimes be overwhelming, leading to too many alerts and potential distractions.
author: Ishvarya

review_detail:
title: Best tool for project product task and sprint palnning
pros: All the options available in JIRA made the sprint task planning and review easy and the stats helped to track the efforts and delivery quality.
cons: nothing as of now, as we use daily we feel it as a handy tool to update our tasks.
author: Sigilipelli

review_detail:
title: Jira is great for workflow management with technical teams
pros: Jira really helps with workflow and completing projects on time by splitting the tasks into manageable sprints. I like that you can put tasks that are not urgent into the backlog so that you do not forget about them. It is also nice to be able to communicate on the platform directly on the tasks.
cons: I would like to be able to change some of the task codes after creating them but you are not able to change it from task, to story to bug unless you delete it and recreate it.
author: Annika

review_detail:
title: A great experience for a Project Management tool
pros: Its capability to integrate with many other tools and manage projects through the whole SDLC
cons: Sometimes it is tough to configure fields to be shown for a specific element type across different projects
author: Analia

review_detail:
title: An essential tool for task and project management.
pros: It is actually a software that is needed and essential for effective management of my various tasks and varieties of software projects. Its a top notch tool i have used in tracking and monitoring the development of my projects. Its comprehensive reports and diagram chats on progress of my projects provide an insight on software projects. I like its customizable dashboard as it makes it easy to use.
cons: Its often tasking to understand its step by step set up as a beginner and glitch occurs when am using it to manage a large data of software projects.
author: Patrick

review_detail:
title: Effective Task Tracking and Agile Management with Jira
pros: Jira is widely regarded as an excellent tool for task tracking and managing agile projects. It allows you to create and customize workflows to fit the specific needs of your team or project. Jira natively supports Scrum and Kanban methodologies, providing built-in boards, backlogs, and sprint planning tools, helping teams to implement and follow agile practices effectively. Jira integrates seamlessly with many other tools and applications, such as Confluence, Bitbucket, Slack, and various CI/CD tools, creating a unified ecosystem for project management. It provides detailed reports and dashboards, helping teams to track progress, identify bottlenecks, and make data-driven decisions with features like burn-down charts, velocity charts, and cumulative flow diagrams.
cons: Jira has many features, which can make it hard to learn and use at first. Jira can be expensive, especially for small teams or startups.
author: Alok

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Jira is a fantastic platform that has a user-friendly interface that makes stay on Jira smooth.
cons: For me I have no dislike with Jira because it is easy to use.
author: Azoba

review_detail:
title: Jira, the swiss knife for planning.
pros: Multitude of tools and active improvement of available options/functionalities. User friendly and SOTA.
cons: Users rights and therefore plans are switching without changes by administration. Check the number of users frequently!

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: So far, I’ve not had any bad experience with Jira.

review_detail:
title: Indispensable application...but setup is not for the non-tech savvy

cons: JIRA is a beast. Plain and simple. Actually that's just it...it's not plain and simple. You have to have a good grasp of what you want from it to make sure you get what you really need. It is not friendly for the non-technical user looking to create a workspace.

review_detail:
title: Industry standard software - but usually overly complex for most projects

Most new team members coming onto your project already understand how it works and why it is used and can be bought into your companies particular work flow very quickly
cons: For every use case i have used this for in 4 different companies I have found that it is overkill. It often as a result has features that are not so useful for the average project. This adds complexity to the work flow that doesn't typically need to exist. In addition this often creates permission issues in adding tickets or modifying tickets.

review_detail:

Dasboard will display our work list. - Greate and easy user interface. - flexible app to create NPR, user stories, bugs, technical tasks etc. - Add labels to each ticket is the another help, where we can group the ticket with lable. - We can track the status of any ticket from OPEN to CLOSE. - Each ticket have the option to add detail like(Type, Priority, Status, Resolution, priority, lable , etc) and description, where we can add the full detail of the task. - Through the "Activity" part , we can track all the detail like comments, Work Log,History, Activity,Transitions and Stateoscope. - We can include the people who wants to know about the ticktes at "Watchers" list. As a developer, this software is a great helper to track my work and project my work to higher officials.
cons: Adding tools like table columns and rows is still difficult at the description part of the task. other then that, As a developer I haven't find any Cons.

review_detail:

cons: It can be complex for new users, requiring time to learn. Its customization options, if not managed properly, can lead to overly complex workflows and potential inefficiencies

review_detail:
title: Advanced Task Management For Your Team!
pros: At our company, we love using Atlassian products, and Jira is one of them. It makes task management so easy and straightforward! You can create different dashboards and organise them by project or team, and see who owns what per task... all in one view. It's very easy to use and great for collaborating with or across teams.
cons: I believe the initial setup could be optimised, we always have someone with some tech background set up the project at the beginning. Once this is running, it's as easy as it gets! It's also a bit pricey compared to other solutions.

review_detail:

review_detail:

cons: Initially gets difficult to get used to it, as user interface is not too great, but once you are familiar with it, you can play around.
author: Gopi

review_detail:
title: Amazing tool for Project Management
pros: Jira is the best product for Product Management where we can create Epics, stories inside those epics and bugs for each story. In short, we can track issues, bug tracking based on the priorities, organize the progress of each story, etc.I would say Jira is the best software for any agile development environment.

author: Chirag

review_detail:
title: Fantastic product!
pros: Lots of integration features - helpdesk software, trello, slack, notifications. Filters/reports allow for easy communication of release notes. Configurable for team preferences. Value fir the money
cons: Can’t think of any major cons. Would like additional reporting/dashboard options
author: Tara

review_detail:
title: The greatest product for task and product management
pros: Jira is the most effective project management software I've ever used. It has become a comprehensive solution for monitoring the status of a project. It helps me consider epics, storylines, projects, bugs, and ways to make things better. I can set up many projects and a scrum board. It helps me to keep track of all tasks assigned to me as well as those I've generated myself. It is outstanding.
cons: Almost nothing is wrong with Jira. Jira is easy to use but managing it may need a comprehensive understanding of the technology or further training.
author: Chelsea

review_detail:
title: Good but Never Easy
pros: Jira is a solid platform for workflow management. It won't add a ton of value if your team is not already organized, but it works pretty well once you have a certain degree of organization and understanding of the platform. It's very easy to use Jira in its simplest form.
cons: Jira continues to surprise and frustrate me despite my years of using it. This is partly because of how I've seen it used -- e.g., organization locks it down to an almost inflexible state -- rather than the software itself, but I think Jira encourages some inflexibility. Jira is also pretty hard to "master," especially when it is locked down. Some fundamentals, such as backlog management and reporting, can be very painful without teams organizing around the platform. Despite its apparent simplicity, Jira, or at least some of its aspect, feel ineluctably like time-sinks.
author: John

review_detail:
title: Great for traceability and project tracking
pros: Our teams work across many domains in robotics and Jira is a useful platform for collecting and archiving information about our products. Information like bugs and feature requests can be linked to other projects for effective traceability. Jira is also helping our teams do Scrum sprint planning.
cons: Out-of-the-box Jira is lacking in dashboard analytics that would help managers get an overview of project tracking across many teams. It would be helpful to have more permissions levels in projects to take some load off of admins.
author: Dana

review_detail:
title: Jira, un outil de gestion de projet et de collaboration efficace
pros: Ce que j'aime le plus dans l'application Jira, c'est l'interface utilisateur. C'est un parfait système de gestion des projets pour gagner du temps et l'organisation du travail entre équipes surtout pour suivre le cycle du projet. Jira est super simple et facile à utiliser pour un débutant qui s'intègre dans de nouveau projets à l'entreprise.
cons: Jira est un logiciel très complet. Il fournit un service qui fait gagner beaucoup de temps aux organisations. Pour l'instant, je ne pense pas qu'il y ait de défaut majeur dans le système, mais parfois, le chargement du tableau de bord peut être lent où je ne peux pas télécharger les larges fichiers dans Jira.
author: Houssam

review_detail:
title: We used this for SCRUM/KANBAN Project Management
pros: - JIRA's quite powerful feature-wise. We have used it for over 6 years now at work and it has always performed its best. - There is an option to customize workflows for each project, depending on the team involved. This helps a lot because we can adapt it to our needs, rather than get adapted to the tool ourselves. - We used it in conjunction with Confluence and one of the features we found very convenient for our team was the fact that you can write down minutes in the Confluence and transform the tasks mentioned there into JIRA tasks right away. - JIRA offers a multitude of integrations and additional features that you can add based on your project's requirements - User permissions are extensive in the way you can tailor them for your needs. Some of our clients are technically advanced, so we give them access to view the board so they can see the progress.
cons: - I haven't been the one who set it up, despite having admin rights, so at times it was hard to understand where something should go or where something can be changed. Also, sometimes I just didn't know something was possible :D
author: Zee

review_detail:
title: First class service desk offering
pros: Of course there's a little confirmational bias in any review of a product already acquired, but implementing it really was a thoughtful decision. Over the last few years, this product has really matured. When we started with it as an immature FOSS offering, it wasn't really enterprise-class. We were motivated by cost initially, but Atlassian has really grown it. Now with external directory integration, tiered hosting offerings, MSP-level features, and significant customization available, I can't think of another product that beats the value proposition. My most favorite feature? The return on investment. We use this to manage service desk interactions with more than 25 MSP clients, and have never been let down. It costs us less than weekly staff meeting pizza to operate and integration with other Atlassian products is superb.
cons: Much of the branding customizations fall flat. Inability to resize or edit logos, the prominently featured plugs for Atlassian throughout the UI, and clunky DNS-tricks requires to redirect customer portal URLs to MSP's domain.
author: Jack

review_detail:
title: Outil de gestion de projet pour grande entreprise
pros: Il est particulierement utile dans de très grande entreprise avec la possibilité de creer plusieurs DASHBORD en fonction du projet et même des métiers. le suivit des taches est aisé, le suivit des ticket et bug également fluide. Le Dashbord est simple et très lisible
cons: Grande complexité pour la mise en place et la configuration. Necéssite même la presence d'un expert. Son est prohibitif et donc reservé aux grandes entreprise.
author: Boris

review_detail:
title: User friendly, organized, reliable
pros: Easy to use, I received very little training yet it was very user friendly
cons: Some complexity in the report/dashboard building
author: Konal Alfonso

review_detail:
title: Good for technology, not for marketing
pros: Jira has a fairly clean interface that is easy enough to navigate without knowing the tool super well.
cons: As a marketer, I found Jira to be far too complex for managing marketing tasks, workflows and projects. It is too easy to fall down rabbit holes of dependencies and child tasks and not be able to find what you were looking for to begin with. The issue numbering system also feels a bit too technical and can create confusion between parent and child tasks. Our marketing team would have benefitted more from just seeing the title of a task, not a string of numbers. To use Jira well, it desperately needs established governance for how your team will use it and someone to regulate and maintain that system in order to keep the team from getting frustrated but it.

Con Jira, è possibile adattare completamente il sistema alle esigenze specifiche del team o del progetto, creando flussi di lavoro su misura, definendo campi personalizzati e configurando regole per automatizzare i processi. Questa capacità di personalizzazione consente ai team di adottare Jira in una vasta gamma di contesti e settori, garantendo che possa essere utilizzato in modo efficace per qualsiasi tipo di lavoro o progetto. Inoltre, apprezzo la sua integrazione con altri strumenti di sviluppo software e la sua ampia gamma di funzionalità di reporting e analisi, che forniscono una visione chiara dello stato del progetto e del progresso del lavoro.

review_detail:
title: A very powerful task tracking system
pros: Our company uses JIRA to manage work tasks. It has all the important features for assigning work to team members, tracking how long each task takes, notifications, capturing comments and hours worked. The tools allows for the flexibility to create your own JIRA ticket types or categories, with any kind of number of input fields. Data fields may be dropdown boxes, tags, values, or free text. Fields inherently have the ability to recognize hyperlinks and add those in once you type out a link, and it also recognizes JIRA links, such that if you enter a JIRA ID tag, it automatically creates a hyperlink to that JIRA entry. JIRA supports Agile development schemes and tickets could be easily tracked through a JIRA Dashboard. JIRA filters are also easy to use. You may use the basic query that provides you with simple dropdown fields for common elements, or you can create more advanced queries using JQL.
cons: Being a JIRA user can be limiting as you only have the ability to enter data for the fields that are currently configured. You have to go through IT or the admins for any form of customization such as adding/removing/hiding fields, setting what kind of text format is in each field (e.g. plain text vs rich text) and modifying which fields are required vs optional. When you have rich text formatting, sometimes it can be frustrating getting the text to show up the way you want. The workaround for this would be to use the Text tab instead of the Visual tab so that you can modify the formatting tags.
author: Randall

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: JIRA Review
pros: JIRA is one of the best applications to capture bugs and issues for engineering team. It's functionality to organize issues, assign work and track status of each issue reported is amazing. It's one of the best software for SAAS based organizations where your customer's and internal teams are reporting issues on a daily basis. 1. One of the best softwares to automate your daily issues and workflow. You can create different groups and assign tasks, track progress and do followups. 2. In depth report on when issue got created and history of work performed by each assignee followed by the issue close date and time. It helps to run your engineering / support operations efficiently and monitor the bandwidth utilization of resources and helps in capacity planning as well.
cons: 1. Generating a performance dashboard to get the team's performance in a single click. At present there are too many filters and reporting options given which makes it difficult to reach to desired output. 2. No reminder or notification options to highlight backlog issues.

title: Great Software Development Management Software
pros: JIRA is the de facto software management software in my opinion. It has abilities for customizations, features for different project tracking schemes, and really is an industry standard. I would highly recommend JIRA for anyone looking to manage their software development project. It is native built for multiple methodologies: Kanban, Scrum, SaFE, and others, and is flexible to meet your teams specific needs. I love features like updating tasks in spreadsheets and then sending those to JIRA for bulk updates, it makes planning really easy, and then with the push of a button you can get dozens or sometimes hundreds of tasks and updates automatically created in JIRA.
cons: our implementation of JIRA was a little overburdened with how many fields and functions were created, which made updates somewhat cumbersome, but overall a good platform, I would just suggest keeping it simple, to keep it easy to use.

review_detail:
title: Perfect product for Task and Project Management
pros: Atlassian's Jira has an intuitive UI. It is an excellent tool for project management and managing tasks in an organized way. It makes managing active sprints, backlogs, reports and releases easy. You can navigate the software with ease. The search bar at the top makes finding specific issues quick. Users can see what needs to be done next, their progress and the issues completed by them. You can describe an issue, specify the quality assurance acceptance criteria, and estimate the amount of effort needed to complete it using story points. Sub-issues can be created to manage the main issue in a better way. Additionally, teams can track progress and identify improvement areas using the platform's reporting tools. Its integration with Confluence helps the teams to easily collaborate and keep all their work in one place.
cons: So far I haven't found any con with this product. But a new user may get confused with the terminology and features of the platform.

author: Kristin

review_detail:
title: Heavy-duty workflow management, but unfriendly UI and complicated bug fixing
pros: * Allows complex workflows, and good visualization of them. * Third-party software plugins as well as Atlassian provided ones. * Good detail in docs, with DB fixes possible instead of it being a mystery blackhole. * Integration with other Atlassian products. Straightforward key management. * High-volume (detailed) logging. Good separation of app config/data and app files. * Runs on a standard Tomcat build. While you're required to use their included version, customizing it is done the usual Tomcat way, and allows for easy configuring Apache or caching front-ends.
cons: * Big and complex. It has a heavy footprint and can be sluggish * Heavy installers and overlap between products. Eg, the full install (tomcat and pieces) is bundled with every product, requiring some integration effort if you don't really want to run several tomcat instances (see "heavy footprint") * Very poor error management. Doing migrations between servers or from cloud to hosted can result in mystery errors that the UI should be able to identify or repair, instead rough DB fixes are required. * Eg, a plugin is somehow disabled by an error condition. Rather than offering a UI to re-enable it, or to clear the setting, or reinstall, instead you can't reinstall the plugin (error) and have to go find the DB entry where it's "off", and set it "on". That would be expected in a v1 product, but Jira is how many versions old now? * And DB fixes require shutting down the service and then restarting it (a sluggish process).
