review_detail:
title: Wonderful tool with variety of features
pros: We have used this for the Project Management solution. This is very good tool and it have integration with other third party tools that made our day easy.
cons: As of now i didn't any cons on this product.
author: Thazeemuddin

review_detail:
title: Jira is a must have tool for working together on tasks and managing projects efficiently
pros: Its user interface, covering most of the needs and performance.
cons: Inexperienced Jira admins could configure the tool in a way (adding add-ons etc.), causing sluggish behaviour and slow performance. As a user, despite providing feedback, you may have to accept the way the admin configures the Project.
author: Ozgur Bulent

review_detail:
title: All-in-one project management tool
pros: Overall, the JIRA tool does the job and I would suggest it. I'm quite impressed with its features, which include problem tracking, project management, agile development, configurable processes, and connection with other programs. Enables us to simply generate, track, and manage issues and tasks.
cons: For beginners, complexity is the main hurdle. Apart from this, technically, it has limited built-in testing features, and setup cost for a startup firms and smaller companies.
author: Anterpreet

review_detail:
title: Highly recommended
pros: It is a great project management tool. Easy to track the status of the projects.
cons: Interface can be improved. A user using it for the first time might find it difficult.
author: Shahzad

review_detail:
title: Jira'z Simplicity To Use
pros: Jira has a reliable customer support team and it is easy to use Jira for task tracking.
cons: Jira is amazing to use and has no challenges.
author: Roselyne

review_detail:
title: Lleva tu soporte TI a la excelencia con Jira
pros: Es bueno para gestionar tickets de soporte y cuando las organizaciones son grandes, los reportes permiten encontrar oportunidades de mejora.
cons: El precio es caro para organizaciones pequeñas.
author: Ariel Horacio

review_detail:
title: Addressing the Aesthetic Gaps in JIRA's Interface
pros: The content and the categories are highly structured. It makes the work so much feasible.
cons: User Interface feels a bit dull and lacks visual appeal.
author: Karishma

review_detail:
title: Nice tool for product development with bug tracking
pros: Scheduling of tasks, Sprints and Epics makes it a must have tool for everyone. It is easy to track and share your tasks with your team
cons: Grace period should be of more duration when the billing cycle is approaaching.
author: Ajay

review_detail:
title: Jira Service Management (formerly Jira Service Desk) service management solution for IT and business teams
pros: It is widely used in the software development industry for tracking tasks, bugs, and progress across teams. Its robust features, flexibility, and integration capabilities make it a top choice for many organizations.
cons: While customization is a strength, it can also be a challenge for teams without technical expertise.
author: Mazher

review_detail:
title: Great PM tool
pros: JIRA is very easy to configure to work best for our team and department. The customization capabilities make it very easy to fit a tool into our existing processes. The new JIRA Product Discovery tool has been very helpful in managing the top of the funnel for new features and ideas.
cons: Permissions structures are a bit rigid, and it makes it difficult to work in a project unless you are an admin.
author: Michelle

review_detail:
title: Task management made easy with Jira
pros: I could tailor it to fit my team's workflow perfectly. This flexibility made managing projects much more efficient and organized.
cons: As a new user, navigating through its numerous features and settings felt overwhelming. It took me a while to get the hang of it, which slowed down my initial productivity.
author: Mrunmayee

review_detail:
title: Mon avis sur Jira
pros: Jira est un outil puissant qui a révolutionné notre gestion de projet. Il offre une multitude de fonctionnalités qui nous permettent de suivre chaque étape du développement, de la planification au déploiement. La possibilité de personnaliser les workflows et d'intégrer Jira avec d'autres outils est un véritable atout pour notre équipe.
cons: Je dois admettre que nous n'étions pas entièrement satisfaits du plan gratuit. Il manquait certaines fonctionnalités essentielles pour notre activité.
author: Marie-Jeanne

review_detail:
title: versatile project management tool
pros: can organize all of my tasks and work agile.
cons: a bit over-complicated sometimes, and it takes time to understand all of its features.
author: Ido

review_detail:
title: Jira : A Comprehensive solution for modern project management.
pros: Jira is a very comprehensive solution for project management with good customizability and integration with other tools to track specific issues or problems and help to mitigate.
cons: Jira is highly customizable, but this can be a downside too, As the volume of issues and project grows, sometime Jira becomes sluggish.
author: sarvesh

review_detail:
title: Jira: Strengths and Weaknesses of a Leading Project Management Tool
pros: I like the customizable workflow feature, we can set up things as we require. Advanced reporting and Analytics feature also helps us to check what has been went good and wrong.
cons: Steep Learning Curve:- There are vast features of Jira, which indeed hard to learn completely. Complex Customization, we need to keep so much effort in-order to create some customizations.
author: Vamsi

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: I love how we can track our work with the help of tickets. Recently, l have observed a new feature -- its AI capability to generate tickets automatically based on prompts.
cons: Sometimes it becomes messier to manage different ticket types like there are so many like: EPICS, TASK, Subtask etc.
author: Sahil

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Jira's pretty flexible for customizing workflows and tracking deals. I can whip up Kanban boards to see my pipeline, assign tasks to my team, and keep tabs on all our interactions with potential customers. The reporting features are handy for seeing how we're tracking and where we can improve.
cons: But to be honest, Jira's interface is a bit clunky for a CRM. It takes a bit of wrangling to get the hang of it, and some features, like contact management and email automation, aren't as flash as what you'd find in a dedicated CRM. Plus, it's a bit pricey for smaller sales teams.
author: Kevin

review_detail:
title: A Powerful Tool for Organized Project Management
pros: I liked that Jira makes it easy to track tasks, see progress clearly, and keep the whole team organized in one place.
cons: What I like least is that Jira can feel a bit complex at first, with too many features and settings that take time to learn.
author: Isaac

review_detail:
title: Indispensable Tool For Agile Teams
pros: I like the integrated roadmaps feature which is essential for proper planning of project goals. It has outstanding bug tracking capabilities which are useful in resolving bugs.
cons: Its time tracking capabilities are limited in comparison with similar tools.
author: Ramos

review_detail:
title: Jira: An easy win
pros: The registration process and web page creation was easy to setup. Beginners could do it with no prior knowledge of online technology.
cons: Its great that they have so many features but its alot of time to get everything setup and structured properly. I'd like it a it more if it were a bit more streamlined.
author: Rene

review_detail:
title: Great features but it is complex
pros: Jira can be highly customized to match diverse workflows and processes, which makes it perfect for adjusting the tool to accommodate different teams and projects. Teams can successfully manage tasks, issues, and user stories with the support of the comprehensive issue tracking tools, which offer comprehensive insights into progress and status.
cons: User interface is quite difficult to understand and many a times when many user are working than response time becomes slow and it is costly.
author: Arjun

review_detail:
title: Powerful tool that enhances productivity and communication in project management.
pros: Streamlined approach to project management and collaboration.
cons: Fully grasping and utilizing all the capabilities of JIRA in short time frame.
author: Naudina

review_detail:
title: Helps keep me and my development team on task!
pros: I like that it helps me track the tasks that my developers are working on the app I'm building.
cons: I don't quite understand the hierarchy of tasks, and it seems like maybe the developers are using it wrong. But, I see duplication of tasks a lot
author: Steve

review_detail:
title: Jira - THE Agile tool
pros: If your business is related with IT services and development, and you are still not using Jira, well you need to reflect seriously on the efficiency of your teams. The perfect tool to apply an Agile environment, Jira promotes communication, efficiency and transparency.
cons: When using it for the first time, it is not the most user-friendly option: meaning that you need to take some time to understand the functionalities and explore the platform.
author: Ivo

review_detail:
title: Jira review - excellent tool for Project and Sprint planning
pros: Comprehensive project management and issue tracking features. High level of customization. Strong integration with other tools and platforms. Excellent reporting and analytics capabilities. Effective collaboration tools.
cons: Steep learning curve for new users. Can be overwhelming due to the abundance of features. Performance can be slow with large projects or extensive customizations.
author: Chinmay

review_detail:
title: JIRA the best manager
pros: It is a significant system for ticket management with a friendly, easy-to-use and business environment.
cons: It is a very friendly and easy to use system.
author: Gretty

review_detail:
title: Worth the price
pros: So easy to learn and use, also their pricing is the best
cons: It is working well with us. No issues so far
author: Keegan

review_detail:
title: I really liked my Jira experience
pros: Customization: Jira is highly customizable and can be tailored to meet the specific needs of a team or organization. Users can create custom workflows, fields, and issue types to fit their unique requirements.
cons: Complexity: Jira can be complex and difficult to set up and use, especially for users who are not familiar with project management software.
author: chaouechi

review_detail:
title: Software for every project manager
pros: Jira help me to track, plan, and resolve my project management issues. It sync my entire team and give me there performance idea of each. Through jira I can understand what next I have to plan in my roadmap and what time it will get finished. It also connected with my other software with help me to track my complete project from starting to end
cons: Jira pricing is little high if you are using for large size team.
author: Sumit

review_detail:
title: Best Agile development software in my eyes
pros: Quick and easy management and organization of my backlog tasks, the flexibility of setting up almost any integrations for bug tracking with ease, works flawlessly when used alongside other Atlassian products like Confluence. Best pricing options seen till date. Overall takes my agile workflow to the ultimate level with the amount of extensiblity that is second to none in my opinion!
cons: At times there is some flakiness in the outcomes of the actions but generally not a lot worrisome. Also the availability, although can be improved using a private cloud probably, does suffer some occasional hiccups here and there. The bug tracking is comparatively the most improvable area i suppose. It is good don't get me wrong, but can be so much more better with just a few tweaks here and there that's all.
author: Jitendra

review_detail:
title: Cornerstone of AGILE software development
pros: JIRA is a complete tool for SCRM teams. It features a wide variety of features catering to the needs of every level of an organisation. That includes task creation and tracking for engineers and reporting tools with auto-created beautiful graphs and charts for managers.
cons: There are a lot of flavours(read versions) of JIRA. Each version caters to a particular set of requirements. It is very easy to lose money buying the wrong version. So buy carefully.
author: Abhirup

review_detail:
title: Jira for the win!
pros: Jira has become a defacto project management tool that goes WAY beyond project management. So many of our code development tools plug into Jira (and Jira into them) that the sheer interconnectivity of Jira is hands down the best feature.
cons: Jira is as simple or complex as you want to make it. I've been using Jira now for around seven (7) years, and because Jira is so flexible on naming conventions, labels, ticket types, integrations, etc etc. it's easy to create a rats-nest of your own doing. Before you've realized that you've made some bad decisions in Jira, it's three (3) months too late and so many other bad decisions have been piled on that to 'undo' a simple mistake now takes weeks/months to unwind.
author: Justin

review_detail:
title: Great For Bug Tracking, Project Planning, And Forecasting All In On Nice Neat Package.
pros: Allows for as simple or complex bug tracking as you need, users can easily create a flow that is customized to what their organization needs. Allows for easy collaboration between users in all disciplines to be able to work towards completing an objective and show what was/wasn't completed.
cons: Project management could use some upgrading. Some more complex projects are hard for new users to get used to, to be able to use Jira to its full potential. A lot of work needs to be put in to get Jira how your organization potentially needs to use it.
author: Andrew

review_detail:
title: Jira for project management
pros: I love the Jira Query Language for filtering data and the gadget variety is really great.
cons: Overall is good software, and I have no complaints.
author: Héctor Fernando

review_detail:
title: Jira is one the best collaborative tool for developers and software Team Members
pros: It allows the yeah to plan agile work from product backlog to sprints within set sprint schedule It's is used for Kanban and Scrum Boards. Scruk master can prioritize backlog. It is easily customizable with third party integrations.
cons: Creating a template seemed a little difficult in the beginning then it became easy after initial use.
author: Syed Mohsin Ali

review_detail:
title: Enterprise Task Management
pros: Jira has a strong SaaS-based offering that makes the administration and operation of the product simple and easy. The software has multiple options for viewing tasks (from project-task style to Kanban style) which allows different teams to be flexible and use different formats.
cons: The difficulty of running the hosted version of the software with custom plugins is almost unacceptable for enterprise-grade software. The concept that enterprise project-management software requires dedicated IT assets to service and maintenance increases the overhead of the software to unacceptable levels. If a deployment requires a host, non-SaaS version of the software with custom plugins, reconsider.
author: Stephen

review_detail:
title: Jira-It took a while, but now I know it's the most awesome ticketing option out there!
pros: Jira is what we are bringing our new software to life with. I have found that the ability to create one ticket and pass it through the planning stages, prioritization, product, development, then education and support is brilliant. Our development team is vast, each having a different skillset. A ticket is created as an idea, or (gasp!) bug, and that ticket is then moved through all the necessary channels and team members until it's implemented into the software. At first, I was skeptical of Jira but over time I've come to love it just for the tracking and productivity aspects. Then you add in the analytics and it can blow your mind, in a good way.
cons: I had to absorb all that Jira could do in small bites. The learning curve of Jira is INTENSE and I'll admit, I still don't know everything there is to know but as I use it more and more, I've come to appreciate how complex Jira CAN be.
author: Tatum

review_detail:
title: There are many programs to manage projects and teams, but they are not Jira
pros: I will give an example of how I used it on one occasion and the advantages of having had this software.I was hired by a digital marketing company to improve proprietary applications, internal APIs, creation and migration of landing pages made in WP for our clients, migration of PHP applications to Python, server management, diversity of containers... The DevOps who was doing all that work left the company.An external audit was hired that provided workers spread all over the world, Spain, India, Latam...So we find ourselves with a lot of work, from very different areas, work environments and projects of all kinds and just one person to manage everything.With Jira we all worked under the same environment to organize tasks, but above all incidents and bugs, and with the need to manage the priorities of each new element that entered our work boards.At a glance, I could assign tasks, review code, refactor or modify it, and upload it to the test servers. Review the tickets, with screenshots of the errors or the new results that should be obtained. Keep in touch with everyone from one place and also receive all feedback in Jira.It was months of hard work, without Jira it would have been impossible to manage it.
cons: Despite having Jira with everything necessary for software development, sometimes it becomes more complex and less visual than if we accompany it with some extras, also from Atlassian. So it is easier for some boards or planning to use Trello, GitHub or Bitbucket for continuous integration, Sourcetree to make the different branches and versions more visual, Composer for team collaboration...
author: Enrique

review_detail:
title: Jira : a dominant tool for Agile projects
pros: Jira have powerful Agile views it provides separate boards for kanban as well as scrum model of agile custom workflow of jira provide better visibility of set of processess involved awesomme detailed reports its highly customizable
cons: complicated user interface for new users no collaboration features to communicate with your team the tool can be expensive sometimes it becomes very slow
author: Anup

review_detail:
title: The 2022 Tool for Agile Project Management.
pros: - Agile project management is the ultimate reason as to why jira has become useful in our organization. One is able to assign and follow-up with tasks. - Jira software is easy to use. - Jira's analytic tool helps in the creation of data driven insights to propel the team forward. - Customization of the jira workflow makes it easy and flexible for the team as they execute their duties. - Workflow tracking has also been possible on jira. - Integration with third party software products like Slack has made the whole user experience amazing. - API integrations can also be done since jira provides space for that. - The filters on the platform are incredible.
cons: Just to mention, the jira software is simple to use and thus if there be more improvements, we shall fully embrace this from our end.
author: Justine

review_detail:
title: Flexible but not at all fun
pros: The biggest strength that Jira has to offer is how customisable the app is. We're forever fine tuning how how development flows are setup and I've never run into an issue where what we wanted to achieve could not be possible. The workflow editor is pretty straight forward once you figure out how to map these to specific projects and features. It also has a mammoth number of apps that can integrate with it, which can greatly help simplify your organisations stack. We use a bunch of apps that connect to Jira such as Slack and Git. The mobile app is pretty good and more simple to use. There's also a new iOS app that you can run on a mac that seems to be a slightly faster and more user friendly version. However, I haven't quite worked out how to tailor the notifications. The search is very powerful!
cons: It is very slow to load pages and jump between stories. When using this on a daily basis it really gets annoying. When we need to change a setting it's hard to work out where to go. I have to say I've never seen another app quite like Jira which has so many different places to go to in order to change very similar settings. If someone accidentally creates a ticket with the wrong type the only way to change it is to Move the ticket. And I can't seem to change the status of the ticket at the same time. So often an Open bug ticket becomes an Open feature ticket, which really should still be in Draft.
author: Marc

review_detail:
title: Jira, a complete platform that increases productivity and successful execution of projects.
pros: JIRA is a project management platform that definitely increases visibility and promotes collaboration, with multidisciplinary and even multicultural work teams. Jira organizes the planning and execution of almost any type of project extremely quickly, from large or large, where multiple tasks are supervised, and with a high degree of complexity, to flexible implementations that require simple and collaborative work.In this way, with JIRA we manage the entire execution cycle and even subsequent phases associated with evolutionary maintenance, roadmap, and support.
cons: Jira is really intuitive, and its functionalities allow the successful execution of large or small projects, however, for the result to be impeccable, we must prepare all the team members and train them properly, and in this way we can expect a process without complications, on the other hand, the licensing may not be as flexible as other usable tools currently on the market but it remains in the average range.
author: Marianela

review_detail:
title: A Very Good Tool for Project Management
pros: I mostly liked the ticket creation and assignment part. It is very easy in JIRA to create a ticket and assign that to a user. We can integrate other software like Bamboo, SVN, etc with JIRA easily.Overall JIRA is very easy to use. There are a lot of Basic and Advanced filters. Search is quite powerful.
cons: No collaboration features to communicate with team members and little hard to set up the first time.
author: Vandana

review_detail:
title: Jira is a fantastic tool for managing projects
pros: Project, issue, bug, task, and workflow management are all handled by Jira software. All phases of a project's development life cycle, from planning to coding to testing, may be managed from within the system.
cons: Problems with the software cause the window to take a long time to load, and real-time updates and app integration are also areas for improvement.
author: Courtney

review_detail:
title: Simple and scalable agile tracking tool
pros: It’s pretty abundant in features and productivity reporting. Works well for simple agile projects but can also work with scaled agile. Free for 10 users is a great way for new teams to explore and learn it.
cons: Some powerful features such as dependencies between projects are part of their “advanced” offering, which is an extra subscription.
author: Eduardo

review_detail:
title: A complete project management suite!
pros: What makes Jira stand out from other project management tools is the ecosystem of products that it sits in. Atlassian has a solution for everything. - Confluence for Knowledge base - Service Desk for IT or any type of requests - Bitbucket for version control - Jira for Project Management It's a very well-thought-out project. Everything from sprint planning to scrum to project planning can be seamlessly handled in the Atlassian suite. We've extensively used Jira & Confluence for Engineering.
cons: Jira doesn't have a dark mode. In a world where most people their daily tools in the dark mode because it's easier on the eyes, Jira still lacks this. It's on their Q4 roadmap. Let's wait and see if they get it right.
author: Nirmal

review_detail:
title: Enablement of Team collaboration for Agile projects.
pros: 1. Different user roles can be defined to allow for segregation of duties. 2. Epics can be defined to assist with long and intermediate project planning. 3. Duration of sprints can be defined according to project requirements. 4. Statuses for user stories can be used for tracking progress as well as workflow management. 5. Allows for bulk import of epics and user stories which can fast track administrative tasks where this information has been captured elsewhere e.g. CSV format
cons: 1. Only users from within the organization can be assigned to tasks and user stories. This can cause unnecessary delays where external users need to provide urgent input or contribution. 2. Statuses (user stories) cannot be defined specifically for a board where multiple boards exist within a project. 3. Only two types of users can be assigned to user stories, which are assignees and reporters. JIRA does not allow for multiple users (assignees) to be assigned to one user story.
author: Joshua

review_detail:
title: My experience with Jira
pros: In this program, I loved the way he manages projects and how to plan and manage time to finish these projects as quickly as possible.
cons: How to deal with it because it takes time in the beginning to understand it
author: Abdalla

review_detail:
title: Great all-around tool for Agile project management and software development!
pros: First of all, this product offered a free trial to experience the features first-hand without any strings attached. It was great to have the ability to go and play in a sandbox environment and carefully evaluate what it can and cannot do for me and how it can add value to my organization. Set up and gaining access was easy and quick. The different permissioning levels make sense to stay organized and maintain accurate information. Some of the features I liked the most was having a great UI for exploring and learning without much training. I was personally tasked with setting up a couple of projects and the respective boards for my teams and I was able to do that in a pretty self-serve way. The design is minimalistic and doesn't feel overwhelming, it is clean and navigable. Easily creating backlogs, sprints and administering those are also my favorite features because it makes it so easy to implement an Agile project management and software development culture. The categories of initiatives, epics, stories, tasks etc. align very well with the Agile methodologies in following the same hierarchy. I love being able to get a quick summary view of the tasks before diving deep into the details. Assigning owners, labeling, story points to track work effort needed, description fields, attachments, comments and seamless integrations with other products make it all the more user-friendly. Kanban Board views in Active Sprints tabs provides a clearly easy to understand view of progress.
cons: Managing boards within each project is the first that comes to mind. Jira does not offer a standard naming convention for the projects and boards and this can cause some major confusion. I have hard coding this manually and training people to do the same to ensure consistency. If you attached Lucidchart diagrams or embed other important document within tasks or epics, they don't update in real-time or even with refresh which is frustrating. This runs the risk of people getting outdated information which can misinform their actions. The search functionality within Jira is also something that I like the least. It does not return optimal results or even close to optimal results. Sometimes it does not search for metadata and you have to remember the actual word you're searching for to track down a task. It returns an overwhelming amount of results and the filtering or sorting options available are confusing and hard to understand. Another limitation is that even though one project can have multiple boards within, it can only have the one same backlog of items which does not make sense to me. There also cannot be multiple sprints running across different boards and all of this makes me wonder what the actual difference between projects and boards are. Jira also lacks some automation in moving tasks to different statuses upon completion. The workflows are suboptimal and don't work as intended most times. The reporting capabilities within Jira are also quite weak in my opinion.
author: Sabharish

review_detail:
title: Good stable piece of software
pros: I like multiple options and integrations, You can really adjust this tool under Your needs. Integrations with Teams, Notion, Gitlab, issue numbers are automagically recognized and linked - that helps a lot.
cons: UI is definitely the worst part of Jira. Not too comfortable, not modern-looking, there is a lot of elements in the viewport. But You can deal with it.
author: Monika

review_detail:
title: JIRA works pretty great for projects and tasks
pros: I like the kanban board, it works very well and looks simple to use (but it's not easy to setup). The task management for business project is very nice and the new feature of being able to look at the overall work like in a spreadsheet, definitely beats Smartsheet for me. I like that you can easily move your work when you're done using the board view, if you like.
cons: Scrum/Agile can be difficult to setup because the Kanban board isn't so great when setting it up. I have run into some difficulties with it, their support board was helpful but it did not resolve the issue. Business projects do not have the ability to link to Bitbucket, it would have been nice to include task management with Bitbucket integration, it helps to appropriately follow up on tasks. The board view for tasks and sub-tasks doesn't work for me. I'd like to see that there are major tasks with steps of the child tasks (change the subtask icon too).
author: Ogaga

review_detail:
title: Streamlines management of complex workloads across a large team for efficient task management
pros: Jira allows us to efficiently manage a tasks across a wide variety of different projects, assigning work easily to each team member and allowing us to run a clear process from briefing through quality checking. It has allowed the team to communicate more effectively and improved the overall quality of delivery with better expectation management.
cons: We've used a variety of different task and process managment tools in the past - and still do for direct client work where they have a preference (e.g. Basecamp, Asana etc), and the interface on Jira is maybe not as attractive, but it works fine and allows good interaction.
author: James

review_detail:
title: Jira is a powerful tool to help with your Scrum Project
pros: Jira is really powerful and has helped us a lot with a lot of important features to track the team tasks and progress.
cons: When you are starting to use the software, it's a little hard to understand all the features, but it doesn't take a long time to learn and understand what you can do with Jira
author: Silvano

review_detail:
title: Jira for test management
pros: The organisation of tests and the variety of the issue types for testing (Features ,Test cases, Test sets, Test executions, Test plan, bug...) The ability to track the executions of tests and bugs Great adaptability with Gherkin and Cucumber It goes perfectly with ISTQB standards for testing Perfect for both Scrum and Kanban users The great boards and views provided by Jira (followup dashboards, sprint board, ..) The ability to add Xray or Zephir or whatever test plugin that suits you
cons: Jira users must receive a training before starting to use the software since it can be a little complex to use the software for the first time For testers you cannot execute the same test case more than once in the same test execution It gets more and more difficult when end to end testing multiple applications at the same time
author: bennar

review_detail:
title: Can manage daily tasks efficiently.
pros: You can manage daily tasks easily and manage software cycles using this software. I can manage when the task in progress and when it is in testing and when it is production ready.
cons: There is nothing which I do not like about this product.
author: Krishan

review_detail:
title: Very Intricate Project Management Software
pros: What I like most about Jira is the customization abilities throughout various aspects of the application. Not only can you customize your dashboard/homepage to show what is most important to you personally, you can also customize the way projects/tickets are created and what fields do/do not show up depending on other factors within that project/ticket itself. I also love the "Epic" feature that was semi-recently added which helps you to organize tickets into higher-level projects.
cons: There's not much I don't like about Jira but one thing that I've found I dislike with the recent interface update is that there are a few bugs with adding/downloading attachments to tickets. A lot of the time I've resorted to clicking the "use old interface" button in order to get done what I'm trying to accomplish. The new interface has been around for a while now (I think at least 6 months) and I haven't seen any changes/fixes made yet.
author: Allison

review_detail:
title: Best Project and Task management software
pros: Helps to follow Agile process with ease
cons: Better documentation on configuring the boards can be more helpful
author: Syed

review_detail:
title: Good tracking Tool for project management and delivery
pros: The way it is designed for ease management , creating the task and tracking each item is good
cons: I don't have anything as of now in mind in terms to improve
author: Safeer

review_detail:
title: Top-notch issues tracker right out of the box
pros: Jira is constantly being improved for the better and Jira 2 years ago this is a completely different product than now. I like the ease of task management and as the other Atlassian products here are closely integrated.
cons: 1) Settings are not always obvious. 2) With a large number of automation and integrations, the system has been slowed down.
author: Zack

review_detail:
title: One of the most valuable pieces of software for developer teams
pros: Being able to track tasks and drag and drop tickets is fundamental for visualizing or tasks as a team. The tickets are all highly editable and changes are publicly tracked. Notifications are sent out to those team members most involved with the specific task.
cons: Jira is sometime "down". To be fair, this has happened less in the last couple years, but when it's down it really slows our teams production to a halt. The analytics needs work. I'm specifically thinking about the "burn down" chart my scrum master uses. The goal post seems to move instead of the chart reflecting what is truly happening.
author: Kevin

review_detail:
title: Jira: The Ultimate Solution for Project Management and Planning.
pros: The best thing I like about Jira is it's Kanban and Scrum boards, because of these my team manages to perform work efficiently and we as a team become productive. Throughout the project lifecycle, an agile-centric strategy always helps us improve transparency in project work, gives us flexibility, and better team cooperation.
cons: I know few co-workers from a non-technical background who find it a bit complex to use, because of the terminologies, which makes it difficult to navigate.
author: Ashutosh Krishna

review_detail:
title: Great workflow tool for agile teams
pros: I love the ease of backlog management, ability to track time spent on tasks, the velocity and data analytics which helps in sprint retrospective meetings. This was seamless to integrate and it really helped the organisation meet it's product development goals.
cons: I didnt really have any areas or features I wasn't pleased with but I feel it can be better improved. For example users may be allowed to link their ux/ui tools like Figma and Adobe XD and directly link designs to tasks.
author: Taiwo

review_detail:
title: JIRA Review
pros: JIRA is a full featured tool to track project tasks, especially when used in an agile environment. What is great about the tool is its extensiveness of its features. The ability to trace changes, have people collaborate on the task itself, assign tasks to specific people and link them with dependencies are my favourite features. I'm currently using the roadmap feature in JIRA which provides a really nice traditional gaant chart view. This aids communication with stakeholders who do not need to dive into the details. Lastly, I'll comment on the ability to create custom search queries to build reporting that best suits your needs.
cons: There is a bit of a trial and error aspect to using the software. Since there are many functions - especially with starting sprints and ability to customize fields - there are sometimes occurrences where the outcome of certain functions are not clear. This requires testing and experience with the tool to truly use it to its full potential.
author: Nicolette

review_detail:
title: Best-in-class task management software with a steep learning curve
pros: Jira is a good project management tool for tracking and planning tasks in software development projects. It allows for great customizability. For example, it allows creating any type of field in a task, allowing managers to better manage and track tasks. Kanban boards are also a great way to get the team used to SCRUM methodologies.
cons: Although Jira is powerful, it is complex and sometimes not intuitive. For example, filtering tasks for boards with "SQL-Like" queries is great, but the language is not as easy as it seems and requires a high learning curve. Finally, even though a lot of apps are available for Jira, a better selection of 3rd party tools would be great

Had this case with a newly acquired partner and they were spammed with details for projects they didn't have access to in the first place. Was fixed with a patch from Atlassian later on, but the initial origin of this error remained unknown to us.

It can also be heavy in execution time but it depends whether you host it on your own server or use Attlasian cloud.

review_detail:
title: JIRA by Atlassian
pros: JIRA by Atlassian is a great tool for software development platform. It simplifies the issue and project tracking. The new dashboard looks decent and give one stop view to backlog, board, reports, releases, issues and repository. Planning the sprint and distribution of task across team is easy. Release menu provide the clear view on the progress of the different release version on the single display. Best thing of JIRA software is we can select our own work cycle as per the organisation standards or by the size of company. Integration with the other third party tools like bamboo to view the build status help to get the real-time status on the release process bar.
cons: The third party APIs we are working with are expensive. So we are developing own APIs which is complex. The documentation and on screen help should be more systematic. Support and ticket solving process are the areas where JIRA can work on.

review_detail:

cons: I don't have anything specific that I didn't like about the platform. What I can mention, maybe, is the slowness in some specific occasions when navigating through the platform.

review_detail:
title: Atlassian Jira
pros: The simplicity of assigning tasks to architects and developers

author: Michał

review_detail:
title: Best for Agile workflow
pros: One of the most appreciated features of Jira is its flexibility in defining and customizing workflows to match the specific processes and needs of different teams and projects. This allows teams to tailor Jira to their unique project management methodologies, whether they follow agile, Scrum, Kanban, or another approach.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for new users due to its extensive feature set and complex configuration options. Setting up projects, workflows, and permissions may require a steep learning curve, and it may take time for teams to fully understand and leverage all of Jira's capabilities.
author: nitheen

review_detail:
title: Outil qui fait ce qu'il promet !
pros: Exhaustivité et facilité d'utilisation après une petite phase de prise en main et de montée en compétence.
cons: Approche assez tech car c'est un outil de ticketing. Pas fait pour d'autres usages.
author: Eric

review_detail:
title: A Comprehensive Tool for Project Management and App Dev
pros: I've been using Jira for over a year in a mid-sized software development team, and it's been a generally positive experience. Jira has been a game-changer for our project management and issue tracking needs, offering a robust and highly customizable platform. The flexibility to create and manage multiple projects, each with its unique workflow, is invaluable. The seamless integration with other Atlassian products, such as Confluence and Bitbucket, enhances our overall productivity by providing a cohesive ecosystem for our development process. Setting up a Kanban board and tracking exceptions has helped to improve the visibility of our development deliveries, and helped to keep our global/remote team on task.
cons: It can be a steep learning curve at first - there are so many integration points, and "layers" to many of these capabilities, that it can be a bit challenging to set up and orchestrate. Additionally, I find that administration can be challenging - who has the ability to create stories/complete stories, etc. I had similar feedback for almost all Atlassian products in general though
author: Micah

review_detail:
title: Perfect, Powerful Tool
pros: Jira allows users to create custom workflows tailored to specific project needs, making it versatile for various teams. Its core strength lies in issue tracking. It offers comprehensive reporting and tracking capabilities for bugs, tasks, or user stories.
cons: Jira can be overwhelming for beginners due to its vast array of features, settings, and configurations. It often requires training to use effectively.

pros: It is very easy to share files and find data in this application. It finds diversity of charts and graphs which helps in sprinting. Moreover, I do not face any issue with cut copy paste and to attach images, while creating files. Integrations of this tool keeps much importance, it provides easy mode of communication like Hip chat and Slack which helps you in commenting and tracking conversations.
cons: Its mobile app is not so good in response and also creates problems in upload of the heavy files. I have reinstalled that application many times but still I have to face this problem. Apart from this I do not have any issue with its services.
author: Shannon

review_detail:
title: The preferred tool for product, project, and engineering teams
pros: Simplifies and streamlines various functions for various roles (product manager, project manager, development and test engineers) Intuitive to use - set up projects as simply, or as elaborately as you need Ease of integration with other Atlassian offerings, especially Confluence Ubiquity - almost everywhere I have worked, JIRA is the preferred option
cons: Some downloads result in huge/heavy files, which can be very slow to review/manage The name - need to clarify to users whether i is a soft i, or a hard i or something else - JEE-RAH or JY-RAH
author: Ash

review_detail:
title: Quite effective as our choice project management tool.
pros: The quality of reporting and the variety of reporting available for all Jira managed project from my experience, is what sets Jira apart from substitute project management suites that I have encountered and what I like best about it. Out of the box, Jira comes with more than twelve different types of report types, which includes Burndown charts, sprint reports, velocity charts, cumulative flow diagrams etc thereby simplifying access to real time insights into my teams performances.
cons: Jira has very limited collaboration tools, infact it offers no real time messaging tool out of the box. Also, its user interface is not very friendly and this tend to create a slow learning curve for non-technical users in my department.
author: Karla

review_detail:
title: A great planning tool for business processes used by agile teams
pros: It comes with a ton of functionality by default. It contains several levels (Teams, Projects) that may support the structure of the entire business, creating just the correct amount of separation while also allowing for the proper linkages between the various teams inside the business. May be easily integrated with the entire Atlassian ecosystem (Bitbucket, Confluence), and I highly encourage doing so because you'll have a ton of places to store any piece of your project (code, backlog, sprints, documentation). It provides you with all the tools you need to manage any Scrum or Canvas team, albeit I must stress that you will benefit more from adopting Scrum. It makes for incredibly inventive automatic build ticket systems and is simple to incorporate via code.
cons: It's expensive and difficult to say whether it's the best tool for tiny independent teams when there are many free choices available that can manage numerous users. That is in fact the best option for businesses, but for low-budget teams, it's definitely safer to use a free alternative with no membership cap.
author: Sibusiso

review_detail:
title: The most powerful way to handle software projects, with some pitfalls
pros: I like the great number of features, the UX, the way you can configure workflows, add fields, and really tailor it to your needs (even if you have to deal with very different contexts in the same instance). Having a rich API is also something I value a lot. Extension through marketplace module is also a big plus.
cons: Well, Jira Cloud is perfect to handle agile projects, but you have to struggle a lot when you need to address fixed price projects with strict budget management and a clear separation between your customers and your internal teams. Time tracking could also be better (without requiring extra module/money with Tempo). The ability to group projects (of have subprojects) is also missing
author: Guillaume

review_detail:
title: Good experience
pros: Save the time and there is more functions
cons: Nothing I think once you know how to use it’s easy

review_detail:

pros: I like Jira mostly for its ability to customize different boards. We have multiple teams in our company and this is really of help. I also like the transparency, you can assign anything to anyone and it's available for everyone, no need to email, follow up, everything in one place
cons: It really takes time to adjust to the software, but once you get there, everything is great. I suggest to have less mandatory fields while opening a task. Also the limitation of file size upload needs to be changed.
author: Kristine

review_detail:
title: Best Task management and Issue tracker so far
pros: Jira task management is super customizable and so intuitive to use. We have 5 boards for 5 separate projects and have more than 3 people working on the same project. The git integration is such a time saver and makes communication between devs much easier as it's very difficult to track changes with bitbucket only as there are a lot of updates every day. We have also recently started to merge Freshdesk with Jira, The experience so far has been really good as everything is connected.
cons: I don't dislike anything in particular. One thing I would like to see is time tracking, though I suspect they might already have this or maybe we can achieve with some other tool and integrate it with jira.
author: Amit

review_detail:
title: Boost Your Team's Efficiency with Jira's Customizable Workflows
pros: One of the biggest advantages of Jira is its flexibility. It is highly customizable, and allows you to create your own workflows, issue types, and fields. This means that you can set up Jira to match your team's specific needs and processes, which can greatly improve efficiency and productivity. Another benefit of Jira is its integrations with other tools, such as GitHub, Bitbucket, and Confluence. This allows for seamless collaboration between team members and tools, and ensures that everyone is working on the same page.
cons: However, one downside of Jira is its steep learning curve. While the flexibility of Jira is a big advantage, it also means that the software can be complex and difficult to navigate, especially for new users. Additionally, Jira can be slow and resource-intensive, which can be frustrating for users who are trying to work quickly and efficiently.
author: Kavindu Githsara

review_detail:
title: Strumento per gestire i progetti "Agile
pros: Con JIRA è possibile gestire i progetti in modalità Agile. Ciò significa che tutti i task da realizzare possono essere inseriti in un cd. "backlog" e quindi assegnati alle persone che li prendono in carica, fissando scadenze. Una delle caratteristiche positive è che le attività possono essere spostate da una sezione all'altra senza vincoli (quindi un'attività può essere spostata dalla sezione "da fare" a quella "test" ma anche viceversa). JIRA dà la possibilità di visualizzare con un unico colpo d'occhio come sono distribuite le attività di progetto sia per quanto riguarda il numero di attività assegnate a ciascuna persona, sia per quanto riguarda le attività considerate per ciascuno stream. Infine dà una visione immediata di quante sono le attività completate e quante quelle in ritardo
cons: JIRA ha enormi potenzialità ma richiede parecchia formazione per sfruttare al meglio tutte le risorse. Ad ogni modo Atlassian, sul suo sito, offre una formazione gratuita fruibile online in lingua inglese.
author: francesca

review_detail:
title: JIRA- Task management
pros: Product is very easy to us. We can make topics as an entity and then group our tasks based on topics. And Add to watch is also nice addon feature which helps to keep an eye on task. And In The search functionality and or conditions can be used to filter search results.
cons: sometimes the product gets hanged up and need to refresh back the form.
author: Rimjhim

review_detail:
title: You'll probably using this, but could use a lot of optimization
pros: You have the ability to integrate/link to other platforms (such as Zendesk), which can be useful for cross-integration work. There is a nice ability to enter a ticket name and number, and it'll let you see the status of that ticket right then and there. It is overall serviceable and for basic ticket creation, tracking, and updating, you have what you need if you need a SaaS project/ticket management system.
cons: Quality of life features are lacking, often neglected for years, before being closed out as an issue that won't be resolved. Examples of QoL features lacking are: Inability to open links in a new window (this even extends to the Atlassian website...), sorting tickets by name/title (absolutely awful if you are working with them in a specific order), filters timing out after an amount of time requiring a hard refresh, no easily accessed filter for tickets watched (you'll have to figure out how to do this manually). The software also is quite slow in certain parts. Another gripe is the eventually forced UI update, due to the fact that it OBSCURES MORE information off the bat, which is exactly what you wouldn't want when looking at a ticket's details. Their JIRA Slack apps also have a very annoying 'feature' that constantly bugs you to let it connect to your account, with no option to permanently block it - only temporarily snooze.
author: Evelyn

review_detail:
title: Reen kym
pros: It helps the projector to plan and work faster
cons: It has alot of friction limiting you you use jira well

pros: Very user friendly software and very easy to navigate through. It is the best tool to manage cases.
cons: nothing. JIRA is a great software tool out there in the market.

title: Jira - The Agile director
pros: 1) Managing Epics, user stories, and Subtasks effectively 2) Bug capturing and life cycle management 3) Availability of plugins 4) Project planning 5) Integration with Wiki
cons: 1) Cannot integrate with systems to cover automated test case coverage. 2) Customized burn down charts are not available
author: Uddipan

review_detail:
title: Easy to use and my best friend for project management
pros: Jira is a great project management tool. I use it for all my projects and in addition to tracking the progress of each task, Jira helps me keep track of the overall project goals and objectives. It also provides real-time reporting which allows me to analyze where we are at any given time so that I can stay on top of things. It's extremely useful in keeping tabs on your progress as you move along through a series of tasks or when you're working with multiple teams who may be developing different parts within one bigger project.
cons: The UX can be a bit more user friendly. Right now, i have to shuffle between tabs more frequently.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Efficient Task Management and Collaboration with JIRA: A Game-Changer for Project Success
pros: What I love most about JIRA is its robust task management capabilities. It empowers me to efficiently organize tasks, assign responsibilities, and collaborate seamlessly. With JIRA, I can track and prioritize tasks effectively, leading to improved project success and enhanced team productivity.
cons: What I like least about JIRA is its steep learning curve for new users. Initially, navigating through the various features and setting up workflows can be overwhelming. However, with time and practice, it becomes easier to harness its full potential for efficient task management.
author: Ashish

review_detail:
title: Managin Technical Projects The Right Way
pros: JIRA offers true Agile support for managing technical projects. Initially developed by developers for developers, JIRA is a powerful tool that captures more than just the project management aspect of any development project. JIRA offers a complete suite of issue tracking throughout the development life cycle. Starting with the backlog and planning, JIRA lets you layout your entire project across as many iterations (Sprints) as necessary. It provides ease of tracking the project progress and offers a host of tools for collaboration such as commenting threads. Projects and their projects can also be tracked across releases, with its release management capabilities, and provide comprehensive reports on performance and progress. JIRA is extremely flexible and offers pre-set templates across all functionalities, and allows you to modify them as neededto fit your team and organization's needs. Unlike some products with rigidity built into them, JIRA allows you to define how your team works. JIRA has a vast number of integrations and add-ons to further enhance its capabilities.
cons: JIRA is very powerful and very detailed. So much so, that some users often find it quite cumbersome if their development environments are not complex. Essentially, JIRA fits beautifully in any environment, but is extremely robust for enterprise environments, making it perceptively complex in small simple projects.
author: Miguel

review_detail:
title: Excellent for product development
pros: Excellent automation Seamless with Confluence and Bitbucket Perfect for the development side of things
cons: It's not really accessible or considered desirable by business functions not involved with development unfortunatley
author: Rachel

review_detail:
title: Widely used software for ticket/task tracking
pros: The nice thing about Jira is that most tech companies use their software for task management and setting up workflows. When working with different companies and teams, their systems can integrate which makes it easy to organize work.
cons: Jira has a lot of quirks to be aware of when using their software. The interface, navigation, documentation, etc. is not exactly user friendly. Occasionally you will look for a solution for a problem you have, only to find Atlassian's fix is to buy a separate addon. It's a decent software for managing team's work, but there's a lot to be aware of for first-time users.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: Logiciel de gestion
pros: Le logiciel Jira est bon pour la bonne gestion des projets aux entreprises.
cons: Il a un rapport prix très compétitifs que j'ai pas imaginé
author: Alexine

review_detail:
title: One of the best Project & Task management tool
pros: Highly customisable of the Issues and fine grained access policy
cons: Atlassian supports take more time respond and cost is costlier
author: Yuva

review_detail:
title: Works great for Software Project Management, I wish the configurations were easier to set up.
pros: The task tracking and overall reporting are pretty solid. If configured properly, you will not miss on any updates and can proactively resolve blockers.
cons: The configuration. They are very complicated and you cannot expect a new user to get it right and that's why there are dedicate people who set up this. We did it on our own and it took us a couple of months to get things right.
author: Fahad

review_detail:
title: Great for large organizations, incredibly flexible, but not often difficult to use.
pros: Jira works incredibly well for large organizations, allowing each team to have their own workspace for projects, epics, user stories, and bug tracking. It is incredibly flexible, allowing each team to customize the fields that appear on each issue. This lets the teams customize their workflows, and makes it possible to manage very diverse teams such as art, development, and marketing all within the same system. It has very powerful integrations with tools like GitHub, ZenDesk, and Power BI, which helps automate issue tracking and provide organization-wide statistics and analysis. Flat-fee pricing for small teams is very competitive for the amount of power it provides.
cons: Way too much overhead to actually get started. Jira is so flexible that you have to invest a lot of time to get it working the way you want. The layout of the interface isn't very intuitive and can take a lot of time to learn. They sacrifice usability for flexibility, which is a blessing and a curse. This tool is far too complex for a small company or team, although it may be a good choice if the company is growing quickly or manages very diverse teams.
author: Richard

review_detail:
title: Jira roots
pros: Jira is great application used to understand the lifecycle of the used story in a project. it has clear discription of each step where user stories are placed
cons: Ther is sometimes save issues and also there is file upload limit which can be increased. Overall all a slightly confusing to use jira one who doesn't know the functionality will get difficult to figure out.
author: Aldrin Wilfred

review_detail:
title: Customizable for your most complex workflows, quick to use everyday
pros: We develop software solutions for a highly regulated environment, and that means lots of bureaucracy before a feature gets evaluated, developed, tested, released. Jira helps us keeping track of the state of the tickets without having to rely on the versatility of spreadsheets (!). There's also a lot of tools to track time or effort planned or spent, with plenty of fully configurable charts and their very own sql-like query language. If you like fiddling with this kind of things, you can get interesting information out of it, all for the benefit of the team. Atlassian tools are well integrated and Confluence is a nice tool, too.
cons: In our case of highly regulated environment, Jira doesn't seem to be compliant with some specific regulations and we can't use it directly as the main tracking tool. Using the cloud solution, you'll often see changes that might surprise you and get in the way while working, and some times it gets pretty slow (that might be due to the oceanic distance from the servers). At first impact, coming from a cork board and paper, we needed some time to get used to the small screen. The main issue was the lack of a whole picture of how the (scrum) sprint was going, and we've overcome this only when we took the time to explore the dashboarding features.
author: Andrea

review_detail:
title: Great for big companies
pros: It's probably the best software in its class but it's too complex that you need someone to work just administrating it.
cons: For small companies the price is affordable but it quickly scales to very expensive so it's actually for big companies.
author: Ignacio

review_detail:
title: Great project management tool
pros: As a user, Jira is very intuitive to use. The user interface makes it very straightforward to do certain actions and also makes it easy to monitor the progress of all tasks/stories.
cons: As an admin, it's quite challenging to customize a Jira workflow.
author: Rey Anthony

review_detail:
title: Tool for easy project management
pros: Easy to use and maintain different projects across different teams. Easy to get synced with all the works and the deadlines
cons: There is nothing to dislike just a little bit pricey
author: Richa

review_detail:
title: GitHub is my choice for project management
pros: - up-to-dated dashboard - mobile application - flexible settings
cons: - bulk actions are not intuitive and require to be reviewed
author: Oleksii

review_detail:
title: Jira is the best tool for project management necessities
pros: You can create pie charts to track the task of each users and get valuable information when dealing with huge projects. You can also create sprints and attach each task or issue with the sprints.
cons: It is not easy to create a task, since there are a lot of entries to be filled. There might be a way to automatically fill some of the entries, to shorten the creation process.
author: ilhan

review_detail:
title: Jira functionality
pros: Entire project and product can be tracked on JiraBack kog refinement can be completed on JiraDistributed teams can work easily and their progress tracked
cons: There's need for a formal training to learn the basicsIt can be difficult navigating the various functions at beginning
author: Ifeanyi

review_detail:
title: JIRA - Boost your software development process
pros: It's a great tool for development and quality assurance team. For development: * It's great to have a single place where we can document epics/features/stories/tasks. * It's a great integration with third-party tools like Git. * Everything is on a single place and everything is documented. You don't have to waste time asking which team members have the details. * You can create charts to track your team speed. * You can create sprints, and sprint boards are great to keep track of your sprint progress. * If a developer creates a merge request, you can see the details on JIRA if the correct plug-in has been configured. For Quality Assurance: * You can review the features/stories/epic details on JIRA. * You can create issues and link them to the Jira story. * You can connect the development team directly.
cons: The only problem is when you have a high volume of projects/epics/stories/issues. Jira gets slow, and sometimes it takes minutes to load.
author: Luis Miguel

review_detail:
title: Un logiciel puissant de gestion de projet Agile
pros: En offrant une vision globale très claire des projets en cours et en proposant de multiples pages d’accueil personnalisables, l’interface utilisateur, extrêmement intuitive, est le premier atout du logiciel, très complet, même dans sa version gratuite. Disponible en plusieurs langues, celui-ci met à disposition de l’utilisateur d’excellentes fonctionnalités de gestion des projets. Donnant à l’utilisateur la possibilité de centraliser tous ses projets au même endroit, le programme permet réellement un gain de temps considérable et une optimisation efficace de l'organisation du travail collaboratif. Enfin, Jira est aussi simple à utiliser que rapide et performant et supporte de nombreuses intégrations ainsi que nombreux plugins pour améliorer sa productivité
cons: Il est dommage que l'application mobile soit peu stable et bugue souvent. par ailleurs, l'application, avec ses nombreux paramètres de personnalisation, peut sembler complexe d'utilisation sans formation préalable.
author: Delphine

review_detail:
title: Tracking everything in a high volume service B2B
pros: Planning is very strong. You track everything around a project or resource itself. Build input forms and integrations is easy and clear. I've been working for many years, and the response to detail metrics is very good. Extracting tools for report anything you want, goes strong on analytics.
cons: Could have a more visual interface, making things a little bit easier in special for non pro users.
author: Fabiano

review_detail:
title: Best tool for agile management
pros: Issues, stories and feature are easily accesible on jira boards and it is useful to track down the issues and also helpful in tracking the sprint timelines and backlog items
cons: As of there are no cons i found on this tool
author: Abhishek

review_detail:
title: Jira is a good compromise tool doing several different things well, but nothing perfectly.
pros: It is extremely flexible and easy to use. It also supports a great deal of integratino with other software making it easy to input and extract data.
cons: The design of Jira has certain drawbacks for certain groups of developers. There are lots of useful tools for managers who want to look at burn down charts, but in many ways it is not as friendly to people working out of it individually, such as QA analysts and Software engineers. A lot of time it introduces clunky workflow steps which have a beneffit for those who are running project, but are simply extra work for anyone working on projects.
author: T. Ryan

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool in the market
pros: So many features in Jira based on the use of the customer's requirement, easy customization, and so many tools available for integration, and task management based on the multiple projects with multiple teams, easy to maintain access and track all the activity based on the user's and projects.
cons: As of now none, we are using Jira tools last couple of years so far good.
author: Ashish

review_detail:
title: Jira: A Focused and Simple Tool for Project Manangement
pros: Jira makes it easy to use manage all aspects of a project, from delegating tasks to tracking timelines, all through its slew of handy and user friendly features.
cons: It is possible to get a little to granular with Jira, with some people raising new projects/tasks for the most minor of changes, although this is more of an issue with users than the product itself.
author: Eleanor

review_detail:
title: Best Platform for tracking issues and bugs in your projects
pros: - JIRA is easy to use, you can easily create and manage projects, tasks, and subtasks - It has a great user interface - It provides all necessary tools for managing your projects - You can easily integrate it with other Atlassian products (Confluence, Bitbucket)
cons: It can be expensive for small businesses because it requires a subscription fee that starts at $10/user/month. Another disadvantage is the lack of support for mobile devices like tablets and smartphones. This means that you have to use your laptop or desktop computer in order to use the software, which can be inconvenient if you are on the go or at another location that does not have your laptop accessible.
author: Rohan

review_detail:
title: Collaborate with your team
pros: Jira is an software to manage team task and collaborate with users. You can set a Jira issue to be resolved, or to track the progress of a bug or feature. The workflow is quite simple. From the JIRA menu, navigate to Issues, then select Create New Issue. Next , enter a title for your issue, choose a description and set your priority. In the next step, you can choose whether to assign the issue a priority or assign it to a group.
cons: i would improve some things . For example, if you want to set an issue as unresolved, it should say "Unresolved" in the title. And if there is a checkmark next to it, this means that it is resolved.
author: Leonardo

review_detail:
title: An Advanced Project Management Software in Hands
pros: Though I am still novice in using Jira, I find it helpful to customize and manage tasks and sprints easily. Jira allows you track your activity and thus work faster; it comes with add-ons, many colours and themes, mainly built-for-you templates. Known to be built for developpers, but Jira comes with a rich dashboard ideal for HR, marketing, finance and many others.
cons: I cannot find what to blame, but it is impossible to re-use reports on Jira unlike other tools. Jira is a bit expensive and does not compromise! Another serious issue is that it take time to understand how it works for it is built for developpers.
author: Mohamed

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management tool
pros: It's versatility allows you to use it for both small and way bigger project. You can manage a lot of things like workflow, teams, rights, time estimation, planning, issues, etc
cons: The settings are hard to find sometimes and the notification system isn't well built.
author: Geoffrey

review_detail:
title: Great tool for software development
pros: The capabilities for team management and cooperation between software development team. Easy to track the time using tasks and user stories from backlog
cons: With many implementation/customizations it may be hard to learn where the features are in different distributions.
author: Kacper

review_detail:
title: Too many emails, it needs to get more intuitive.
pros: I really like the how Jira integrates into almost all the other debugging/testing sites out there, such as SauceLabs. It has really become the standard in the reporting tools industry. The options and plugins available for test scripts, and criteria is very nice. It is rather basic of a software, but it works.
cons: The emails, the emails, the emails. If someone changes the workflow, comments on the story of why they changed the workflow, and changes the owner for the next step in the workflow, you will get 3 emails with each one of those steps. It would be ideal if Jira did a summary email of all changes made within 1-5 minutes. I can't setup a rule to delete them in outlook either because I need to read 1/3 of them, so i'm stuck wasting time going through the endless emails.
author: Cami

review_detail:
title: Best project management system to keep project workflow running smoothly
pros: Task assignment feature and the way you can set multiple roadmaps to track different tasks status in different schedules
cons: Nothing worth mentioning, UI could be better and should provide support to different screen sizes.
author: Youssef

review_detail:
title: JIRA is great at what it does, but to get more you gotta pay
pros: I love that JIRA is what it is, and it does what it says it does. You can set up a great basic workflow and JIRA and have it do everything you need to do.
cons: There are features that make life so much simpler that are addons and extensions you have to pay for. Anything beyond the most basic automation isn't available unless you buy a third party extension.
author: Shawn

review_detail:
title: JIRA- Best tool for project management and bug tracking
pros: jira is used across the company to manage and track the project activities. Different activities going in team can be monitored there. We can use different agile methodology with in it. Sprint can be done with using Jira. All the discussion on specific task or issue can be done at jira . Where we can attach different file for future reference.It have very good user interface .
cons: Jira is costly and in feature wise it need version history also . Edit history is not there now . Size of file which we can upload in jira has to be increased.

review_detail:

pros: Flexible workflow management and agile capabilities

Platform planning, creating and managing structures is one click job. Issues can be imported into different formats.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:
title: jira
pros: the workflow management and tracking of projects and creating or assigning tickets
cons: the interface looks a bit old which can be improved

review_detail:
title: Excellent task monitoring product.
pros: The flexible way to work with kanban and scrum boards.
