author: Luiz

review_detail:
title: Best project tracking tool
pros: I like how flexible the tool is and an excellent tool for issue management and highlight different cases.
cons: So far there is nothing about the toll to complain. All good and easy to use.
author: Krishnamurthy

review_detail:
title: Review on Jira
pros: Jira is an amazing software when it comes to issue handling. With numerous possibilities it makes your many tasks simple and easy to execute. It has a well built platform and a great user interface. I love the ability for customization and no other software can compete with Jira on this feature. Also the bug tracking tool is awesome. This software is a perfect solution for an organization with a huge number of employees.
cons: The greatest drawback I see on Jira is that customer support is really poor. They take an awful lot of time to respond and sometimes they actually never do. I faced this issue several times and I hope developers work on this matter. Other than that, I really don't see any negative aspect related to Jira.
author: Shenali

review_detail:
title: This tool is implementation dependent
pros: customization is a plus. The ability to modify/change things as you learn more is unique and helpful, however it can be a curse as well. The ability to create metrics and follow projects is there and it is helpful when done properly.
cons: the customization is both a blessing and a curse. You can over engineer things and make them very complicated. If the tool becomes to cumbersome due to the implementation, then you wil turn your stakeholders/users off to it. Be careful with you set it up.
author: Brad

review_detail:
title: Excellent solution as “One stop shop” in IT industry
pros: This software is very easy to manage day to day work,progress,assignments and forcast for different phases of projects..It turned out to be very effective tool in order to achieve efficient and cost efffective operational model in enterprise organizations
cons: This software should have most reporting widgets and open integration ports so that various data connectors can be integrated for limitless reporting
author: Ashish

review_detail:
title: The best organizer and issue tracker
pros: I like how easy it is to look up past events—having the ability to transmit directives telepathically is a plus. And we're all set to check out the exciting details, like the suitable date, in each reference. Moreover, dragging a record is a snap. Bringing up the work in a new tab is also quite helpful. Card-to-card attachments are also helpful.
cons: They have already been making progress on this issue. However, I suppose they could include more guiding principles in the template for less frequent users to spare unnecessary hassles. This is not a significant concern, but I agree that they could provide more designs. For example, performing the same item in two separate places in Jira might feel like two completely different experiences due to the item's inefficiencies.
author: Nur Syikin

review_detail:
title: Jira software
pros: The fact that you can drag and drop stories in terms of priority order with ease.
cons: If you’re not familiar with the tool, you will require quite a bit of training.
author: Andrew

review_detail:
title: Very good management tool for Agile project
pros: Easy define backlog for the whole project and allocate task into PI, Sprint and assign for team and member of project, clear dashboard to track working effort, member task, and sprint progress.
cons: It is hard to customize and require some effort for creating a ticket, it will be better if we are able to create a default template ticket for each team/project
author: Hung

review_detail:
title: Need to track Agile development methodology - Just go with Jira
pros: Jira is one of the best development tool for the agile environment of development. It is very easy to plan, track and release software. User can create project roadmaps with just drog and drop features with every minute project details. It's functionality like create user stories and issues, plan sprints and distribute tasks across the team etc very flexible to design. It is one of the best tracking tool I have ever worked with. I believe it is extremely handy and effective for project management. In nutshell I like below features very much: - Drag and drag feature is one of the best feature to design the project roadmap - Bird view and quick access to the project status/ tracking - Security features are also awesome and highly configurable - Beautiful dashboard - To extract data for reporting suppose is also easy
cons: - As an user I didn't find anything I can considers as 'Cons' but I heard from the management that it is quite expensive software. - It is highly configurable, so some times it is quite complex also to find out the configuration for a simple change
author: Sumit

review_detail:
title: JIRA IT Product Software Incredibility
pros: Ease of deployment and possession of simple settings. Flexibility to all internet enabled devices. Online projects, tasks and teams management. Employees scheduling. Online time tracking, among more.
cons: Nothing to like least since it over delivers all.
author: Kibaiya

review_detail:
title: Defect and project managment at ease with Jira
pros: 1) Ticket or story management becomes very easy. 2) It allows multiple links to a child ticket and hence tracking down or updating the ticket becomes very easy. 3) Ability to create new custom subtasks in a parent ticket. 4) Embed test case management tools like test rail, hence user can see and update the status of the test case in the same window. 5) Updates/comments form QA and Development teams are very clear. 6) Works efficiently for agile methodology projects. 7) All project related information like scrum team, sprints, scrum masters, QA team, Dev team MRD/BRD are organised very well. 8) Allows users to split their daily working hours in different tickets. 9) It has a vary vast storage, and allows all types to files to upload without any overall size issue.
cons: Webpage loads with some lag. Although mostly it has data only rather than UI but still it lags and specially if you are working inside VDI or VPN as in India most of the QA testers work inside client VPN only.
author: Manish

review_detail:
title: Best way to track your time and tasks
pros: Jira is the most professional ticketing solution I found so far. It is by far the easiest to use and is the golden industry standard.
cons: Some options related to sprints can be hard to find in the context menus, but once you know where they are it becomes much easier to use.
author: Goran

review_detail:
title: An industry leader that hasn't kept up
pros: Jira for a long time has been the industry standard for software development process management, and it has some exceptionally powerful workflow features to help you keep a development team on track. It's pretty intuitive if you're just looking to plan and run sprints.
cons: In the last couple of years, releases to the product have felt a little careless. This has lead to several inconsistencies and problems in the user experience. It can be overly complex and require you to reach out to Atlassian's (incredible) customer support team. I will be exploring other alternatives in the future such as airtable, Monday or Trello (owned by the same company).
author: Ash

review_detail:
title: Best software for allocating and tracking work items for project collaboration
pros: 1. Can personalize the fields as desired for work items or tickets or whatever you would like to use for like status, assignee, environment, importance, etc. 2. Can assign labels and resources. 3. Easy to see comment and activity history.
cons: 1. Analytics and usage per team or per user can be improved. 2. Sometimes email notification stop coming. Happened more than once. Hamper's the day's work as we become dependent on the product.
author: Yash

review_detail:
title: JIRA software helps me in my work
pros: JIRA software provides better workflow visibility by automating the process and tracking progress in real time
cons: It's a little confusing at first because of its sheer size and scale
author: Mohammed

review_detail:
title: Simple & Easy ALM Tool
pros: Good UX Flexible Options Customizable Provisions Add-In Support Dashboards & Boards
cons: Nothing as such. The JQL Syntaxes can be made available via hints for complex / advanced queries.
author: Rahul

review_detail:
title: Jira...the best out there
pros: Jira is highly customisable, and also has plugins. It allows you to monitor your projects and provided granulated access to individuals. You (or your admin) can set roles for the project and associates those roles to certain activities and then associate the roles even further to individuals. You can organize your tickets in sprints and releases as well as monitor workload and task assignment to your team during sprints (or whatever other form of software delivery you wish to choose).
cons: Pricing model. Currently, you have a choice of server vs cloud setup. If you have a team that can maintain the server instance, I'd recommend going to server because you have a lot more plugins you can use on server and you can set it up the way you want. The best thing is the licenses are a one-time cost, as opposed to lower, but monthly and forever costs on the cloud portion. The other thing that is to be considered is that the plugins you choose need to have the same level of range for hte user count. i.e if your jira is for 101-250 users, all your plugins will need a license level of the same range, i.e 101-250 users. Something to consider if you are thinking about moving to Jira.
author: Shaffick

review_detail:
title: Excellent for task management, setting workflows and an easy-to-set system for approvals
pros: Task management, setting workflows for approvals were damn easy - even for a huge organisation like noon
cons: Project management was not great especially compared to the likes of Asana - could be done, but not intuitve
author: Vedant

review_detail:
title: Best for large teams
pros: Jira is awesome; If you want to use it in large teams and big projects, definitely this is the one
cons: It is complicated and hard to use compared to other available solutions, Lacking flexibility. You will need a lot of paid extensions.
author: Mostafa

review_detail:
title: The Standard for Tracking and Reporting
pros: Jira provides everything we needed in a resource/project tracking tool. If you know how to use it, it provides great reporting and metrics to track progress, velocity, etc.
cons: Jira is a workhorse and while new users get quite a bit from it, it does take someone with solid experience to get things working right. Even with this person, there are still so many features and use cases that you feel like there is always more you could be doing and that gets overwhelming.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: The best tool for SCRUM
pros: The ease of use (for administrators and users). The Agile board provides a much-needed dashboard to track the progress.
cons: Reporting is limited and can be spruced up. Export of issues out of JIRA is not always easy, if not configured correctly.
author: Amit

review_detail:
title: One of the best Document MGMT tools in the market.
pros: A robust and constantly-evolving application with lots of side features and integration options.
cons: The configuration can be confusing sometimes.
author: ihsan

review_detail:
title: Using JIRA to manage software development
pros: I like the ability to select a template to create my JIRA workflow. I use the Sprint template which I then tie to my releases. I find the release reports helpful so that I can track what went into each release. I also like the timeline function. It shows my major features we are working on, what issues are in each feature and the status of each issue within the feature. I also like seeing the releases across the top of the page.
cons: I do find the forms and form configuration confusing at times. I am not a software developer and it doesn't seem to be strait forward.
author: TERESA

review_detail:
title: A seasoned project mangement software
pros: Ability to collaborate with others and GIT Integration
cons: At first for an inexperienced person, it could be overwhelming but it makes life much better once it's all setup and a workflow is established.
author: Vikas

review_detail:
title: One stop solution for Test Management and Project Management
pros: 1. Easy to use 2. User friendly Dashboard 3. Easy to Integrate with 3rd party apps 4. Easy to track RTM.
cons: couldn't find any cons as i have been using it for almost more than 3 years n it has helped us in easy sprint planning and project management
author: Smita

review_detail:
title: Review of Jira from a team members point of view using it everyday
pros: Jira helps in management tracking assigning and identifying roadblocks in a Sprint which is ultimately helpful to track the progress and cast the team's productivity over the course of the project. It also helps in integrating different applications for example bitbucket and active rail user.
cons: There is initial learning curve which can throw off non-technical users.
author: Rajiv

review_detail:
title: Reliable work horse
pros: We can use it for multiple things in our business
cons: Sometimes you need to dig really deep in the user forums to find a solution
author: Mark

review_detail:
title: Jira - Best for complex product development
pros: JIRA is fantastic to use. The task management and Kanban board are easy to understand. Superb for handling complex software developments/Projects
cons: On JIRA, I am not able to create multiple child tasks to get a better view holistically, so that I can have a branch mechanism for individual departments

review_detail:
title: Works well with other apps
pros: Integration with Other Tools – Seamlessly integrates with tools like Confluence, Bitbucket, GitHub, Slack, and more.

review_detail:
title: Getting Things Done with Jira
pros: There are many views available, ranging from the Kanban board, to the list view of all issues. This enables one to easily slice and dice issues any way one prefers. Also, the email alerts let you know when colleagues and partners, both internal and external make updates to the issues we are working together on.
cons: There is not much to dislike at all. We are able to make good use of the tool.

review_detail:
title: De facto standard of Issue management hosted on Cloud.

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

review_detail:

Its also easy for me to market our various projects which has helped to let people know about our services we render. I also like its notification feature as it keeps me on track on any development on managing my projects and tasks.

review_detail:
title: Evaluation_Jira
pros: Prise en charge des méthodologies agiles Intégration transparente d'un large éventail d'outils et d'applications tiers

author: Mamadou Lamine

review_detail:
title: My Opinion on Jira as a Project Management Tool
pros: As a person who is trying to grow in the tech world and in the niche of Project management, I like jira because it helps up my game in this niche. I am so excited to up my skill using this tool.
cons: I don't like the name. It sounds like an app for game or fun.
author: Damilola

review_detail:
title: It is very good for tasks accountability
pros: With Jira, our team has been able to enhance handling with the sprint tracking and issue escalation. I have a good sense of progress from the reporting tools and the ticket dependencies prevent miscommunication.
cons: Sometimes moving or updating multiple tickets takes longer than you would expect it to take and sometimes there are some delays when applying filters.
author: Abdelfattah

review_detail:
title: Best ticketing product
pros: Its really nice and intuitive interface. All the configurations and workflow settings are really good also.
cons: Sometimes the bulk mode editting issues works slowly.
author: Ian

review_detail:
title: Excellent tool for tasks management
pros: The best thing that I like about Jira is that it is very easy to integrate with other powerful tools. You can also automate repetitive tasks.
cons: Jira has been working well. However, the systems sometimes becomes a bit slow when handling complex projects.
author: Bob

review_detail:
title: Sans Jira, je serais perdue
pros: JIra est un outil indispensable dans mon quotidien, il me permet d'échanger avec mes collègues sur l'avancement de mes demandes et d'avoir un tableau de bord fiable.
cons: parfois pour faire les requêtes, il faut avoir une bonne maitrise de la donnée
author: Céline

review_detail:
title: very comfortable for tickets
pros: its really It's really comfortable to manage the projects we have and the tickets
cons: during my work experience I have always used jira for my work but I have not found any negative side
author: Nancy

review_detail:
title: Ticketing tool for better productivity and resolution
pros: Wet can deploy in the cloud easily and all ll it is easy to use
cons: The ticketing process time needs to be optimised
author: Devaraj

review_detail:
title: Jira is neat, and helps all teams stay organized!
pros: Jira really helps my team communicate and manage multiple projects across many external teams. It is organized, and easy to use.
cons: From an aesthetic perspective, Jira does seem a little outdated. They might benefit from cleaning up the visuals!
author: Lyna

review_detail:
title: The perfect project management tool
pros: Extremely systematic to track the milestones for a project using the inbuilt tools like Kanban board. Bug tracking is easy where every state of the bug can be tracked from the backlog state tot done state
cons: Only that jira sometimes is not responsive if multiple users are working on the same board
author: Sneha

review_detail:
title: Jira is a very versatile tool that allows you to create custom workflows for any team.
pros: Jira has adaptability to a wide range of project management needs, a broad integration ecosystem, strong agile support, powerful visualization tools, real-time workflows, scalability, and comprehensive reporting. These capabilities make Jira a versatile and essential tool for effectively managing projects in a variety of industries and environments.
cons: Complexity, learning curve, potential for high customization, cost, and spatial performance issues must be considered when evaluating the right fit for a team or organization.
author: Dhiraj

review_detail:
title: Easy project management for everyday use!
pros: Jira is a great tool. I use it every day as a part of a support project. I use it to keep track of my tickets like incidents, alerts, and service requests. The tool is super easy to use and one can learn it easily. The ticket management is absolutely great. Jira allows the user to create various filters and dashboards to keep a track of his/her various tickets, tasks, and requests. Multiple dashboards can be created as per project needs and can be shared easily with the team members to improve collaboration and communication within the team. Jira allows has tools to create data analytics which can help the user understand the day-to-day work in depth easily. One does not have to manually work on the data, and can simply use the analysis tools provided by Jira. Keeping a track of others' tickets is also very simple, and all one needs to do is add oneself as a watcher in whichever he/she wishes to. Another great feature of this software is closing multiple incidents/alerts/tickets in bulk. Having used this functionality on a daily basis, I know how much time and energy is saved which can be better utilized. There is also a mobile application available which can be used when a laptop/desktop is not available to the user.
cons: The only drawback I have experienced while using Jira is that it does not provide an option to have sound notifications. For example, while working with tickets, Jira does not notify the user of a new ticket with a sound. So when away from the device, the user might miss out on an important ticket unless it has collaborated with another tool like pagerduty. Even the mobile application does not have the option to enable sound notifications, and each time the user needs to open the application to see if any new tickets have been added to the queue.
author: Aarti

review_detail:
title: Jira Product Discovery Beta is a game changer
pros: Jira Product Discovery Beta includes the flexibility that was lacking in Jira Software to track ideas, link them to goals and collate supporting insights for context and prioritisation.
cons: Granted, the product is still in beta, but it would be useful to be able to add custom issue types, or to be able to add "Milestones" in addition to "ideas" for better differentiation. The sharing and export options for a roadmap aren't really marketing friendly, so often content needs to be double handled from Jira into other tools.
author: Ryan

review_detail:
title: Best Productivity tool
pros: I like all of the features of Jira, but most I like is JQL(Jira Query Language) , the data fetching technique is well and good. fully customizable ,robust, and fast. you can integrate many services with it and easily mange all your projects, and Kanban boards is the another feature that i like the most you can track your teams planning , and all work . You can integrate it with the CRM and mange easily all your customers data. Opsgenie is the another application that seamlessly integrate with the Jira
cons: I have seen most of the application are giving the dark option but Jira dosent comes out of the box with this feature, Jira can make the User interface more user friendly. Sometime its gives the bug intermittently.
author: Shahwar

review_detail:
title: Jira - The Godzilla of Project and Task Management
pros: Setting up complex projects and simple projects alike is so easy through the structure that has been tried and proven so many times - and if that doesn't work for you, you can bend the system to your will (to some degree, mind you). But as someone who worked with different software solutions before, Jira took the least amount of time to bring in our old projects and set up new ones.
cons: At times, having so many options can become a disadvantage - you may get lost while trying to create a PERFECT setup, perfect privileges, perfect roles, perfect workflows. My advice - ditch some of the possibilities at first, go simple and build on from there. Unfortunately, JIRA doesn't tell you that itself. Also, Confluence, which feels like a must-have due to how interconnected it is with JIRA, can be a bit pricey for a bigger number of users.
author: Djordje

review_detail:
title: Bram's Jira review
pros: The ease of use is such a timesaver. Also the many integrations with other attlassian products is great, it really saves a lot of time and it's a great as documentation. Jira is the reference for software development team, and with good reason1
cons: It can be costly and there are nasty sides on the licensing. For example, you can't use plugins for a limited number of users, and only pay for that the number of users. Although in some cases I can understand, in some other cases it makes no sense and it's really a barrier. An other nasty side we experienced is the lost of investment when upgrading during a license term. We bought a license for 2 years, without any discount wrt the 1 year license deal. Within the year, we already needed to extend the number of licensed users so we had to upgrade the license. We then had no way to recover a part of the investment of the remaining time of the initial license ... never buy more than 1 year! One last BIG negative is the recent forced move to cloud. We have always ran Jira and Atlassian products on prem. A recent decision by Atlassian is forcing the user away from the current on prem solution. This is simply not what we want or can. I'm sure this will be an issues with several European organizations where the move to cloud wrt GDRP is not that easy or not a company priority.
author: Bram

review_detail:
title: Happy with the new Jira features
pros: I love the roadmap feature since it can breakdown all the progress of our work from daily to monthly, Backlog, Issues since it's very easy to maintain and create a new issue with different categories can be a bug a feature or a story making it very for the next person to understand as well as the report part for presentation purposes
cons: Its too big and probably needs one to always learn more about other features so for people who are less technical like business people it can be a challenge for them to understand how to navigate their way around
author: Kagisho

review_detail:
title: Industry standard for Software Development teams
pros: The software is made around the idea of AGILE collaboration on projects for the entire team. It brings transparency to the processes and is a great information radiator for the entire team. It facilitates commonly used methodologies such as SCRUM and KANBAN and makes project management significantly easier. It is also very versatile and adaptable to particular needs. Although the standard fields are great, you can also create your own to fine tune your processes. Workflows are also highly customizable, giving the user-base great flexibility on how work is set up. Based on this, teams which work in areas not related to software development can also reap the benefits. I've seen implementations in recruitment, data analysis and more. Another great feature is its integration compatibility with other ecosystems such as Microsoft's which makes it easy to pick up. In terms of services, Atlassian offers multiple ways teams can use Jira: Cloud or Self-managed (Server or Data Center) making it an adaptable offering that can withstand the highest level of corporate security scrutiny. Another great feature is the marketplace which contains a great number of apps that provide added capabilities to the app. Last but not least, Atlassian has developed an entire ecosystem geared towards solving projects (especially software ones)like: Confluence (Info silo), Bitbucket (code management), Service Desk and more.
cons: The plethora of fields and customizations available can make a new user feel a bit overwhelmed. In this regard, it takes a bit to get used to it. The interface could use a revamp to make things cleaner, clearer and more crisp for the more casual user at least. (ex: easier to find timekeeping, task transitions, new task coloring schemes and more) The workflow engine can also be upgraded to be more user friendly and provide more administrative options (create, apply, delete, manage versions) The security administration section also needs a revamp in terms of adding or removing users, groups, roles into or from project (ex: if you create a new group, you can't bulk add it to all existing projects without some scripting in the CLI)
author: Vlad

review_detail:
title: Jira the review
pros: The advantages of this program is that it is easy to use and also provides many services such as project management and task management
cons: The disadvantages of this program is that it sometimes makes mistakes in managing the project, and we hope that you will develop from that
author: Yousef

review_detail:
title: Project Manager User in Jira
pros: In the agile sense, this product is so easy to use and understand. Makes it easy to ramp up a new employee because the product is pretty intuitive. I also love that you can change anything for your team as you see fit, for example, tailoring the sprint board for the needs of the team.
cons: Adding in capacity planning isn't easy as you ahve to add a plugin for it. Also creating your own filters on your boards or team isn't so easy/ intuitive.
author: Cayla

review_detail:
title: Jira as Project management tool in building softwares
pros: The feature that Jira is good at is mainly in task management. I personally use Jira when tracking my personal software development projects. I found it useful and very simple to use. It also offers a good integration with their another product for documentation which is Confluence.
cons: Jira offers a lot of features out of the box for a first time user. Those features might not be even known to current users using the software. What we usually work on is the stuff that we can currently or easily navigate on the application
author: Ryan Christian

review_detail:
title: The software an engineering department can not live without
pros: First of all I want to say Jira is DOMINATING the market. There is little that Jira cannot do which makes it a no brainer of everything most startups and companies will use. I love that Jira for the most part is a one-stop-shop for Engineering teams, IT teams, Knowledgebase, ticketing systems. You don't really see issues with using Jira until you get bigger. The fact that I can link Jira tickets to my Git commits and add confluence documents to my tickets and google drive files ALL IN ONE is ourtagious and its something my company loves inside and out.
cons: Just like every software out there you cannot be perfect in all ways. Because Jira is a one-stop-shop the biggest issues we have is customization of Jira. Not because Jira cant be customized, but only because it can be customized so much that we need set Jira admins whos sole job it is to manage Jira for the entire company because of the huge learning curve because it takes so much time how to figure out even the littest changes to make our lives easier. On top of that, a big issues I see if that as you grow in Jira it is a money pit at times to have it scale with the company. At this point, we are so vested in Jira we cannot get off of it. Adding SSO, and Confluence, and CI DI, and all the features that they promote arent dominating their fields, but its like "Well.... We are on Jira and they don't integrate well with other software so if we want the best features I guess we will have to use all their software
author: Randy

review_detail:
title: Best and most true to tradition agile project/product management tool around
pros: Jira is an immensely powerful issue management tool. It's JQL language provides ultimate flexibility to satisfy the needs of all roles on a product/project team. It's easy to use (if agile concepts are familiar to you and semi-intuitive if they're not), easy to deploy (especially if you're using Jira Cloud) and easy to integrate with.
cons: The pricing model for add-ons. You could have a 100 users registered to your Jira instance, have an add-on that is used by a small handful of power users, and still be paying a license fee for all 100 users. Very annoying!
author: Luke

review_detail:
title: Most used project tracking software - Jira
pros: Most useful feature of JIRA is it's sprint or Agile features, access control features etc. It's very easier to integrate with Git and Deployment pipelines. One of the best Team collaboration software.
cons: It's pretty easier to use and free of any major bugs. There's nothing much to dislike except the UI of Jira is same since many years and can be improved.
author: Salil

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: Highly regard Jira Software for its task management, status tracking, progress tracking, and project planning capabilities.
cons: It has some limitations in areas like calendar management and task scheduling.
author: James

review_detail:
title: Easy to use and all-in-one Agile Project Management Solution
pros: The agile project management features like sprint creation and automatic sprint track were a super advantage that I could not find in any top-tier Project Management tools in the market. The backlog management made super easy because of this solution and feature.
cons: The inability to have more than one organization was a huge draw in the Free version. However, this can also be resolved with several simple workarounds.
author: Dilanka

review_detail:
title: Project Management is no more a Rocket Science !
pros: Apart from Project Management - JIRA helped in collaboration between various teams and helped us accomplishing the Project Goals 100%
cons: Nothing specific to mention about JIRA or Atlassian company as such
author: Ravi

review_detail:
title: The best Agile and work organizer all at one place
pros: Jira has made it a part of the daily work, mainly for the IT department. Used it to list down project ideas, some discussions on the production stage gathering. Raise tickets and assign it to the specific team/ indivisual which promotes further help in keeping track of them with the progress being made. Even the labeling of those tickets, prioritizing bugs, metrics being agile in nature, improves the department and indivisual effort to get things together, making it so easy for all of us.
cons: Has a lot of features and functionalities to use where we might not use them all as it can take a steep learning curve with a lot of time gaining experience which makes it not so ideal for people who are not from the tech background. More integration options could come up with the latest external applications for product development and engineering.
author: Suru

review_detail:
title: Multiple Tool
pros: Once configured, it is a multifunctional tool for a robust IT team, which allows you to manage help desk, projects, tickets; each independently.
cons: I think it's a great tool, the only bad thing is the cost per user, at the beginning it seems cheap; but with growth the cost benefit is lost and one ends up losing robustness.
author: Erika Jeannethe

review_detail:
title: Jira, Streamlining Team Collaboration
pros: - Task management: Jira offers a comprehensive system to create, assign, and track tasks, with built-in templates to simplify the process.- Workflow Configuration: Jira allows teams to customize their workflows to match their specific processes and requirements, with built-in templates to aid in setup.- Collaboration: Jira provides a range of commenting and notes features to enable easy communication and collaboration among team members.- Reporting and Project Tracking: Jira offers a variety of reporting and project tracking features, including real-time data, visualization options, and built-in reports to help teams track progress, identify trends and measure performance.- Alerts and Notifications: Jira provides real-time alerts and notifications to keep teams informed of important changes and updates to tasks and issues.- Access controls and Permissions: Jira offers role-based access controls to manage access and permissions for different users and groups.- Calendar Management: Jira has a calendar feature that enables teams to schedule and manage their tasks and projects.- Document Management: Jira provides a central location to store and manage documents, such as files and images.- Integration: Jira can be integrated with a wide range of tools and applications, Like Slack, Google Calendar, Google Drive, Trello, GitHub, Bitbucket, Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook & Zendesk.
cons: Jira is a powerful tool that provides a wide range of features to help teams collaborate and manage their tasks, issues, and projects effectively, but as it is a complex tool, it may require some time to set up and use. Also, the UI can be cluttered and confusing for some users, and the performance may be slow when working with large projects or many users. The mobile app may lack some features compared to the web version, and the reporting and analytics features can be limited. However, Jira offers many integrations, which can help teams to work more efficiently and effectively.
author: Ahmed

review_detail:
title: One stop solution for Agile project management
pros: My favourite thing about JIRA is its ease of use. It is very straightforward. From creating dashboards to managing tasks everything is seamless. You can use the drag and drop feature to push your tasks from one status to another, you can easily create and track bugs and tasks and link your bugs to particular tasks. JIRA provides you with a lot of freedom to work with, it is very easy to manage sprints in JIRA as well.
cons: It sometimes feels like JIRA has way too many features, though it is a project management tool, you will mostly be using a particular set of features in your everyday work, while the tool itself can do a lot more and this will take a long time to learn
author: Moseen

review_detail:
title: A Great Project Management Tools For Business As Well As Employees
pros: Zira is a pretty impressive tool in terms of Project Management, Task Scheduling and Task Management. I have been using Zira since 2018 and never got disappointed. So, for me, I think this is the best tool for managing a Project.
cons: Nothing to dislike here. It works well in all aspects.
author: Parwinder

review_detail:
title: My Favourite agile product management tool. You need to try this for sure!
pros: I started using Jira a few months ago and these are some of the pros that I have experienced: 1) There are more than 1000+ apps and integrations of Jira which has made it easy for the admin to choose scalably and stay on track. 2) The tutorials on the right side column made the users easier to understand the workflow-related process. 3) The main page view which contains the summary of the projects that the team has worked on, viewed, assigned to, and starred made my day start easier. 4) Creation of sprint, epic, sub-tasks, and child issues really help my team to understand the work better. 5) The insights part of the project made it easier to understand the sprint breakdown, epic progress, and sprint process. Overall, it is a good tool for product/project management.
cons: As I see a lot of tools daily, I see a bit of ease of use that can make Jira a great product. I hope the developers and product managers of Jira are trying to get that soon.
author: Srinivasa Ashok

review_detail:
title: ML Engineers Jira review
pros: Workflow customisation is by far the best of any software that i used. Also connecting confluence pages with jira tickets helps a lot for better documentation.
cons: Sometimes it is slow or wont load. Also i have a felling that the state of a ticket changes on its own, but not always.
author: Nemanja

review_detail:
title: All in one
pros: If you are looking for a management system that is good enough to cover all your needs then Jira and the Atlassian portfolio is exactly what you are looking for. Every aspect of your workflow is infinitely customizable and perfectly integrated with their entire suite of software development tools. Once your setup is complete everything is easy and automatic for your team. The potential for boosted productivity is huge.
cons: All the updates can be overwhelming. Great updates can provide users with additional features without affecting present ones but some updates are breaking and requiring you to find the relocated setting in order to configure what you want. That is adding to the already high cost of setting up a new project. If you have someone dedicated to administration then the rest of the team will have a great experience. This is a very powerful tool and that means it will take time to learn and properly manage it.
author: Victor

review_detail:
title: A software that's topnotch for team productivity
pros: My most favourable features onJira is the ability to perform repetitive tasks automatically while working collaboratively on projects with the team, track issues, track team progress, perform complex searches and synchronize data without hassles.
cons: The Jira software is mainly built for engineering and software development teams might be a little challenging to set up by non technical teams. Also there is no idea management features to keep track of my ideas and plans but I believe this will be a great feature if implemented.
author: ThankGod

review_detail:
title: Jira An Astonishing Software For Monitoring Progress
pros: Jira's capability to manage complex projects, customize workflows and tracking progress is really astonishing. Jira is easy to use and it saves time through team collaborations on certain projects.
cons: Jira is really good and so far i haven't had anything that has made me to be furious with this platform.
author: Karanja

review_detail:
title: The Most Robust Project Portfolio Management that Ever Existed
pros: Jira is highly customizable which makes it easy to tailor to our project and task management needs. It has a mobile application for iOS system that has a clean UI and UX than any other tool that I use for PPM.
cons: I am able to acquire team and project management needs without facing issues when using Jira in the healthcare industry.
author: Amber

review_detail:
title: Gets the Job Done
pros: Jira is great for keeping projects organised and transparent. The boards, task tracking, and reporting features make it much easier to manage deadlines and collaborate with the team. It definitely adds value by saving time and reducing confusion in projects.
cons: The interface can be somewhat complex for new users, and it takes some time to become familiar with all its features. Customisation is powerful but sometimes requires more technical know-how than expected.
author: Sreevalli

review_detail:
title: Why I Considered To Work With Jira?
pros: Jira has improved features and they have a very vibrant customer support. I like the way it is easy for me to collaborate projects with teams and get them done fast and in a beautiful manner. I am able to manage tasks in an easy without having to struggle much.
cons: I have been amazed with this platform and it's capabilities are also marvellous. I haven't had it ruff with Jira.
author: Fujimory

review_detail:
title: Jira for a disorganised Software Developer
pros: I love how Jira helps me stay organised with the tasks I need to do. With Jira Automation and GitHub, I don't have to keep updating my card's status. If new features are added and I take some time from work, it's easy to re-update myself on the current status of the projects.
cons: It took me awhile to get used to jira. There are so many moving pieces that sometimes it's hard to get to where you are. Still can't find where to view cards that are done and didn't have an Epic.
author: Lwando

review_detail:
title: Fantabulous PPM of 2025 that I Highly Trust
pros: There are tons of PPM tools in the market, but Jira is my favorite. I like that it allocate robust team collaboration, project coordination and task management tools unlike any other alternative that I am currently using.
cons: Jira for over six years had been my go-to project portfolio management program - the new features that are in the new version 237 are not complicated to customize since the vendor offered free e-books and tutorials.
author: Darien

review_detail:
title: My Views on Jira Usage
pros: Jira is the most iconic tool that every business needs in order to thrive in today’s competitive digital era. I like how Jira saves time by automating complex repetitive processes such as project and task management.
cons: I use Jira regularly and I rarely come across aspects that rarely align with my desires when planning, tracking and managing projects.
author: Michele

review_detail:
title: Maybe too flexible
pros: I like how flexible it can be but that is almost a double edged sword. I like the way you can get different views of the same thing, timeline, kanban, item lists, queries etc.
cons: They used to be more opinionated about ways of working but now every Jira set up I see is so wildly different there doesn't seem to be a way of working any more. You used to rely on moving between companies and being able to pick it up easily but no more.
author: Stuart

review_detail:
title: Jira a True service management tool
pros: An ITIL-compliant tool, full-service end-to-end management. Reporting, dashboards, and a lot more for the MIS/Reporting and following KPI'S for teams.
cons: Somewhat convoluted setup process, but it was the nature of the product that it had different aspects/modules for different levels /types of team working.
author: Richard

review_detail:
title: Eficiencia en grupos de trabajo
pros: flexibilidad para adaptarse a distintos tipos de equipos y flujos de trabajo. En mi caso, lo usamos principalmente para desarrollo de software, y la capacidad de personalizar tableros Kanban, workflows, permisos y automatizaciones hace una gran diferencia.
cons: puede resultar abrumador al principio, especialmente si no tenés experiencia previa con herramientas de gestión de proyectos.
author: Valentino

review_detail:
title: Jira Transformed Our Workflow: Centralized, Efficient & Game-Changing
pros: Jira provides an exceptional platform for managing tasks across multiple projects in a centralized workspace. We can easily create tasks, assign them to teammates, and track progress without losing track of anything. The real-time updates are a lifesaver - I always know exactly where things stand without having to chase people for status updates. What I appreciate most is how flexible it is - whether I'm working on a simple project or a complex project with multiple steps, Jira adapts to my needs. The visual dashboards make it super easy to see what's done, what's in progress, and what needs attention.
cons: It's not the easiest tool to learn at first - new users often feel overwhelmed by all the options. But it's very useful for tech teams when you have learned how to use it.
author: Navneet

review_detail:
title: Effective Project Management System for the organized team.
pros: My favorite thing in Jira is how good this tool is at supporting structured team-oriented project management – particularly in Agile environments. The platform provides a level of flexibility that allows you to build workflows, task types, and dashboards that suit perfectly the needs of your team. Whether you're managing a simple class project or a multi-layered software rollout, Jira can be adjusted to suit both small and large-scale efforts. Its visual task boards -Kanban and Scrum- make it easy to manage whom is doing what and where each task is at. This not only makes teams organized but it also prevents communication gaps. One of the things that I found really useful is the real-time transparency that it provides. you can instantly see progress updates, bottlenecks, and what's coming next. Jira also has very detailed reporting tools that allow the teams to reflect on how they performed at one point in time. Charts and analytics such as burndown graphs or sprint reports provide clean information as to how works are moving. These features are very convenient for planning further tasks or detecting the places where one can improve. Other strengths include Jira’s ease of interfacing with Confluence, GitHub, Google Workspace among the rest. This helps keep all – documents, code, communication – together in the same ecosystem, which is good for concentrating and being productive.
cons: And what I did not like most about Jira was the spiked learning curve, especially for new users and the non technical team members. Despite the fact that Jira is an astoundingly powerful and feature-rich tool, the very complexity can make the initial onboarding a little bit confusing. It takes time to know how to switch from one project to another, configure the boards, and use all its tools at maximum potential and occasionally people may require external help or training. The user interface is another aspect that could be enhanced, even though it is operational, it may seem chaotic and non-user-friendly in some areas, especially, when one is trying to switch between varied perspectives or work with personally created workflows. Without forgetting Jira’s many integrations with other third party applications (e.g., GitHub)- their configurations at times can be quite technical and not really a walk in the park for an average joe that had not previously dabbled in such. File management is another little problem – adding, storing shared documents in issues can be not as fluid and accessible as it should be, and especially in comparison to more communication-based platforms. However, the major part of these barriers is bound to fade away with time, as one carries on using them. After becoming accustomed to the platform, it becomes a lot easier to use all the opportunities provided by Jira.
author: Yigit

review_detail:
title: Jira: The PPM GOAT that I Know
pros: I started using Jira in my previous organization as Literacy Specialist. Ever since, it has been a reliable tool for project management, collaboration and workflow automation.
cons: I can’t outline any definite flaw that I have experienced since our in-house support in collaboration with vendor tech team have eradicated all.
author: Rose

review_detail:
title: It helps us deliver high-quality projects without anyone getting lost in the Excel loop.
pros: A user interface that inspires rather than annoys; the design is clear, friendly, almost playful. Even new trainees can quickly find their way around. It's very clear despite the large number of projects; we sometimes have over 20 parallel active projects but we rarely lose track. Regular updates with really helpful new features; you can tell the Jira team is thinking ahead. The integrations with our Google calendar works seamlessly. Once connected, it's never forgotten.
cons: I can't assign subtasks to a member of staff. I also can't assign a color to a user/employee whose projects are the assigned and visible in that color. I hope that will be considered in the next update.
author: Rimantas

review_detail:
title: Collaboration made easy with Jira
pros: I like the fact that it helps my team and I to better manage our projects with customizable workflows that allows us to track progress and collaborate efficiently. also like the fact that it allows us to integrate with other tools to enhance our productivity.
cons: Well, it can be a little bit complex for new users as it requires some sort of learning to get a hang of the software at first. It may also be a little bit pricy for teams who are just starting out hence making it less appealing to those in the that category.
author: Edafe

review_detail:
title: Good issue tracking software, good integration support, admin editing is a pain
pros: We use Jira to help manage our projects and resolve any software bugs in our frontend/backend/mobile apps. Creating a project is pretty straight forward. I like that Jira supports many integrations and 3rd party apps. For example, our vulnerability alerts go to Jira. I like the backlog view and the kanban board view. The reports have gotten better over the years.
cons: Finding things is a pain. For example, finding how to add another value to a custom's field drop-down takes way longer than it should. Dashboards take forever to make. I wish there were pre-built dashboards. Automation rules are tricky to setup, and tricky to troubleshoot if the rule fails.
author: ☁️ 👩‍💻 M

review_detail:
title: A great tool for agile companies
pros: Highly customizable and easy to use for new users and administrators
cons: It is a tool tailored for an agile driven company, therefore i won't suggest it to companies focused on waterfall methodology
author: Daniele

review_detail:
title: Best-in-class and reliable project management and workflow automation tool.
pros: The best part about Jira in our company is we are able to create ,assign and monitor issue through customizable workflows.Tracking legal cases ,client matters and court deadlines is fast and easy.Generate reports for client billing and cost management. The great dashboard helps us to visualise legal risks and pending compliance actions.It automates workflow processes make them more manageable for us and reduces a huge amount of manual work.
cons: I find it having a big learning curve for a new user since it require a lot of learning to be able to use most of its features effectively.
author: Simon

review_detail:
title: Jira - a great tool for Tech/DevOps/Product Teams
pros: Scalability and the abundance of tools they offer to resolve many pressing use cases.
cons: The reporting is limited to 365 days past the current date. This limitation is very frustrating and restrictive at times.
author: Posh

review_detail:
title: Build your dream team with Jira. A groundbreaking tool for project collaboration.
pros: Jira offers incredible task planning functions which help us to organize and streamline our projects work. It also has very powerful data safety and protection features which ensure complete safety and privacy of our projects information and details. Jira provide us with excellent team communication and collaboration tools that help us work conveniently together on our projects. The task tracking tools makes it easy to monitor the progress of our projects and identity any areas that are lagging behind.
cons: We have not seen any problems with Jira yet. It has very impactful features that has not given any troubles.
author: Adelia D

review_detail:
title: Overall it's a good tool
pros: I manage multiple projects, and all templates are not suitable for all projects. I really like the ability to choose from multiple project templates (Sprint, Kanban etc.) available, that help me manage different types of projects with the same tool.
cons: There's no inbuilt time tracking mechanism. It can be integrated with other third party time tracking tools like Clockify etc. using plugins, but an inbuilt time tracking mechanism will be more helpful.
author: Swagata

review_detail:
title: Most Optimal PPM Program of All Times
pros: Jira makes it super easy to plan, track and manage projects and tasks automatically. With Jira, I am able to collaborate on projects with colleagues in one place.
cons: I slightly dislike that Jira offers only 7 days free trial - but this is not a big deal since I upgraded to premium.
author: Joy

review_detail:
title: Planning and tracking projects with Jira, the best of the best.
pros: Jira task management functions allow us to easily organize and plan for our projects making it possible to meet their deadlines. It has very advanced project reporting features that allow us to easily keep up with the progress of our projects. Jira also has amazing tracking functions that makes it easy to identify any issues in our projects and their root causes.
cons: We have seen nothing wrong with Jira so far. It is performing its functions diligently for us leaving us with nothing to complain about.
author: Joe

review_detail:
title: Tailored for greatness, Jira is a phenomenal tool for managing project tasks.
pros: Jira provide our team with the most efficient task planning tools that help us to organize our projects and align our work with our objectives. It has amazing dashboards that provide us with a real time view of the status of tasks making it easy to track our projects progress. Jira reporting tools help us generate detailed insights that assist us to evaluate the performance of our projects. It also has task tracking functions that allows us to keep up with our work progress. Jira has collaboration tools which allow us to connect easily and work together on our projects.
cons: Jira has been incredible to us and it has nothing that does not fit our needs. We have not experienced any challenges using it.
author: Zack

review_detail:
title: Jira, the best way to keep track of your work.
pros: Jira is an excellent program for keeping up with all aspects of different jobs.
cons: The complexity of it and how many different components there are to it. It's likely that people who use it more and are more comfortable with you appreciate this aspect of Jira.
author: Mitchell

review_detail:
title: Great companion for managing work
pros: Easy to create and manage work streams, stories, plan out sprints and allocate and track work through it.
cons: Can be difficult to find all the different options available on the UI and can start feeling a bit clunky
author: Shreyash

review_detail:
title: Startup uses Jira to ship fast
pros: First, it was easy to get started with common guiderails. There was a deep feature set that figured out, made Jira flexible for use cases. The integrations with CI/CD & customer success tools were very helpful for keeping the data in Jira up to date.
cons: The depth of the product made it hard to configure when experimenting with changes to our workflow.
author: Zach

review_detail:
title: Jira simplifies project management for teams.
pros: Jira stands out because it can be customized to almost any project management methodology. This has greatly helped my team's particular process needs. These are better than most reporting solutions I've used. I schedule sprints using their more detailed project statuses, velocity charts, and burn down metrics.
cons: Though improved, the user experience still feels strange and slow, which bothers me when working.
author: Kishan

review_detail:
title: Great for managing team projects
pros: Jira is great for team project management and keeping everyone on track to complete "sprints
cons: Sometimes I can't find the task I need to check. Uploading images for reference gets a little buggy too.
author: Cyrus

review_detail:
title: Project Management Tool
pros: 1. One of the best platforms to manage requests and provide updates to the team for ongoing and upcoming changes, projects, bugs, or any other raised matters. 2. Very customized dashboard and intuitive platform to use and manage. 3. Reliable and secure to the environment as well.
cons: 1. The learning curve is extremely vase, I took around 7 months for me to know this platform completely. 2. It is quite expensive as well.
author: Abhishek

review_detail:
title: Good shedule work item management with some improvement desired
pros: It is pretty easy to schedule work in Jira which provides a graphical board for visual presentations.
cons: Sometimes, it is kind of difficult to find work items in the graphical board. It should be easier for users to find their items.
author: Xiaoyu

review_detail:
title: Jira FTW!!
pros: Jira is user-friendly and also it can be as deep and customizable as need be. It is the backbone of my business for ticketing, collaborating and troubleshooting across all environments.
cons: If I really have to mention cons, I would say more customizable themes. Other than that, it does the job.
author: Alan

review_detail:
title: Abysmal quality for sky high price
pros: It supports two-factor authentication now.
cons: This company ignores every software development best practice. Unresolved bug and feature requests on their support site are often more than a decade old. They rely on plug-in developers to make broken things work, and the plug-ins generally come with a ridiculously high price tag. No admin tasks, from the simplest data validation to proper relationships between Assets objects, can be accomplished without work-arounds. And the workarounds generally break other things. Data integrity is a joke in Jira and JSM, especially in Assets. If you want your data to be clean and accurate, be prepared to learn a lot of code.
author: Kimberly

review_detail:
title: Excellent Tool
pros: It's Easy to use, the user interface is quite user friendly. Almost everything self explanatory, from raising a bug to closing it, resolving it. If any new person who has never used JIRA, starts using it, it wouldn't take more than 1-2 days for him/her to fully understand it. Additionally it provides you an option of extracting reports where you can view/track your/your team's performance, the work load and many more things which would help you take decisions. I also like the feature of creating dashboards in JIRA, it gives a rich and professional look to your work, which you can showcase to your team, management and other stakeholders.
cons: There's not much but the scope of reports and dashboard is sometimes limited like I wish to include more options/filters but I couldn't.
author: SHUBHAM

review_detail:
title: Jira review for our company at Vanco media
pros: How efficient and how its so easy to use for our employees. And also the fact that it streamlines most of our difficult tasks that would usually take hours to do if we did not have Jira
cons: There was not many cons than pros to be honest, infact there wasn't any cons at all! Everything was at the best quality
author: Luke

review_detail:
title: A necessity that provides what needs to be provided
pros: Every person's contribution is clearly visible as their own. Timestamps are also helpful. Cataloguing and structuring is also good. Good integrations with external applications. I also really like the preview of task links in Atlassian applications.
cons: Somewhat of an outdated look and feel, however the cloud version is considerably more modern than the old one for sure.
author: Eva

review_detail:
title: Monitoring Progress With Jira's Incredible Tracking Features
pros: Jira is a wonderful software for monitoring progress of my projects. It is easy to use Jira because it has a user-friendly interface. Jira has everything I need in one place. It makes things easy for me.
cons: I haven't found issues with Jira and am glad for that.
author: Francis

review_detail:
title: Jira is a Lifesaver
pros: Jira has allowed multiple tickets regarding incident reports, technical support claims, and human resource matters all to be effectively managed and responded to, as well as prioritized in real time.
cons: I have not had any bad experiences to date
author: Jacquelyn

review_detail:
title: Top collaboration tool
pros: Easy task management and visual process flow. Continuous improvements and several addons to choose from.
cons: Not all add ons work in same standard as Jira.
author: Rakesh

review_detail:
title: Easy to Use!!
pros: I love building Jira boards out and connecting and integrating all the various programs to it, especially Google Drive!
cons: There’s a lot of options that you can choose from when building and sometimes you can lost in it and it can takes longer to build.
author: Stefanie

review_detail:
title: Jira for Managing many different projects with a team.
pros: Great for managing multiple projects and staying organized. I used this with my team and it was great for keeping up with different people working and updating it consistently.
cons: Can take a little bit to get used to navigating when you first start. There are lots of tools and even though the experience is user friendly, it still takes some getting used to.
author: Raya

review_detail:
title: Comprehensive Project Management and Agile Tool Jira is a powerful project management tool known for its extensive customization capabilities .
pros: Customization,Agile Support,Integration,Reporting and Analytics.
cons: I see that the least about jira in :Complexity, performance and high cost
author: Reham

review_detail:
title: Herramienta Versatil, Escalable, Robusta y Segura
pros: Es una herramienta versatil, escalable, robusta, segura.
cons: Quizá podria mejorar la interfaz, un poco mas actual.
author: Ivan

review_detail:
title: I love Jira
pros: I love how I can build out automations and interact with different teams to captures any forms or data
cons: Sometimes the errors I get or can be very glitchy causing me to have to refresh or that when I building out an automation, it's limited on how many rules I can put in one
author: Solounge

review_detail:
title: Jira Review
pros: The updated ticketing GUI is very appealing. Supports different methodologies like Scrum, Kanban, and even hybrid approaches. Handles everything from simple task tracking to complex bug and project management. Backlog management, sprint planning, burndown charts, and velocity tracking are all well integrated. Backlog management, sprint planning, burndown charts, and velocity tracking are all well integrated.
cons: Can be overwhelming for new users due to its complexity and rich features. Large instances with lots of customizations and data can become sluggish over time. Easy to fall into the trap of over-configuring workflows, which can slow down teams.
author: Aaron

review_detail:
title: Jira Comprehensive IT ticket system
pros: Comprehensive options when configuring the help desk for IT including SLAs etc
cons: Linux based on premise boxes are hard to upgrade and configure
author: Peter

review_detail:
title: Excellent all-around project management / work-tracking tool
pros: * Easy to learn and use. * Powerful, flexible, and useful features for managing work and projects. * Has many templates for managing work via Scrum, Kanban, Waterfall, etc. * Timeline, backlog, and board features are super helpful for communication, collaboration, and coordination of work. * Plenty of capabilities for integrations and add-ons for enhanced / additional functionality.
cons: Jira in itself is sufficient for most things and while add-ons could increase features and potentially productivity, they can be expensive depending on the number of users. Capabilities and limitation differences between team-managed and company-managed projects can be confusing. The former is a simplified setup that facilitates system administration by giving teams autonomy, but it can be frustrating to manage and work with its limitations.
author: Hector

review_detail:
title: A Transformative Tool for Agile Project Management
pros: Jira is an exceptional project management tool, offering a wide range of features for seamless task tracking, sprint planning, and collaboration. Its customizable workflows make it easy to tailor Jira to any team’s needs. The intuitive agile boards visually simplify progress tracking, while integrations with Confluence, Github, draw.io, and other tools streamline communication and productivity. Furthermore, real-time reporting and analytics provide powerful insights, helping teams stay aligned and on target.
cons: While Jira offers a wide array of features, new users might find the platform somewhat complex at first. However, this initial learning curve is easily overcome with adequate training and time, and the software becomes much more intuitive. The pricing can concern smaller teams, but the value it adds to project management and workflow efficiency makes it a worthwhile investment.
author: Christopher

review_detail:
title: My Review of Jira
pros: For the past two years, Jira has been the main backbone tool for project and task management in my organization. I like that it has a robust backend integration capability which advance features enrichment.
cons: I do not have any drawback which I face when using Jira.
author: Adeniran

review_detail:
title: Jira: Robust, Iconic & Full-featured PPM
pros: Manual workflow tends to consume a lot of time and is highly expensive to use in business processes. Jira is the main tool which I use to automate workloads such as task and project management.
cons: The errors which I was experiencing last year are no more since the vendor success team eradicated them early this year.
author: Samuel

review_detail:
title: Jira Overview
pros: Jira is pretty straight forward. Once you get used to how to set up a Jira, and subscribe to notifications it works on auto-pilot helps to get track of complex issues, resolution and monitor progress
cons: Once Jira is created it is left out as "Unassigned". I don't like this feature as sometimes time is lost in assigning manual work to find it and decide who to take care of the Jira. It should be a way to automate this process.
author: Stoyan

review_detail:
title: robust task management tool
pros: Jira Software provides a comprehensive set of task management features that help teams to plan, track, and manage their work throughout the development process. Whether working on small or large projects, Jira Software can help teams to collaborate more effectively, improve productivity, and deliver higher-quality software.
cons: real time chat or video conferencingImproving mobile app functionality could help users to work more effectively on the go.
author: Mansi

review_detail:
title: Indispensable within my team , as far as project management is concerned.
pros: I find the drag and drop workflow automation builder on Jira incredibly user-friendly and customizable. By employing the simple "when, if, then" logic, I can easily automate and tailor workflows to meet the specific needs of our team projects. This feature has proven especially useful when setting up customized triggers within Jira for automating particular aspects of our projects.
cons: Jira can be a challenging project management tool for beginners due to its steep learning curve. Without prior experience using Jira, new members to my team have experienced growing pains that lasted several weeks and months.
author: Michael

review_detail:
title: JIRA the ultimate project management tool for SaaS
pros: The Kanban board, export features and workflows are all features which stand out to me from my experience with JIRA.
cons: There can be some confusion on finding settings within the admin section. So a bit of a learning curve to the software in my opinion.
author: Brandon

review_detail:
title: One of the best project management tools!
pros: Sprint tracking features that rolls up to an epic is very useful. Plus all the cool notifications systems to various chats
cons: It is pricey compared to some of the other tools available
author: Anand

review_detail:
title: Good issue tracking platform
pros: Jira is a useful tool and is widely used in many organisations. Some of the benefits that I found useful are listed below: 1.It helps in tracking a number of tasks whether it is a new feature, an issue or bug or anything that requires some kind of tracking. 2. It is highly scalable and provide features to have different kinds of workflows for tracking. 3. It is easy to use and user-friendly and is widely used by business owners and managers to keep track of the project's overall status. 4. It provides time logging as well which is useful to identify the time spent on an issue or user story. 5. It can be integrated with the third-party tools as well and provides a number of add-ons. 6. It helps in speedy delivery of the projects.
cons: I have found that sometimes it is hard to install add-ons or integrate jira with other tools from a developer's perspective. Most of the times administrator privileges are required for such tasks and jira provides no information about the admin to contact. So, such processes are time-consuming. Jira provides an API for issue management, however, the API has limited set of features and has scope for more rich features.
author: Rohit

review_detail:
title: Jira is awesome
pros: I love the way I can manage my project with all my team at one place.
cons: Sometimes I get stucked with broken link and lack of support with 3rd party integration like Offie 365 and all
author: Milan

review_detail:
title: Très bon logiciel
pros: C'est un bon outil de gestion pour les progets qui me permet à utiliser les fonctionnalités dans mon équipe et pour gérer mon travail de quipe de bien fonctionner facilement.
cons: Je n'ai aucun problème avec logiciel Jira parceque c'est facile à mes projets de vite évoluer dans le monde entier je lui donne 5 étoiles
author: Clement

review_detail:
title: Sehr gute Lösung für Projektmanagement und Projektplanung
pros: Die Tools für Zusammenarbeit finde ich top und besonders die Futures haben unsere Team richtig geholfen.
cons: nicht alles übersichtlichm also man benötigt etwa Zeit für die Einarbeitung.
author: Mohammad

review_detail:
title: Organise your work and manage project effectively with Jira!
pros: 1. Kanban Boards: is one of the biggest advantage of Jira. One can easily manage tasks and bucket them in different phases and each item can be assigned an tracked from end to end. The visual representation with Kanban boards make it easy to grasp and also helps immensely during Srcum meetings. 2. Workflow management: One can easily create sub-tasks under parent task and assign to different team members. Tags can be used for segregation and reporting as well. Workflow of any task/ bug/ epic can be managed very well directly from the console.
cons: Learning curve: is quite huge. Jira is a one-man army platform which does not need any other platform. It is capable of doing so many things that the UI at times becomes confusing. Although, Jira has a pretty solid documentation, still experienced users fail to identify the right options the very first time.
author: Kunal

review_detail:
title: Great integrations and project management tool
pros: What I like most about Jira is Its versatility to accommodate various project management methodologies, while its user-friendly interface makes it accessible to everyone in our company. Jira's integrations, and real-time updates, enhance teamwork, and its data-driven reporting empowers informed decision-making.
cons: Jira is a little complex to use since it has way too many features. There's also a little bit of delay when handling large amounts of data or workflows. Lastly, I feel that Jira sends way too many notifications, and people need to really dive deep into the settings to disable or minimize most of them
author: Victor

review_detail:
title: Easiest and efficient CRM tool to start
pros: Jira gives you felxibility to create tasks/stories and manages the same in your own way at every possible level. It does not restrict anyone from not doing anything except if restricted by administrator. Agile board and Kanbann is something any organisation would love using it with Jira when migrating from classing waterfall model to Agile/scrum. Also timesheet management feature gives your organization to manage financial reporting
cons: For cross reference a jira case, one has to open both in separate window. Having a view of taking look at all cases on the same screen would help. Also Dashboard view is not efficient. Every time one clicks on dashboard,it takes you to the 1st page of dashboard rather than taking you to the relevant dashboard page which you were working on earlier
author: Mitul

review_detail:
title: No pain no gain
pros: Since it is the mainstream product in the market and Atlassian has other powerful tools, the integration with first and third parties is guaranteed and are usually pretty good (ex. Confluence, Slack, Gitlab, TeamRetro...)
cons: After more than 10 years using JIRA for project management I have to say the UX still terrible, the changes and new features took ages to be implemented, and still have too many unresolved issues. If I have to choose a pain point, dashboards are really really painful to craft, and is really easy to face simple limitations that require a paid plugin to allow you to get what you need.
author: Ruben

review_detail:
title: Its really a good tool for managing the internal approvals with ease. It is user friendly tool.
pros: This tool works on a hosted model and can be accessed from anywhere in the world by using internet connection. The web version and even the mobile version (which i guess has been recently launched) is good and can be accessed through click of a button while it is assigned to you. It is has various options like assigning to different users, obtaining their comments, attaching supporting documents, printing the ticket, reports and dashboards which can be customised by the users, option to download, link the ticket with other tickets, etc., The tool has the option to create various workflows as per the requirements of the users. It has the option to alert the users with email alerts and also reminder mails. There is option to close the ticket, clone the ticket, revoke the ticket. The users can customize the reports and dashboards as per their requirement and download the ticket in various formats from the JIRA tool.
cons: The reports and dashboards does not provide for reports in a graphical way. The tickets can not be simultaneously assigned two or more users. The tickets can only be closed by the creator which is a set back if the creator does not close the ticket once its gets over. The note which is created allows only text inputs. It does not allow for creation of table or column. Turn around time for closure (at each specific user level) of the ticket can not be generated from the reports automatically. This is a big drawback. Also, it takes so much time for loading the contents and if the internet is slow then it does not get loaded at all.
author: Vijayakanth

review_detail:
title: lo mejor para mis trabajos grupales
pros: puedo compartirlo con mas personas a la vez, su facilidad a la hora de crear me encanta, es muy facil de entender y de practicar, me da un mejor funcionamiento a mis tareas y proyectos con los demas
cons: muchas restricciones en el free, ya que los demas cuentan con menos
author: Beatriz

review_detail:
title: Jura for project and issue management
pros: You can integrate this software with most of the SAAS products and the Jira APO are ease to use. The Jira community also a great help to learn and implement.
cons: Field level limitations that we have in Jira while integrating with other applications. No other draw backs I saw for this software.
author: Ajit

review_detail:
title: JIRA is great, for the most part
pros: I have used JIRA in several businesses I've worked, and it definetely has a lot of good sides. It's not very hard to learn for anyone who is new and the information is available quickly. The fact that JIRA can handled so many different type of projects as well, all from bug tracking up to planning makes it a versatile tool.
cons: It can sometimes be a bit overwhelming. You get bombarded with so much information and finding one specific field can sometimes be hard. I wish there was some sort of AI integration that would understand what type of fields are commonly used and so on.
author: John A

review_detail:
title: With great power comes great . . . complexity
pros: I've been on teams that have used Jira for more than a decade now. Now I manage teams that use it and we certainly get a lot of value out of it. I love the power and infinite flexibility to customize everything to our needs. It's incredibly powerful, fast, stable, and powers all of our cloud, app and firmware deployments/releases by managing the user stories and bugs that go into each release.
cons: The user interface is now so complex that we have to employ full time people just to wrangle Jira. The PMs themselves are pretty scared of it and would never try to customize it--the TPMs and Sr. TPMs often struggle to do what we need. It can really take on a life of its own because it's so incredibly complex. We have had to move a lot of project management tasks over to Asana because there are so many things messed up and broken about our current Jira (cloud) instance. Bottom line--don't choose Jira unless you've got SDEs that are super adept at it already. If you're just starting out, it's very attractive pricing, but the complexity will kill you. Go with something easier.
author: Steve

review_detail:
title: Best about JIRA
pros: The good thing about JIRA is that it is easy to manage and implements other application, such as Bitbucket or any types of Repository to track your task. It is also cheap comparing with other management tools being catered.
cons: JIRA has only access to web application. No application built in a way that you won't need to access through browser
author: Emmanuel

review_detail:
title: Planning and Project Management
