pros: Gathering all the personnel working on the project in a common platform, making both information sharing and process management more efficient provides an advantage in today's economic order. In this way, it provides both an increase in the sense of belonging of the personnel to the project and a decrease in wasted time.
cons: The absence of a visually illustrated back interface can make it difficult for users to understand.
author: erdal

review_detail:
title: Jira- accepted cross organization usefull for vendors and inner teams
pros: Licenses are use progresibly as per need, widely spread it is accepted with vendors contracts
cons: Additional layer of systems to keep track
author: Matias

review_detail:
title: Intern das wichtigste Tool für die Planung neuer Projekte
pros: Für uns im Vertrieb, ist es wichtig die Probleme, der Kunden in Aufgaben für die Entwicklung zu erfassen. Alles bekommt eine Nummer, lässt sich auch nach Jahren wieder finden und jedes Projekt, kann weiter bearbeitet, ergänzt und geschlossen werden, wenn erledigt. Intern nutzen wir es für die Dokumentierung von Kundenfeedback, Bug Behebung und Weiterentwicklung unserer Software.
cons: Dazu kann ich nicht wirklich eine Aussage machen, es gehört halt zu den Firmeninternen Prozessen und es wird so benutzt, wie ich es vor 8 Jahren gezeigt bekommen habe. Damals war es für mich, auf jeden Fall nicht selbst erklärend und ich musste eingearbeitet werden, weil die Softwar an sich für mich nicht selbsterklärend war.
author: Antje

review_detail:
title: Logiciel d'équipement
pros: Jira est un outil de développement qui permet de planifier et développer des produits Vivement conseillée
cons: Je ne lui trouve rien de compromettant pour le moment
author: Bernadette

review_detail:
title: A project manager’s dream
pros: One of the best features I’ve found in Jira is the Workflow editor – I’ve never seen anything like it despite my extensive experience. Some people would say it’s not even that important, however, for growing businesses it’s something you can’t do without. Lots of task tracking is needed all at once, as you can never predict what necessities will arise in a growing company. Jira provides great help with all these issues. Sprints can be structured across multiple tandem-working teams, taking into account their wishes and preferences – either for traditional setups or for newer ones.
cons: Honestly, one thing that was really off-putting for me was the impressively complex layout. The project list is simply huge, and you have to take some time to grasp the navigation and search features. Perhaps, in the next update the developer needs to add the possibility to tag or somehow categorize or classify projects more clearly to make them easily searchable. Otherwise, it takes a bit too much time. The dashboard is simple, but I don’t much like the visualization for reports. You also can’t assign tickets to several people at the same time. Only the person who created the ticket has the authorization to close it, which is quite bothersome. You can’t create columns or tables, and notes exist only for text input. I would also like to see a feature where you can generate turnaround time for ticket closure in an automatic way using reports. Plus if you have a bad Internet connection, there are issues with loading contents (sometimes the loading even stops altogether).
author: Anita

review_detail:
title: A critical product for software development
pros: Jira helps us track a project and it’s progress in various ways, which is very helpful for the team to work.
cons: Everything is good, I do not have any issues.
author: Karnika

review_detail:
title: Best In the Market Project Management and Test Management Tool
pros: I use it for Project Management and Test Management. It's User friendly and have useful integration with tool like Jenkins and BitBuket.
cons: I can't find anything to dislike which I can term as Cons.
author: Rajat

review_detail:
title: High quality software
pros: All project management features has high quality functionalities.
cons: Integration with 3th party applications
author: Sergio R

review_detail:
title: JIRA is an amazing tool in a very useful suite of project management software.
pros: JIRA is a great way to track items that need to be done or defects that need to be fixed across a business. If you take the time to customize the interface, add fields, workflows, etc. that match your business model, JIRA can make your organization so much more transparent and efficient. Combined with it's siblings Confluence, BitBucket, et. al. you have an amazing suite of productivity tools. Each individual may feel that they are doing a little more than they used to when adding information into these tools, but the time saved in meetings, querying peers for information & not having the full picture will soon become apparent. To get the most of JIRA, be prepared to customize and train. Without those two pieces, you may end up with users who don't see or feel the benefit.
cons: The least appealing thing about JIRA and the other tools in the Atlassian suite is the fact that you must buy plug-ins to get a lot of functionality that should have been built in. Atlassian is proud of their App ecosystem, but, from an end user perspective, it can just feel like it is a place grabbing your money.
author: Tim

review_detail:
title: Extremely confusing software, not user friendly, just complicated
pros: The amount of possibility that gives you are endless. Usefull in really big teams especially when you have to log and keep track of software issues and failure. It helps to easily manage the status of your issues and easily communicate with your or other teams.
cons: Not user friendly. It completely makes you forget why you are using it in the first place. Too many "solutions" and often not a single one is worth it. The price is extremely high, considering that you are not receiving the same assistance and software quality of their competitors.
author: Dario

review_detail:
title: Best project management tool
pros: I liked its customizable workflows which were helpful in handling tasks in a way that aligned my development methodology. We used multiple methodologies for different projects and Jira was perfect as it is adjustable to any method. I liked its integration feature with GitHub and Slack which made our task flow smooth.
cons: In the beginning, it was complex because of its extensive customization options. For me, it was a bit harder to set up the projects and flow initially.
author: Bishal

review_detail:
title: JIRA - A very complete tool from Atlassian portfolio.
pros: The Scrum boards are very light weight and handy to manage backlog and Sprint planning and execution
cons: Customization is a bit a of an issue. Eazy BI report plugging is bit lethargic and difficult to operate upon
author: Manish

review_detail:
title: Exceptional project and Task Management tool
pros: Jira's ability to be customized to meet the unique needs of any organization and its comprehensive set of features and integrations make it an effective solution for tracking and managing tasks, monitoring project progress, and collaborating with stakeholders.
cons: The least liked thing about Jira is that it can be difficult to learn, especially for those who are unfamiliar with the project management software.
author: Crispussia

review_detail:
title: It is very easy to keep track of assignments at work
pros: I loved Jira such a ton that subsequent to moving positions I took it with me and utilized their free form just to help track my own personal errands but none of my other colleagues were utilizing it. Jira has made my work life simpler particularly during a period where we as a whole need to work distantly. It assists me with dealing with the undertakings and follows side by side of the jobs being finished. The product is very simple to know and hence the wealth of clear how-to recordings is incredible.
cons: Estimating has gotten truly wild as of late. it had been once extraordinary worth however since they should be cornered a major market fragment they're truly draining it for all its value, Jira like most programming highlights a tad of an expectation to learn and adapt.
author: Krishna

review_detail:
title: Useful tool for agile development
pros: The tool works great to keep track of an ongoing software development job. Multiple users can get involved within the platform and have different subtasks assigned to them. Having the possibility to create workflows keep things simple and easy to see what's the current status of the whole task at a glance. The platform allows for customisation as well, this comes really handy as no project is identical and you may need to add some automations to the process to meet your specific needs. Thanks to their recent Boards implementation, you can see the next tasks that need to be worked on and as well as what's already been done and what's in progress.
cons: The platform might be a bit overwhelming when you start working with it for the first time. It's hard to know all the possible functionalities until you have worked with it for a while. Although it's possible to customise, some parts can get a bit tricky to perform if you don't have the knowledge. On the other side, you can also reach out to them if you need help. In terms of pricing, it can get a bit expensive if you need a lot of users.
author: Pedro

review_detail:
title: Using JIRA with Corporate Learning and Development
pros: Ability to collaborate easily with SCRUM teams; everyone has access in real time to the most up to date information for each JIRA story; ability to mock ups and to add comments @ team members who are notified immediately and vice versa when they respond. It allows us to accurately track to our L&D deliverables related to the SCRUM’s JIRA stories, as they may change over the course of a sprint.
cons: Sometimes you have to download a mock up instead of it opening directly in Windows viewer, not a big deal but just an extra step; JIRA is a much more technical application, it definitely requires a learning curve to use it, it’s not a super simple interface.
author: Marcy

review_detail:
title: Among the top 5 best project management tools for Software Development
pros: This is a pretty interesting and simple to use software platform by developers, testers & managers in the software industry. It is mainly adopted by teams following the agile methodology. The overall usability and user experience are unbelievable and the smoothness through which we can switch between different sections of the platform makes it a very usable product. It helps to create Scrum and Kanban projects as well as create and manage tasks, user stories, etc. by these teams. Developers can easily use GIT or TFS to check-in or commit data on the respective servers whereas testers can file relevant bugs or issues encountered for the relevant tasks under a User story. Overall, this is a great project management tool to use.
cons: As compared to other platforms like Microsoft Azure DevOps (formerly Visual Studio Team Services), this tool doesn't provide much more features and support for functionalities. Anyone would prefer to use Azure DevOps as it is a complete DevOps solution as well as a Project management tool with decent pricing for corporates and also free pricing for a team of 5.
author: Siddhant

review_detail:
title: The best solution for Team Project Management
pros: A lot of plugins and tools are available on the Marketplace. The tools are used a lot amoung the Video Game Industry, making it a standard for task management and bugtracking. Offers a lot of options to present to the data to the users as well as gathering information from the backlogs and rendering charts for project managers.
cons: Lot of options and tools, makes it hard to master. Not always easy to find its way in the options, especially because the tool is revamping and evolving often, making tutorials or classes quickly out of date.
author: Cédric

review_detail:
title: Great for Backlogs and Organizing Software Releases - Bad For Agility
pros: The backlog and features for managing the backlog with different methodologies such as Kanban, Scrum, or Kanban + Scrum hybrid are very flexible. Planning sprints, releasing sprints, and looking at history of what was done is very organized.
cons: Cumbersome to setup. Workflows for issues and UI/UX for creating them is not easy to understand. Sure you can figure it out, but it will require a lot of facepalms. It's good for larger organizations with several cross-functional teams, but if you are a smaller organization stick with Trello and checklists for the cards if sub-tasks are needed. The sub-tasks in Jira are just plain awful to work with, and will end up wasting a lot of time for your team.
author: Adam

review_detail:
title: Could be simple or complex - all up yo you
pros: I've been using JIRA on an off, for about 15 years with several employers that I have been. It is very customizable, and can be as simple or high lever as administrator/users require it. If you have several users working on a project, no matter how complex - JIRA is your tool. You can create tasks, subtasks, assign them to different users (who will receive email notifications when they are mentioned or any changes are made), request updates, etc.
cons: Some of the users I worked with overcomplicated the process - but this is not fault of JIRA at all.
author: Oleg

review_detail:
title: Task Management Leader
pros: i can easily track the lifecycle of the task and easy to write a ticket instead of taking notes for task allocation
cons: some features doest work sometimes and some tickets which i create from a parent ticket using issues is always takes home in backlog what is this i am breaking down tasks so they should be directly shown on bord but now i don't know why but it always goes to backlog issues
author: Madhav

review_detail:
title: Projet Manager Tool -JIRA
pros: The smoothest features of the app and tremendous project management features and the main thing I like is it has a finest mobile app
cons: I have been using this software for the past 2 years and personally found it the best in the market the only con is about the paid features I feel
author: Harshit

review_detail:
title: Excellent tool for applying kanban-agile methodologies
pros: It is a powerful tool to order, prioritize and visualize the tasks that are part of the different projects.
cons: The initial learning curve was a bit steep, more support during the implementation phase would strengthen the after-sales service
author: Jenelin

review_detail:
title: Best of the Best tool for any kind of tracking
pros: JIRA is very very flexible and there is no end to the add-ons to improve the functionality or need. JIRA allows lot of customization. Hence, this was customize to used by a team who manages the deployments and version controlling. This usage is very different than the usual usage for issue tracking. These features makes the life very comfortable and it helps people at onsite and offshore collaborate well and communicate well.
cons: Sometime due to many option/boxes to fill for tracking, it make monotonous. This may confuse the first time users a lot. Mastering this tool is little difficult too.
author: Raghavendar

review_detail:
title: It does it all - then they add more for free
pros: I have been using the cloud version of JIRA for over 9 years. One of its best features is they keep expanding its capabilities and don't change the cost. Don't get me wrong the tool has always done what I expected it to do and done it well, but with each release the generally add some features and capabilities it did not have before. I love that they allow Kanban boards and sprints on the same project - if that's how you want to work. Super flexible, fast and easy to use, even when I'm doing Admin work that I don't do everyday and can't remember exactly how to do it. Additionally the tool has lots of add-ons - we use Tempo for time keeping and have used Gliffy in the past for diagramming. I'm not sure if
cons: My least favorite thing is that they have changed the interface several times while I have been using it. However each time after I spend time getting used to it I find their redesign to be significantly better. I really find this when I use locally hosted older versions and see what I used to do - I really realize how they improved it.
author: Jeff

review_detail:
title: JIRA : One of the software for project management.
pros: Task management. Bug tracking. Dashboard Watchers Attachments
cons: The size limit of the attachment is 20 MB. Sometimes there are multiple options, that are confusing so it will be better to have a quick demo.
author: Amit

review_detail:
title: Jira - One stop solution to all project management needs
pros: Being able to create issues and sub tasks to streamline the process and approval process inside the system
cons: It becomes cumbersome for larger teams to adopt
author: Vidyullatha

review_detail:
title: Jira is great for managing Agile processes...
pros: Easy to use interface with tons of features to track tickets through the agile process. Good integration with the other Atlassian products as well as some outside of that ecosystem. Ability to restrict access to those that need it across multiple different levels.
cons: A little bit costly. Migration from server to cloud can be difficult.
author: Ronald

review_detail:
title: The most used issue tracking tool used in many organization
pros: I am using jira since the starting of my career. All issues, bugs, enhancements for any particular release is created using a jira and assigned to respective team and individuals. It is then tracked by higher management using a dashboard. It is easy to use and has lot of option and we can define diff workflows for different type of tasks in jira
cons: The pricing model can be improved as it is over a higher side. Apart from that no other issues as it provides many required features
author: Khan Nida Khanum

review_detail:
title: Jira is the best
pros: It is very practical to follow up work on Jira and to communicate with other teams related to the business. You can create and categorize a board as you wish. Thus, you can monitor the current status of your work. Also, we use it integrated with slack. We can see any action on Jira as a notification in slack.
cons: Navigation menus can be a little simpler and more user-friendly. Sometimes access can be very complicated. Also a bit expensive in terms of price
author: Deniz

review_detail:
title: Good for project management but not an out of the box tool
pros: I like the ability to manage projects by creating tasks and sub tasks. Color coding and separate boards are useful for separating out different tasks.
cons: Learning to code is difficult enough, and if your team is using JIRA, it’s a whole skill set in itself. It’s not intuitive for new team members, its workflow can vary drastically from team to team, and icons/symbols are largely unhelpful.
author: 👨🏼‍💻 Sarai
